98808.name: Ultimate Boss Battle of Doom
98808.body:
![banner.jpg](///raw/9b8/2/z/16ec7.jpg)

## How to play

Defeat the big bad guy and his minions by jumping on bombs and stuff.

* Move with W, A, S, D
* SPACE to Jump

### Hint: Jump on the bombs, not the enemies :)

![screenshot1_800 v2.jpg](///raw/9b8/2/z/17772.jpg)

## Tools Used
* Godot Game Engine
* Photoshop & Aseprite
* Bfxr & Audacity

# !!!
## NOTE: The HTML version does not work properly in Chrome. Firefox recommended!
# !!!

98833.name: Orbital Chaos
98833.body:
Your mission is to **launch as many satellites to the orbit as possible**. At first this might seem easy but when the satellites start to stack up you will be *running out of space* pretty fast.

![ezgif-1-9fad35f27b.gif](///raw/103/41/z/179cc.gif)


## Controls
**Move your mouse** to automatically switch between the "aim points". ![aimpoint.png](///raw/103/41/z/179ae.png) 

**Press left click** to fire a shuttle to the selected "aimpoint". When to shuttle reaches the "aim point" it will **place a satellite** and **return to earth**.

The **white circle shows the orbit** that the satellite will move around earth.

**F11** to go fullscreen. **F5** to restart game.

And **if you hit a planet** or a other satellite **you lose** :)


## Credits and afterthoughts

Please feel free to **check out** [**HRME**](https://soundcloud.com/itshrme/) he made the awesome **music** for this game and helped me a lot by testing the game and giving me new ideas.

This was my first time participating in Ludum Dare. Making all the sprites, sounds and code was a lot of fun and I will be participating in future for sure. Sadly I got sick halfway through the jam so the game isn't as polished as I hoped it would be. But I hope you enjoy it and find time to give it a review. ;)

98863.name: Pool Watch
98863.body:
# Pool Watch
No one likes to watch the bay. But everybody loves to watch the pool.
You made your passion to your job and became a lifeguard of a local swimming pool.

Your daily guests are swimmers who cannot swim. 
But that does not stop them from going into the pool. 
Watch them enjoy their time, but be careful. 
Help them out when they call you. 
Otherwise they will drown.
**So do your job and save them!**

## Controls
As soon as a swimmer starts to wave to you, snip him to a ladder.
Click on him and drag the force line into the opposite direction of where you want him to go. 
The longer the line, the more force is applied. 

Swimmers who don't wave or dead swimmers won't leave the pool. 

You have lost as soon as the *death bar* is full. 

![Screenshot.png](///raw/a22/81/z/18075.png)

*Made with Godot - Made by Sabrina, Lukas and Joschi*

98869.name: AsterVoid
98869.body:
AsterVoid is an Asteroids-style game with a twist: each destroyed asteroid leaves behind a "void" in space that you can't fly through. Dodge the asteroids and the ever-growing void, and try and rack up a high-score!

![ld42_20.gif](///raw/da6/11/z/16300.gif)

**Features:**  
- Gameplay based on the classic Asteroids, with a fresh new twist  
- Particle effects system  
- A couple of hidden secrets

**Controls:**  
- Arrow keys: Move  
- Z: Select/Fire  
- X: Go back a screen

![ld42_11.gif](///raw/da6/11/z/16304.gif)

Made entirely from scratch using PICO-8.

98878.name: Escape: The Game
98878.body:
This game is about a child getting closer to death. Objective: Find all the Doors & go home.

This game was my first Game & Game Jam i have made.

98885.name: Dark Lord Ludum Dare
98885.body:
He has risen! The Dark Lord Ludum Dare is now walking the Earth. It corrupts everything it walks on. And it wants to conquer the world!

Controls is WASD or Arrow Keys.​

PLAY IT HERE: https://martintristan.itch.io/dlld

Hope you guys enjoy this simple game! The objective of this game is to corrupt all the land tiles by walking on it. However, you will encounter some enemies that can one-hit kill you! But they are slow and takes time before they can move and attack. To defeat an enemy, all you gotta do is corrupt all the land tiles around an enemy (four directions), so that they can no longer move (hence, they RUN OUT OF SPACE!). 

​Had a blast with LD42. Not really a fan of the theme but hey, it's the theme! I also used the other themes as well as old LD themes! Can you spot all of them? Spent almost 12 hours thinking of a game and I had only about 4 or 5 hours available each day to code, test, and do the artwork. Was initially planning to send this for the Compo but that will remain as just a dream.​

![title.jpg](///raw/7b0/7/z/181d2.jpg)

![ss01.jpg](///raw/7b0/7/z/18145.jpg)

![ss02.jpg](///raw/7b0/7/z/18149.jpg)

![ss03.jpg](///raw/7b0/7/z/1814c.jpg)

98887.name: WinDOORS
98887.body:
[![Play WinDOORS](///raw/02e/81/z/17e3e.jpg)](https://petrspelos.github.io/Ludum-Dare-42/)

## Introduction
WinDOORS is a game that revolves around clearing up as much space as possible on your hard drive. The goal is to survive as long as possible until your inevitable hard drive failure occurs.

*WinDOORS was made in 58 hours for the Ludum Dare 42. Theme: Running out of space.*

## What the game offers
* More than 20 applications to install and play around with 😱
* Many achievements that persist between playthroughs ✅
* Very many (too many) jokes hidden behind interactable parts of the Operating System. 😂
* Multiple random viruses with various effects ⚠
* Cool sound effects 😎
* Hot graphics 🔥
* Too many emojis 👌

## How to play
**This is also explained in the game.**

Open applications by left-clicking them on your desktop.

Remove files from the trash bin to clear up some space.

Uninstall big applications by clicking System Settings > Uninstall Applications.

Install new applications from the App Store to assist you in clearing disk space.

Remove viruses by scanning with the VirusButcher.

## Screenshots
![Screenshot-1.png](///raw/fe3/21/z/18110.png)
![Screenshot-2.png](///raw/fe3/21/z/18116.png)
![Screenshot-3.png](///raw/fe3/21/z/1811a.png)
![Screenshot-4.png](///raw/fe3/21/z/1811d.png)

## Developers
#### Petr Sedlacek (@Spelos)
#### Ben Kosmann (@Snoops)
#### Marcus Otterström (@LeMorrow)

98899.name: Kingdom Brunel in the Temple of Teacakes
98899.body:
These ancient temples huh? Always full of traps it makes you wonder how anyone actually ever *used* them.

They make for great places to find treasure though, especially treasure of the bready and curranty variety. 

That's right. **Teacakes** are whats hot, even after a thousand years. The gold dust of English tradition. Join Kingdom Brunel in his latest bid to impress the unimpressible Queen Victoria buy gathering up as many valuable teacakes as his chimney hat will hold.  




![Capture.PNG](///raw/026/2/z/16a34.png)

![26.gif](///raw/026/2/z/16eff.gif)




# Mission
Collect as many teacakes as possible and escape the temple! The ceiling is made from concentrated BAD TIMES so don't go touching that. Also falling into the bottomless mists isn't advised.



# Controls
MOUSE to aim

LEFT MOUSE BUTTON to pick up teacakes (you've got to look at the teacake and get the cursor on it to pick it up)




WASD to move

SHIFT to run

SPACE to jump

RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON to do nothing at all

98905.name: Downscaled
98905.body:
![splash.png](///raw/649/21/z/160f5.png)

Jump and roll your way to the high score whilst tackling an ever shrinking game screen.

'Up' to jump for coins, 'Down' to roll through boxes.

Each game lasts 1 minute with a grade at the end. Retry for an A+!

Built completely from scratch in PICO-8 for my 2nd Ludum Dare! Enjoy!

Follow me on Twitter https://twitter.com/therealjoshwong

98918.name: SunnyLand
98918.body:
Done with my first ever Ludum Dare- LD42! I worked alone, but submitted in the Jam category. It was a great experience, hope to play-test some other games as well, I will definitely participate in LD43! 

All looks fun, but beware of the slowly approaching black void as it approaches to swallow you. Quick! cruise through the levels swiftly so that the void, the water, or even pure nothingness cannot consume you. Every second wasted can be a matter of life and death as the evil crams you up. As you run out of space, it gets harder to finish this game and earn the trophy at the end!

98921.name: The Gauntlet
98921.body:
In The Gauntlet you're racing both the clock and space itself.

Avoid the crushers and red zones, tho some might not be all they appear to be. Pass through each green zone within time and reach the end.

Huge thanks to everyone who tuned into the stream to watch the progress. You all kept me going.


![01.jpg](///raw/862/81/z/176a6.jpg)
![02.jpg](///raw/862/81/z/176a6.jpg)

98942.name: Armageddon
98942.body:
The **Armageddon** is at our doors !!!

You need to save your land from burning!
Grab extinguishers, splash bombs and get going!

1 Fire tile extinguished = 1 point!
Controllers supported & recommended.

**Warning:** The game is quite hard hehe... :)

**Hint:** Try to always clear an item out of the fire to use it right away!
(Yes it's doable to hit a score of multiple thousands :p)

**Good Luck, Have Fun !**
Share your best score & challenge a friend :)!

![gameplay1.png](///raw/972/81/z/16e52.png)
![gameplay2.png](///raw/972/81/z/16e6c.png)

98947.name: TENORMS
98947.body:
TENORMS (an acronym for Technologically Enhanced Naturally Occurring Radioactive MaterialS) is an action platformer based around a guy trying to get into an exploded nuclear reactor. The closer he gets, though, the less space he has to maneuver around the gradually mutated enemies that call the wastelands home. Be warned, there are 4 different levels, and it gets hard fast. See if you can get through them all!

BUG: Pause menu resets the level, don't use unless absolutely necessary.

Shooting fix is coming, check back soon!

Controls:
Arrow keys to move.
C to shoot (only works when still)/select menu options.
X to pause the game.

![Thumbnail.png](///raw/422/3/z/16ec2.png)

-Mathstr0

98957.name: Flood
98957.body:
### DESCRIPTION
"Flood" is a zelda-inspired survival game where you must search for weapons and food, while also be under constant threat of an ongoing flood. To prevent being engulfed by this flood, you must go to an elevated location, such as a hill, and wait for it to pass.

As time goes on, enemies encounters grow harder and harder, and you can starve more easily. How long can you survive for?


### CONTROLS
WASD - Move

LEFT MOUSE BUTTON - Attack



### CREDITS
*Megalink* - Programming

*jtn191* - Art and Sound Design

*Gideon the Bard* - Art

### We hope you enjoy!

![shot0.PNG](///raw/662/z/17609.png)

98961.name: Temple Trap - The Game!
98961.body:
![tttgtn.PNG](///raw/d8f/51/z/16a60.png)

"Temple Trap - The Game!" is a wave - based combat arcade game, based around the idea of having a shrinking play area rather than a health bar. Fight off monsters in a constant attempt to escape this deadly trap, gradually gaining skill as foes of increasing strength and number rise to face you. 

## -Controls-

#### Movement - Arrow keys
#### Run - Shift
#### Attack - "X"
#### Select - Enter or "Z"
#### Exit Game - Escape-
#### Toggle Fullscreen - "F" or F11



![Base Profile Screenshot 2018.08.12 - 15.09.31.10.png](///raw/d8f/51/z/16a91.png)
## -Credits and Source Code-
All asset design, programming, and sound design was done independently
[Sound FX were created using SFXR]
SOURCE CODE:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1YsL1iup_CXvpvcou998dtyMzZkzb1ikd

98969.name: Bomber Brigade
98969.body:
Bomber Brigade is a simple 2.5 D game where you are a bomb disposal officer and you have to dispose off the bomb as soon as possible before the bomb goes off. If the bomb explodes, you lose the portion of tile from your walking path where the bomb was last located. The mission is to get rid of as many bombs as possible before you lose 30 tiles. Try to create a high score and enjoy the game #LD42
![Bomber Brigade.png](///raw/c72/81/z/15e67.png)![BomberBrigade_cover.png](///raw/c72/81/z/15e86.png)

98991.name: Dodge and pray
98991.body:
Hi all,

I really enjoyed this LD and I m here with my Dodge and pray. For this entry I chose a game with really low scope and still I had some issues with it. This game I will extend in the future, I have a plan with local multiplaler or maybe I will do some experiment with online.

In this game you are in arena and your goal is to live as much long as possile. You can control the game by arrow keys or with your gamepad. (tested with PS4 with "DS4Windows" software). You have to dodge from enemy and its follower.Score is time you were able to resist. Fortunately minions are stupid and sometimes they get stuck.

I really enjoy the time and I want to continue working with this idea.

98999.name: Colony
98999.body:
Lazlo has to find a new home for his civilisation. His home planet can no longer support the number of people living there, and it is time to look to the beyond. Help him on his quest to find a new home that is habitable and safe from dangerous aliens.

![Screenshot 1](///raw/6b2/81/z/174dd.png)

![Screenshot 2](///raw/6b2/81/z/174de.png)

We built this game for Ludum Dare 42 in 48 hours! Use A and D or the arrow keys to move, space to jump, and Q to fire. Good luck, and have fun! Please leave feedback if you enjoyed, or managed to find a bug.

99003.name: Just A Small Buisness
99003.body:
Oh no i can't get home...
Where is the key to unlock the door...
![Screenshot2.PNG](///raw/9b2/81/z/1646d.png)

Uhm... Why are the walls coming closer?

You are a buisness man and want to get home for dinner, but the Key is gone. And the walls are coming closer?

![Screenshot3.PNG](///raw/9b2/81/z/16475.png)

Anyway you have to find the Key which you pick up with [F].
To Interact with Objects press [E].
You can turn right [D] and left [A] and walk with [W].
To open and close the Pause Menu use [Esc].

![Screenshot4.PNG](///raw/9b2/81/z/16476.png)
![Screenshot5.PNG](///raw/9b2/81/z/16479.png)

99016.name: CLIMB
99016.body:
A hostile planet threatens to consume you! Can you gather enough resources to launch your rocket to escape while the planet tries to climb after you?!

[advert3.png](///raw/7c2/81/z/168fb.png)

Tools Used:

- Code Stuff: CLion 2018.2, Allegro 5.*, yaml-cpp, msys2
- Music/Sound FX: Bosca Ceoil, SFXR, Audacity
- Art: Aseprite, Photoshop
- Morale: Spotify, Red Bull!

99027.name: CritterRun
99027.body: Dodge Asteroids in a mission to deliver the critters home to Earth, The catch it the more asteroids you hit the more the critter multiply and fill up space in your ship, if it get too full it'll explode! plus as you fly along the screen gets fuller and fuller with asteroids. Can you make it to level 3 and beat the boss?

99035.name: Blaze From Outer Space
99035.body:
**About**

Blaze, a space explorer, is attacked by Space Pirates. 
He crashed upon an unknown planet and needs to fix his ship in order to escape from there safely.


- Download link:
https://thanyx.itch.io/blaze-from-outer-space



**Overview**
- Short point-and-click adventure with little bit of crafting.
- You have just 2 inventory slots, so use them wisely
- The resources around you are infinite, so you can always delete items and take them later if you need more inventory space.

**DISCLAIMER!**

**- There is a bug when player's trying to delete some items. Sometimes the game deletes the wrong item from inventory.**



Credits:
- Alan Mrakava - Audio,  Writing, Story
- David Brocek - Graphics, Coding, Writing



![THUMBNAIL.gif](///raw/2bf/z/162a1.gif)
-
![Blazescreenshot.PNG](///raw/2bf/z/16211.png)

99044.name: Defragment VR
99044.body:
![ss1.png](///raw/93a/z/15cdc.png)

# DEFRAGMENT VR
## Warning: Requires VR
### (Tested on HTC Vive and Oculus Rift, unknown if other VR systems will work)

# Story

You are a Defragmentation Program.  Data is coming into your storage medium in the form of data blocks, and you must make efficient use of the available space to store as much data as possible before your space completely runs out!

![ss2.png](///raw/93a/z/15cdd.png)

# How to play

- Data blocks (each worth 1 MB of data) appear in the area periodically; this will speed up very gradually over time.
- Use the trigger on the left and right controllers to pick up data blocks, and release the trigger to drop them.
- While holding two cubes of the same color, you can touch them together to merge them; they take up the same volume, but can still make more efficient use of space.
- If any block touches the barrier above the play area, the game ends, and your score is displayed (the number of megabytes of data you managed to store).

![ss3.png](///raw/93a/z/15cde.png)

# Notes

- Try not to push blocks through each other, as it can launch one of them, typically resulting in an immediate loss when it crosses the barrier.
- It's possible to push blocks through walls, but don't do it.  At worst, the block will stay in the play area but become completely uninteractable.  At best, the game will realize a block has left the play area, resulting in an immediate game over.
- This has not been tested with any VR system other than the HTC Vive.  That's not to say it won't work, however, so if you have another VR system and can test it, let me know the results in the comments.  *Update* A user has tested it on the Rift and confirms that it works fine!

# Tools Used

- Programming:  Unity 2018 (uses SteamVR assets from Unity Asset Store only for VR setup)
- Graphics:  Adobe Animate (just to draw a single texture normal)
- Sound:  GoldWave, Voicemod
- Music:  Reaper, Vocaloid 4

99050.name: Quatris - LD42 - Running out of Space
99050.body:
Think of it like Tetris but instead of rotating the pieces, you can also rotate the screen! Blocks appear from the middle of the screen and it's your job to keep that middle clear and stack the pieces to the best of your abilities to create full lines.

Its my first LD submission. I had an absolute blast and while it might not be the best out there, I really enjoyed making it.

![Screen1.png](///raw/8e2/81/z/16dc9.png)
![Screen2.png](///raw/8e2/81/z/16dce.png)
![Screen3.png](///raw/8e2/81/z/16dd2.png)

99052.name: Space Billiards
99052.body:
Space. The final frontier. These are... Hold on... Ah, crap, wrong series.

Welcome to this year's [Intergalactic Bar Billiards](https://sites.google.com/site/h2g2theguide/Index/i/540914), one of the more major hilarious concepts of the Hitchhiker’s Guide. Of course, this name is now already taken, and we have 2018, with the tendency to oversimplify things it's just called - drum roll :drum: - Space Billiards.

![timelapse-final.gif](///raw/dba/c/z/170ad.gif)

You will have to help your planet :camping: (and its 10 billion inhabitants) to survive a game of Space Billiards. Planets are billiard balls :8ball:, suns are billiard pockets :hole:, and of course there is the obvious space-time-distorting black hole :bomb: every now and then. Luckily, you have a large finite improbability drive :rocket: (not an infinite one, though!), thus you can move your planet around quite a bit. Also, when it's loaded, it can materialise an asteroid in the vicinity. But everything has side effects :grin:... like filling up space with alternative fact\H\H\H\Hrealities...

When your main computer isn't busy discussing the end of the world with Marvin, he will help you by plotting the probable trajection of the major bodies in the solar system. But he hasn't noticed, that it's billiard time with bouncy walls...

By pressing UP and DOWN keys you can accelerate (prograde) and decelerate (retrograde) your planet. By pressing the left mouse button you can release an asteroid, when the right gauge is full. You can fling it a bit by moving the mouse during release.

The left gauge shows the population's demise, by crashes with bodies in the solar system, or by leaving the habitable zone around the sun.

Well, don't forget your towel :reminder_ribbon: - what could possibly go wrong... :dizzy_face: 

I have also posted a [post mortem](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/space-billiards/space-billiards-post-mortem) with a timelapse video :film_frames: of the development process.

99055.name: Space Hauler
99055.body:
![banner.png](///raw/1fd/c/z/16d78.png)

Made from a scratch within 48 hours during LD42 compo. Space Hauler is a side-scrolling space cleaning simulator with pixel graphics, relaxing Zen atmosphere and Tetris-like space management. In near future space tourism and industrialization has grown steadily. As a side effect Earth's orbit is blocked by space debris. You are recruited to join the emerging industry of Space Hauling. Save the Earth and profit!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gMPeGZpk6Tg

- Fly with a space truck or step outside in a space suit
- Push space debris off from Earth's orbit or down to atmosphere 
- Pull debris with your space suit's tractor beam
- Collect and sell valuable loot (rarity system)
- Avoid space mines
- Fix your space truck with your profits

:keyboard:**CONTROLS** 

- WASD = Move
- Space = Enter / Exit truck
- E = Open / Close truck's cargo door
- Mouse1 = Pull space debris / Use fix button / Interact with the Dock master
- P = Pause
- F4= Tutorial

:moneybag: **ITEM TIERS** 
![tiers.png](///raw/1fd/c/z/1758b.png)

**:white_check_mark: 13/8/2018 v1.0**


**Theme:** "Running out of space"

**Programming:** Unity C#

**Graphics:** PyxelEdit 

**Audio:** Audacity, Zoom H1n, mouth(best instrument), music: https://www.audiotool.com

> I think the theme was better this time than ever before and I'm happy with the result. Utilizing Unity's physics engine was fun and it freed so much time from animation etc.I managed to stay organized until the end and got all basic mechanics in.  One thing I might add in future is upgrades to the Truck and upgradable tractor beam for the character. Have fun playing! ❤️ Leave a rating and tell me what you think! Positive or negative feedback, I'd love to hear all of it.​ If your criticism leads to future changes I'll put a mention up with your username. Thank you!🙏

:bird: https://twitter.com/antti_koponen

99062.name: Adware Attack
99062.body:
In Adware Attack, your computer appears to have an odd file on it. Unfortunately, this file unleashes an Adware attack! Survive as long as you can by clicking out of the ads. Some ads, however, are not so easy, and will require you to find their kill code. Doing this also keeps the ads at bay, and increases the amount of time in between their spawns. Your apps act as computer health, so when you can't see one, your computer isn't doing so well. You lose when all of your apps are covered. How long will you survive the ADpocalypse? (Note: game contains no actual adware and all ads within the game are simulated and representative of no real product.)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xQSGvOhNIpE

![Adware Attack Gif 2.gif](///raw/f22/c/z/17821.gif)
![Adware Attack Gif.gif](///raw/f22/c/z/177b7.gif)

99078.name: 42_GetOut
99078.body:
Puzzling adventure about getting of from work, back home to play ld-games.
![picture.png](///raw/45e/2/z/168e8.png)

The tools I used: Unity2018.2, Blender 2.79, Beepbox.co, audacity, gimp 2.10

99079.name: Brightly-Wrapped Boxes
99079.body:
It's your friend's birthday, and you've planned a massive surprise party. Everyone's invited! But maybe you invited a few too many, as they all start showing up with gifts. No big deal, right? It's just some gifts. Now, where to put them? 

![Boxes-01.png](///raw/297/z/1603d.png) 
That looks like a good place.

Brightly-Wrapped Boxes is a small game about fitting a never-ending supply of gifts onto the table without letting any fall to the floor or making people wait too long for you to take their gifts. Arrange the gifts carefully around the table. It's ok if you stack them, but be careful they don't fall! 

![Boxes-02.png](///raw/297/z/1603e.png) 
Stacked!

============================================== 

### Controls

Use the mouse to pick up, move, and place gifts on the table. It will show red when there's something in the way, but sometimes you can fit it in anyway. 

Use A and D or the left and right arrow keys to move around the table. You can look up and down a little with W and S or the up and down arrow keys. 

The escape key will bring up an options menu (with just volume control and a chance to exit the game). Time doesn't pass in the options menu. 

All of the controls can be remapped in the launcher (except for the web version). 

============================================== 

This game was made in Unity3D 2018.1.0f2. I used Paint.Net and Krita for the 2D work, and the 3D was entirely done in Unity. For Audio, I used LMMS with some VST instruments from DSK Music and Audacity for the sound effects. The font I used in this game is called Peace Sans. It's by Sergey Ryadovoy and Jovanny Lemonad.

99086.name: Crawling Dungeon
99086.body:
In 'Crawling Dungeon' you play an unknown species that needs to survive in a dangerous dungeon with spooky monsters'n'stuff.

**Controls**
```
Arrow Keys: Move
Spacebar (hold) : Shoot
Shift (toggle): Lock (allows you to shoot vertically) (only use it if you can handle it)
```

Enjoy.![bandicam 2018-08-13 00-08-22-972.jpg](///raw/9d3/71/z/16a37.jpg)

99087.name: Spider tank
99087.body:
### Spider tank is a turn-based strategy.
    
Your goal is to push every single enemy out of the stage before they push you out!
  
On every single turn, you can either:  
* **Move**  
* **Fire** destroys a tile and pushes enemies away.  
* **Jump** moves you much further than simple move and you will push enemies around your landing tile.  

There are two types of enemies:  
* **Rush** type  
  - Always tries to initiate close-ranged combat.  
  - Can shoot diagonally unlike player.  
 
* **Range** type  
  - Cannot move but can shoot from far away albeit not too precisely.  


There are six tutorial levels. After that, all levels are randomly generated.
![game.gif](///raw/caa/31/z/168ca.gif)

99088.name: SAVE YOUR BROTHER
99088.body:
![004.jpg](///raw/291/21/z/17699.jpg)

## PURCHASE LEGENDARY MEDICINE BEFORE YOUR BROTHER DIES

### PROCEED　　　　 : W
### DISCARD ITEM 　 : DRAG TO TRASH CAN
### SHOP　　　　 　 　: CLICK TO INTERACT
### ENVIRONMENT　 : CLICK TO INTERACT
### SELECT TOOL　　: 1 2 3 4 5 6 OR CLICK
 
* Jisam : Programmer
* Quro : Programmer
* Sunny_K : Artist

99104.name: Running out of space (and more importantly, food).
99104.body:
You are trapped. Alone. In a cave. ~~Naked~~ (well maybe not that one).  
And to top it all off, completely unaware of how you got there (well, mostly - barring some vague memories involving huge quantity's of alcohol, a lama in a clowns mask and a garden rake, but that's probably irrelevant).

And more importantly, you are hungry (like _really_ hungry) and need to find all the food you can (before you run out of space. In your life. As in die :) ).

Luckily (for some reasons explainable only by way of a large whiteboard, lots of string and a extra jumbo sized banana), you have to only survive a _minute_ before help arrives with a large pizza. Well, what are the odds :shrug:. Isn't it amazing how these things work out.

Good luck.

---
### EDIT: (approx... 1 hour after the deadline)
So apparently the game crashes as soon as you try to open it :/  
I'll fix it tomorrow

---

99112.name: Jail Space
99112.body:
Finished early, but there was not much left that I could do that would impact the finished result too much. I guess I had worn myself out on the first day. Anyway, this is Jail Space: a game about a prison overcrowding. I think it turned out alright, I mean, it's not flawless but I'm proud of myself.

![guys.PNG](///raw/baf/31/z/15dec.png)

meta.link-01-name: Game and Source Code are both on my itch.io

99114.name: The Dome
99114.body:
![banner_dome.png](///raw/49/z/16c38.png)

**Backstory: **

The year is 2073 ...

... after the devasting global warming episodes of the early 21st century, the Earth being to boil. The loss of plant and animal life caused a change in the composition of the Earth's atmosphere, causing the oxygen levels to plummet and forcing humanity to move into huge dome constructions to protect against the elements.

The quality of life slowly deteriorated over the years as resources got being ever more limited. Crime has never been higher.

However, the domes are only a temporary solution until the scientists can finish up building them space rockets - for which space within is limited. You need to pay your way onto the shuttle, but your still 15 grand short.

It's a jungle out there ...

![screenshot_01.png](///raw/49/z/16d16.png)

----

**Instructions:**

**[W] [A] [S] [D]** - Drive your car (tank controls)

**[F]**             - Fire gattling gun

**[SPACE] **        - Hand-brake

The aim of the game is to collect $15,500. You can earn money by picking up passengers and taking them to their destinations. Alternatively, you could just shoot them and take their money.

![map_dome.png](///raw/49/z/16ce6.png)

* I'll work on this in the coming days and upload a fix.

----

**Development:**

The game was made using **Java 1.8** and [LWJGL 3](https://www.lwjgl.org/) for the openGL bindings. I also used the [LintfordLib](https://github.com/LintfordPickle/LintfordLib) 'engine' I wrote. 


----

**Feelings: **

As is becoming a reoccurring thing with me, the scope was simply too much to finish. There are win and lose conditions which can be triggered, but the game itself is lacking any real substance.
I had a little trouble thinking of an idea for the theme, so I just decided to focus on the type of game I wanted to work out - a top-down free racer.

There are a couple of things which are almost finished - including hit contract missions, but alas I just ran out of time.

* Issues
  - There seems to be an issue with the police not triggering for chases.
  - hitting cars from certain angles causing instadeath (I likely messed up calculating the damage based on fresnel)

I'll update this page with a time-lapse, source code and some better screenshots after I've had some sleep.



Enjoy

99118.name: Anti-Virus:XP
99118.body:
Guess what? You own a fabulous pc running on the marvelous WINDOWS XP; but what happens when an annoying, disrupting virus decides to clog up your storage with unwanted data in the form of red objects that resemble the ancient space-invader style aliens? 
Well! Fasten up your seat belts as you decide to hunt down and destroy these "aliens" with your own virtual spaceship on the familiar battlefield of the Windows XP Desktop.
However, you must beware that these aliens are unpredictable and keep an eye on your storage. 
Once you run out of space its all over...
Will you eradicate this endless nuisance or fall victim to their malignant behavior? 
![Action.PNG](///raw/d23/81/z/1619d.png)


LET THE STRUGGLE COMMENCE!!!


![ezgif.com-crop.gif](///raw/d23/81/z/161a2.gif)

Hey everyone, the Ludum Dare website had so much traffic so our submission was late. We meant to have 9 levels, but 6 of them broke, so we only had 3 remaining. We only finished 2 of the 3. We are planning to make an update where we have an updated UI and a 3rd level.

99136.name: Crowded Dungeon
99136.body:
A visual novel about orcs running out of space in their dungeon. 

Artwork by me and my 15-year-old - I didn't realize the compo couldn't include a team member. Oh well! Call it a jam, I guess.

Making of (wherein I try to draw some stuff in Flash, model some stuff in Blender, and use neither) (also it's pretty boring):

99140.name: Grid Weaver
99140.body:
![teaser.gif](///raw/dae/2/z/16fab.gif)

The Grid Weaver spider is exceedingly rare. To form its web, it spits squares of the stuff out of its mouth. Unfortunately for the Grid Weaver, the web's chemical properties are such that it is highly desired by a variety of insects. Perhaps that explains why the Grid Weaver is so rare...

Controls:
WASD - Move
Space - Shoot web

Tap 1 to toggle screenshake; 2 to toggle audio.

99161.name: Rainforest
99161.body:
### DESCRIPTION
Help *Joe* push a trolley through a delivery warehouse on your first day at a job at *Rainforest inc*.

Pick up boxes of the right size and carry them to the appropriate shelf. Watch out for space on your trolley and avoid boxes from falling out of the conveyor belt, or else you will get *fired*!

![rainforest_gameplay.gif](///raw/287/2/z/17953.gif)

### CONTROLS
- **WASD** or **ARROWS** to move
- **click** on boxes to pick up
- **click** on buttons to empty shelf when full

![final_screenshot.PNG](///raw/287/2/z/17a52.png)

### INSTRUCTIONS
- Your goal is to organize as many *boxes* as possible into *shelves*
- Boxes come in different sizes: **1**, **2**, and **4**
- Each box goes to the appropriated marked shelf
- Click on a box when close enough to pick it up
- Go to the right shelf to automatically drop it
- Your cart only has *limited space*
- When a shelf is *out of space*, push the blinking button to empty it
- If **3** boxes fall out of the conveyor, it's game over and you are fired!

### NOTE
- If control is hard, use **TAB** to switch between player-relative and camera-relative controls.
- Leaderboard submission only works on desktop versions, not WebGL

Made in 72h using Unity, Blender, Photoshop.

99171.name: Slime Escape
99171.body:
![vlcsnap-2018-08-12-22h48m15s831.png](///raw/4f5/2/z/16888.png)

You'll need your wits about you as you help Dolores the Slime escape this cave!

Move: **A** and **D** or the **Arrow Keys**

Jump/Double Jump: **Space**

Dash: **Shift**

You'll gain an extra dash and a jump when you go through a portal!

Please note - there are a couple of audio glitches on the WebGL version, the **Windows/Mac builds are preferable**!
## Edit
Fixed the audio glitch and physics! http://domharris.uk/ld/fixes - rate me on the broken version obviously, but if you enjoyed it enough to play for longer use that link instead :grin:

Try out challenge mode to earn a shiny gold name on the leaderboard :grin: in challenge mode, a few of the helper platforms added to normal mode have been removed.

If you want to know how development went, [check out my post-mortem!](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/slime-escape/slime-escape-a-post-mortem)

99178.name: Oh No ! More Food : A Vegan Story
99178.body:
Embark on a journey with Steven the Vegan as he eats as much vegetables as possible.

Prove the world wrong and show them that vegetables can be both healthy and nourishing !

## Controls
Use A and D keys or Left/Right arrow to rotate the walls around Steven

## Credits

- Maksime

99179.name: Shrinking
99179.body:
One of the worst LDJam experiences in my life!

The game is supposed to be a fight and dodge Game. You have to fight a superior enemy and don't get killed. Every time you succeed the walls will come closer and you have less room to evade his attacks. Essentially you are running out of space to dodge.

Unfortunately, our team of 2 was 50% taken up by the job. So all the design is missing, the attack animation is not there, sound is not existing, the attack cooldown: nowhere to be found, and finally the health indicator.
So maybe imagine having these things and comment more on the basic principle and less on the actual game.

99189.name: Defrag
99189.body:
![banner-sharp.gif](///raw/1db/11/z/18663.gif)



**Delve inside a decaying computer from 1995.**

**Defragment the the files and free up some disk space.**

CONTROLS

WASD / Arrow keys – Move around 

ESC – Teleport back to the start (handy if you get lost)

—

![screen1.gif](///raw/1db/11/z/1866e.gif)



Uh oh! - this computer's hard disk is bursting at the seams, it can barely even switch on >_< Time to get into your miniaturised  Defragger ship and delve into the heart of this decaying computer to help free up some space.

Find all the pieces of the fragmented gifs to win - explore, solve puzzles, open shortcuts and plunge into heaps of tiny computer files as if they were dried leaves in the fall /autumn.

This computer is falling apart and large chunks of it are open to THE VOID  - enjoy exploring this terrifying, trippy, infinite, beautifully overdrawing domain!
There's all sorts of crazy nonsense in this nightmarebox - keep an eye out for a foe from a bygone era of word processing ;)


![screen2.gif](///raw/1db/11/z/18671.gif)

Music by Chime  – Everything else by Luke No Further

99196.name: DE/VOID
99196.body:
A minimalist physics-based twin-stick shooter with a greater focus on puzzles.
Use mouse controls and keyboard (WASD or direction keys).

In the inflationary universe of DE/VOID, inflate the enemies and reduce the counter to zero to win. But you'll find yourself quickly running out of space.
 
Each stage brings its unique characteristics and you'll have to understand how each creature works to complete the stage.

Stages completed are blacked out in the main menu, and you can revisit the game anytime to complete the stages in any order. Made a whopping 35 stages although I was really gunning for 42 stages. Can you complete them all? 

Made in Unity

Music and sound effects made in LMMS 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dtp9HtHuJrw

99218.name: Savle
99218.body:
**Savle is an experimental tiny text-based game with file system interactions. It is based on the idea of disk space, that we have to manage. You will be playing an employee of Savle and will have to delete files (in real Windows/Mac/Linux file system) to free up space in customers disks.**

![cover-ldjam.png](///raw/694/c/z/1616c.png)

:warning: **Warning** : *This game is made with a Shell (Bash) script. So the program can technically do what we want, including deleting files from your computer. But I testify on the honor that I never used "rm" (remove) function and even writing function. I guarantee that I only used read functions that are working only in the game folder. I also did not use any online function.
You can see all of that by editing the script, but if you do so before playing the game, you will be spoiled. If you play the game, and understand Bash, it could be cool to write a comment saying "I understood the code, and I can garantee that it does not contain any malware" (for other people who don't understand the code).* Thanks! :)

*The game files weigh +600Mo and that's normal.*

*I did the game in Compo settings but have to use pictures, videos and music made earlier.
All the files are self made, excepting the music files.*

License : [CC-BY-SA](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/)

**Thanks for your understanding.** :thumbsup:

99219.name: Running Space
99219.body:
# [Play in Browser (Unity WebGL)](https://geeitsomelaldy.itch.io/running-space)

Travel to a far future space station where the prisoners fight against automated drones to win their freedom in the Running Space Tournament!

Fight through 7 stages of enemies, but Watch your step! it's not just the drones you have to worry about.  The arena itself will disappear under your feet if you take too long.

99220.name: Closure
99220.body:
Closure is what you get when you realize you have 8 hours left for the jam.. After rushing to make anything you look up and realize.. "Oh thats the timer for compo..!!!!!.." welp lol Here ya go! 

Controls: Left = A, Left Arrow. Right = D, Right Arrow. Restart = R.

Collect  diamonds to make walls recede.

4 hits = Dead.

It's not much but at least I still made to the jam :D and with posting this I'll get some closure.. Get it :>

Music from Jukedeck - create your own at http://jukedeck.com

Hope you guys have a bit of fun! I can't wait to play yours!!! :D

99223.name: Mishap (Garbage LD42 Game)
99223.body:
This game fucking *sucks*, but I wanted to do SOMETHING.

My *original* idea was to have a guy pressure wash graffiti off of the ground from people trying to make statements about the government/lizard people/hot pockets being too hot, and when each level passed whatever graffiti was left would stay there forever. But then I thought I was running out of time to do it right, so I scoped what I had down to two graffiti people who had fallen in love and wanted to kiss before the building they were on was demolished, and all the negative space around them acted as walls you couldn't pass, so when parts of the building exploded it would then be impassible. This was actually WORSE because it was a mix between 2D and 3D and had a lot of weird dynamic stuff going on.

***SO***

This is what you get now: A game about a wounded scientist crawling to a portal before some scaffolding falls on him. It's pretty stale and has no replayability, but it's better than nothing. :)

A better game than this in a similar vain is Diving Simulator 2015, one of my previous LD games. You should play that if you some better button smashing action.

99227.name: Bounce Block
99227.body:
Play as a square try to grab the coins and a avoid the other smaller blocks!

Have fun.

I couldn't do sound or have a UI cause I ran out of energy.

99234.name: Dungeon Faller
99234.body:
# Dungeon Faller

Traverse through a dungeon while the floor is falling away!

As you move through the dungeon both enemies and yourself will eat away at the floor. Try to make it to the end without falling through!

**NOTE**: The web version of the game has known issues with audio and particles. For the best experience, please download the game for your platform.

### Controls
Movement: WASD or Arrow keys
Jump: Spacebar
Shoot: Left mouse button
Aim: Mouse

![Screenshot_2018-08-12_18-10-57.png](///raw/dbf/11/z/16a83.png)
![Screenshot_2018-08-12_18-10-03.png](///raw/dbf/11/z/16a8a.png)

99244.name: Chief Data Engineer
99244.body:
![ChiefDataEngineerUpdated.png](///raw/cf6/2/z/17c0c.png)
You are the Chief Data Engineer of a Starship. The ship uses an advanced storage drive that holds Pentabytes of data but sometimes requires manual defragmentation. ***Your hard drive is running out of space!*** Free it up!

![MainStoryScreen.png](///raw/cf6/2/z/16bcc.png)

![Level1.png](///raw/cf6/2/z/16bbb.png)
# HOW TO PLAY

Use your mouse to drag data storage units around. Drag all the storage units into the green target squares to beat the level.

99245.name: TeTrans
99245.body:
You decided to follow your dream and become a trucker. 

**[Play now in your browser!](https://boltkey.cz/tetrans/)**

Travel across different cities, pick up and deliver goods and gain money. Try to gain as much money as possible before you run out of fuel!

![tetranslogo1.png](///raw/194/z/167da.png)

Your task is to deliver goods from point A (a city with a question mark) to point B (a city with an exclamation mark).

Click on a rectangle with a question mark to select a good you will want to deliver. Then, you can place it into your cargo space. You can rotate the good you acquired using right click. After you load the goods, you will have to deliver them to correct city in order to get some money.

![ld42gif3.gif](///raw/194/z/16814.gif)

There are 3 zones to unlock, discover and explore! Can you hit the high-score tables?

---

---

## FAQ

**Q**: How do I get more fuel?

**A**: You don't. The objective of the game is earning as much money as possible before running out of fuel.

---

**Q**: Why is the first zone the Czech Republic?

**A**: Because I live there.

---

**Q**: I can only get up to 1 star! Help!

**A**: Try to deliver goods with high value and don't get distracted by low-value ones.

---

**Q**: Why is there no music?

**A**: Cause I suck at making music.

---

**Q**: What are the stars gained based on?

**A**: They are based on the amount of money you gain in the zone. Here are the thresholds: [1, 350, 400, 530, 600], [900, 1100, 1400, 1600, 1700], [1800, 2200, 2500, 3000, 4000]

---

**Q**: How is the good value determined?

**A**: (10 + *a*) \* *b* \* .08 where *a* is length of the shortest possible path between the two cities in pixels and *t* is amount of blocks the good is made from. The T shape counts as 5 blocks, for whatever reason.

---

**Q**: Please, I want to see the screen lapse, is there one?

**A**: Yeah, of course there is a screen lapse, you'll find it between the links.

99248.name: Mr Red Rectangle
99248.body:
![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 11.02.07 PM.png](///raw/f29/z/17367.png)

Help Mr Red Rectangle escape from Deepest Darkest Dungeon™. But move with caution, The walls are closing in, soon he will be trapped and stuck in the Deepest Darkest Dungeon™ forever. __Oh, wait. Time travel?__

# Controls

- LEFT / RIGHT to move
- UP to jump
- SPACE to reverse time

_* You may have to click on the iframe to capture input_

99267.name: Robert Raccoon and the Great Gallery Robbery
99267.body:
You are Robert Raccoon,  and you have fine taste (despite being a trash panda) in Art. 

Security Cameras make your trip across the art gallery tricky, as Space is Running Out (the theme). Dodge them and grab a nice Van Gopher, and get outta there!

Made with Godot 3.0.6, blender, etc.

99276.name: TrashBot
99276.body: After the commercialization of replicators, garbage has been building up quickly and recycling systems have outdated. You are a TrashBot who's tasked with keeping garbage buildup under control. You will need to load garbage into the airlock to keep your station clean.

99281.name: Dish It Out
99281.body:
Fling cup, bowls, and plates to land them on the table in the middle of the room. Points are scored for each dish remaining on the table when time expires.


![YouDishIt.gif](///raw/a5/z/16a82.gif)

![Game3.PNG](///raw/a5/z/1693a.png)

![Game1.PNG](///raw/a5/z/1693d.png)

** Controls: ** 

- Move camera with WASD

- Rotate camera with Right Mouse button (or Alt + LMB)

- Mousewheel zoom camera in/out

- Enter dish launch mode by left-clicking and holding on a dish

- Drag the mouse to change the throwing power

- Shift + Mouse to add/subtract height from the throwing power

- Release mouse button to throw the dish


** Objective: **
- Get as many dishes onto the center table as possible before time runs out

- For a dish to count, it must remain on the center table

- Each dish type has its own point value

** Version

v0.11 - Capture and hide mouse cursor whn aiming dishes 

v0.12 - Allow movement before the timer starts

## Post your high scores below

99282.name: Slaughter House
99282.body:
Created in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 42 (August 10-13th, 2018)

Theme: Running Out of Space


![2018-08-13 (2).png](///raw/9e4/z/18167.png)
![2018-08-13 (5).png](///raw/9e4/z/1817e.png)

Gameplay

-----------------------------------------------------

Animals will come at you in endless waves. The corpses will start to pile up.

Shove them into the meat grinder to  and get points.

The Meat Grinder will go off every 30 seconds 

Push the corpses into the meat grinder before the time runs out buy some breathing room and score. 

Control

------------------------------------------------------

WASD  to move

Mouse to aim

Hold Left click to fire

Music 

------------------------------------------------------

"In a Heartbeat" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

99288.name: Space Survivor
99288.body: Destroy and loot the alien spacecrafts, collect fuel, material, wrench. Repair your spacecraft.

99296.name: Trashy Universe
99296.body:
## Universe is Trashy!
- Robots are producing more and more space junks

  - Freeze them by shooting them, temporarily preventing them from moving/produce junks
- Clean the junk without colliding with them

- Don't Get Overwhelmed by Increasing number of junks

![Information.png](///raw/811/21/z/161c2.png)

- Press W to accelerate

- Left mouse click to shoot
  - If you miss, your bullet will turn into a junk
  - You can also use it to freeze the robots

- Move your mouse to look around


### If you are playing in WebGL, it's best NOT to use the full screen mode. It breaks the aspect ratio. Also, for Windows/Mac/Linux version, aspect ratio is breaking for 'Some' devices. Most reliable version so far is WebGL version without full screen mode. 


# Preview

99305.name: 20,000 Leaks Under the Sea

The longer you work, the longer the patch will stay; weld 100% to fix a leak much longer.

99311.name: Amistad
99311.body:
Venture through the infamous Friendship Bridge (Paraguay - Brazil), one of the greatest smuggling routes in the world. Bring what you can in your smuggling bag!

W A S D - Movement
J       - Drop last item
K       - Buy/ Sell / Start new game

99318.name: Blinding Caves
99318.body:
![gp6.gif](///raw/521/z/15c4d.gif)

In this game you have to complete simple platformer levels, but the deeper you go in the cave, the fewer visibility you have, so take your time!




## Controls:

* A and D : Move

* Space : Jump

* click & drag : move the camera




Have fun !




* Game made with GM Studio 1.4

* Music made with Bosca Ceoil

* Art made with Pyxel Edit

99325.name: Mob Floor
99325.body:
Hack, Slash, and Toss mobs to avoid *running out of space*!!

Defeat monsters to stun them, and toss them over the bottom of the level to kill them! If you dont get rid of them, they will swarm you, take up movable space, and make it harder to survive.

How high of a score can you get?

Kill and throw the dummy off of the void to start the game.


*** Controls (Keyboard) ***

wasd - movement.
L-click - attack.

R-Click - Block

Space - Grab and Throw

Enter - Pause

*** Controls (Gamepad) ***

arrow keys to move

x - Attack

b -Block

a - Grab and Throw!

start - Pause

*** Safety Keys (Important) ***

Ctrl - Returns player to game area, near the center of the room.
(Only use if you get stuck in a glitch! Abusing this will ruin the game! In other words, dont use it just because monsters are swarming you)

Esc - Restarts the game

* if you get a popup asking to search for an app in the app store, just click no *

Press 0 to reset the high score.

99335.name: Cell Trapper
99335.body:
## Description

The game is simple, you have to trap purple cells using walls. However, if you build more walls to trap the cells, your movement will also be limited because of the walls. Trap as many cells as possible. Go through as many waves as possible within the shortest time as possible.

## Screenshots

![title.png](///raw/29/z/17545.png)

![screenshot1.png](///raw/29/z/17546.png)

![screenshot2.png](///raw/29/z/17547.png)

## Controls

* `Space` - Build Walls
* `R` - Reset or Destroy Walls
* `Arrows` - Move

## Technologies

* Game Engine: __Godot Engine__
* Sound Effects: __LabChirp__
* Graphics: __PaintTool SAI__, __Adobe Photoshop__, __Aseprite__

## How to Play

![how.png](///raw/29/z/17d6d.png)

## Downloads

99342.name: Not enough [ SPACE ]
99342.body:
# Not enough [ SPACE ]
![DEMO](///raw/ed3/81/z/18080.gif)
> I'm actually a Front-end Web Developer but I'm also a Hobbyist Game Developer. I joined this contest a bit late, but my game is finally finished. This is my very first game I made on web. And this is also the first idea when I read the Ludum Dare 42's Theme.


## The story
When you go to work the first day at a company called IBEEM, IBEEM company was being harassed by a dark force called the SpaceJamLord. They cursed all the company's digital material by deleting all white space in the text. And also cursed all the company's most modern computers by ruining the [SPACE] button. The company fell into bankruptcy. You are the last hope of the company with the super-ancient computer but can curb the curse.



## Tech I used in this game

  - VueJS
  - Netlify for deploying
  - Photoshop for drawing 
  - Google Fonts
  - This color palette https://coolors.co/1974c6-1781c9-f0a821-d9601e-ffffff
  - A few Monster's energy can
  - My sick humour and imagination
> I'm really sorry because the game has no sound effect or background music. I don't have enough [TIME] to make some. If you guys like this game I will update that later.

99390.name: Too Many Gems
99390.body:
Hello! :smile: 

## What is this game?

In ***Too Many Gems*** you are on a quest to collect all the magic gems of the dungeon, equipped with many tools to help you: a flame thrower, an ice maker, an axe, a shield and an umbrella. But your bag is full and you have to get rid of the right tool each time you collect a new gem. Will you make it to the end without all your gadgets?

## Controls:

Remark: please consider changing the "Use an object" control to F or R if you use the AD keys on the keyboard. You can do that in the "Input" tab before launching the game.

### Keyboard
* **A/D, arrows** Move left/right
* **Space** Jump
* **Q/E** Change equipped tool
* **1-6** Change equipped tool (quick select)
* **X** Use equipped tool
* **R** Restart the level
* **Escape** Quit the game

### XBOX 360 controller
* **Left stick** Move left/right
* **A** Jump
* **LB/RB** Change equipped tool
* **B** Use equipped tool
* **Back** Restart the level
* **Start** Quit the game

## Tools used

* **Engine / Programmation:** Unity 2018.2 with C#
* **Graphics:** Photoshop, Photofiltre
* **Sounds:** Audacity and a Guitar Hero microphone
* **Music:** Bosca Ceoil

## Screenshots

![screen_final4.png](///raw/1e/z/175d1.png)

![screen_final5.png](///raw/1e/z/175d2.png)

99456.name: DON'T RUN OUT OF SPACE
99456.body:
In DON'T RUN OUT OF SPACE (DROOS) you take on the role of a greedy whiteboard worm. Your goal is to deposit as much "art"/"treasure" as you can before the whiteboard fills up.

Controls:
- a         - move left
- d         - move right
- space - jump
- l-shift - explode

![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/f74/81/z/167b2.gif)

Press "Enter" to play. Deposit treasure by making contact with it while  your character is the same colour. Change colours using colour vortexes. Break-down treasure by exploding it. Can only explode 1 time per second (1 e/s). You lost if a treasure gets stuck in the ceiling for more than 5 seconds. 

Good luck.

99481.name: Floorspace Deprecation
99481.body:
Whelp, here we are again. This is my fourth time doing Ludum Dare, but third time publishing a game for it. With the theme being "Running out of space" I chose to make a top down shooter style game with a disintegrating floor. While you play, pieces of the "stone" floor underneath you will start to disintegrate and fall down into lava. Your goal is to shoot the enemies while avoiding the lava. It's a pretty simple idea.

![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 8.50.43 PM.png](///raw/8b1/7/z/17185.png)![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 8.50.35 PM.png](///raw/8b1/7/z/17186.png)![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 8.50.31 PM.png](///raw/8b1/7/z/17187.png)

99492.name: Backpack Simulator
99492.body:
## "Backpack Simulator? Did you run that by a focus group?"
### ~My Imaginary Boss, probably

In this RPG, you were reborn in a mythical fantasy world of your dreams... as a backpack. Worst yet, your Adventurer is a kleptomaniac and a hoarder. Your only hope of seeing the Goddess again, is keeping your Adventurer alive by managing their inventory and making sure that they don't run out of space.

## "Has a good sense of humor, I guess."
### ~Imaginary Focus Group, probably

As a sentient backpack, you control all the items that are inside of you. You can circle locations and encounters on your map to guide your Adventurer. Each monster/encounter is unique with varying degrees of difficulty and strategy. Some monsters require more preparation and certain buffs/items. However, with each monster defeated your kleptomaniac Adventurer will take all the loot... and the sticks... and the nails... You will need to craft and combine these items to keep your storage low and your Adventurer unencumbered.

## "Explain to me what you mean by 'Video Game Competition?'"
### My Next Job Interview, almost definitely

Features:
- Nine different enemy encounters including two different boss enemies.
- Over fifty items each with their own unique flavor text - some of them are even funny!
- Blood, sweat, tears, sleep deprivation, friendships forever shattered due to this game.
- A full fledged inventory management and crafting system.
- A ~~immersive~~ combat system with buffs, debuffs, enemy special attacks and sfx.
- Some semblance of a plot.!!

[LD42Menu.PNG](///raw/619/61/z/17feb.png)
[Capture.PNG](///raw/619/61/z/17fdb.png)
[Capture.PNG](///raw/619/61/z/17fb2.png)

99533.name: Space Box Rescue
99533.body:
![vlcsnap-2018-08-13-16h27m49s632.png](///raw/2cb/z/177d1.png)

![vlcsnap-2018-08-13-16h28m03s297.png](///raw/2cb/z/177d2.png)

![vlcsnap-2018-08-13-16h28m12s140.png](///raw/2cb/z/177d4.png)

# Space Box Rescue

This game is a Sokoban-like where you have to rescue some boxes. Easy enough!

## How to play

Use the W, A, S, D keys to walk around. F to undo your move, R to reset the level.

There are 10 levels. First play-through should take about 5-10 minutes. A new game mechanic is introduced in level 8, in hindsight I should have worked it in earlier or made more levels...

About the online version: I only really tested it on Chrome, it should work on Firefox, but it most certainly won't work on Safari or Edge/IE.

Thank you *ccCam* from the #ludumdare IRC channel for testing the Linux version!

** This is a puzzle game, it requires some patience - if you quit at level 4 you're missing out **

## How it was made

- Three.js (WebGL)
- JavaScript
- Audacity for sound effects
- Logic Pro for the music
- features the stone slabs in my driveway as a texture :wink: 

## Post Compo Changelog

- scoreboard display
- took out level 2 because it was superfluous

99565.name: CENTIFEED 2042
99565.body:
(4th Ludum Dare!) CENTIFEED 2042 is a snake-like game where you are a hungry centipede looking for good mushrooms to eat so that you can grow up big and strong.

- Eat the good mushrooms to grow more tail segments.
- Eating bad mushrooms will cause you to lose 2 tail segments.
- The more tail segments you have the higher your score will be.
- If your head touches your tail... game over!
- You can move outside the bounds of the screen, but don't wander for too long... you'll lose 10 tail segments or more if you are away for too long.
- Use the arrow keys (Up/Down/Left/Right) to move.

99754.name: Compactory
99754.body:
![CompactoryBannerBig.png](///raw/700/31/z/169b6.png)

---

## Factory planning in a compact space! You must route all packages to the correct exits by designing conveyor paths.
![Easy.gif](///raw/700/31/z/16905.gif)

---

## Boxes must keep moving! If a box's entry point gets too backed up, you will lose!
![Medium.gif](///raw/700/31/z/16907.gif)

---

## Space is limited! You'll have to be clever if you want to have a fully functional factory!
![Hard.gif](///raw/700/31/z/1690c.gif)


---

## Controls:
- **Q: select basic conveyor belts** (moves boxes in the indicated direction)
- **W: select splitter conveyor belts** (moves boxes in one of 2 directions)
- **E: select bouncer conveyor belts** (bounces boxes over one space)

- **Left Click: place selected conveyor**
- **Right Click: delete conveyor at mouse**

- **Space: pause game** (great for planning, you can still modify your factory while paused)
- **Z: quick restart**

## Some Notes:

To create conveyors, click and hold on the grid space you want it, then drag in the direction it should point. It takes a little getting used to, but once you master it you can quickly create complex conveyor lines.

Deleting conveyors actually just marks them for deletion. Marked conveyors will be removed once there are no boxes on them.

Box receptacles have a powerful suction! A box of the correct color will be swept up by a receptacle if it passes by.

Boxes take time to be processed! You can't funnel too many boxes into the same receptacle, you'll have to split up the load to keep things flowing.

The game is a little rough around the edges because I wasn't able to start until half-way through compo, but I'm pretty happy with how it turned out!

99794.name: Not Enough Room in this Space[bar]
99794.body:
## Have you ever rolled your face on your keyboard and thought: "Hey, I wish someone could gamify this. I also wish my friend could do this with me!"

Well random internet stranger, you are in luck! Not Enough Room in this Space[bar] brings you the lowest tier of gaming, playable with or without a friend. No limbs required! (You still need your head) 

Mash keys on your keyboard to turn adjacent keys to your color. Try not to accidentally mash your opponent's keys, since there's no way for me to enforce the rules in real life. In fact, let's call that a feature!

## Features
- Heartpounding local multiplayer action!
- Minimal UI elements so that more of your attention is focused on breaking your keyboard!
- A pure experience showcasing one feature and one feature only!
- A deep solo player experience nested within the multiplayer mode, as I can't prevent you from being Player 1 and Player 2 at the same time!
- Download for Windows, Mac, and Linux at my Itch.io page. Link at the bottom of the page!

## Known bugs
- ​Sometimes the Left Brace key refuses to accept an input. This is a bug in Godot 3's export process. If you really want to mash your face against your keyboard, download the source from my [Github](https://github.com/you-win/Ludum-Dare-42)​​ and the [Godot 3 engine​](https://godotengine.org/download/) (they're both pretty lightweight). If anyone knows what might be causing this, any help would be appreciated. This is also why I am not providing an HTML5 version, as those have never worked for me.

## Tools Used
- [Godot 3](https://godotengine.org)
- [Pyxel Edit](https://pyxeledit.com/)
- [Krita](https://krita.org/)
- [FL Studio](https://www.image-line.com/flstudio/)
- [bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/)

![clean-board.png](///raw/3a8/41/z/16203.png) ![dirty-board.png](///raw/3a8/41/z/16205.png)

## Designer/Developer/Artist/Musician Retrospective
On a more serious note, my design for this game was way too lax. I originally had a few, very solid ideas lined up but decided to go with something more wacky at my roommate's suggestion. Instead of doing the planning work for how everything would work out, I just started work immediately and made things up as I went. Definitely not a good choice.

The coding for this jam did not go as planned. My initial design for how the code should have been structured was extremely sub-optimal. This made adding additional features beyond, mash buttons win game, difficult. You can take a look at the garbage on my Github page. Please pay attention to how overloaded each Key.gd class is with logic.

The art process was hampered by the fact I tried to procedurally generate each key that I needed instead of just creating a separate asset for each key. That was a mistake because it was a huge time sink, and the results of that endeavor weren't great. If I had to do it again, I would go for a hand-drawn look. It probably would have taken less time and the aesthetic would have fit the game better.

The music creation process went the best for this jam. I got everything slapped together in about 5 hours, which I think wasn't too bad. I liked the result but the energy of the music probably fit a more structured, arcadey kind of game more.

99820.body:
Can YOU survive highschool for 10 weeks? Find out in this game which mimics the education system in quality! 

To witness the game in all of its Gloruois Glory consider it is recommended to play it in full screen mode!

Do you like spaghetti? If yes then click here for the source code! https://github.com/mmmuscus/ludumDare42

Actual Game: https://mmmuscus.itch.io/french-penprice-doom

Known Bug: Sometimes you can't click on some of the shapes properly when two or more overlap. If this is the case try and grab it on a piont where it does not overlap with any other shape.

P.S.: Any and all critisism is appriciated! I want to hone my craft in every way possible

99837.name: Beaver Pitch
99837.body:
Barnaby the beaver's lodge is under attack by a bunch of naughty neighbour beavers. They want to steal Barnaby's logs to use in their own dams. You have to stop them!!

My idea was that Barnaby can't swim, so as the logs are stolen he is *running out of space*.

**But** I ran out of time to do animations, music and victory conditions :(

![thieving-beavers.gif](///raw/b70/21/z/166ff.gif)

## Controls

Hit SPACE to start.

Use the arrow keys to move.

Walk into the beavers to bop them and get rid of them.

The game is over when all logs are stolen.

Hit space to go back to the title screen.

## Thanks to

* [trivial-gamekit](https://borodust.org/projects/trivial-gamekit/) by Pavel Korolev - this made writing and publishing a game in Common-Lisp pretty easy!
* [GIMP](https://www.gimp.org/)
* [Bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/)

99842.name: Bardolf's Curse
99842.body:
**Bardolf Malgerius**, corrupt advisor to **King Nichol**, has put a **curse** on the castle. It's up to **you**, a mere squire, to **stop** his dark magic and **escape**.

A work of interactive fiction crafted with [Inform 7](http://inform7.com/), Bardolf's Curse is playable in full online. Be sure to check out the [Introduction to IF](http://mrjoshuamclean.com/bardolf/compo/IntroductionToIF.pdf) and [IF Postcard](http://mrjoshuamclean.com/bardolf/compo/Postcard.pdf) if you're new to interactive fiction.

Use of theme is simply inventory limitation. Would have opted out of the "theme" category if I could. >_>

* **Release 1 (Compo)**: **Please rate according to this version, as this is a COMPO entry.** In addition to the traditional bugs of a game made in 48 hours, this version lacks several items listed in room descriptions. If something is there but you can't examine it, chances are I didn't get around to describing it, and it's not important. So the Compo version is--in a way--easier than intended.
* **Release 2 (Jam)**: Over 70 things added with revised room descriptions, improved clarity, a few additional actions, and an alternate (bad) ending. Not finished by a long shot, but a significantly improved version.

Thank you for playing, rating, and providing feedback!

*Cover art is by my beautiful fiancee [Kate Goebel](https://www.instagram.com/katethemakeupmonster). There's no art **in** the game, so it still qualifies. Right? Right. :)*

99843.name: The Grid Room
99843.body:
![TheGridRoom.png](///raw/1ee/8/z/17f41.png)

​This is a short game made for Ludum Dare #42, the theme being 'running out of space'. I had issues with inspiration with this theme, so the game loop is no where near as engaging or polished as I think it should be. I just made it up as I went along.

CONTROLS
WASD\Arrow Keys - Movement & terminal grid selection
Spacebar - Jump
Left Shift - Sprint
E/Left Mouse Button - Use
Escape/Right Mouse Button - Cancel
0 or P - Quit

GAMEPLAY INSTRUCTIONS
- Grab the coloured diamonds and place them in the terminal scan zone.
- Select a grid, cell level, and cell to place the diamond in. The diamond in the scan zone 
will automatically move when an empty cell is select.
- Arrange HORIZONTAL rows of the same coloured diamonds.
- Submit the contents of the grid via the submit button on the terminal. (NOTE - This will
submit any correct rows of diamonds in the grid).
- Submitting correct rows converts the diamonds to disk space.
- When the disk is full, grab another disk and put it into the terminal. This will remove 1 strike.
- A strike is gained when 4 items reach the end of the conveyor belt and there is no data in the disk.
- 3 strikes is game over.
- At the end of each round a grid will disappear at random.

99848.name: Out Of Space

99851.name: Bloody Cell
99851.body:
Hey guys, I am new to this competition and bring this little product.
I don't want to be boring, so let's make it short:

>> You are a T-Cell in a human body and fight against the cancers.

Ya, deadly simple! That's it!
Of course the mechanism is a bit more complex, but, no worries.
(If you are bored, then just skip the following lines and download the game)

Here comes's a complete mechanism explanation:

>> 1.  There will be cancer tumors randomly generated in the area every time period.

>> 2.  Cancer tumors will block your way meanwhile some of them will spawn cancer cells.

>> 3.  Cancer cells may rush to you and explode or just swipe, trying to make you dead.

>> 4. You can shoot both tumors and cells but tumors usually takes more damage.

>> 5. You can also call for a Chemotherapy which gives a map-range attack, but be careful -- this will hurt you too!

>> 6. You just can't win.

And now let me explain, well, the assets I created (due to competition policies).
So, let's first begin with audios.
It is my first time so I am really deadline-catching. I soon figured out that I have not much time for musics, so you can see there are only two sound effects. The gun shot sound is a bit weird because it was created by swiping my bath towel real fast. And the blood splatter sound was from drinking Orange Finda. Haha, creative as I am. The BGM is somewhat my favorite factor of this game. I used Garageband and only spend 3 hours to get the final product. Quite Japanese style right? I got the original idea from BioHazard, then came out this stuff. Hope you guys like it.

About art, no, my pain!
As you are going to see, there are only cubic stuffs in the game. This is because they are all created by the primitive cube meshes. What's more? There is also no animation. I hate to use animations, making the process unpredictable and debug-unfriendly. I code all the animation work -- lerp, slerp, damp, then everything is in control but wasted quite a lot of time. Most of the textures, or the ui sprites in the game were created through PowerPoint. I am a good PPT artist. The only thing that was difficult was the blood splatter pattern. I tried multiples ways, and finally I procedurally processed the texture from the Photoshop (you know, combinations of different brushes), sharpen the edge just a little bit. So you could see the resolution is terrible.

Then the source code. Cinemachine is what I used for Unity's camera management, and I also learned some new knowledges of it this time. The movement of the enemies comes from the new Unity Navigation sets. It is way more convenient than before -- such as runtime baking which is extremely helpful this time. The optimization of this game isn't too bad. I mean, I try to pool everything that I can -- explosions, particles, bullets, enemies -- but you will understand my pain if you could insist for several minutes in the game.

I really enjoyed this match. I was first killed by the theme because I thought that it was too limited. Soon, just half an hour later, I came up with this idea. But time, emmm, really a catchy thing. It is now 4 am in the morning in my country, and I'm a high school student and no sleep. Jesus, I even have another report to hand in this afternoon. Why so unfair>>>just kidding, but I did get entertained by the experience, hope you guys too! Good luck to all the participants! Maybe you could get a nice ranking, who knows?

Finally!
Read after me >>>>
Bloody Hell? Bloody Cell!

Now, enjoy your time!!!

================ Bug Fix ================
1. The UI problem is fixed! No worries for resolution now!
2. Th bug of Chemotherapy is fixed!
3. Optimize a bit of the performance!

================ Bug Still Exist ================
1. Player movement sometimes cannot receive the correct input -- the problem is due to the separation of logic frame and movement frame, taking time to recode it.
2. Undiscovered yet......

99858.body:
### Ball on keys is a game in which you click keys on the keyboard in order to create borders around them.

99859.name: Evolucity - Build as high as you can!
99859.body:
Welcome to Evolucity!
Try to build as high as you can, without losing your balance!

![upload0&.gif](///raw/5fc/c/z/1622b.gif)

The goverment is out of space and has the ridiculous idea of building vertically. As an Engineer, you will need to try and stack as many buildings as possible on top of each other. This can be pretty ridiculous!

![upload2.gif](///raw/5fc/c/z/1622d.gif)

Tips for playing:
- Left mouse click to place buildings
- Right mouse click to rotate camera
- Place as few buildings as possible per level to maximize your Score
- To go a level higher, click on Next Level
- Don't loose any base blocks, otherwise you will loose the game
- Loosing buildings, will only cost you points

99882.name: Blank Slate
99882.body:
Blank Slate is a mobile-first game I created from scratch for the LD42 Compo.

I wanted to make an entire mobile game within the 48 hour time limit, so I picked a simple concept that went along with the theme and ran with it. I'll be submitting the LD version to the Android and iOS app stores soon.

99894.name: Room Tetris
99894.body:
"Room Tetris" is our family in-joke for trying to fit into one place more things that reasonably should fit there.

This basically describes the game. :smile: 

You have a room (split into tiles) and a set of things to place into it.
Use mouse to select what you want to place and try to position it into the room.
There are however 2 additional constrains:
- The room has 2 windows and both must remain unobstructed - meaning nothing is stanging on the middle tile in front of window.
- A clear no-diagonals path must remain from the door (on the right) and touching all the placed items.

The game will no allow you to put an item if any of those two conditions are not met.
You can pick up and reposition items that were already placed.

Press Esc to remove the item (you will have to put it back eventualy).

Space to rotate item.

It is not obvious, because the supplementary texts are missing, but the game consists of 4 levels. Once you place all the items from one level - new items are added to the list.
Once you clear all 4 levels - you get the game wins screen.

Yes, it **IS POSSIBLE** to fit all items into the room while meeting additional constraints. Thought it might be challenging.

99900.name: Waste Control
99900.body: Year 2042. Mankind explored space with such enthusiasm that became... completely cut out from it. Space junk was accumulated on the planet's orbit for many years, and now space ships completely ran out of space to fly. Your mission is to gather waste completely and open up the road to the stars.

99901.name: Edge of the Universe
99901.body:
### How to play
Your goal is to find the edge of the universe.
To reach it you need fuel for your ship.

To get fuel you need to collect fuel components.
A+B will create normal fuel, and A+B+C will create super fuel, which will reach a lot longer. A and B is fairly common, and C is rarer.
Arrows to the side of the screen will point you to the closest component. Click the arrow and the ship will automatically track it.

Drive the ship with the controls in the lower left corner. The speed slider sets the speed. The steer slider steers the ship while you hold it and will return to center once you let go.

The fuel drains quickly, so find components fast.
The fuel drains faster while accelerating.

The distance from your starting position is your score. Try to get as far as you can!

### Tools used
- Unity
- Visual Studio
- GIMP
- bfxr
- Audacity

99908.name: RC Adventures

if you want to have fun: hold richtclick, but that never got finished so it is buggy as hell.

99931.name: Solar Destroyer
99931.body:
In this game you are a space ship that needs to defeat as many waves of aliens as possible.  The map fills up over time as more aliens appear and place walls for the player to run into. 

The aliens are small green and purple dots.  
You lose a life if you run into an alien or a wall.

Controls:
[WASD]       -> moves your ship.
[arrow keys] -> shoot lasers in that direction.

Technically I created this entire game by myself, but I didn't have any time to work on it for the first 24 hours and couldn't finish it for the Compo.  

¯\_(ツ)_/¯ Oh well.

99942.name: Trapped Dwarfs
99942.body:
# Hello,

# Presentation:
It's my **4th** ludum dare in compo mode.
But it's my first time using **Unity** (I was using GameMarker).

You'll see, there is a problem with the view. When I was debugging, I haven't had the 'finalise' view and you can see more than I espected (Unity noob problem)
And the sound, the is no sound on WebGL.... A bug with Web GL build, so if you want the sound, Windows link!

# Game :
You are some dwarf, working at the mine.
But then suddendly, an unknow people have decide to kill all the dwarf.
You have to survive! And for that you'll be able to use old relics. 

# Control : 
- Move : Arrow Key
- Use : Q and W

Thank you for testing.
And sorry, not my best game x)

99967.name: Hell Runner
99967.body:
It Is A Hard Game That Consists of many Different Types of spanner that will Make You Life Difficult.
You were sent to hell and now have to get out by strategically moving between shields till there are non at all.
This Is My first game Submitted To The LD JAM.
Thank You For Playing

99975.name: Inventory Story
99975.body:
You play… not the knight but his trusted backpack! 

- Throw away junk by dragging items out of your backpack!
- Give your ‘Knight’ weapons (on time!) by putting items in his weapon rack on top.
- Don’t give him a weapon, and you’ll get hit! Repeat this 3 times and your Grand Adventure is over!
- Everything is a weapon, but only real ones give the best loot!
- Complete quests to get points!
- Sell 25% of your loot to Mr. Checkpoint. The sold loot adds to your score!

‘Heroes’ always get the credit.. but this is your time to shine!

Art and Design by KapiteinKoekwous! (the Author(s) section didn't work on the 'Edit Page' function).
Programming and Audio by FredMaaktGames

Trailer is still in the making! Will release it tomorrow.

100009.name: Package Overload
100009.body:
![Unity_2018-08-13_22-55-25.png](///raw/289/z/18112.png)

Welcome to Package Overload! In Package Overload you need to store and find packages quickly or the customers will complain. Hopefully you won't run out of space or get fired because you get too many compains!

**How to play: **
Customers will come to the front desk and either give you a package you need to store, or request a package you have in storeage, indicated by a transparent ghost of the wanted package. The number on the packge must match!

**Controls:**
* WASD to move
* Left click to pick up
* Right click to drop
* Space to jump
* M to exit to menu

Controller also supported (win build)

100022.name: It's Raining Pillows!
100022.body:
You never know whats going on inside the mind of a cat but our own sweeite loves pillows so we imagine it looking something like this! This game is dedicated to her, our wonderful Naminé.

Gameplay: hit the pillows (with X) to rip them apart and if the room is filled up with 50 pillows it's game over.

We have been having so much fun making this, and even though we wish there was more time for polish we are proud to present: It's Raining Pillow.

Hope you enjoy and please let us know what score you got!

You play as Max Power, a young handsome film maker, seeking to banish ghosts by taking an object to another area whilst avoiding ghosts with your camera. 

As we all know ghosts don't want to be seen on a camera.

Claustrophobia is a survival game

You're trapped in your hotel room? Can you get out?

100045.body:
You have been captured and put in a cell in the Temple of hate. You must fight your way to the portal if you want to have any chance of surviving.

This game is a raycasting engine created in c++ similar to how wolf3d worked. Tad buggy but I learnt a lot of stuff by making it :).
