100052.name: Shrinking Room
100052.body: Theme was Running out of space so I decided to make a game where a room constantly shrinks and at the same time, cardboard boxes attack you. You can shoot them and save yourself. My personal record is 3900 Can you beat it?

100059.name: Herding Humans
100059.body:
Get all the stupid humans to the saferoom before the doors shut! Make sure you don't get locked out either, because they can't do anything without you. Objects will get in your way, you will get stuck in doorways and humans will run back into danger.

Sacrifices will be made, lives will be lost.

I broke the theme down into two core concepts:

1) Available space being taken away from you.

2) Filling a space with more and more objects until it gets chaotic.

Combined they became the idea of grabbing as much as you possibly could from a shrinking spaceship and stashing it in a small space before time ran out. As this was my first Ludum Dare entry I did a terrible job of documenting my workflow as I was too busy just making things work in time.

Solo project. Made with Unity3D/Blender/Photoshop/Reaper/Audacity from scratch. 2x8 hours slept.

![Screenshot 2.jpg](///raw/596/81/z/17235.jpg)

![Screenshot.jpg](///raw/596/81/z/163e4.jpg)

(I spent a non-insignificant amount of time swearing and laughing at the seemingly suicidal humans)

---Added Web Port---

100080.name: Atlas
100080.body:
![ATLAS.png](///raw/581/z/178d6.png)

## About
This time around, I’ve gone a bit non-conventional for my game, and made a Discord bot that runs a game in a Discord server for you! I’ve never made a Discord bot before, so this was (mostly) a ton of fun to make!

![at-screenshot1.png](///raw/581/z/1787e.png)


## Instructions
- Just jump in and follow what the bot tells you to do!
- This requires at least 5 people in the game to work well. (4 works as well, but it doesn’t make a balanced game).
- Once you have all players in the server, run the start command (below) for the bot to configure your server. Please note, once the game has started, no new players can join, and if any leave, the game will probably break.
- Please note, the Server Owner will be able to see every channel, which isn’t configurable by discord. Unfortunately, I am relying on people being honest with this and not cheat. 


# WARNING!
### BEFORE YOU PROCEED: START A NEW DISCORD SERVER FOR THIS! THIS WILL DELETE ALL NON-REQUIRED CHANNELS BEFORE THE GAME STARTS! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

If you’re sure about it, go ahead and type ‘!startgame’ in any channel. This will delete all other channels and begin the game.


#### GLHF!


Please note: Atlas will not be running until submission hour. I need sleep, and I have to go to work. I'll get it running when I can, but feel free to join the Community Server in the meantime (maybe pre-plan some games?).

100093.name: Noninterferance
100093.body:
You know that story, your toxic family member won't leave you alone and try to interact with you with the best intentions, but this time you will defend yourself.

Push this people from your expanding safe zone, you need some space to live. The more you let them in your life, the more anxious you become. Now, it's time to stop.

Try your best to manage them, all out at once, or at least to save as much sanity as you can.

**Control:**

*You can't*

Move/Fight/Cast fireballs

**SO WHAT CAN I DO TO PROTECT MY SELF?**

You can resist. Each family member has a "key" to push them away. Be with the flow and follow instructions.

**Just to be sure, if someone encounter any critical bugs (like black screens) let me know pls, I'll try to fix as fast as i can. Thx.**

*Screenshots:*

![Screenshot_2.jpg](///raw/9d1/c/z/163be.jpg)

![Screenshot_3.jpg](///raw/9d1/c/z/163c1.jpg)

![Screenshot_4.jpg](///raw/9d1/c/z/163c3.jpg)

100095.name: Beamrunner
100095.body:
Hey there on my page. It's about my second game, but it's the first one made in Compo mode. And it was a really nice experience!

So the purpose of the game is running on the light beams, which is literally said in the title. I think, that I have somehow skewed our theme, but it should be clearly visible (or hearable) in my game. 

I have made all of the graphics myself, so don't judge it too harshly, please, cause I have never been a good artist. On the other hand all of the music was downloaded from the internet.

Both the game and source code are available on the same page.

So, enjoy it and also have fun while trying all of the other games! :P 

Here are a few screens:
![Screen1.png](///raw/694/41/z/16462.png)

![Screen3.png](///raw/694/41/z/16469.png)

And final note: Do not be ashamed and leave your comment! I really do need your feedback. :P

This is my submission for Ludum Dare 42

The game is the result of mixing Tetris and Little Alchemy game concepts!

The player has to combine the delivered elements filling his warehouse before it is full of them.
Some combinations provide bonus and help you to make some space in your arehouse, but becareful some others have bad effects!

Enjoy and good luck!

Treivize

100110.name: The Maw

100117.name: Claustrophobia
100117.body:
My entry for LD42 its a short shooting game in whitch you get overrun with enemies plus the walls close in on you untill you kill enough of them to progress.It was a pretty enjoyable project with some minor hickups and still has room for much improvement.

100119.name: Red Square
100119.body:
A game designed to be intuitive and easy to understand, with very little penalty for trying things out. My knack for inventively naming games comes off once again in LD42 in RED SQUARE.

Gameplay video below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S5h2B1jluCg

Features:

> Speedrun mode

> Easy to understand, Easy to master!

100132.name: 1066; The Viking Conquest of England
100132.body:
The year is 1066. You, the great king of the Norwegian people, Haraldur Hardradi is on a great quest to secure the English throne. The game plays out after you landed in York, and is now fighting your way further and further into English land.

In your way stands enemy archers, enemy swordsmen, bad voice-acting, and programmer-art. But with the help of great music... and something else, nothing is going to stop you!

We hope you enjoy our game. We value any feedback, so we can further improve until next Ludum Dare!


NOTE: The game is created in pure Java, and is tested to work on Windows and Ubuntu. It should work on any system that have a JDK or JRE version higher than 1.8.


The Team. their role, and their qualifications
-------------------------------------
prv:     |Programmer and Designer               | Second LD, basic understanding of colour.

Sondray: |Programmer, Designer, and Voice-actor | First LD, first game, have Audacity, basic understanding of colour.

CRS:     |Sound Engineer and Designer.          | Musician, owns Photoshop.


The Goal:
-------------------------------
Get as far into English territory as you can. Historically you lose the battle of Stanford Bridge and is killed on the battle field. 


How to Play:
-------------------------------
Kill all the enemy units. Then proceed to walk into the center of the castle to capture it.


Controls:
-------------------------------
Move: W,A,S,D
Attack: LMB (Left Mouse Button)


Known Bugs:
-------------------------------
- Prices might be unbalanced.
- Hitboxes might be unstable at times.

100144.name: Junkyard: Crash it & Cash it
100144.body:
Howdy folks!

We believe in your management skills, so from now on you will have a unique opportuninty to administer the Junkyard!

There's plenty of old, rusty cars and trucks waiting to be left in our fab yard. Drive in with as many vehicles as possible and remove any obstacles that stand in your way.

Time is money, and cars are too, so you need to respond fast. Customers are getting annoyed while waiting for too long! Sadly, you must also be nice to them to get tips just to pay the damned taxes!

Our pal Joe will guide you. And remember: do not run out of space!!

100171.name: The Forgetful Cube
100171.body: The Forgetful Cube is the first game I have ever finished. Being so, it is not that great of game. It is a 2D platformer about a Cube who is 'running out of space' in my brain. He can only remember so many skills at a time or he will start to forget past one. It has some Metroidvania like elements such as finding new abilities and allowing you go backwards to find secrets rooms. Be sure to explore levels carefully because many levels have secret rooms you can find. WARNING: this game has bad programmer art. I did use some art made by someone else, so it isn't all bad.

100177.name: Planet escape
100177.body:
![StartScreen.png](///raw/db0/3/z/17a97.png)
![Screenshot (13).png](///raw/db0/3/z/17a99.png)![Screenshot (14).png](///raw/db0/3/z/17a9c.png)

Planet Escape,

Game was meant for the compo but instead of "running out of space"I ran out of time and was not happy with the result.
I took an extra day for some polishing. I am still not very happy with the result but at least enough to upload it.

The goal is to build a Dyson sphere because you are running out of space on your home planet.

Gameplay is simple: build, research and keep your people happy.

Important to note. Initially, a Spaceship overview screen was intended but did not make it in the end

When you click a spaceship you can use the planets on the left to navigate to that planet and order the ship to go there.
The ship will disappear while it is in transit from one planet to the other. The further away the planet is the more turns it takes.  

You lose when one of your planets have 0 happiness left. You win when you colonize all planets and let each of them create a Dyson sphere part

I am guessing some bugs still remain, feel free to comment one if you find it I will update the list below so people will know:


KNOWN ISSUES!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Right now there is no check on population when sending a ship so it is possible to get minus population. (easy way to win I guess)

100192.name: Boop's Space Adventure
100192.body:
A simple platformer, with a twist: you can _clone_ yourself! But don't get too excited, because too many clones and you'll run out of space quickly. I only started learning Unity 2 weeks ago so don't expect too much, haha :sweat_smile: .


I encourage you to **play until the end**, there are 5 levels. Don't worry if you are stuck on a level, after a short while a sign will appear which lets you skip the level. At the end is something special, so please don't give up too soon.

Note: the game is **HARD**, boring and punishing. Only play this if you have lost the will to live (or want to lose it). The infinitely repeating 20-second music clip will numb your senses while you do so. 

Most "puzzles" have an easy solution however, and if you find yourself doing frame-perfect moves or pixel-perfect clones you are probably not solving the puzzle as intended. If you really think there is something wrong, please leave a comment and I'll take a look at it.

Note 2: yes, it is quite easy to purposely glitch out, but I don't really see a reason for doing so. If you are stuck in a level a sign will appear letting you skip it.


Let's hope the game launches and you'll have fun playing it! :)

Thanks and good luck!

![screenshot.png](///raw/584/81/z/15fc2.png)

100197.name: Abalite Crystal Defender
100197.body: You must place turrets and walls to stop the flying enemy tanks from destroying the rare Abalite Crystal at the back of your cave. See how long you can last!![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 10.24.25 PM.png](///raw/b82/d/z/171bb.png)![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 10.23.14 PM.png](///raw/b82/d/z/171ba.png)![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 9.14.56 PM.png](///raw/b82/d/z/171b9.png)

## TriSpace is a top down space puzzler built for the LD42 compo.

![trispace_1.png](///raw/03a/e/z/172fb.png)

The controls are (should be) explained in the game but just in case:

Progress is saved automatically.

Tools used

- OpenMPT - music

**Note** - if you are trying to run the game from source you will need Love2d v10 (the latest release is v11). I'll push a compatibility fix soon.

**Note** - to run the game on OSX you may need to open the /Application folder and right click on trispace and choose open (this will get around the un-recognised developer warning)

### Bug Fixes and Updates

100223.name: Dont Drop
100223.body: My First LD game is a simple puzzle with drop platforms

100227.name: Throwing Science Out The Window!
100227.body:
The lab monkey's have broken lose and are throwing science out the window!  You must save the science in order to win the game.  But be careful, there is only so much space in your truck to haul it back to the safety of the garage.

The more you are carrying the slower you accelerate and if you are too full your max speed will be reduced as well.  So it is best to to empty before you get too full.  If you miss science, it will reduce your science score.  If you hit -100%, you lose.  Save 100% science and you win!

You can tell how full you are to an extent by the color of your truck.  Green is not full, Red is really full, Grey is completely full.

I managed to get in one bonus item, it is the atom looking science that comes flying out.  You can store up to 3 of these bonus items.  Use the Shift key or Fire3 button on your controller to use the bonus.  This will dart you back to the garage super fast.  Very useful when you have a massive load.  If you don't use your bonuses and capture more of them, you will get a large score bonus (not science bonus).

Use the Left Ctrl key or Fire1 button on your controller to brake.  Keep in mind though that you'll have to re-accelerate.

Things I didn't get too:
- High Scores
- More bonus items
- Actual monkey's throwing science.
- Animated truck... He's a little static and boring, sorry.

There are probably a few bugs.  I completed everything in the game myself and that is why you get terrible art assets :)

I feel decently good about the sound this time around.  The game itself is meeting most of what I expected to get to so I'm pretty happy about that too.

I'm trying out DropBox for the Source and Executable this time around.  Play the HTML5 version on itch.io.

FULL SCREEN RECOMMENDED.

Tools:
- Unity
- Paint.NET
- Bosca Ceoil
- BRFX
- Audacity

Known Issues:
- HTML5 version the bonus pickup sound has a weird click after it.
- Non-Full screen runs will cause title image to be cropped.

Notes about Non-Windows/Non-HTML5 Builds:
- I do not have a Linux or MAC and thus cannot support or test these builds.
- Hopefully it all just works.  If not, the HTML5 version should work in most/all modern browsers.

![Title_Small.png](///raw/384/z/16ee2.png)

100234.name: Dilan vs. Trees
100234.body:
![dilan_vs_trees_001.png](///raw/416/1/z/16a20.png)

You are Dilan.
A mysterious demon has placed your friends into a cursed
forest. It grows constantly and rapidly, and everyone will
soon run out of breathing space. You and your trusty
flamethrower have seen much worse, but you still don't know
where your friends are, and the demon's undead army now knows
of your presence.

![dilan_vs_trees_003.png](///raw/416/1/z/16a24.png)

-Use the WASD keys to move and strafe
-Use the ARROW KEYS to look around
-Hold SPACE to use the flamethrower

to make things go by a little quicker!

![dilan_vs_trees_002.png](///raw/416/1/z/16a12.png)

100242.name: Hitch Bird
100242.body:
In Hitch Bird, you play as bee-eater bird, hitching a ride on an elephant. The elephant flushes out your prey, but you're not the only hungry bee-eater around.

## Gameplay
Fly into other birds to scare them away.

Fly into insects to eat them.

Make sure you don't run out of stamina in midair! (tip: elephant backs are great for replenishing rests)

## Controls
- Flap wings: `Spacebar` / `Xbox A`
- Fly around: `WASD` / `Xbox Right Stick`
- Camera Control: `Mouse` / `Xbox Left Stick`
- Dash: `Left Mouse Button` / `Xbox X`
- Tweet: `Right Mouse Button` / `Xbox B`
- Demon: `Y` / `Xbox Y`

_Press 'P' to toggle Post Processing Effects_

🐘🐦🐝

100252.name: O-Shooter
100252.body: My first game here in LudumDare (and my first game that actually works).

100256.name: RE:Boot
100256.body:
The Game:
The world population growth rapidly, the earth is running of out space. As a higher being, you planned the reboot the planet. You are trying a lot of ways to reduce/wiped out humans. If you able to wiped out all the human, congratualtion! You successfully reboot the earth!

Remark: This is the first jam we participated, we are team up of two. The game may come with some bugs or balancing problem. Feel free to commend or giving feedback, we appreciate that. Your feedback will motivate us to make a better game.

100268.name: Welcome to Heaven
100268.body:
Movement: Left and Right arrow keys.
Use inventory item: Z, X and C keys.
There will be upward and downward direction indicators to show the character is going up or down

Concept: 
Life is short, you can die anytime, welcome to Heaven. 'Do you really want to leave your comfy bed'
Inventory slots are limited, like your life.
if you don't do it now, you're going to miss the other things in your life.
so keep spamming your inventory slots, and hope for the best to get good items.

100301.name: High Factory
100301.body:
I tried to make something like Factorio in very limited space. I had a lot of ideas, but too few time to implement them all. The result is some kind of a survival sandbox game with a bit of progression, because I had no time left to add a proper story.

If you want to have some fun, try to complete this challenges:

* Craft stone tools
* Craft iron tools
* Create auto miners for coal and iron ore
* Automate iron mining and iron ingots creation (iron and coal miners -> conveyors -> furnace -> conveyor -> crate)
* Craft launch pad and launch items across islands
* Unlock all islands
* Automate all resources (iron ingots, stone, wood)
* **HARD:** Place 3 crates for all resources at the last island and transport resources into them by conveyors (post screenshots if you did it)

![001.png](///raw/4c8/8/z/1672b.png)

![002.png](///raw/4c8/8/z/16733.png)

Coal and ore goes into furnace, ingots goes out
![003.png](///raw/4c8/8/z/16738.png)

![004.png](///raw/4c8/8/z/16739.png)

You can launch items between islands with launch pads
![005.png](///raw/4c8/8/z/1673d.png)

![006.png](///raw/4c8/8/z/1673f.png)

![007.png](///raw/4c8/8/z/16740.png)

100314.name: Postman
100314.body:
Your purpose - to fill trucks with mail as fast as possible and compactly... Please be careful with cargo. 
Rules: Click to mailbox and throw it to truck, after you must click on large button for close of truck's door, if you dont close door, then mailboxes can be losted. You should not drop the cargo outside the central loading platform.

100319.name: Defrag
100319.body:
Did you think your computer defrag process was all about code and stuff? 
This game is here to show you that when we're running out of space, and the computer needs cleaning, there is a lil' guy who goes on a great adventure to help us...

Between traps and pitfalls, our small friend will have to make his way out of the disk through its different slices.
Time boosters and special slice specific glitches (music/video...) will make your journey even trippier! 

Thank you very much for playing our game, we hope that you'll have a lot of fun with it!

![](///raw/90a/81/z/17ddf.gif)

# Dev Process

We decided to go in a computer related theme (50% of the team is developers, they were pretty convincing), and with the vision of the good old defrag tool, the idea just.. came up!

![3EbIJ.png](///raw/90a/81/z/17e10.png)


It was all an adventure for 4 of the 5 devs who had never used Unity before, but in the end it went fairly smooth and we were able to create this game, packed with awesome graphics and soundtracks full of a dark synthwave/Tron-ish vibe made on the fly over the weekend!

# Controls

- Move clockwise : Right Arrow
- Move counter-clockwise : Left Arrow
- Jump : Up Arrow
- Slide : Down Arrow
- Attack : Space


# Team

- Florian Coulouma : Game Design
- Thibault Palluet : Game Design
- Corentin Bescond : Graphics
- Leo Delisle : Graphics
- Baptiste Tiers : Programming
- David Maidenberg : Programming
- Guillaume Gomez : Programming
- Raphael Beltrand : Programming
- Victor Goya : Programming
- Terence Toussaint : Sound Design

100349.name: Overflow
100349.body:
![Unity_2018-08-12_23-37-44.png](///raw/987/c/z/177d8.png)


# Introduction

Overflow is a game about saving persons with your little boat. 

The water is constantly rising and you have only one seat on your boat. 

Save them all by putting them on the raft.


*To fully enjoy the game, please play in high quality and enable the sound (even better with headphones).*

**Have a great journey and enjoy the ambiance and relax on the waves..**


# Controls

**Move** - arrow keys

**Take/Release a person** - E key



# Credits
*Ressources used, links and everything coming.*


I didn't made all the models and the music, this is why you can't vote for this categories.
But any feedbacks on it in the comments are welcome.

**Please share your thoughts, and comment below :) **

100359.name: Match In A Bottle
100359.body:
Welcome to my Ludum Dare 42 entry!

**The Game was made under 24 hours due to me having school finals the same day that LD was taking place. Please keep that in mind as you play along and things might seem a little rough!**

![breaking_compressed.gif](///raw/2f0/8/z/16d7f.gif)

The theme is 'Running out of space' so I present you my game!

You are trapped in a bottle, you must avoid the falling cubes from the top of the bottle.

Use the **arrow keys** or **WASD** to navigate. You can use **'up_arrow'**, **'W'** or **'space'** for jumping!

In order to survive, you must get rid of the blocks in the bottle or you will suffocate otherwise!

By selecting full lines of the same color blocks, you can free-up some space and earn some points!

![match in a bottle 2690.png](///raw/2f0/8/z/16d89.png)

In order to select lines, left click using your mouse from each end of a line. **Please note that each box of the line must have the same color!**

There are also powerups in some of the cubes!

Break the cubes in order to activate their special abilities!

![best.PNG](///raw/2f0/8/z/16d74.png)

P.S. Bring a friend along, it get's more fun if you split the work load, one takes care of moving, the other takes care of matching lines!

Press 'M' to mute music!

![match in a bottle 2891.png](///raw/2f0/8/z/16d8b.png)

Tools I used:

- **Engine:** [Game Maker Studio 2](https://www.yoyogames.com/)
- **Graphics:** [Pyxel Edit](https://pyxeledit.com/)
- **Sound (Music):** [FL Studio 12](https://www.image-line.com/flstudio/)
- **Sound (Sounds):** [BFXR](https://www.bfxr.net/)

![chaos compressed.gif](///raw/2f0/8/z/16d81.gif)
![death_compressed.gif](///raw/2f0/8/z/16d83.gif)
![match in a bottle 3148.png](///raw/2f0/8/z/16d8e.png)

100379.name: When Life Gives You Lemons
100379.body:
![Heaader.png](///raw/72e/d/z/180a8.png)
# About
When life gives you lemons, you’d best be prepared to defend yourself. Citrons, those little lemon folks out there, fell from the sky earlier. Their fancy spaceship thingy came crashing down onto my farm. Now, we don’t take too kindly to strangers around here. So grab your gun and get ready.

It’s lemon season.

# Tools
- Unity
 - Fungus
 - iTween
- FMOD

100397.name: Aeromancer
100397.body:
#### **Aeromancer** is a game about navigating platform puzzles while using your ability to manipulate air. You must find keys, fight enemies, and move boxes to get to the end.

The difficult part about the game is that because of your 4 abilities, all inventory slots are full, you are running out of space to hold things, so when you hold a key or box, required to complete a level, one of your abilities is discarded or temporarily disabled for the rest of the level or until you place the box down on the button.

### TRY TO BEAT ALL 6 NON-TUTORIAL LEVELS. IF YOU CAN, LET ME KNOW YOUR APPROXIMATE TIME WITH YOUR FEEDBACK

**(Some of the particles and colours in the GIFs below are not showing properly, they look a bit better in game)**
![gameplay2.gif](///raw/01c/1/z/16f68.gif)

100399.name: Rumble Trouble
100399.body:
![Cover.png](///raw/728/81/z/16bd9.png)

Oh no! The goblin island is all gone! You must lead them to the teleporter to escape, but be careful. The ground you stand on isn't quite durable...

This is my first submission and it was a interesting experience.

This is a simple turn-based puzzle game where you move from the start of the level to the end while collecting keys but the ground beneath you is falling.

![Screenshot1.png](///raw/728/81/z/16b35.png)

There are only 12 levels and they are quite short if you get them the first time, but hey! It's got full controller support!

Changelog:

1.1 - Fixed the bug with the UI on level 10. Probably fixed the Mac version.

1.0 - The game.

100404.name: Insanity
100404.body:
Insanity is a simple "Horror" game. 
Created for the Ludum Dare 42 Theme ("Running out of Space")  
The lower your Sanity is the lower your Vision Space gets.  
Find 7 Pills around the Map, and don't go Insane.  
  
## Controlls
WASD & Arrow Keys - To Move Around  
E - Open Doors when close to them  
Picking up Items by walking over them  

## Softwares Used
Unity3D  
Blender  
Audacity  
Photoshop  

### Other Mentions
All the Sounds were recorded with a Phone.  
Sometimes the doors will not work properly, but we wanted to keep it that way, just cause we thought it was funny.  
Do not play this game with Max Volume. It will be loud.  
  
WE WILL NOT BE PROVIDING SCREENSHOTS TO KEEP AWAY THE SUPRISE OF THE MAP AND OTHER THINGS IN THE PROJECT.  
You will have to see the game yourself.

100405.name: Shrink Runner 42
100405.body:
Hello I'm a newbie! Please be kind!! ![cover.png](///raw/d0c/01/z/17b10.png)

Use W-A-S-D to move the ball around.
Collect Yellow and Blue power ups to score and slow the ground from shrinking!

100408.name: Pig Pile
100408.body:
This game is an action platformer where you kill pigs and place their guts on diplay for points.![1.PNG](///raw/85e/11/z/17c66.png)

Use AD to move | 
WS to climb up and down ladders | 
SPACE to jump | 
E to switch weapons | 
P to toggle block placing mode | 
ENTER to attack, place a meat block or press a button |

100420.name: The Sky is Falling
100420.body:
This is my first Ludum Dare. I didn't get to spend much time on this, I hope you enjoy!

Controls:

WASD to move

Space to Jump

Click to shoot

Hold shift to sprint.

Goal:

Survive for as long as possible on the floating platform. Green balls will destroy platform blocks.

easy mode and Hard mode differ in that the ball spawning rate is different, and the the platform blocks behave differently.

100426.name: Escape from the spaceship
100426.body:
You need to escape from the ship while is falling apart fast.
I mean really fast.
And just for fun itt filled with dangerous rooms.

You can drown in them, or get sick by toxins.

Oh... And I almost forgot. You can fall down to nothing. So try to craft the landing pod as fast as you can.

![2018-08-13 (1).png](///raw/d3c/z/16eb6.png) 

- Controls

You can use the items in your "inventory" with 1-4.

You can open and close the craft menu with "C" and cratf the pod if you clickc the "Craft" button. After you craft it you can use it and win.

Pick up them with "F".

Use jetpack wit "Space" and mowe with "A" and "D".

Sadly i cant add music, sound effect or animation because i run out of time.

![2018-08-13 (5).png](///raw/d3c/z/16ebe.png)

--- Bug fixing ---

- Fixed when you press "Q" or "E" and you win or lose instantly.

100432.name: Falling Town
100432.body:
## This game is about building your own town, and preventing it from getting destroyed.

Your town is located on a island in the middle of the ocean, it's up to you to build it, and making sure it doesn't get destroyed. Each night a comet strike and destroy some of your island's tiles. The game is a little bit luck based, but there are some interresting features that will make or break your town. There is 8 different buildings with different mechanics. Your objective is to survive as many days as possible. If your townhall gets destroyed you lose, or if your power goes below 0 you lose.

### How many days can your town survive?

This game was made in 72 hours by:
Lausemand,
Procezz,
Ubber

Tools used: Unity3D, Visual Studio, Paint.net, Bosca Ceoil, Blender

100436.name: Quicksand
100436.body:
**Quicksand is a physics game about trying to walk through.. surreal quicksand of some sort. Playing your own music recommended.**

*Amazing ride this LD. The concept I chose to work on (on Saturday late night) turned out more challenging than I pretended it is, and the game itself almost drowned in the sand as its main character. What came out is neither a decent quicksand nor human body simulator, but perhaps a good video for some slow or slightly depressing music. And watching that guy sink turned out pleasing in some way, what more can I ask for. Looks better live than on screenshots I promise :P*

How to play: To move limbs, aim limb circles with mouse button, hold left click and drag away in desired situation. You will know you are pulling a limb if a string appears between it and the cursor. Release click to release the limb. Body parts will get stuck if they sink into sand, but with some pulling force they can be freed.

Controls: Mouse and left click to play, space to restart, escape for menu.

![screen2.jpg](///raw/5a5/5/z/17978.jpg)

![screen3.jpg](///raw/5a5/5/z/17979.jpg)

100445.name: Pocket Pets
100445.body:
You raise little monsters in your pocket!

Feed your pet to curb its hunger. Play to keep them happy. If they get too big for your pocket, put them on a diet. Then release before they're too old and get evaluated!

![pocketPets.png](///raw/562/21/z/17ecc.png)

Different pets react differently to each action.

Left-click on buttons to interact with the game. To cycle through text, click the next arrow button on the bottom-right of the screen.

And, when in doubt, just click the screen.

Access the downloadable game by visiting the linked itch page!

100447.name: The Fall of Arcology ONE
100447.body: A platform game made for Ludum Dare 42 - Running out of Space.

100456.name: F-STOP
100456.body:
This was created in 72 hours for the Ludum Dare gamejam. It was based off the canceled Valve game of the same name and also inspired by Portal.

Press "Single Player" to start the game. The other buttons are created to simulate the Valve style menu and don't actually work. 


Controls:


W/A/S/D - Movement


Space - Jump


Left mouse - Prepare picture (then again to take)


Right mouse - Back out of picture


E - Interact

100461.name: Owned By
100461.body:
![2.png](///raw/2da/8/z/17cdb.png) ![3.png](///raw/2da/8/z/17ce4.png)![4.png](///raw/2da/8/z/17d0c.png)

Interested in experiencing a twisted view of the human mind? If so, you are in the right place.
Owned by is a visual game poem that depicts society's expectations of the individual. We sprinkled it with a few metaphors and a crapton of psychedelia.

100475.name: PÖSITRIS
100475.body:
A Tetris-like game for Nine-to-Fivers.

Positive affirmations are shown while you play, to help you stay motivated while avoiding the tedium, dullness, and meaningless of your life.

100485.name: Hovertank 42: Modern Wall-fare
100485.body:
What an exciting Ludum Dare! This is the first one I've submitted in a long time. Finally, we are victorious once more :smiley:. 

### You can play in the browser: https://thoughtreactor.itch.io/hovertank

Hovercraft 42 is a fun little survival top-down shoot-em-up with a twist. Aim carefully, as your missed bullets will create deadly walls. Dodge and shoot enemies to unlock more Missiles needed to destroy dastardly Orange Walls to survive an endless wave of enemy Hovertanks!

5 different random arenas. 3 pick-ups (Ammo, Nuke, and Health). Over 4 challenging enemies! Can you survive the onslaught?

## Media
https://youtu.be/SfRcAIaNzpg

![Screen3+small.jpg](///raw/ef3/z/17188.jpg)

![Screen2_small.jpg](///raw/ef3/z/1718a.jpg)

![Screen1_small.jpg](///raw/ef3/z/1718c.jpg)

## How to Play
Hovertank: Modern Wall-fare is a classic top-down shooter where the player's missed shots spawn deadly walls that kill him on collision. Use missiles to destroy your own walls and survive as long as you can. 

Keep an eye out for more ammo, health, and the 'Nuke', which destroys all player walls.

## Controls
 - WASD or Arrow keys to move
 - Mouse to aim cannon
 - Left mouse - fire primary weapon; if it misses and hits a wall it spawns a wall
 - Right mouse - fire missile; destroys player walls
 - Press ESCAPE in game to puase

## Info
Built in under 72 hours, solo, using Unity, Photoshop, and FL Studio. Thanks for playing! Comment with screenshots of your best results!

100492.name: caelique
100492.body:
After a long time of humanity putting satellites, rockets and other things into space, they eventually had to run out of space.

You will play an astronaut on a mission to get through all of that space junk. On your way you will encounter a special type of gravity.

Your little astronaut can be affected by the gravity of different colored Blobs and you will be able to control, which one is activated at the moment.

100498.name: Butterfly Catching

![ld42.png](///raw/d88/81/z/16afe.png)
Catch as many butterflies as possible
Adding butterflies to your collection will give you glue. Bridges degrade over time, use glue to repair them.

Rumor tells of a golden butterfly, perhaps catching it will bring good luck.

100511.name: Box Blast
100511.body:
## What's it all about?

You are a worker in a small facility and your only job is to sort boxes. You must send three different colored boxes off, when requested, and attempt to keep the box supply as low as possible.

![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 12.08.45 AM.png](///raw/a48/8/z/172a6.png)

## How do I play?

To start, simply click the play button on the main menu. You will be tossed right into the game where two conveyor belts, a box count, and a requested color display greet you. Take boxes from one conveyor and put them onto the other when their color is displayed on the UI. Note that when you put the desired color box in, a new color comes up. Be sure to keep the box count below 15, or the game is over.

![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 12.09.21 AM.png](///raw/a48/8/z/172a7.png)

## What are the controls?

`W A S D` -> Move

`Mouse` -> Look

`Left Click (hold)` -> Pickup Boxes

`Right Click` -> Blast Boxes

## Any bugs?

Yes! Lots of them. Sometimes the boxes get stuck, the player can't play the game over again, and so much more. Since this is a game that was made in a rush, much like other Ludum Dare games, it is full of issues.

![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 12.08.35 AM.png](///raw/a48/8/z/172a8.png)

### Side Note

>This is one of the first "complete" Unity games I have made. I understand that this is not anywhere near great, but it's pretty good for one of my first games and I am very proud of it. Be sure to give it a shot, and attempt to have fun! I apologize if the Windows download does not work, I can't test it out. I will be honest in saying that I DID watch tutorial videos, however this was not to copy down code. It was for the sole propose of seeing how a function works so I can implement it on my own.

meta.link-03-name: Source code converted from .cs to .txt files.

100518.name: Black Star
100518.body:
Black Star is made with Ludum Dare 42's Theme "Running out of Space". It is a top-down shooter similar to the class game "Asteroids", however, you must shoot the debris before it gets sucked up into black holes. Black holes are death zones that grow whenever they consume something, so the player must try to keep them from growing as much as possible. 

Black Star is an unwinnable game. Instead, the challenge comes from trying to last as long as possible as space itself slowly devours you. Players will get a unique experience every time, as they try to see how long they can last in the cold vacuum of space.

Made in Unity

100522.name: UB Extreme
100522.body:
UB Extreme! 
![ezgif-5-28403f1e4a.gif](///raw/8a8/81/z/1603c.gif)
Avoid crashing into the enemy ships. 
Shoot enemy ships to survive! 
Shooting reduces your FOV. 
Destroying an enemy increases your FOV!

Try to get a high score! :)

Made in GM Studio 1.4.

![Capture.PNG](///raw/8a8/81/z/16008.png)

100541.name: Computer Funfare.
100541.body:
Computer Funfare contains three minigames following the theme of running out of space. There is Rock Dodger (Rodger), a minigame where you dodge rocks, but they stay on the ground for up to 10 seconds. Shooter, a minigame where you control a cannon, shooting off boulders as the walls close in on you, however, you can shoot them back into position. Finally, Burn-Out!, a minigame where you have to get your work done (hold space by your computer), while keeping your room cool and cleaning up the piling garbage. I hope you have fun with it, I know I did.![Special_Chap.png](///raw/836/1/z/15841.png)

After some thought, I've decided to make a standalone update to the Rodger game! Please check it out! It doesn't follow the theme, but that's because I wanted to make a bit more of an incentive for endurance to get the ending statues for your score! I hope you have fun with it!

meta.link-02-name: Update to Rodger! (Type B Unfinished, F2 to restart)

100543.name: Agressive Acqusition
100543.body:
[IMPORTANT]~~HOW TO PLAY~~ [​IMPORTANT] ​​Fixed Download Link
This is our first game and we challenged ourselves to not use the asset store or anyone elses art or code(caved for music)So the UI is not very good and a tutorial is non existent. ​But there are some decent mechanics hidden in there.

You will start the game with one of each type of BASE resource miner, click and hold on frames to build new miners or click and hold on existing miners to add speed mods.
You also start with one ​Fabricator ​​and one ​automation mod​. Hover over Fabricators to craft (its on a timer) and Click the Fabricators​ to change the recipe and install mods. Automation Mods remove the need to hover over a Fabricator and speed mods increase the ​amount of items crafted at once. ​Neither mod can be removed so use them wisely.

Fabricators​ are on the top 2 floors, databases are on the bottom 2 floors. Click and hold the "shops" to build new instances of each. Each new database adds 8 more ​slots for ​Storage Cards​ which are crafted in the Fabricators and each add 1024 to your item capacity.

That's about it. I know its clunky, we hop to have a better product next dare!​

Synopsis

Data's obsession with acquiring resources​ has lead her to this desolate planet. While devoid of most life, there are still abundant resources here. Her goal is to gather as much as possible as quickly as possible while managing her digital Matter Acquisition System.

Don't run out of space!

The walls will slowly and persistently creep up on you, and bugs wander around the ever-shrinking space. Fight back against both and try to survive for as long as you can. You might not last forever, but you can certainly try.

100606.name: The Coming of the Great Colorful Handkerchief
100606.body:
This socio-critical game was created for the Ludum Dare 42 in under 72 hours. It's about the myth of the Great White Handkerchief as we know it from the Book "Hitchhickers Guide to the Galaxy" by Douglas Adams.

A very long time ago - I mean a very very long time - what is known to the people on Viltvodle VI as the GREAT GREEN ARKLESEIZURE sneezed out the entire universe.
These people lived in fear of a time they called 'The Coming of the Great White Handkerchief'.
But they were wrong in this point.
They should have been afraid of something else.

The GREAT COLORFUL HANDKERCHIEF is penetrating from another universe to ours.
To be honest: Nobody really knows what would happen if it succeded. But it would be bad. Probably.
We built a core to prevent this.
Now you come in.
You protect the core.
Prevent our universe as we know it from getting whiped out! Or getting too colorful! Or whatever.
NOW is the time of ...
THE COMING OF THE GREAT COLORFUL HANDKERCHIEF

At some point, the Great Colorful Handkerchief will come. 
The Question is just nehw.

100643.name: Interstellar Janitorial Service
100643.body:
# Welcome to your new job JU-018!
 As our newest janitorial unit, your first job is to clean the trash compactor room. The controls have been kinda iffy so hopefully, you won't get squished like our last bot!

# -Controls-
![controls.png](///raw/129/81/z/16e65.png)

Your hose has limited capacity! So use it wisely to clean or push away evil critters!

Whatever kills you score will let you be able to buy much-needed upgrades!

100658.name: Finite Factory
100658.body:
![cover.png](///raw/bdd/c/z/16bfd.png)

## Description
You are a new employee at Iris Labs. Your appointed manager, HAPIS, will request you to build factories as "efficient" as possible (using his meaning of "efficiency").

## Controls
Everything is done with the left mouse button: drag tiles from your toolbar to place them, click on already placed tiles to remove them.

## What I didn't manage to add
 - A 2-star system. One star for completing the level, and another for being as "efficient" as possible.
 - Drawing a line to place conveyor belts. Currently, you have to place each tile separately.

## Development
-- coming soon --

## Software used

**Engine:** Godot Engine 3  
**Graphics:** GIMP  
**Music:** MuseScore 2  
**Sound Effects:** Bfxr

100665.name: Space Cleaner
100665.body:
# Images:
![Space_Cleaner_1.JPG](///raw/412/e/z/16ce8.jpg)
![Space_Cleaner_2.JPG](///raw/412/e/z/16cf0.jpg)
![Space_Cleaner_3.JPG](///raw/412/e/z/16cf8.jpg)
![Space_Cleaner_4.JPG](///raw/412/e/z/16cfc.jpg)

# ​About:
Space Cleaner is a game about small robot on a spaceship. Its task is to collect trash cubes and transfer them to the airlock where they will be thrown into space.

# How to play:
- Transfer trash cubes to the airlock.
- You will lose if there will be more than 3 trash cubes on one spot.
- Do not get smashed by falling trash cubes.
- Do not get crushed by the gate.
- Do not get trapped inside the airlock.
- Lights and sound alarm indicate when the airlock will close/open.
- Once every 30 seconds you can use your special power to destroy surrounding trash cubes.
- Have fun!

# Default controls:
- Arrows/WASD - Movement
- Space/E - Grabber
- Left Ctrl/F - Use Power Up

# Note:
- Due to Unity limitations WebGL version has worse graphics (mostly lighting). Use standalone Windows version for the best experience. :D 
- If you have issues with low FPS or the game does not load try standalone Windows version. :D
- There are currently two bugs that I will fix soon.

# Have fun! :star::star::star::star::star:

meta.link-01-name: Play Online (HTML 5) (PLAY WINDOWS VERSION FOR BETTER GRAPHICS)

100681.name: Bouncing Boxes
100681.body:
"Bouncing Boxes" is a simple party game (I think) where you take control of a robot-box created by someone using an hoverboard, a bucket and some wheels... 
Your aim is to push the other boxes (why should someone build robot-boxes..?) down from the falling platforms (yeah, platforms will fall randomly, because... Why not?).
The minimum number of player in order to play with our awesome creation is 2, but you can play with 3 more friends, for a total of 4 players, and waste in this way your time!

# __CREDITS__
Federico Giorgi - Game Director, Game Designer, Programmer, Level Designer, UI Designer, 2D Artist
Davide Dal Cin - 3D Artist, 2D Artist, UI Designer, Level Designer
Main Menu Theme: [Finley Burch - The New Dawn](https://soundcloud.com/finley-burch/the-new-dawn)
Game Theme: [[TPRMX] Vivaldi - Four Seasons 'Summer' 3rd Presto REMIX](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xJ9crgQ2RSk)

__SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS__

|   | Minimum  | Recommended |
| :------------ |:---------------:| -----:|
|__CPU__|AMD E-300 @ 1.3GHz|Intel Core i5-4460 @ 3.2GHz or equivalent|
|__GPU__|Radeon Graphics HD 6310|Nvidia GeForce GTX 1060 or equivalent|

100691.name: Space Out!
100691.body:
![Space Out! 2018-08-14 00-07-58-08.png](///raw/d69/3/z/18412.png)

**Space Out!** is a cute strategy game about managing the quickly growing human population by exploring and populating other planets!

### EXPLORE
![so-02.png](///raw/d69/3/z/18584.png)
### RESEARCH
![so-01.png](///raw/d69/3/z/18570.png)
### EXPAND
![so-03.png](///raw/d69/3/z/185ab.png)

The human population is ever growing. In order to prevent it from collapsing, your goal is to expand to other inhabitable planets. As the population on a planet increases, it generates more money, but having overpopulated planets will make the planets deteriorate, and eventually, they will die. 

Keep the human population within healthy limits and don't let any of your planets get destroyed.

100704.body:
![popcorn-mayhem.gif](///raw/659/81/z/1795c.gif)

![screenshots.png](///raw/659/81/z/165f7.png)

:smile:

Oh No!! All you wanted was some microwave popcorn and now your are trying to run for your life.
** Use arrow keys to get out of there as fast as you can. **

*(My first Ludum Dare!! Was only able to work on it for about 10 hours, since it was my daughter's birthday this weekend)*

Note: Best played on Chrome Browser with a 60hz monitor

Bug Fixes: Attempt to Fix issue with different frame-rate monitors & Fix to issue with "Phaser 3" physics group clearing "bounce" property

100705.name: Edge Runner
100705.body:
"Power walk to the edge of the universe"

For LD42 I decided to take a literal approach to the theme. In "Edge Runner" you literraly need to run out of space. No like you need to run to the edge of the universe and actually physically run out of space. You get it.

Anyways, I am super proud with the result of my game this time around. I tried to make a game mechanic as simple as I could and have it fully complete with art, audio, and gameplay. While I wasn't able to get any art put into the game, I feel that the rest of the product is as complete as I would have hoped. 

The only thing that didn't work out at the last minute was a short video that is supposed to play at the end. I guess Unity WebGL has some incompatibilities with it. So, if you want the *full* experience, feel free to download the executable of the game. Fortunately the video isn't that important to the overall game and the gimmick at the end still works without it. Enjoy!

100717.name: Interstellar Stupidity
100717.body:
Built with

```
GameMaker Studio 2
FL Studio
LabChirp
Aseprite
```

for Ludum Dare 42 Compo

When making this game, I decided to place limitations on the sound and graphics of the game. So, the graphics are locked to the CGA 1 High palette, which restricts me to using black, white, cyan, and magenta for all of the graphics in the game. The sound is locked to something close to the Tandy 3 Voice sound card, which is a card that allows for 3 square wave channels. I tweaked the limitations a bit to let me use one of the square channels as a noise channel, allowing for simple percussion. The sound effects are limited to simple one channel square or noise beeps. I'm essentially trying to make this look and sound like a game that looks like it would be played on an old DOS computer.

100723.name: Game With A Robot In It
100723.body:
A Metroid-type game, but the robot only has enough memory to store one upgrade at a time. All you need are the arrow keys, space bar, and left shift.

Admittedly, this could have turned out a lot better, but outside factors are keeping me from working on this as much as I'd like. As a first attempt at a Game Jam, I guess it turned out okay, though I'm sure your opinions are much harsher than mine. If nothing else, it was great learning experience, since while working on this I figured out how animation and sound works in Unity.

100757.name: Bunny Ice Cream Maker
100757.body:
1 to 5 local players.  Supports keyboard and up to 4 controllers.

In this silly micro game, a frantic team of rabbits must make ice cream but when the ice cream machine breaks and spills ice cream everywhere, they have to eat it to keep the machines running!  But they can only eat so much without going to the toilet, while the toilet teleports around the map. 

Yeah it makes no sense...

"The toilet is the best thing in this game" - play tester

Let's Play:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fjRTwzg8w-8

----

**Tutorial**

**Step 1**: 1 to 5 players!  Use keyboard and controllers to join! Press space or A button to jump or double jump

**Step 2**: Make ice cream!  Press E on keyboard or B on controller on red buttons.  Change all 6 red buttons to green

**Step 3**: Oh no, the ice cream is leaking!  Eat it or we’ll run out of space and the ice cream maker will break! Hold E on keyboard or B on controller near ice cream to eat 

**Step 4**: Oh no, you are too full!  Use the toilet! Press E on keyboard or B on controller near toilet

100767.name: Countdown
100767.body:
![Cover Image](///content/e99/81/z/16e38.png)

**What is Countdown?**

Countdown is my first entry for the Ludum Dare 42 C​ompo. There are Windows and Linux builds currently available.
**How do I play?​**

You are running out of space! The game grid is composed of hundreds of hexagons, each of which has an attached timer that starts at a random value. When the timer goes to zero, a dangerous block falls on the square, killing the player instantly. Avoid getting trapped in enclosed chambers of blocks, and your time will increase substantially!

**Is it customizable?​**

Yes, it is! In the "Change Colours" menu, you can not only set your colour scheme to one of nine colour presets, but you can mix your own colours with the interactive colour pickers! In addition, in the "Settings" menu, you can change countdown speed and maximum starting number. Avoid putting this too high, otherwise, the game might take years to finish. Press "Reset" in either menu if you wish to put the game back to factory settings.

**What game engine was used?**

Unity 2018.2.2f1 Personal.

100796.name: Bead Jar
100796.body:
It is a game about surviving and more. The player can explore the land, pick up and drop items there to get resource and score. Resource is necessary to live, while score is score. The game time is (temporarily) 705 seconds, which means more than 10 minutes. But! The game is in very very early phase. Now the version0.0 is super boring and full of bugs. (And it doesn't have tutorial or audio even.) If you want to play it, do read the control instruction at the bottom to avoid unnecessary annoyance.

This boring game is a systematic prototype of a great design. I know the design is over-scoped (and I don't have enough time for it), but I like the idea a lot, so I asked myself "why not to spend my time on something I really like?". So it is. I believe it will grow into an amazing survival simulator in the future.

I will continue the development and post future versions on LD. If you have interests, you can say in the comment "Hey I want to be noticed when the game is updated" then I will @ you in the future. (Please do clearly include the keyword "notice". I don't want to spam you.)

Thank you for reading!

Game Basics:
If you don't move, the time wont't pass.
To pick up items, you have to get close enough to them.
The size of your backpack is 100. The sum of weights of the items in your backpack cannot exceed 100.
Time limit is 705 seconds.

Control Instruction:
WASD - Move
Space/Mouse Left Button - Pick up/Drop Highlighted Item
ESC - End the game immediately

100807.name: Space running out oooh nooooo
100807.body:
# Overview:


Starting with just a town hall, you need to place towers and generators to defend yourself against endless waves of enemies. There are 3 seconds to the map: An outer black circle that you cannot build into, an inner shaded circle which you can build to if you build beacons, and the light circle where you can place your towers.

You will be allowed to build between rounds. There are 3 types of buildings you can place:

1. Bomby boy - Does an area of effect attack. Large damage but uses a lot of power to shoot. When converted to a generator it will store 500 power and generate 5/s.
2. Archer Tower - Low damage, high attack speed. When converted to a generator they will store 100 power and generate 5/s
3. Beacon - These will illuminate the area so you can build further out. This will also allow your towers to see the enemies from further away. Beacons will drain 10 power per second.

Once you are happy with your layout, click the ready button in the top left.

Bomby Boy and Archer Towers can be toggled between tower and generator between rounds. A tower that is generating power cannot attack and will be shaded blue. This toggling is free, but cannot be 

All towers can be removed by right clicking - But this will not refund any resources spent on it. 

Every wave that spawns causes the outer circle to get closer until eventually you will no longer be able to expand any more. So make sure you expand quickly enough!

# Things not implemented:

1. A few of the UI elements were removed as we didn't have time to implement them. You will also see some things don't fill in with content
2. More enemy/Tower variety.
3. UI descriptions of the Towers (Resource cost, damage, power generation, etc)
4. A tower for repairing tower (All towers go to full health at the end/start of a round)
5. Health bars

100821.name: EnclaveTD
100821.body:
The Man

I've just started using Unity for my University studies, and wanted to get some practice building a game from start to finish so this will be my first non-tutorial attempt at a game. Every Ludum Dare I'm amazed at the work that is produced in such a short amount of time, I hope one day I can create something to a similar quality.

The Game

My concept is a hex tile based tower defence game where the player has to protect the central city. The building space starts off large and for every tick an enemy is alive, the approaching horde (the map boundary) ever so slightly shrinks. Towers are consumed by the horde if the boundary shrinks past it.

Starting your build from the center of the map will mean you will lose vital map space early in the game, but invest in towers that will help you for the entire game. Outer rim towers will help kill enemies quickly to slow down the approaching horde, but will be consumed before central towers.

The Execution

As my first game I've created, I think I did a fairly decent job. There was still so many things missing: menus, mouse navigation, explosions (the list goes on and on. And on and on...) But it has been an amazing journey and an eye-opening experience. In such a short period of time I have learnt so much and hope to come back for Ludum Dare 43 with a little more knowledge and experience.

100925.name: Desktop Defense
100925.body:
**WARNING: I haven't tested HTML version, so I'd recommend playing the desktop one if there's something really wrong with browser version.**


Made for **Ludum Dare 42: Running out of space**.

![DesktopDefenseLogo.png](///raw/877/1/z/17b34.png)

Defend the tower! Sounds simple? Then let's add to this the whole computer simulation.
*Really weak computer.*

As you progress and more enemies show up on screen, you have to balance game's RAM usage by disabling parts of the game. If memory usage is too high, you will not be able to start another round.

![20180813192502_1.jpg](///raw/877/1/z/17b27.jpg)

Still not enough? The game (I mean, the game IN game) has no interface. For example, to see your statistics and stuff you have to open your save file. And it's still not that simple, because you have limited space for all windows.

![20180813192440_1.jpg](///raw/877/1/z/17b2a.jpg)

Still there? Then what are you waiting for? Let's see if you can survive 5 rounds...

*Good luck and have fun!*


**TOOLS USED:**
- GameMaker: Studio 1.4
- GIMP 2.8
- SFXR

And yes, I'm aware of few bugs, like windows not correctly sticking to cursor and some objects clipping for others. But they're far from game-breaking, I'll eventually fix them someday. Let me know if you encounter any other bugs!

I made the whole game by myself... Then why not compo, you may ask. Because instead of programming the game 2 days ago, I prefered playing Stardew Valley and started jamming for real yesterday. I'm lazy...
Also, I just noticed that in the game I wrote 'Running out of time' instead of 'Running out of space'. Sorry for that.

"R" to restart a level.

100977.name: Pyyrolysis
100977.body:
First-person exploration of a space complex going through its - rather harsh - semi-automatic cleaning process.

Find your way into the station, and switch on *all* the pyrolysis cleaners ... without getting cleaned yourself.

![screenshot.jpg](///raw/cf9/z/15e45.jpg)

There's no gravity, which means you can go any direction you want, with limited control, though (you can't 'roll'), and with a little inertia. As there's no up nor down, it's very easy to get lost. Be sure to wander around and memorize the topology of the station, before activating the first cleaner.

![sc2.jpg](///raw/cf9/z/1664b.jpg)

And by the way: keep away from the cleaners once they're activated ... as time passes, activated cleaners become more dangerous. Which means you have less and less room for navigating through the complex.

Don't run out of space, otherwise you will end up stuck between two rooms, waiting for your imminent death ...

The game is *hard*, and will require some good 3D sense of direction skills ; but it's definitely doable!

Controls:
- Use WASD + mouselook to move.
- Spacebar or E to activate a cleaner.
- 'R' to restart the game (shouldn't be needed)

Powered by:
- Emscripten + SDL + OpenGL + C++
- Vim + GNU Make
- Audacity
- Blender
- Gimp


Keywords:
- HTML5 / Web
- 3D / OpenGL / WebGL
- First-person / stressful / exploration



NOTE: If you're having mouse-locking issue (due to the GameJolt's iframe), try this direct URL: http://code.alaiwan.org/games/pyyrolysis/

100981.name: Cache_
100981.body:

# Cache_ 

a top down bullet hell shooter.

### Controls:

100988.name: Space Defender
100988.body:
In Space Defender, you control a ship trying to defend a piece of piece from aliens determined to build their space station there. Enjoy!

I did everything except the music (and the font).
Music is "Moist Mechas" by Sim Gretina.
Font is Anita Semi-square: https://www.dafont.com/fr/anita-semi-square.font

100992.name: SpaceIO
100992.body:
# About

SpaceIO is a game about running a cell phone startup, a startup where you manually manage the backup of user's data. Your job is to make sure that none of your customer's phones ever run out of space. Whenever they're awake, the customers will be sending emails and taking photos like crazy.

You have to choose how and when to back up their data. If their phones fill up, they'll take their business elsewhere. On top of managing the current customers, as a SpaceIO employee you have to set the price for new customers and oversee infrastructure upgrades.

# Demo

https://youtu.be/-zD6PZJYJvg

# Screenshots

![Home](///raw/964/7/z/15bcd.png)

![Gameplay 1](///raw/964/7/z/15bcb.png)

![Gameplay 2](///raw/964/7/z/15bcc.png)

![Game Over](///raw/964/7/z/15bce.png)

101008.name: Problematic Quadratic
101008.body:
* Note the word says one squares color and *is* the other sqaures color
 * Click the square that shares a color with the word, they both turn black
 * Click the square that the word says, they both disappear
 * Black out the screen to end the game; you are *running out of (white) space*

**tl;dr: By clicking the color of the word that appears and not the word itself, you are running out of "white space"**

101013.name: Save That Fish!
101013.body:
I hope you are enjoying the game!
Even though it is in the jam category (because we worked together) it was made in 48 hours! Always remember: The more fish you have, the higher your score gets every second! Made by Julius Herrmann and Justin Balliet. ![Screenshot_4.png](///raw/39a/81/z/16541.png)![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/39a/81/z/16544.png)
Disclaimer: I added the food to eat after I initially submittet the game, but I added it before the deadline!

101025.name: Industry Island
101025.body: Industry Island is an economy game where you attempt to store 1,000,000 of a single resource to pay back the loan you used to purchase the island. The catch is that you have limited space on your island and a time limit to complete your task. However, you can use the power of adjacency bonuses and resource deposits to your advantage to exponentially increase your resource production. Will you be able to create a strategy that will allow you to pay off your debts and become the true owner of Industry Island?

101031.name: Circle Packing
101031.body:
Click inside the square to start growing a circle, and let go to stop. If your circle touches the edges or another circle, it's game over. Try to fill up as much of the square as you can!

This is my first Ludum Dare, and my first original game, so I figured minimal is best!

101036.name: Space Race
101036.body:
Second Ludum Dare completed!!

Be the one with the most space before the time is up to win.

Use WASD or arrow keys to move and left click to aim and shoot.

Hope you enjoy and leave me some great feedback. Will return the favour where I can.

![SpaceRaceScreenshot.PNG](///raw/a05/c/z/16cd5.png)

101038.name: S.O.B.A.D.
101038.body:
Singleplayer Offline Battle Arena Domination!!

My first Ludum Dare entry.  The Game was made with Unity, blender, Inkscape, and LMMS.  I didn't have time to animate (or model really) but the gameplay is there.

![Untitled.png](///raw/daa/81/z/170dd.png)

Controls:

Right click to move and attack.

Q - power shot

W - heal (left click friendly target)

E - mind control (left click enemy minion)

R - not yet implemented

Esc - pauses game.

101055.name: Deluge of Doom
101055.body:
![top-title-better.png](///raw/460/1/z/16efa.png)

The dumb Merbals have caused an ecological disaster, and a flood is coming. Can you provide housing and jobs to the little Merbals as their land rapidly disappears underwater? _...Running out of space..._

:construction_site: :factory: Play now in your browser: http://deathraygames.com/play-online/deluge-of-doom/ld42/ :cyclone: :swimmer: (Sorry, not mobile-friendly yet.)

**Tips**

* The starting factories produce pollution and boxes of widgets (needed for building).
* Click a building to toggle it on and off.
* Click the build buttons on the left, and then click on the world to assign a building.
* Make note of how many boxes are needed to complete each building.
* Buildings aren't useful until they've been completed.
* Merbals are happy if they have housing, the housing isn't too far from the water, and they have a job at a factory.
* You win by getting rid of all the pollution. Try to get Happiness, Housing, and Employment as high as possible at the same time.


![screenshot-2.png](///raw/460/1/z/16a85.png)

101057.name: Space Compact
101057.body:
SPACE COMPACT - A Game for Ludum Dare 42 (48 hour Compo)

![cover.png](///raw/3de/z/16de1.png)

CONTROLS: (if nothing is happening, click in the game window to refocus)

up arrow: accelerate

down arrow: repulser shield

left and right arrows: rotate ship (or move left and right inside space station)

spacebar: shoot and dock at stations

You're an outer space entrepreneur! (spacetrepreneur?) Use your pitifully small cargo hold to deliver crates from station to station. Try not to get crushed by totally-original-and-non-copyright-infringing asteroids, and avoid getting shot down by space pirates. Use your lasers and repulser shield to defend yourself.  Survive for as long as you can and make bank! After every 5 full deliveries, you'll get a free hull point repair to help keep your ship in the fewest number of pieces possible.

101064.name: Window-less
101064.body:
Window-less is a pretty simple game, you are "Running out of space" as the window the game is played in slowly shrinks. You need to collect the star to prevent the window from shrinking.

This is my first game and first Ludum Dare game for Ludum Dare 42.

I started learning SDL just before the event so I'm aware the game isn't amazing and is missing a lot of what I hoped to add, however I liked the concept and wanted to finish something. 

![windowless screenshot 2.png](///raw/7ca/81/z/16dd8.png)

![windowless1.gif](///raw/7ca/81/z/16ec8.gif)

101074.name: Shafted
101074.body:
Shafted is a game about a miner named Herbert who is trapped in a mine. He must escape, but any movement causes the cave to collapse just a little bit further.

Current progress is some art and the back-end code to draw and animate sprites:

101089.body:
**HINT: GETTING STUCK? DON'T FORGET TO USE YOUR ITEMS :)**

![monsterMochi.gif](///raw/a4f/2/z/1721f.gif)

## Al is a unique choose your own adventure. 

You play as a student going on their first date in a long, long time. Only problem is your apartment is trying to kill you with your own clutter!

![apartmentDemonsPortrait.gif](///raw/a4f/2/z/1721c.gif)

101092.name: Night Shift
101092.body:
NightShift is a simple puzzle game, you drive a forklift and have to deliver cargo to the destination. In the process you compete against time, but mostly yourself. That's right, with every new delivery you have to avoid a ghost of yourself who delivers previous package. It's getting crowded quickly and so you run out of space. And since our Leader sees everything, your story will end in the newspaper, so better make sure its a happy one. There is a lot of accidents on the night shift, so be aware of dead bodies everywhere (who doesn't like fun with ragdolls). This game explains why they call night shift a graveyard shift. 

Gameplay video of first three levels:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Szz1CzwGhyw

Game includes 5 playable levels. 
![5.jpg](///raw/8d5/21/z/165df.jpg)
![6.jpg](///raw/8d5/21/z/165e3.jpg)
![3.jpg](///raw/8d5/21/z/165e7.jpg)
![4.jpg](///raw/8d5/21/z/165ea.jpg)

Controls:
turn left - left arrow or A
turn right - right arrow or D

Tools used:
Unity, VS code, 3D max 2015, Blender 2.79, Photoshop CS5, Paint, Bosca Ceoil. 

Total time 33 hours. 

Known issues:
- sometimes when finishing level in last seconds, game over popup appears (next level will be loaded anyway, so minor)
- music is terrible (it's my Achilles heal) hence I set the volume on very low

Later I will be uploading TimeLapse from dev process.

101094.name: Bus Mayhem
101094.body:
**Game for LD 42**, theme; running out of space.


You are fighting for the **space** in the bus and trying to not get pushed out of it.


**Hold on long enough to win the game**


Move with **WASD** or **Arrows**, press **SPACE** to hit other passengers in the right timing.!


[game_screen.png](///raw/2ea/81/z/162fe.png)

101098.name: Bon☆Guys
101098.body:
Raise your Bon☆Guys in your small studio apartment!  Sell Bon☆Guys to earn cash, to buy more!  Run out of space to farm them!

Hint: Open your front door at the beginning to get your starter items.  You can then access the BonGuide with more information from your computer desk.

101107.name: Electric Fence - Micro B
101107.body:
You're the only member of the SeiWei Emergency Group. 3 Generators have malfunctioned, and the space around them is destabilizing. Destroy them all!

Features:
- 9 Barrel Shotguns
- Challenging Gameplay
- Fun method of locomotion
- Weird enemies

![Screenshot_2018-08-12_15-31-30.png](///raw/2fa/81/z/16c86.png)

Rooms and weapons are randomly generated. Move towards the target centered on the barrier, and spam it with an overpowered weapon.

Use WS keys to accelerate, and AD keys to steer. Press J to fire weapon. Stay within the shrinking barrier.

This game was suppose to have more stuff, but I slept for too long. All this was developed on an Chromebook, so no complaining about system requirements or badly optimized code, hehehe.

A bored boy on a boring math lesson started drawing something that became alive! And now it wants to escape from his birthplace! Help our blue friend reaching the freedom through the obstacles put by the creator, you count with a huge sort of different movements. Good luck!!

WASD to move. Mouse to look. Left click or space to shoot. Pretty Basic.

101130.name: Block Breaker

101131.name: Ball-a-mia
101131.body: No pain - no game! This was the moto of our team during LD#42. So, with these words in our minds the idea for the game was born. It's an action platformer about eating as much as you can in order to beat bulimia. And vomit is your main weapon on the way to victory.

101140.name: Trial by Fire
101140.body:
Destroy as many enemies as possible while also managing your space in "Trial by Fire!" When you destroy an enemy they leave a flame behind, preventing you from passing where you killed them. Survive as long as you can and get a high score by managing where and how you kill enemies!
![GifPreviewCompressed.gif](///raw/21b/81/z/1748a.gif)

This was our first game jam ever! It was super fun and I hope you all enjoy the game!

The most important feature (a death wall) is currently buggy so maybe it will be in this version maybe not.

Click and swipe to make pairs of planets and clear the space before it runs out.

101187.name: T00 Many H00mans
101187.body: A 2D platform - shooter in which you have to evacuate a lab with force granades and not getting swarmed by love-hungry people.![Cattura.JPG](///raw/72a/81/z/17c16.jpg)![ScreenShot00003.png](///raw/72a/81/z/17c1c.png)

101208.name: GRAVEDIGGER - A final stand
101208.body:
Gravedigger a final stand is a game that revolves around a single hero fending of countless enemies in a post apocalyptic world. The world is shrinking for your hero, Every hit you take will limit your play area. If the play area under your feet disappears, you lose!

Press "W,A,S,D" to move around. 
Press "LEFT SHIFT" to sprint.
Press "LEFT MOUSE BUTTON" to fire.
Press "RIGHT MOUSE BUTTON" to aim.

The theme was "Running out of space"

Everything in the game is made by us except the music.

SFX - Steven Ekbrand & Johan Lavén

Graphics - Steven Ekbrand

Programming - Johan Lavén & Erik Holm

![screenshot_highway3.png](///raw/15e/8/z/184eb.png)

![screenshot_mainmenu.png](///raw/15e/8/z/1827f.png)

101233.name: Arc
101233.body:
# Another one finished!!
![Preview1.png](///raw/741/c/z/165a2.png)
![Preview2.png](///raw/741/c/z/165a4.png)
![Preview3.png](///raw/741/c/z/165a5.png)

# Arc

## Description
The planet of your species is dead. Now on board a ship -ARC-, you must bring your people and your ship to your destination through various perils on the journey.

## Gameplay
At first you have to design your ship, along with placing various systems:
 * Engine
 * Life support
 * Shields
 * Sensors
 * Weapons
Each play a role in your journey
Once you launch your ship a turn represents how far your engines can take you.
Also each turn you can do a limited amount of changes/repairs to your ship.

## Theme
Since there's a limited amount of space on your ship, you have to manage it well.

## Tools
 * Unity
 * Gimp
 * Bosca Ceoil

## A few notes
If i had more time i could have added more events along the journey and a few improvements on the ship looks and mechanics, which were planned. 
I am satisfied with the result, though I could have invested a bit more time
Also, it's damn easy to win the game since there are only a few events...

## Links
Down below, source code and build.

101252.name: Fergie Forker
101252.body:
![LD42-Screen06.jpg](///raw/196/a/z/18035.jpg)

Well, for better or worse, here it is!

Fergie Forker is a lightweight, casual, relaxing, almost mind-numbingly boring warehouse management game. You are a cute, tireless little Forklift whose job it is to receive packages and sort them on the warehouse floor. If you start to run out of floor space, start stacking! Sometimes, deliveries will be requested; maybe you can stack deliveries, or rush to get more than one through the door? But, remember, bad forklifts don't drop packages!
 
Scoring:
Earn $ by picking up packages; some packages are worth more than others, and bundled packages can be worth more than single ones. If you do not pick up a package, you will be docked a % of the package's worth. If you drop a package, you will charged the wholesale price of the package. If you deliver a package, you will receive the retail value of the package. I know it's not realistic, but neither are happy little fork lifts!

Controls:
W - Move Forward

S - Reverse

A/D - Turn Wheels Left/Right

E - Forklift Up (also Up Arrow)

C - Forklift Down (also Down Arrow)

SPACE - Slow Down (Gently)

ALT - Stuck Help Minor (If you get stuck on a mild bump, use this while moving forward/reversing).

BACKSPACE - Stuck Help Major (Reset your position, but it'll cost you $200)

SHIFT - Horn (Just Because)

1 - Warehouse View

2 - Fork-o-Vision View (You'll need to switch views often!)
 
So, there you have it! You should know everything you need to know about Fergie Forklift; mind you, I guess it works? I only tried it on my computer, and I don't have Mac or Linux to test it there... so, good luck! :D

Happy Forkin' Lifting!

101259.name: Postal Pup
101259.body:
![7B2191E1-D981-4B91-B3EF-2BD8D8CC464D.png](///raw/1fa/21/z/181d5.png)
A bite-sized game about delivering mail!

---

**CONTROLS**

Movement: WASD, Left, Right, Up, Down
Interact: Space

---

Created by Kiana Mosser (*@kianamosser*) and Matt Fisher (*@MattFDraws*). Kiana did the paintings, title screen, and backgrounds. Matt did the character designs, and both of us programmed. We were only available for one day during LD42, but feel free to check out what we created in that time!

101263.name: Running out of Space
101263.body:
I hope you enjoy the concept of my first submission, definitely tried to think a little outside the box on this one!

The game is definitely unfinished, the concept is there for further stages but seems like no time to implement any more ideas as the time I had didn't work out.  Overall I got to try out Game Maker Studio 2 which I found very good and play around with Ableton and Affinity Designer.

101307.name: Pyramidion
101307.body:
![title_screen_clean_ld.PNG](///raw/6bb/81/z/18030.png)

Explore the pyramid in your quest to snatch the holy capstone located at the top. Approach carefully, as there are dangers on your path, and available space becomes scarce as you approach the top of the pyramid.

I just recently started learning Unity, and this is the first full game I've ever made! :) I'll be really happy to get some feedback.

# Instructions

Use the arrow keys to move. Use space or the up arrow to jump. Use the up arrow to enter doors.

The game has three difficulty modes. The hardest difficulty mode includes a new enemy type, and unlocks only after you beat the game in normal difficulty.

# Credits

I've used some music from opengameart.org:  
Snake Charmer (Created by Erich Izdepski)  
Suez Crisis (Created by Spring)  
Victory! (Composed by: Jon K. Fite)  
  
I've used some sound effects from freesound.org:  
hiss2.wav and hiss3.wav (Created by Reitana)  
poof.wav (Created by ryansitz)  
red_tail_hawk2.wav (Created by wisslgisse)  
hawk_one_show.wav (Created by Robinhood76)  

All graphical assets were created by me using Gimp / Aseprite.

# Walkthrough

In case you want help playing through the game, here's a walkthrough for normal difficulty mode:
https://youtu.be/8blglUdtrFA

and here's a walkthrough for hard difficulty mode:
https://youtu.be/uceuNSQkjC4


# Screenshot:
![screenshot4.png](///raw/6bb/81/z/18034.png)

101309.name: Blarbs!
101309.body: [Not available yet, just submitting this now before the submit-frenzy]

101310.name: ItsRainingVirus
101310.body:
ItsRainingVirus is my first Ludume Dare Game for Ludume Dare 42.
![Cover Art.PNG](///raw/a51/6/z/170d9.png)
ItsRainingVirus is a game about not getting killed by virus blocks that fall from the sky, something we can all relate to.

101312.name: Area Assailants
101312.body:
It's a shmup!  Not really.

Unfinished, mostly just a test of my YaML-driven bullet system for Unity.

I wasn't going to be able to do a serious LD game this time, but I wanted to enter just to say I was there for LD #42. :v:

101335.name: Asteroid
101335.body:
You are the head of research group, based on asteroid belt. Finally you and your group reached perspective asteroid, and prepared to set up camp. Maybe you made a mistake in the calculations or something else happened, but the surface could not stand the landing of you ship. You have a few resource, some scientific equipment, but land is actually falls down. Help will arrive in about 10 days. Can you survive and save your crew and scientific data? You have to build buildings, gather resources and make decisions, but remember, at any moment everything can collapse.

![Screenshot 2018-08-13 21.15.06.png](///raw/6db/81/z/17ba7.png)

101338.name: Hoard
101338.body:
Instructions are in-game, plus the undocumented Tab key which allows you to select a different item without using the mouse. You can also use the arrow keys+PageUp/PageDown instead of WASD+QE.

![screenshot.png](///raw/861/z/176e0.png)

This is a game in which you arrange items until you run out of space to put them, at which point you can give a limited number of items to your rabbit friend using the spacebar, until you run out of space-bar uses. Oh and the music is a layered progression in which we add more and more instruments until we run out of space between notes!

101365.name: Dungeon Trader
101365.body:
![banner.png](///raw/1fb/81/z/17657.png)

This is a love-hate tribute to all those games that don't give you enough bag space.​

This dungeon is full of junk! 

Sift through the bones and boots to find the items your party needs to survive.

Click the items that monsters drop to bring them into your inventory and find out what they are. ​

Trade unwanted items with the merchant while you make sure your knight is armoured​ and your archer has enough arrows.  The merchant is very  generous... perhaps too generous.

Keep your party healed, cured, and revived all while making sure you have enough free slots in your bag.

![screen.jpg](///raw/1fb/81/z/1765a.jpg)

Controls

​Click / Tap items in the top screen to place them in your inventory.

Drag items out to give to party members.

Items

- ​Arrows and Shields are for your party.
- Potions cure ailments or heal lost health.
- Hearts bring the dead back to life.
- Junk is junk, and there is so much junk. Get rid of the junk!

101368.name: Warehouse
101368.body:
# Screenshots

![Screenshot 2.png](///raw/158/2/z/17b59.png)

![Screenshot 4.png](///raw/158/2/z/17b5a.png)

![Screenshot 5.png](///raw/158/2/z/17b5b.png)



# Description

You've been hired by a shipping company! That's some good news, until you see that their previous employee left a big mess. You must organize the boxes you have, while also making sure to manage ones coming in and out of the warehouse. Make sure all of the deliveries are made on time, or they might reconsider your employment.



# Controls

**WASD/Arrow keys/ZQSD** - Movement controls

**Esc/F1** - Menu

**Space** - Lift and lower forklift

**Controller support!**



# Credits

**James** - Coding and Level Design

**Anthony** - Modeling and Level Design
