101383.name: It's All Falling Apart Like ...
101383.body:
![logo.jpg](///raw/c75/z/165d7.jpg)
 
![pic1.jpg](///raw/c75/z/165cf.jpg)

![pic2.jpg](///raw/c75/z/165d0.jpg)

![pic3.jpg](///raw/c75/z/165d2.jpg)
___  
  
💡 **Idea:**  
It's All Falling Apart Like ... like what? Honestly, I have no idea, but I know that "*all*" can relate to anything. Your code quality as Ludum Dare progresses? Oh yeah, definitely. Same applies to your sanity? Yep, that's for sure. Your life? Yes, but hopefully not...

It's All Falling Apart Like ... is a game about controlling a thing with keys that can pick up good things and kill bad things oh and all the things also can jump and a lot more... This game... maybe it's a platformer, maybe it's a tower defense (or maybe it's a plane?), maybe it has battle royale elements to it or maybe I just believe that it does...
 
The platforms on each level are collapsing under the deepness of the subtle plot... You need to try your best to survive.
 
Do you see how many ellipses I'm using? Am I doing this for a joke? I don't know. You'll have to find out for yourself... Yeah... This is truly something... Really makes you think... 🤔
  
___  
   
✏️ **Theme:** Running out of space
  
___  
     
  
🏅 **Features:**
- Underground setting, *why? Well imagine this is like a mineshaft, so the falling wooden platforms actually make sense now. Simple™*
- 3 unique levels, *the ones you've never seen before. Because you've never seen this game. I recommend, 9/10, but needs more procedural generation*
- Replay value, *tons of it. You can play with your eyes closed, or maybe with your monitor upside down. Possibilities are endless, really*
- 3 powerups, *those are things that do good things for you. These can be the key to survival, no joke, especially when used by a real player and not by an enemy*
- Smart enemies, *those are things that do no good things for you. **HEY, LOOK, THEY ARE SMART, ALRIGHT??? THEY ARE TRYING THEIR BEST TO COMPETE WITH YOU. IT'S NOT THEIR FAULT THAT YOU HAVE A BRAIN AND THEY HAVE ONLY 650 LINES OF SPAGHETTI CODE WRITTEN BY A DRUNK CODER. BUT YOU KNOW WHAT? IF YOU DIE YOU GET TO ENJOY ENEMIES PLAYING ALL BY THEMSELVES. HA. HAHA. THEY ARE FULLY INDEPENDENT AND DON'T NEED YOU*** 💪😤
- Realistic combat, *this is basically your typical battle royale game, but it can be played on a potato calculator without Internet connection. Seriously, you aren't eager to play it yet?*
  
___  
   
🎮 **Controls:**
- Up/Down/Left/Right Arrows - Move the landing spot target
- Space - Jump to the landing spot target
- Left Mouse - Pan a camera around when player is dead
- R - Quick restart
- 1/2/3 - Use powerups if available
- Escape - Close the game  
  
___  
  
🕹 **Cheats:**  
If for some reason you find enemy bots beating you then:
1. don't get frustrated 
2. git gud 
3. if you still get frustrated use these: 
 - Page Up - Goes to the next level
 - Page Down - Goes to the previous level
 - P - Gives infinite number of powerups
  
___  
  
🎥 **Timelapse:** 
  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2GnB7wELpUc
  
___
  
*NOTE: HTML5 version of the game might run slow since this was made in GameMaker:Studio, which isn't optimized for HTML5 at all*

101384.name: LD42 Running out of Space
101384.body: A space arena shooter where space is closing in on you.![2018-08-12 (1).png](///raw/65b/81/z/16f9c.png)

101413.body:
Help. Your files are fragmented and all over the place and your disk space is in the process of running out. Bring order to the file chaos, get points for better order, survive as long as you can.

101421.name: maze game
101421.body: maze game and you have to find to red cube

101433.name: Bleach Beach
101433.body:
Welcome to Bleach Beach!

The sea is draining, and you have been assigned the task of catching the most fish possible before the water is gone. However, BotBoat Corp is competing with you: be careful of them, as they may resort to shady tactics, or surprise them by stealing the fish on their boats.

Move with the **A** and **D** keys, use your jetpack with **W**, aim your cannon with the **mouse** and shoot your harpoon by **_holding_** the **left mouse button**. 

![Screenshot](///raw/d4d/z/17e36.png)

### The Boats

![Player Boat](///raw/d4d/z/17e30.png)  
![Bot Boat](///raw/d4d/z/17e40.png)

All boats feature a grappling hook, a recharging jetpack and a storage space for the caught fish.

### The Fish

![Fish](///raw/d4d/z/17e67.png)  
![Big Fish](///raw/d4d/z/17e64.png)  
![Fish Stack](///raw/d4d/z/17ed7.png)

Fish roam the sea, waiting to be caught by someone...  
After getting on a ship, they can be **stolen** by hitting the fish stack with an harpoon.  
Large fish are worth double!

101438.name: Obstacle Royale
101438.body: Welcome! to L D City!, Home of the World Obstacle Royale! Participate on a Competition where you need to traverse through traps, hidden and visible, and other stuff that will hinder your progress. Only a certain amount of contestants will advance to the final round. First one to get the golden cup wins!

101440.name: Excessive 3: Inadequate Space
101440.body:
![excessive3.jpg](///raw/470/1/z/15ce6.jpg)

A kinetic text adventure and the sequel to my LD40 and LD41 entries, Excessive and Excessive 2: Excessively Incompatible, respectively.

Story: He and she have to contend with running out of space in their new home.

The package contains both the executable (for modern systems) and the source code (for legacy systems).

101463.name: SpaceBreaker
101463.body:
![ScreenIMage.png](///raw/55c/81/z/18103.png)

This was our first time entering the Ludum Dare Jam.
It was quite exiting at the start and all the way through, however after a good brainstorm session we came up with "SpaceBreaker". We made a list of priority and low priority tasks. We managed to finish every single one!

In SpaceBreaker you have to "run out of space", literally, kinda...
Trapped in the cyber space from an 80's machine you have to move faster than ever before!
Grease your fingers, wrists and elbows in order to break trough cyber space!

Will you be able to escape?




"This game is a true test of the ultimate limit in human endurance." 
- The dev team.






Tools:
Source-control: GitHub and client.
Game engine: Unity 2018.
Audio: 
-FX: Bfxr .
-Theme: Audacity**.

Graphics: Photoshop.






The team:

-Mark Duisters(MarkD): http://markduisters.com/
-Jordy Dirkx(Jaydee):/
-Selwyn Wijnants(Foesho):/







**All audio is made from scratch except for: 
Theme song remixed and edited work based on the song "Race Between the Spires" by TeknoAXE
TeknoAXE social info:
https://www.reverbnation.com/teknoaxe
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtgf00GvfFQVsYBA7V7RwUw
Music License: Creative Commons Attribution license (reuse allowed)

101468.name: Castle Custodian
101468.body:
![Cover Image](///content/660/2/z/17a61.png)

Custodians for the more haunted castles have a slightly different responsibility: disposing of the supernatural. Ideally without causing too much of the roof to collapse.

Castle Custodian is a shooter/bullet hell where hitting a wall causes part of the ceiling to collapse, slowly running the player out of space to avoid enemy attacks.

Controls:

Use WASD to move

Press space to combat roll and avoid all damage

Left click to shoot a fireball

![ae934ed390a57fb71d86f25e068f5e01.png](///raw/660/2/z/17cce.png)

![9506a73ee5abbe35c0b39a7396565e0c.png](///raw/660/2/z/17ccf.png)

101473.name: Space Runner
101473.body:
In Space Runner you are literally RUNNING out of Outer Space. Your ship is fuelled by your running, you have to manage the oxygen you have left (blue) and your stamina (green). While in Outer Space, your Oxygen is drained and your Stamina fills up. While in a planets atmosphere, you regain Oxygen but you lose Stamina from all the running. 
It's a simple endless "runner" where you get points for collecting golden stuff and discovering planets. Carefull tho, the planets surface can be very... volatile. Keep your distance from shooting stuff out there.
To play simply unzip the file, open SpaceRunner(PC/Windows) and double click SpaceRunner app.
Have Fun and thanks for playing!
![SS1.png](///raw/f5c/81/z/16c28.png)
![SS2.png](///raw/f5c/81/z/16c2b.png)
![SS3.png](///raw/f5c/81/z/16c30.png)

101492.name: Comet Jump
101492.body:
Comet Jump/Comet Run is a small plat-former about trying to get *out of space* and into your space station, as you will see I am not that good at graphics. I could have changed your player; however I had grown attached to him by the end of my development :)

This has been my second Ludum Dare and it was so much harder than the first, that didn't stop me loving it though! I'm also not sure if I have set the source code up correctly so please forgive me if I haven't.


![CometJumpIcon.png](///raw/e1d/11/z/1692c.png)

101499.name: Island Populating Simulator
101499.body:
** Game **

In Island Populating Simulator you must stop Brad from going insane.
How is he going insane you ask? Well, Brad does not like people!

Brad lives on an uninhabited island to escape society.
However this island mysterically attracts construction workers.
(Keep this a secret, but the island is extremely flat!)

To stop Brad from going insane you must shove the construction workers
off the island, and avoid touching buildings.
Try to get the highest score possible!

** Playing **

Move with the WASD keys and keep an eye on your insanity meter!

** Notes **

This was my first Ludum Dare and that combined with the fact
that I experimented using a new framework (one I made myself);
it resulted in a buggy but playable game.

I also had no time to add sounds to the game, I focussed on 
more important aspects.

I still hope the game is fun to play and would love to hear
your comments :)

101512.name: Sustain the Light
101512.body:
**Sustain the Light**

This is a semi-finished version of what I came up with for my first ever Ludum Dare.

*If you don't want to read the paragraphs there is a **TL;DR** below.*

The idea behind it was that you run out of space by using up the light around you to cast spells. Stepping into the dark would be the end of your life. You could sustain the light around you by collecting pick-ups from enemies you kill, or using your the ultimate ability that bursts you into flames. Allowing you to cast spells without draining the light and gathering more pick-ups. Eventually fighting a boss or moving onto another level.

But then life obligations came up... The game has a working loop (you can start the game, kill stuff (or get killed) and restart. But the combat is very basic and the darkness doesn't kill you so it doesn't really matter. You can use the ultimate ability freely without any cooldown or resource so just spam the button ;) Killing stuff is in, there's no indication of damage but it is happening. You also get damaged if the enemy collides with you, again no indication but you can die. I do like this project and idea a lot though so it might be something I work on casually so that's a plus. Oh, and there's probably bugs but oh well.

Can't wait for the next LD cause this has definitely taught me a lot!

**TL;DR** - Semi-finished game. Working game loop but full design not implemented. You can kill or get killed but there's no hit indicators so be careful (hint - enemies take 4 hits to die).

**Controls**

**WASD** - Movement

**Mouse** - Aiming

**LMB** - Fireball

**ESC** - Pause

101518.name: Roady -- family firendly fun!
101518.body:
your name is Roady, you are a forklift driver and you have to keep the road clean of boxes. because they are so heavy, cars collapse into it and you get fired. 


the goal is to survive for as long as possible, you lose once a car smashes into a box.


How to play:


you control the truck with  W, A, S, D or arrow keys, and you press space to pick up a box, once you are holding a box, a red light on the roof of the forklift turns on.
The maximum stack size is 3 boxes, but sometimes you can stack them above that.

bugs:
this game has a bug with movement, that I couldn't solve in this jam - you sometimes randomly get stuck, and can't move forward while holding boxes. If such a bug occurs to you, you shall press space to let go of the box, then turn right or left, then turn back to the boxes you vere holding and press space again to take the boxes. Then you will be able to move again. 
If you find any bugs, let me know  :slight_smile: 


about:
this is my first Ludum Dare gamejam, and I went straight for the compo. The game has a couple glitches, but overall it turned out great. This was also one of my first experiences using blender :yum: 
![cover.png](///raw/98c/81/z/16873.png)

meta.link-01-name: Unity folder of the game in zip

101519.name: Wall Trap (Ludum Dare 42 Game Jam)
101519.body: This is my first Ludum Dare 42 Submission.

101531.name: The Transporter
101531.body:
![LD42Cover.png](///raw/611/z/169d2.png)

You Must grab & put out all of the boxes before the room gets too small . SO DON'T GO OUT OF SPACE

Tutorial : 
When you  put the box in the truck you gain Coins. 
You can use coins to boost your speed or to slow down the shrinking of the room;

101534.name: Full Grave Panic!!!
101534.body:
![FullGravePanicExample_starting.PNG](///raw/0fe/71/z/16f63.png)

![FullGravePanicExample1.PNG](///raw/0fe/71/z/16f80.png)

![ludum dare.PNG](///raw/0fe/71/z/16f6a.png)

The graveyards are fuller than ever!!!
In this game, you manage a graveyard town, carefully balancing resources between gold, limited space, and coffins.
Coffins drop onto your town and you must clear them away to avoid losing health.
Coffins spawns exponentially faster as the late game approaches, so be prepared.

The game was made using Unity, Substance Painter, Photoshop, and blender.

Note: would really appreciate if you can post your high score in comment. That could really help me understand how to balance the game.

101545.name: Spaceless
101545.body:
This is my entry for Ludum Dare 42, with the theme of "Running out of space".

The controls are A and D to move left and right, Space to Jump holding S to increase the speed of the falling blocks temporarily, in exchange for bonus points.

The game is over once you get crushed by a block or fall too far behind.

Have fun!

101561.name: Merchantile
101561.body: You are a shopkeeper just getting started in the world. While your shop is small now, there is room to grow and become the largest shop around. Make purchases from the Catalog to acquire enough funds to expand your shop. Grow your shop to its full potential to win.![GameCapture.PNG](///raw/be4/41/z/16d58.png)

101564.name: O² Space Salvage
101564.body:
O² Space Salvage is a game about running out of space... in Space. It is set in the far future where you have to clean up space junk in order for space freighters to deliver supplies to different parts of the galaxy.

You can clean up the junk in many different ways. You can shoot it, suck it, or push it. The goal is to try to clear the path for the freighter before it goes through its course.

Oh yeah and there are also evil robots, just so there was a danger element in the game.

Works on Windows + Python 2.7*.

*Requires Pygame 1.9.4 to run.

101571.name: Stardust
101571.body:
THEME: "Running Out of Space"

As a space pilot escaping pursuit, you head full speed into a chaotic debris field hoping to lose your tail. Good thing you've trained your entire life for this sort of thing! 

Make split-second flight path changes by accessing your ACE-MODE skill, which allows you to slow down time around you while controlling your ship as normal. 

CONTROLS: 
SPACEBAR - Press and hold to activate ACE-MODE. Time around you slows to a halt. Release to leave ACE-MODE. 
Arrow-UP - Pitch your ship up. Can only be used in ACE-MODE.
Arrow-DOWN - Pitch your ship down. Can only be used in ACE-MODE.

RULES:
- Avoid RED walls on top and bottom of screen.
- Avoid YELLOW debris fields and pieces.
- Use ACE-MODE to make split-second changes in your flight path. 
- This is an endless-runner; go for score! 

Tools:
- Unity3D + Visual Studio 2017
- Bosca Ceoil https://boscaceoil.net/
- Inkscape https://inkscape.org/en/
- BFXR https://www.bfxr.net/

![Capture3.PNG](///raw/a78/1/z/16d0c.png)

Heartfelt thanks to: 
- Tyson S.
- Christina P.
- Jonathan S.
- Cody P.

101577.name: Breathing Room
101577.body:
You landed on an unknown planet after your spaceship suffered some major damage. The planet is inhabited by ferocious beasts! And to make things worse, there's no oxygen in the air! 
All hope is not lost, however. The cargo you were carrying contained spare parts for your spaceship, so if you can find them you can repair your ship and get back home! The lack of oxygen won't be a problem either! Well, kind of. The round plants you can see scattered around can produce oxygen. 

But don't let your guard down, as the 'safe space' that they create when you activate will shrink before disappearing completely, and you'll be left gasping for air again! And that's not all: the beasts that populate the planet hate the smell of oxygen and will attack the plants, accelerating their decay. With your trusty handgun and the oxygen-powered jetpack on your back, fend off the monsters and defend the plants as you fight for your survival.
**Will you be able to go back home?**

**Controls**
- Movement: WASD
- Interact: F
- Shoot: Mouse 1 
- Dodge: Mouse 2
- Aim: Mouse


**Team**

- @barondev - Programming Extraordinaire
- @squaredev - Master of the Visual Arts
- @mobiusdisco - Music and SFX

101592.name: Protect the Core
101592.body:
Malicious growth is spreading. Your task is to protect the core from it and the creatures it brings. If you are destroyed, you will be brought back, as long as the core is still alive.

The growth, if left unchecked, can spread very quickly and cover most of the play area, so you are always running out of space. The core lazer is very helpful in clearing out some of it.

The difficulty of surviving increases exponentially as time goes on, see how long you can last! 

Tip: try sweeping the lazer!

![F563778A-BCA5-4857-93B0-D9ECB394C11B.jpeg](///raw/fcb/71/z/16da7.jpg)

101595.name: No Room!
101595.body:
You play as semi-naked hero who is tight on inventory space!
You're stuck with one item at a time, your choice of item carries a big weight into your success in not dying and getting out of the dungeon so choose wisely.


*
First time using my home made games framework (bear game framework) to make a game so the amount of content in the game might be lacking due to some time being spent fixing bugs found in the framework during development!
*


CONTROLS & HOW TO PLAY (!IMPORTANT!)
WASD to move, simply move into an enemy to engage in combat.
ITEMS: pick up new item by walking into chest
item can either be weapon, armor or healing (not random, same each playthrough )
Use the ladder seen in each level to progress, there are 5 levels in total.

RECOMENNDED WAY OF PLAYING
Plan your chests carefully and learn what type of item each chest gives you, strategically opening chests at the right time is fundamental towards winning in the game!

SOURCE
the whole game is up on Github, the game uses the framework (bear game framework) written by me which also can be found on my Github page.

![5.PNG](///raw/bd3/z/161d3.png)
![3.PNG](///raw/bd3/z/161d5.png)
![2.PNG](///raw/bd3/z/161d2.png)

101603.name: The Consumer
101603.body:
![ld.gif](///raw/a2a/z/16f14.gif)

You are an ignorant simpleton. You need to consume as much media as possible to become an informed and productive member of society. Your entire self-worth depends on it. Use my convenient tool to consume many random videos at once, and finally become a well adjusted person!

**SORRY FOR DOWNLOAD-ONLY**. There are CORS permissions issues with the WebGL version that I can't do anything about :'( so you need to download the desktop version.

**PLAY ON WIFI ONLY!** The game is streaming tons of videos from the internet at the same time so it can use tons of MB.

**CONTENT WARNING (18+):** This game pulls from ~1600 public domain videos from the 60s-80s, which contain all kinds of things including war, racism, probably some porn.  I have no idea what you might see. You can check the full list of video titles here: https://github.com/foolmoron/TheConsumer/blob/master/Assets/video%20data.json

**CONSUME** to add a new video to the screen

**CLICK THE CORRECT WORDS** based on the text's style formatting (the word is also somewhat related to the video, but that's unreliable)

**LET INCORRECT WORDS PASS** otherwise you will lose points when clicking them

**TURN OFF THE TV** to end the game and save your points before they are lost

**TIPS **
- Each video has 1 correct text format and 1 incorrect text format. Memorize the correct and incorrect styles so you can make the right choice.
- You gain exponentially more points the more videos there are on screen, but the text style differences get harder and more subtle
- If you drop below 0 points, the TV will turn off. Try staying alive for as long as possible with a high # of panels.

101605.name: Gooie the Gooball.
101605.body: Lead Gooie, a small gooball, as he defends himself against hoards of aliens and fights a terrifying boss.

101608.name: grOw
101608.body:
![grOw logo.png](///raw/c8f/21/z/16a35.png)

grOw is a puzzle game where you are constantly running out of space. As you move your orb will gather energy and grow until it can contain no more and it bursts.

![growth looping.gif](///raw/c8f/21/z/16a61.gif)

Avoid red lasers and orbs at all cost! They grow you until you burst!

![pop shorter.gif](///raw/c8f/21/z/16a54.gif)

Use arrow keys, WASD, or the left thumbstick on a 360 controller to move. Change Player Orbs (if more than one alive) by pressing space/shift or the left and right bumpers of the controller.

![game screenshot.png](///raw/c8f/21/z/16a5c.png)

I planned on making more levels, but ran out of time for the compo. (I will be adding more levels after Ludum Dare, and polishing everything up, adding sounds, etc.)

There is no sound, as I'm not good at making music or sounds (plus I ran out of time).

Tools used:
 - Unity 2018.2 (Used their new Shader Graph tool as well)
 - GIMP
 - Blender

101613.name: Carter's Crates
101613.body:
![CartersCratesTitle.png](///raw/40c/41/z/16af2.png)

It's Carter's shift! The crates just keep on coming. Carter's job is to organize the crates and send them down the chute of the matching color. Don't let the crates pile up to the ceiling, or Carter might get in trouble with the boss.

### Controls:
* Space: Jump
* Left and Right: Move
* Shift: Pick Up / Drop Crates
* Down + Shift: Pick up a crate underneath Carter
* 'R': Restart the game at any point

### Tips:
* Watch out for falling crates.
* Carter can pick up a stack of up to 3 crates.
* Consecutively delivered crates yield bonus points.

Can you get the global top score?

![LD42gif2.gif](///raw/40c/41/z/16cae.gif)

![LD42gif3.gif](///raw/40c/41/z/16cbc.gif)

#### Changelog:
* Fixed a game breaking bug where a box collision can result in the game ending. [Commit Here](https://github.com/diego-escalante/LD42-CartersCrates/commit/370e6c5cb0aa185cb60d0c241514f773f778023a)

101623.name: Laser Rails: Chase!
101623.body:
My Ludum Dare 42 Game: 'Laser Rails: Chase!'
Play as a robot - with a jetpack - chasing a train - being shot by other robots - in a western-cyberpunk mashing of genres.

Let me know in the comments what your highest score is!

![CinematicScreenImpact4.png](///raw/d6f/c/z/172fe.png)

Controls:
WASD/Keys - Movement
Space - Jetpack (also helps you get back up when you fall)
R to restart

I didnt get around to adding the laser whip unfortunately, so combat is lacking! :( 

Basic idea of the game:
Keep as close to the train as for as long as possible for maximum points - youll only gain points when youre in close pursuit.


Ive opted-out for Audio because I ran out of time to make any sfx or music so whats in the game wasnt made by me - I just threw it in last minute for some ambience!
Music: BenSound https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music/electronica Track: 'Scifi'

![CinematicScreen02_edit.png](///raw/d6f/c/z/17304.png)

![CinematicScreen03_edit.png](///raw/d6f/c/z/17307.png)

101633.name: Binary Garbage Separation
101633.body:
![Capture.PNG](///raw/863/c/z/15dad.png)

Ever wondered what happens inside your computer when you're running out of disk space? Meet Wisniewski, the Binary Garbage Separator! Your task is to help him get rid of all that incoming data. But keep in mind to seperate your waste!

Plays best with XBOX Controller!

Controls:

- Keyboard: A B X Y

- Gamepad:  A B X Y


Can you beat my highscore of 280? :P

101643.name: The Killer Blue Tiles
101643.body:
If you think my game is unsafe. Go ahead and download my source code. It has the full game inside it. Go to Windows, x86 and it will be there.

There are only 10 levels in this game! So if the next LEVEL button stops working, CONGRATULATIONS!!!


I am now working on a fix for some of the bugs!

101646.name: Falloor
101646.body:
![Ludum Dare Cover 2.png](///raw/d0d/81/z/1743a.png)

It's time to eat! But your wife moved the fridge upstairs because she thinks you're fat. Will it stop you? No! You're going to climb higher and higher and nothing will stop you, even the floor that falls as soon as you step on it.

**Screenshots:**

![Screenshot 1.png](///raw/d0d/81/z/17427.png)

![Screenshot 2.png](///raw/d0d/81/z/17428.png)

101651.name: Shark Barrage
101651.body:
A game in which you find yourself stuck on a small raft in the middle of the ocean. Sharks will try and eat you(and your raft) and you will have to shoot them. You lose by running out of space on your raft and no longer being able to avoid the sharks.

Use WASD to move and the mouse to shoot.

This is my first time participating in a game jam and although the game is not great, I'm happy I got to finish it.

Software used:
Unity 2018.2.3f1, Photoshop, Bosca Ceoil, Bfxr

101658.name: Zlinx
101658.body: My first game, had great fun. Will participate again! Feel free to have a try :) its a difficult fast paced  platformer that can get quite intense l![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 15.04.23.png](///raw/71d/81/z/179e7.png)let me know what you think?

101659.name: Out Of Memory
101659.body:
![LD Coverr.png](///raw/5a4/c/z/166d3.png)

You badly want to download a file, but you ran out of space. You want to delete apps, but they give certain amounts of joy. If you Run out of joy, well, you get depression. If you download file that has size bigger than free space, Game Over.

This is NES / SNES style puzzle game made by 14 year old Dovydas Vaiciukynas.

Make sure to try this game and have fun! 

Download:
https://ihelpofficial.itch.io/out-of-memory

My Website:

https://dovai.net

My Twitter:

@dovker

101675.name: Anna's Tale
101675.body:
[play game](https://goo.gl/dSDYCS)

Our mind resembles an attic, where we hoard memories. When we run out of space, old memories are erazed.

You collect snippets of memory from a princess' life. The more you have, the faster they fade or disappear altogether.

When all memories are collected, the memory fog starts to devour them.

Events, retrieved from the fog, gain another light. And you learn a different story of the princess' life.

![Screenshot (112).png](///raw/b7/z/17ac3.png)
![Screenshot (110).png](///raw/b7/z/17ac7.png)
![Screenshot (111).png](///raw/b7/z/17ac9.png)

101681.name: Faceguy
101681.body:
Faceguy is a short game made for LD42. Evade the evil bullet, drop bombs, survive as long as possible, and try not to blow yourself up... or get impaled... or squished.

                                                        Controls

                                            Arrow Keys to move, Z to drop bombs.

101705.name: Pack-It Down!
101705.body: It's a game about throwing stuff in a bag and giving it to the customer

101717.name: Last Resister
101717.body:
A survival shooting game which you can consume your surviving space for better ability.This is our first jam,your suggestions and rating will be our source of confidence to take part in more jams.Thanks for playing!![game.gif](///raw/5f1/81/z/17852.gif)![game2.gif](///raw/5f1/81/z/17854.gif)

It has been three years since the five kinds of super bacteria started to spread wildly.And the global population is reduced to ███,███,███.
Today a great progress has been made in LAB-██:
Unexpectedly,one special human cell evolve to a "Super Cell".The cell can
secrete bactericidal substance
 to resist the super bacteria,and consume its culture medium to get recovery and improve itself.
However,it can't divide for unknown reason.
Now,the cell becomes the last human cell in the culture medium,but is still resisting.Could it survive and become the final hope for human being?We will keep on observing...

We made up a pretty scary background to match our simple and cold artstyle.
Consuming your space is not so dangerous at the start of the game,but as you are facing more and more enemies and you have to consume more space,it could be easy to be besieged by enemies.

P.S. The game does allow you to trap the enemies in a circle by consuming space,but we don't recommend you to do that because it will greatly extend the time of one round.If you have done that unintentionally,please just press esc to back to title.

101723.name: Viral
101723.body:
Your PC is infected and viruses are taking over your hard drive. If you run out of space your PC will crash and all your precious data is lost forever. You must stop the viruses and delete them all whilst dealing with various challenges like pop ups and a maze-like folder structure.

![cleanScreen.png](///raw/eea/71/z/1609b.png)

![finishedGame.png](///raw/eea/71/z/16097.png)

![deadscreen.png](///raw/eea/71/z/16099.png)

101743.name: Souls Panic
101743.body:
![Capture d’écran 2018-08-13 à 12.21.12.png](///raw/41c/71/z/17678.png)

> **[CLIC HERE TO PLAY ONLINE (WebGL)](http://gamejam.ga/)**

## Game
Luna must take souls arriving on the river, to **place them in their wells**.  
There are 4 areas:
* Neutral (no well) ;
* Paradise (clouds, blue souls) ;
* Hell (lava, red souls) ;
* Earth (grass, purple souls).
  
Warning to the number of souls present in each zone! The more there are, the more the thermometers fill up.  
When an **area is overloaded**, the **thermometer breaks** and the **well is disabled**.  
  
You lose the game when 3 thermometers are broken (the waiting space can't contain an inifinity of souls​ !).

**Have fun and don't panic ! ;-)**

## Controls
**WASD/DirectionalArrows :** Move Luna, the cutest reaper (main character)  
**Space bar :** Catch/Release souls (hold on release to throw souls)  
**E :** Near switches, reverse water flow

## Content

We made all the graphics in pixel art, as well as composed the music especially for the occasion.

## Team
For **our first GameJam**, we realized this game in **4 members team**. We hope you enjoy it !

## Play links

101752.name: Spaced Out
101752.body:
The year is 3683. The Earth has reached its carrying capacity. Any more people on Earth and it will no longer be able to support life. You have been tasked with sending people off of Earth to various planets. However, even in the face of an apocalypse people are picky!

How many people can you save without running out of money to build new ships?


Note: This game uses HTML5 and recent CSS extensively. Make sure your browser natively supports CSS grid and flexbox, and HTML5 drag-and-drop, otherwise this will not work.

101764.name: Light Towers
101764.body:
A mix between Tetris and Stack. Your goal is to get a high score and hold out against defeat. You must time your place when the building is above the tile, but you also have to make sure it is the same color as the tile. 

Controls: 
Space to place
Q W E R to switch the color of the building.

Good luck and thanks for playing my game

![Screenshot (74).png](///raw/a90/e/z/17a2f.png)

![Screenshot (78).png](///raw/a90/e/z/17a30.png)

![Screenshot (72).png](///raw/a90/e/z/17a31.png)

101768.name: You Should Be Executed
101768.body: Suddenly you wake up and you do not remember anything and you see yourself in the execution yard

101773.name: The King's Board
101773.body:
The King's Board is a game made in Unity. Your goal is to have more territory than your opponent, by promoting pawns, moving units and denying your enemy to expand. 
This version has no AI or Multiplayer feature to fight against. It also has no music, but some sound files.
The game is controlled by mouse.
![LD42_Scrrenshot1.png](///raw/c8d/81/z/16678.png)

![LD42_Scrrenshot2.png](///raw/c8d/81/z/16679.png)

101799.name: Very Original Puzzle Game
101799.body:
In a delirious stroke of desperation I cooked this turd up in the final 8-9 hours of the LD42 Jam. Move your crystal thing with Arrows or WASD and avoid walls, which you create by moving. Clever, amirite?

I mean, at the very least I never fully gave up.

101802.name: MapleOS : Backup Royale
101802.body:
MapleOS: Backup Royale is a gripping tale about human survival and the will to safeguard knowledge and tradition. Wait, no... it's actually just a game about saving as much shitfiles from your computer before a virus takes over.

To do so, you must carefully manage your files to make sure you use the limited space across your 10MB hard drive and your shitty floppy disks, without RUNNING OUT OF SPACE!!!!!!!!!! Take some time to browse through the files, after some time, a virus will start propagating in your PC and lead to the end of the game.

The game is really hard to finish as such, and you will most definitely fail. But you will sure get a good laugh from it browsing through the numerous files.

Disclaimer:
While all models and UI elements and most of the content in the files (including texts, sounds and videos) found in the game were created during the jam, several assets were taken from the internet and passed through filters and various effects. As it were part of the game's theme, we don't know if it makes it uneligible for the graphics category.

[Screenshot](///raw/91b/81/z/17aa8.png)
[Gameplay video](https://youtu.be/EdiZLgfN5Bk)

TEAM:

Samuel Bourassa /
Guillaume Duquesne /
Swann Klein /
Alexandre Pernot Lopes /
John Henry Rumsby

101804.name: Package Man
101804.body: You play as a package man loading a truck. Lets see how many boxes you can get into the truck in 30 seconds!![Truck.png](///raw/554/21/z/15b6c.png)

101805.name: Deadlock
101805.body:
![Deadlock.jpg](///raw/991/z/16982.jpg)

Deadlock is my entry for the 42nd LudumDare - a clever puzzle game in which you have to enable all red booleans to green. However you can move only if there is something on your axis - or X or Y. If after a movement, you are unable to move again - it's an impasse - you loose. You have a little bit more than one minute to do the work. First levels explain the main gameplay. Many other tiles which use different behavior have been included so as to increase game difficulty - some reduce considerably your space, chasing player. You have to play with their (more or less) predictable behavior. Have fun ++

Instructions to play :

Use arrows keys to move

R key to restart level

Escape to load menu

​PS : Technically I would like to explain how I did this aesthetic. I didn't use any texture - all has been created simply using scripts which display pixels considering char strings. Now I am working on those scripts because I want to share them with community. However you have to wait a few days because I coded them quickly and I want to share something relevant - optimized. It was an interesting alternative ++​

101824.name: Spacial Management
101824.body: Welcome to MoneyBags Inc! Here you will serve as our Spacial Manager. Now I hear you asking, "What is a Spacial Manager?" Well that's simple! WE LOVE MONEY and one way to make more money is to have less buildings! So we stuffed all our employees in this building and your job is to stuff all these employees in this tiny building! You can rotate the employee's body parts with A and D. You can switch which body part you control with W and S. Move the workers back and worth with the arrow keys.

101825.name: Gutted Goblin Trading Co
101825.body:
Gutted Goblin Trading Co is a Fantasy themed, warehouse management game.

In it, you play as a lone forklift driver, attempting to get as many deliveries out the door before the timer runs out. But watch out! Inventory stacks up in the warehouse faster than you can manage.

![crowded_room.png](///raw/f6b/21/z/173c6.png)

Head Programmer: Hudson Thorpe-Doubble (@DoctorMozart)

Art / Music: Dylan Powell (@BabyKing)

101836.name: TaskMaster 2000
101836.body:
[taskmaster.jpg](///raw/7fc/61/z/17590.jpg)

TaskMaster 2000 is the program you need to get your life together!

With the guidance of TaskMaster 2000's built-in assistant, Mugsy, help a budding freelancer organize her schedule for the month as she tries to balance work, family, friends, and her eccentric-yet-lovable boyfriend, Jerry. 

We hope you enjoy this humorous puzzle game, because we sure had fun making it for our third LudumDare!!

101837.name: The Space Virus
101837.body:
The Space Virus is a fun puzzle game that takes place in your computer. Your computer has somehow got a dangerous virus! The virus is downloading big files to make your computer run out of space. Delete as many files as you can before the virus gains complete control. Good luck player!

Tools used:

Unity: Personal Edition 2018.2.1
Bosca Ceoil
Bfxr
Piskel
Language: C#

![bild7.PNG](///raw/8cd/81/z/17cb3.png)
![bild2.PNG](///raw/8cd/81/z/17cb4.png)

101840.name: Space Junk Jettison
101840.body:
![SJJ - Screenshot 01.jpg](///raw/837/z/15c10.jpg)

Earth is running out of space in its orbit, preventing humankind from launching spacecraft. An advance spaceship called the 'Junk Jettison' has been purpose built to clean up the surrounding debris by teleporting it to Mars.

You're job is to pilot the Jettison, clear debris, buy upgrades and avoid asteroids as you clear the way for generations to come.

101860.name: Astro Run
101860.body:
Bit more chilled than most years, game is a bit buggy, and some features are not optimal, such as the overlapping of objects, but I had a good time making the game, and have big aspirations for a future version of this game.

101871.body:

Greedy Monopolist Simulator. Pretty little Tycoon about money, production and garbage, which won't let you keep calm. Build your comic-styled empire without single thought about ecology and morals - of course, till tons of garbage come knocking in your door.

101876.name: Catchey (VR Only)
101876.body:
![banner.png](///raw/f58/z/18037.png)
Note: This entry is VR only, it uses SteamVR and the new SteamVR input system so it should be compatible with any VR headset.

My entry for Ludum Dare 42! 

Made in 72 hours.

Catch some monkeys! Submit your score!

![Unity_2018-08-13_22-19-32.png](///raw/f58/z/1803a.png)

This is the first time I've tried working with the new SteamVR input system, if you have any issue with the inputs you should be able to easily re-map them in the settings in the SteamVR overlay.

![Unity_2018-08-13_18-49-08.png](///raw/f58/z/1803d.png)

101879.name: Progression || Degeneration
101879.body:
This game is heavily inspired by The Binding of Isaac. You walk around kill things and that's about it. 


I made this game for Ludum Dare 42. I didn't have any ideas I liked for the actual theme, so I just made my game based on the decay and evolve themes. 


Had to cut 50% of what I made due to bugs... so no final boss.


I had to learn how to do every little thing as I made the game, as I didn't have real prior experience. 

 ![TITLESCREEN.jpg](///raw/6fd/81/z/1662a.jpg)

101882.name: Brain's little symbiont
101882.body:
Help brain cope with :bomb::fire: __trauma__ :fire::bomb:.

This is a little experience, and my first attempt at using __Bitsy__. If you are very easily disturbed by the insides of human bodies, or microbes wandering around them, then it might not be for you.

I got some help from @picapica with ideas, layout, graphics and text.

If you leave a comment I will do my best to try and play back your game.

101890.name: Color Run
101890.body:
Small parkour game where you try your best to outrun the wall thats trying to reset you.
![Color Run Banner.png](///raw/dab/81/z/17c7c.png)

101921.name: Baia-Kun
101921.body: Help Baia-kun - a dauntless little-ish pufferfish - to find his way out of trouble. The more terrified you get, the less space you have!

101932.name: Danger Do Not Inhale
101932.body:
![Title.PNG](///raw/8e6/2/z/176ae.png)![Forest.PNG](///raw/8e6/2/z/176af.png)![Goal.PNG](///raw/8e6/2/z/176b1.png)
Hello to those of you reading the description. I hope to cover anything that isn't self explanatory in the game here, and also call out the bugs you might encounter.

Aim of the game:
- Find the pond and walk on one of the stars.

Known Bugs (2 so far):
- On slower machines, the player may end up becoming off-centre on tiles. Purely a visual glitch; not gamebreaking.
- The ending music has some random noise in it. This is because I used the free version of the audio software.

Hope everyone had fun. I'll try to keep editing this page as frequently occuring things come up. Yep.

101943.name: Dark Forest
101943.body:
![trees3.png](///raw/9d1/z/1583d.png)

101948.body:
It's Reigns, but in space, and with dogs.

More to follow

101949.name: Homos Save the World
101949.body:
The world population is growing rapidly, and our little lovely planet is running out of space! All this disaster is due to those heterosexual people who have strong sexual desire, as they have born a lot of children that make our world so crowded! 

Therefore, to solve this population crisis we need to control the birth rate, and we can achieve this goal by eliminating heterosexuals and preventing them from bearing more children, which is essentially what you would do in this game.

In this game, you are endowed with the power of changing people's genders, and your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to make people's genders as unified as possible. You can choose to make our planet either a gay planet or a lesbian one. Once you manage to make all people in the world have the same gender, everybody would be forced to be homosexual and no one would be able to bear more children to deteriorate the population issue any more. 

So LD developers, come to try my game and use your gender transformation ability to prevent our world from running out of space!

## Operation Instructions and Guide

* Press W and S Keys to move forward and backward.
* Press D and A Keys to move rightward and leftward.
* Move Mouse for Yaw and Pitch rotation, which help you aim at people. 
* Press Left Mouse Button to change the aimed person's gender.
* Press ESC Key to quit the game.

Winning Condition: All people on the planet get the same gender and they begin their happy homosexual lives ever after.
Losing Condition: The population reaches the maximum and the planet becomes out of space.

## Development Tools
* Unreal Engine 4.20
* Blender

## Credits
* Models: Kenny (https://www.kenney.nl/assets)
* Graphics: Kenny, PSDGraphics (http://psdgraphics.com)
* Music: Green Bear Music (https://greenbearmusic.bandcamp.com/)

its a simple game about connecting some dots in 3d space but the more dots you connect the less space will be left to connect more dots you will be scored based on your total distance traveled

101969.name: Pathcloser

A puzzle game in which you can't step on a tile more than once.

I hope you'll like it :)

101973.name: Space Depot
101973.body:
SPACE DEPOT - A game created for Ludum Dare 42 by Leon-C. Steinbach

Move your tiny rocket through all the trash in space and collect as many pieces of junk as you can.
Clean the space from all that junk, so that rockets can go through it without danger of colliding.
Can you collect 30 pieces of junk with the front of your rocket?

Have fun!

Controls/Gameplay:
- W, D for rotating
- SPACE for starting your engines
- Collect 30 pieces of junk with the front of your rocket
- Don't collide with other parts of your rocket

Known bugs:
- The collision detection isn't on point
- The automated zooming is not really smooth

Tools used:
- Visual Studio 2017
- C#, XNA
- Aseprite
- Inkscape
- Gimp 2.0
- FL Studio 12
- sfxr

![1.PNG](///raw/eef/7/z/1663e.png)

101979.name: Void Eater
101979.body:
You are a young hero whose mission is to defeat the enormous octopus boss before it destroys you!
 
Note: The game itself may be a little unbalanced and broken as we ran out of time to really tweak the performance (and add audio unfortunately), but nevertheless, we hope you enjoy it! 

Controls:
Move - WASD
Attack - Down Button
Dash - Space

101989.name: Starship Panic
101989.body:
![StarshipPanic.png](///raw/fdb/41/z/165dd.png)

# Starship Panic!

A simple game about surviving on a ship as it fills with junk!

#### Description:
Stay alive and avoid getting crushed as your starship fills with junk!
Break debris down and haul it to the airlock. Once the debris is in the airlock and the door is closed press the vent button to vent it into space.

101990.name: Your favourite game
101990.body:
The game about fighting with nonpossibility to play your favourite game... but don't worry, if you are skilled enough there is a way to get this work, check it out!

-gamedev-
* I wanted to give up many times because the idea wasn't so good in practice, but eventually I decided to finish it
* There is one playable game on this trashy computer
* I was planning two or more, but it was harder than I thought to finish the first and only
* It was hard as hell to balance this game (I was testing more than I was making)
* I didnt finished the help file under F1 key but luckily there is another on your desktop
* The original name was "My trashy machine"

 ! F4 - FULLSCREEN !

Have fun!

101997.name: Hyper Universe
101997.body:
this game was to be a strategy game whose goal was to maintain the health of the population, but the population increased too fast, and it would be their duty to manipulate the resources of the planet in order not only to maintain the health of the population, but also to divide it on other planets, however, so far it is only a generator and simulator of procedural universes

Code: Visual Studio 2015
Art: Gimp
Music: FamiTracker,Audacity

102004.name: Ralph the Rabbit Killer
102004.body:
You are a rabbit living on a tiny island. Other rabbits are multiplying so fast that your island starts falling into ocean. Use diffrent weapons and traps to kill as many rabbits as you can.


![screen1.png](///raw/e79/51/z/18206.png)

102012.name: Another Summer Run
102012.body:
**Summer is coming!**

The ice is melting and you, little polar bear, need to get off the ice quickly. Find the coast to survive until the ice freezes again.
Swimming would be fine for a normal polar bear, but you were never really good at that. So run!




- Controls:
 - WASD for movement


- Used Tools:
 - Unity 2018.2
 - Unity Water4
 - GIMP 2.8.22

102014.name: Dungeon Time
102014.body:
​Dungeon Time was made for Ludum Dare 42's Jam. The theme was "Running Out of Space." The basic premise I came up with was a dungeon that gets smaller and smaller as you clear your way down. I think the result was something really fun and interesting.

I'm just stoked that for the first time in several years I've actually finished an LD entry and it was basically exactly what I wanted. Enjoy!

***NOTE:*** I do plan to export an HTML5 version in the post jam. I just ran out of time. Right now it's Windows only.![XjWpmY.png](///raw/064/z/17b05.png)

102021.name: CLEANER
102021.body:
A quick game made for Ludum Dare 42: Running out of space.

You control CLEANER, a program that is here to clean your pc of garbage files and folders. Use your cursor to move around and LMB to shoot. Grab upgrades and challenge yourself to finish the final boss.

![CleanerScreenshot1.png](///raw/48e/81/z/15d85.png)

![LudumDare42Raymanni.png](///raw/48e/81/z/15d86.png)

102022.name: Cardback Dicing
102022.body:
![dice.gif](///raw/b07/21/z/1660b.gif)

A card and dice game ​where you explore a field of facedown cards but can't move back on yourself.

Pick up items and effects to collect more and more dice to fight enemies with.

When you run out of space to move the level's boss appears.

In combat both you and the enemy take turns attacking. When you're attacking you roll for attack while the enemy rolls for defense. A successful roll is a 4, 5 or 6 (though items make successes easier!). Successful blocks negate successful attacks and the damage is the difference.

If you have an attack or defense potion you can drink it to gain an extra 4 dice until the next round.

![love_2018-08-12_21-56-49.png](///raw/b07/21/z/1660e.png)
![love_2018-08-12_21-57-17.png](///raw/b07/21/z/16612.png)
![love_2018-08-12_21-57-23.png](///raw/b07/21/z/16614.png)

102023.name: Walls Closing In
102023.body:
A horror game. What's in the bunker? What happened to the last people that came here?

![screenshot1.png](///raw/a89/5/z/16d99.png)

I'm reasonably happy with this game, especially because this was the first time I went out and recorded my own sound effects.

102026.name: Major Tom, Can you hear me?
102026.body:
# About

I interpreted the theme as 'Running, out of space', where by the user is trying to escape a space station.

**The game is best played with 2 or more people, only keyboard and mouse is supported.**


# Tools

 * Unity3D [2018.2.2f1]

 * Krita

 * Audio Sampler: https://intro.novationmusic.com/

 * Space Skybox Generator: https://wwwtyro.github.io/space-3d/

# Gameplay

The game requires 2 or more players. One player is the astronaut ​on the space station, all other players play as ground control support members. The astronaut is faced with a randomly generated map containing puzzles between their start point and the escape pod they must reach. The support team have a top down view of the space station as well as documentation required to solve the puzzles. Players must work together to help the astronaut escape safely.​​

# Development Time lapse

102029.name: Polyhedra Stackerama

How to use: WASD/QE to move the camera and right-mouse to rotate it. Left-mouse drag on the handles (purple spheres) to move objects - they will snap to 'compatible' handles elsewhere in the scene. Everything spawns at 0,0,0 - so start by dragging the first few objects away and snapping to new ones as they spawn on (otherwise the object will just move back to its original location at the origin if not snapped to another object).

Gather resources together, combine to make new things, automate a bit if you're up for it, and scrape together enough credits to escape.

Controls:

* **Space**: activate, select in menus
* **Shift**: press and hold to grab+drag objects

3 Minutes to spare, nice.

Arrow keys to move, space to mine
Run out of AXE or collect 8 treasures, you'll die.
Try to find as rare of treasures as valuable. You have a limited number of treasures you can carry, so choose wisely. Pink > blue > red > green

102091.name: Stash
102091.body:
### LD42 Download: [itch.io](https://chris-coe.itch.io/stash)

# Synopsis​
Every adventurer knows the pain of having more loot than you can carry and not enough space in your Bag of Holding. You are one such adventurer.

You have one minute to fill your bag with as much as you can carry. However, you will quickly find your bag is *running out of space*. Thus, you must make room for the most valuable items you can get your hands on to maximize your total profits.

This was created for Ludum Dare Jam #42. The game logic was completed in one day. The rest of the time was devoted to adding those nice little touches that make the game a more memorable experience.

## **Please share your high score!**
How high can you get? The highest possible score is 6,500, but a score of 6,000 is *excellent* and fairly difficult.

# Tools Used
- Code: [GameMaker Studio 2](http://www.yoyogames.com/get)
- Graphics: [GIMP](https://www.gimp.org/) and GameMaker Studio 2
- Sound: [Bfxr](http://www.bfxr.net/)
- Music: [Jukedeck](http://jukedeck.com), a randomizer - create your own at http://jukedeck.com

# Screenshots
![item improvements.jpg](///raw/f81/9/z/17273.jpg)

102103.name: Growing Out
102103.body:
![IconScaled.png](///raw/485/z/16ef5.png)

Mr. Blob is a tiny blob trapped in a deep, dark dungeon. As Mr. Blob explores, he discovers magical gum which allows him to grow in size and grant him special powers. While the additional powers help Mr. Blob explore, the added size also makes it tough to fit into tight spots. If Mr. Blob keeps growing bigger and bigger, will he be able to get out of the dungeon before running out of space? Lets find out!



CONTROLS

Arrow Keys = Move

X = Jump

C = Shoot (Once Unlocked)


DOWNLOAD INSTRUCTIONS

Take the jar file out of the zip folder and double click it to run.

If the game won't start, make sure you have java installed: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jre8-downloads-2133155.html

102107.name: Sauber
102107.body:
![logo_boom.png](///raw/3d8/2/z/1710a.png)

The orbit of your planet is full of satellites. When a critical mass of satellites in orbit was hit, they're falling uncontrolled to the ground after there was no more space left for them up there. They threaten to destroy all the trees on the planet by setting them on fire. Without the trees there will be no oxygen and all humans will miserably suffocate.

Earth is lost but there’s hope. A brave hero stays behind while the rest of humankind is preparing the evacuation of the planet. He protects the trees, extinguishes fires and tries not to be smashed by falling satellites while the evacuation ships are being started. It depends on the skill of this hero how many can be saved before the planet runs out of trees and earth is lost forever. 
It’s a suicide mission to save humankind.

102109.name: Your PC run out of space
102109.body:
I despise running out of space on my SSD/Windows drive, so when I saw the theme I knew I will make a game about that. I wanted something action-paced and quick to play (I know you people have a lot of games to get through :)). And since this was my first time using SDL2, it had to be relatively simple game. This fruit ninja clone won't win the Innovation category but I hope it will make you smile.

![yourpcrunoutofspace_all.png](///raw/c71/z/15ffc.png)

**Controls:** Mouse

If you leave a constructive comment I will play your game and leave one as well <3

102132.body:

I spent a lot of the time experimenting and learning about Unity so the game isn't too long.

It was a solo jam and all graphics and code were created by myself during the jam.

Thanks for playing! :thumbsup:

102140.name: Your Friend Compo
102140.body:
You wanted to download something, but you are running out of space? No problem, your friend COMPO is here to help.

Play as COMPO, friendly computer. Judge the user and free the space by deleting files you thing he/she doesn't need. Beware! Deleting important files and download lag irritates user.

Instructions:

Look at user, he is a funny fellow right? Guess what are his tastes? You better guess right, cause without proper judgmental skills you are a goner.

Browse through the folders (1 click to highlight, 2 clicks to open. Only folders can be opened).

Highlight the folder/item to see what size it has (bottom left).

Delete it by pressing the trashbin. The amount will be added to free space.

Watch what you delete. If you delete somethig which i important to user it it will irritate him (rise his irritation level of course).

Look at the top. There is downlaod panel. Your user is downlaoding something and he needs a space. You can see downlaod progress bar and how much is still left.

As  it usueally happens, download has a time in which it should end. Buuuuut if there is not enough space on computer well duuh it lags. It also irritates user so watch out and try to be fast.

102141.name: Kessler Syndrome
102141.body:
![banner1.png](///raw/847/7/z/16240.png)
![028d84084c3525a5ceeaba6e28a5d248.gif](///raw/847/7/z/15669.gif)

Great work from everyone involved in LD42! Can't wait to play some of those games!

Kessler Syndrome is a fun little game about launching satellites and stations into orbit while trying to not collide with the ones already up there. The game is based off of a real life theory that eventually space will become to crowded for us to fully utilise it. In the game, the player must pace their shots and spread out their satellite trajectories to avoid collision. Too many collisions will get your funding cut and your career will end. The game can quickly become hectic and challenging so plan ahead to see your career through to the end. Assuming that it actually does end... Perhaps? 

I'm pretty proud of my programmer art as it turned out a lot better than expected. Hoping for this one to be my best Ludum Dare yet! Good luck to everyone!

Wasn't originally planning on entering the Compo but since the game was pretty much finished and the Quill stream chat said I should, I did! Thanks guys :)
![compoEncourangement.png](///raw/847/7/z/1652f.png)


Features:
- Various exciting planet types.
![512594ee7d1c257a8478b1c11a872e1c.gif](///raw/847/7/z/15b98.gif)

- Multiple challenging difficulty levels.
![difficulties.PNG](///raw/847/7/z/15b99.png)

- Half-decent art for a programmer.
![Station1.png](///raw/847/7/z/15b9c.png)

- Various References and Easter Eggs.
- An actual soundbite of me throwing up in a bin.
- Hyper-realistic Orbital Mechanics simulations (Okay perhaps not but I did need to consult real life astrophysics formulae to calculate the speed of satellites).

All art, programming and sound was made by me. 

Here's to my best Ludum Dare so far! Cheers!

"Kessler Syndrome (also called the Kessler effect, collisional cascading or ablation cascade), proposed by the NASA scientist Donald J. Kessler in 1978, is a scenario in which the density of objects in low earth orbit (LEO) is high enough that collisions between objects could cause a cascade where each collision generates space debris that increases the likelihood of further collisions. One implication is that the distribution of debris in orbit could render space activities and the use of satellites in specific orbital ranges infeasible for many generations." - Wikipedia

meta.link-02-name: A .rar containing all the .cs files used in the project

102148.name: Project Super Ultimate Democracy Simulator (LDJAM42)
102148.body:
Here is my entry for LD42! The concept of this game was to try to win an election by securing the most seats compared to your opponents. However, as your opponents try to do the same, you will realize that trying to expand is difficult, as there are only a limited number of seats to go around (maybe you can say you are "running out of space").

How to play:

  Use WASD or the arrow keys to move the camera and Q and Z to zoom in and out
  
  Each turn the player will perform an action in a city 

    -This will be done by clicking on the "Select City" button, which will bring up a set of actions

    -Each Action has a cost and a risk, the higher the risk, the lower the cost. 

    -These actions will earn or lose the player a certain number of seats per action.

    -The player can raise more funds if needed (useful in longer campaigns)

    -Please note that the 2 computer opponents will also be trying to earn seats (clearly there isn't enough space for all these parties)

    -After the required number of turns have passed, the player will be judged on two categories, whether they control the most number of districts, and whether they have earned the most seats (on aggregate).

Good Luck and Have Fun! 

The project files and latest builds have been included below via Google Drive


Known Issues:

  Sound does not play

  There have been issues with the shaders

  Menus can hang when trying to access the main menu(normally self-resolves)

  The code is horribly written (sorry to anyone looking at it...)

102186.name: Gut Feeding
102186.body:
![GutFeedingTitle.png](///raw/608/21/z/1731b.png)

Gut Feeding is about an eating competition where you must shovel as much food into your mouth as possible and digest them within the time limit.

## Objective

Digest and "process" as much food as you can.

## Game Flow

At first, the food will be too large to fit into the intestines, but the stomach acids gradually digest it so it can fit. You can hover your mouse over the food inside your body to greatly speed up the digestion. At any time, you can use the toilet flush handle to help hasten the food's passage through the intestines. You receive points when food exits the intestines.

Multitasking is a critical portion of this game. You'll need to balance your flinging and flushing!

Also, be careful not to drop food off the table or fling it past your eater; **you'll lose time whenever food goes out of bounds**.

## Controls

1. Click, hold the food to grab it.
2. While clicking you can drag grabbed food by moving the mouse, or fling it by releasing the click.
3. Hover your mouse over food inside your body to shrink it.
4. Click the toilet handle to flush.
5. Press P to pause the game

![GutFeedingMain.png](///raw/608/21/z/1731c.png)

Kodachi: Music, Programmer

MugenMagnus: Art, Programmer

Software used: Unity, Bosca Ceoil, Krita, Visual Studio, Bfxr

102201.name: Spaceabon
102201.body:
An Arcade Puzzle game for the Ludum Dare #42 (Running out of Space!)

Push and pull blocks, arrange them in groups of three of the same color to *reduce* them, but be careful; two of the same color *stick* together and can't be moved!

There are two modes; **Arcade** for those looking for either shorter time sessions, or a bigger challenge; **Puzzle** for those who like to take their time, or those who wish to practice.

You'll definitely run out of space; but you'll run out of it sooner in **Arcade** mode.

Made with [Löve](https://love2d.org/).


# How to play
You can push and pull blocks
![Spaceabon1.gif](///raw/51a/9/z/17dcb.gif)

The goal is to get three blocks of the same color together, since they are reduced to a single block.
![Spaceabon2.gif](///raw/51a/9/z/17dd0.gif)

But be careful; when two blocks of the same color are together, they stick and can no longer be moved. Don't lock yourself!
![Spaceabon3.gif](///raw/51a/9/z/17dd6.gif)

# Now with web version!!

Unfortunately, it's been hours just to get it to somewhat work, and it's still not up to par with the desktop version. I've only tested it in Chrome, you might need to clear your cache every once in a while, and the sounds are not quite right.

If you like the music or enjoy the gameplay, I encourage you to *download* a desktop version; it's a much better experience!

That being said, I know (I'm also guilty of this) that Web versions are much more convenient, so I've tried to make it feel as close to the desktop version as possible (I haven't been very successful at that though).

 
(Summary: The official, **compo version is the desktop one**; it's the one I did during the time of the compo, the Web version is a non-quite-up-to-par port for your convenience)

102203.name: Getting Over Gold Hoarding
102203.body:
De-clutter your dragon lair that's become overflowing with gold!!! Buy Chests from the shopkeeper. Use chests to collect gold. When the chest is full, deposit it in the middle of the room. 

Depositing Chests give you respect points so you can purchase more from the shop. Get some help from the village folks who will collect gold for you, but make sure they have a chest otherwise they'll be angry.

102256.name: LD48.Claustrophobia
102256.body:
![splash-640x512@1x.png](///raw/e6f/81/z/15ee2.png)

Welcome ! [Claustrophobia](https://deformhead.github.io/LD48.Claustrophobia/index.html) (Ludum Dare 42 Theme: Running out of space) is built in plain HTML5/JavaScript with a framework I am developping.

I'd like to :

- add sfx (with a "buzzz" increasing when the noisy shadow shrinks)

This was my first Game Jam, so I hope you'll like this game. Thank you for your support.

102260.name: The Arena
102260.body:
The Arena is a first person shooter where you have to survive longer than your opponent. To win you have to make your opponent fall of their platform and into the abyss. The only way to do this is to remove parts of the platform by shooting at it. Only a red bullet can destroy the ground, a bullet have to bounce once to become red. But be careful your opponent will shoot back.

You also have to keep moving, if you stand still the ground under you will be removed.
There is a forcefield between you and your opponent to keep you from jumping over, don’t worry your bullets will pass right thru.

Your gun can only have three active bullets at a time, so try not to be to trigger happy.

The game has three difficulties that affect how many opponents you will have to face.

As always with my Ludum Dare games there are a few bugs and didn't get time to do everything I wanted, but I had fun and learned a lot. Hope you have fun playing! 

**Controls:**

* WASD - Move

* Mouse - Aim

* Left Mouse - Shoot

* Jump - Space

* Esc - Pause

**Programs:**

* Unity 2018.2

* Visual Basic

* Paint.net

* Audiotool

* MagicaVoxel

* Audacity

https://youtu.be/mA4M5CLTQNQ

102263.name: Collapsing Space
102263.body: Collapsing Space mixes elements of infinite runners with a typing game. Type or Die!

102270.name: You Are God
102270.body:
![menu.png](///raw/135/1/z/16b55.png)

You are god trying to create more space for your followers to settle. Use godly powers to manipulate the world and create beautiful environments in which your followers want to live.

I'm really happy with how this turned out, but I didn't have time for many things, I have never gone this close to the deadline before (never had to use the submission hour to submit). 
Due to the time limit, I didn't have time to play test everything, so it might be really hard or really easy (well, there's no win condition, so...), you'll have to see. 

As always with my games, it would be very appreciated if you could post the highest score you can get (population in this case).

I hope you enjoy!

A longer, more elaborate Post Mortem will be posted later when I haven't been livestreaming for 17 hours straight.

102313.name: BadPhone
102313.body:
# You are now the proud owner of a BadPhone! 📱

![Gameplay.png](///raw/7b9/d/z/16bf1.png)

## Congratulations, you are now a proud owner of a BadPhone. Good luck! ✌️
Owning a BadPhone means serveral things, but most importantly: it has a severe issues with data storage, so it's up to the owner to handle these issues. Now, because YOU are the owner, this is your task: to manage the BadPhone.


### This game challenges you to be patient,
but also to be fully awake at all times to make sure that BoxDrop doesn't sync too many images, causing your phone to crash, and also making sure that the phone is fully optimized at all times.


### ❓What to do❓
When you have entered the play scene, start the BadPhone by pressing the "on" button, located on the side of the BadPhone, below the two volume buttons.

Once the phone is on, and the moment you unlock it fully, you are from there on fully responsible of making sure that the BadPhone doesn't run out of data storage.

You do this by two primary actions: deleting duplicate photos (keep one copy of all photos) and optimizing the BadPhone in the settings.

If you somehow make the phone crash, which is... likely, then you will be given a score based on how long you could keep it running.

- You control the hand with your mouse.

#### How was this made? 🛠️
- 3D Software: Blender
- Game engine: Unity
- Sound editor: Audacity
- Sounds recorded with my mouth

#### Recommendations 👨‍💻
Play the game in fullscreen, preferably a 16:9 monitor. 👍

102317.name: Hey, Hugo!
102317.body:
## A game by David Williamson

Tilt the world to move. Move to collect Fuzzies. Collect Fuzzies to get bigger. Get bigger to reach more places. Reach more places to get to the exit.

Explore the world by tilting it and inflating deflating your eyeball monster.

Music+sfx by https://twitter.com/ScowshMolosh  
Everything else by me

### Controls
**Mouse**  
LMB - Inflate  
RMB - Deflate  
Move mouse - Tilt world  
  
**Gamepad**  
Right Trigger - Inflate  
Left Trigger - Deflate  
Left Stick - Tilt world  
*If you are using a PS4 controller you can tilt it to tilt the world*  
  
**Keyboard**  
W - Inflate  
S - Deflate  
A,D - Tilt world

You're on a boat surrounded by army fleet. They are preparing to destroy the submarine.

The submarine is attacked with alien form of sickness. And soon it will spread everywhere. Search for oxygen to survive.

You have to send nuclear codes and SOS signal. It's your only chance to prevent submarine destruction while you onboard.

It was the first jam for us. Tried to go for something atmosheric and creepy. Made on LibGDX with java. All models, textures and music has been created by us. Hope you will like it.

102338.name: The Family Business

Join the family business and help your dad run "Out of Space", a store for alien artifacts and merchandise.

102339.name: Running out of Keys
102339.body:
The idea was *'Run out from Space while running out of space'*.


**How to play:** You are always starting from space. From there you can jump to all adjacent key (on an QWERTY-Layout that would be e.g. X, C, V, B, N or M.)


If you are using a recent version of Firefox or Chrome you don't have to change your keyboard-layout.
Source code is downloadable over the itch.io page.

102348.name: Personal Space
102348.body:
Your friend left you alone at a party full of strangers. Your way out is blocked. Find a way out while avoiding an anxiety attack!

XBOX controller was used primarily during development, mouse and keyboard tested as well. If you press ESC during gameplay you will get an options menu with x/y sensitivity settings.

No optimization has been done, run on highest settings at your own risk!

I had a blast streaming the development of this one on twitch.tv/ursagames

102357.name: Sea of Bells
102357.body:
# Enter the Sea of Bells
### Once a year they send one sailor to search for the mighty old bells
## And this time it was you!
![giphy5.gif](///raw/806/c/z/15f16.gif)
### But the sea is so dangerous, full of monsters and darkness!
Fear not! One simple perma-death wont ruin your day!
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 ![giphy3.gif](///raw/806/c/z/15f1c.gif)

### Find the bells, hit them and summon the SPACEWITCH to help you out
## No one really knows what kind of a creature this SPACEWITCH is and why she is still here...

![giphy4.gif](///raw/806/c/z/15f19.gif)

### How many days can you survive?
 

# CONTROLS:

## Move with WASD- or Arrow-keys, shoot with left mouse-button!

# GAMEPLAY:


![giphy10.gif](///raw/806/c/z/15f26.gif)

## While playing as the 2d-ship, try to dodge enemies and shoot every flying bell you can find!
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![giphy.gif](///raw/806/c/z/15f1d.gif)

## While playing as the 3d-ship, first try to go as far as you can until you find the mighty old bell, hit it and then come back!
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
![giphy.gif](///raw/806/c/z/15f62.gif)

## While playing as the SPACEWITCH, try to dodge as many SPACES as you can before the darkness reaches you!
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
### How many days can you survive... 
## ...before you run out of space...
# ...in the ** SEA OF BELLS **?

102366.name: City Farm
102366.body:
City Farm is a game about managing a small farm in the middle of an expanding city. To make it through each day you must manage your money efficiently by planting crops and selling pieces of land.
![Capture.PNG](///raw/1f5/d/z/17378.png)

![Capture2.PNG](///raw/1f5/d/z/17379.png)

![Capture4.PNG](///raw/1f5/d/z/1737b.png)

Was originally supposed to be for the compo but I only had a couple minutes to upload and the site wasn't working for me so I decided to just upload it to the jam instead. All code art and sound made in 48 hours.

102369.name: Burger Or Poop

102371.name: Reductor (LD42 Comp Entry)
102371.body:
My comp entry for LD42. The theme was 'Running out of space'.

Download link for game and source code is right at the bottom, under the screenshots (hosted on itch.io).

It's a wave-based shooter where the arena gets smaller and smaller with each progressive wave. Controls are as follows:
Move: WASD
Shoot: Left mouse button

You can collect health and power-ups as you progress. If your health reaches zero, or you fall off the arena, it's game over. Killing enemies will increase your score and progressing to later waves will increase your score multiplier.

![GIF.gif](///raw/fcd/f/z/16f64.gif)

![1 Screenshot.png](///raw/fcd/f/z/16f4c.png)

![4 Screenshots.png](///raw/fcd/f/z/16f4f.png)

102375.name: The Post Office
102375.body: You are working in a Post Office, and you need to stack the parcels without dropping them. How far can you get before you run out of room.

102377.name: Dr.Zallynzky
102377.body:
"Hello there, I'm Dr.Zallynzky -

I had some problems in my last experiments with the element Z, and now my house is rapidly shrinking (or I'm expanding along with everything alive in it, but it does not matter for now).
I need your help to find more element Z to put everything back in order, even if I have to shrink myself to a molecular level to find it"

Dr.Zallynzky is a puzzle-like platformer where you have a limited amount of time to gather elements before your house shrinks itself into a blackhole. During the game, elements of the map will become smaller, and you'll have to plan your way to make sure you won't get stuck somewhere, making it a fun action packed puzzle adventure.

![Dr.Zallynzky01.png](///raw/fe1/4/z/17fa8.png)

![Dr.Zallynzky02.png](///raw/fe1/4/z/17fa9.png)

![Dr.Zallynzky03.png](///raw/fe1/4/z/17faa.png)

102379.name: SpaceRunner
102379.body:
# Welcome to SpaceRunner
![spacerunnerCover.PNG](///raw/aef/81/z/16cc8.png)

### Intro to the game
You have been sent on a mission to gather resources in space. With the aim to get back to earth as quickly as possible your are literally trying to run out of space and reach your rocket. You can however only travel small distances from planet to planet until eventually you will be able to reach the earth.
Movement up in space is different than on earth so you were smart enough to bring a jetpack! Be carefull though: Manage your fuel charges and use the jetpack with care. There are obstacles that you else you not overcome.
Aim for as many resources as you can get, those make up your primary score.

### Controls
With the theme in mind I went for a "space" focussed control system. All you need to play the game is the spacebar!
* Hit `[SPACE]` to jump and
* Hit `[SPACE]` to use jetpack while in air


## Play SpaceRunner

Right now you can play the game only in Browser. I'll try adding a windows download.



--------------
*Edit:*

added Windows Zip Download.

*Edit 1*

unfortunately found a bug that wont let you finish the game. I'll reupload soon!

*Edit 2*

bug fixed. windows download should be updating shortly. Web is updated.

*Edit 3*

updated links to itch.io page

102385.name: Deep Heat
102385.body:
![imgmgk-output 7.gif](///raw/d8d/8/z/16fe3.gif)
![imgmgk-output 2.gif](///raw/d8d/8/z/16f71.gif)

** Ten. Nope... FIVE floors of mayhem!** 

"Running out of Space" -- the fire obstructs the play area while the arena gets smaller and smaller. 

* Move: WASD
* Fire FLAMES: Left click
* Fire CO2: Right click (or left shift + left click)

Upgrades? Upgrades! Get the upgrades. Make sure to get the HOT FEET. 
  
_Tip: You can get fire back by putting out with CO2._

**Not feeling great about this one...**
I kept changing my mind on how to make the progression work... Unlimited fire/co2? Discard the fire on enemy hit? Spawn fire under the player's feet (instead of using a flamethrower)? Limit ammo based on what's in the arena? How to recoup? etc. Spent too much time to-ing and fro-ing and this is the result. I'm proud of the protagonist's run cycle, and generally the look/feel/polish at least. Hope you like.


**Post Compo Submission changes:**
- Fixed the screen shake.
- Character intro lines.

**Please follow my game development on these here:**  
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/forcehabit)  
[Facebook](http://facebook.com/forcehabit)  
[Website](http://forceofhab.it/)  

** Play on Game Jolt, link below! **

102391.name: JumpingForAlive
102391.body:
JumpingForAlive is a platform game where you have to go from level to level. There are 3 levels in the game. You are a little pink character and you have to survive! You will have to look for the key in the level, which will go to the next level, once the key is obtained, all you have to do is find an "end" flag. 
Oh yes, it's a raging game, as soon as you die, you start again at the beginning. The real question is, can you do it without raging?

![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/3ff/81/z/1794c.png)

Controls: q, turn left
          d, turn right
          space, jump

![Screenshot_3.png](///raw/3ff/81/z/17911.png)


this game was made with the following software:
Code: Eclipse Oxigen (coding in java no librairy)
graphics: paint.net & photoshop
audio: Audacity

102401.name: Space Invaded
102401.body:
# Intro:

What do you do when a Dwarf planet decides he deserves more space in the solar system? 

Join our hero as he journeys into the unknown, uncertain what awaits... will he arrive, or will we just run out of time and never finish the final levels?! There's only one way to find out.

# Controls:
A - Green Cannon Left
D - Green Cannon Right
W - Green Cannon Fire
Left Arrow - Orange Cannon Left
Right Arrow - Orange Cannon Right
Up Arrow - Orange Cannon Fire

102431.name: Literally Running Out Of Space!
102431.body:
Everyone knows there is just one way to reach the end of the space: By literally running out of it.

You went through many tests at the NASA to be the choosen one who can test the Rungine Rocket 2000 to reach the end of the space. On your journey you will encounter many obstacles, like meteorites, dangerous satellite lasers and even UFO's. The Rungine Rocket 2000 is way to fast to be damaged directly, but every hit causes the space around you to shatter.Touching these void holes will cause you to die instantly, so be careful.

Your goal is simple: Run out of space, while trying to not run out of space 
Use the WASD or Arrow keys to move and Space to shoot

This was our first participation in a Ludum Dare Jam and it all worked quite well for the beginning. We had way more content planned like a bossfight at the end or some fancy background objects, but we really ran out of time (and space :>). Anyways, we hope you have fun with our little game and maybe see you soon at another Jam. o/

Credits: 
We took all used sounds from https://freesound.org/ and all music from Newgrounds

Used music:
- Attack - https://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/82073
- Space Jungle - https://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/82073
- Void - https://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/606202
- Space - https://www.newgrounds.com/audio/listen/707567
