103541.name: The cutest garden
103541.body:
First Ludum Dare for me. At this occasion I learned from Monogame (even there is a lot of things that I don't understand for the moment).

![flower.png](///raw/975/71/z/16621.png)

I used these tools :
- Inkscape for characters/background
- Audacity and Bosca Ceoil for sounds
- Monogame
- A lot of documentations ! :)

Context of the game : 
You're a gardener of the cutest magic garden. Flowers are very big, but weeds too...
The owner is left for one week and want keep his garden with just flowers.
But when the owner left, a gang of weeds come and want conquer the garden and flowers !
You're here to snatch these weeds.

One day equals 60 seconds, if at the end of the day it stay weeds, you running out of space.

103557.name: Party Simulator
103557.body:
#### One day you attend a wine party. Everybody wants to move closer and chat with you, and this is what you should do: finish chatting with them as soon as possible, and don't let them crush into your personal space! If your personal space as well as the whole space is running out, the game is over.

This is my first time to compete in LD. Also, I am not a native speaker of English. The game is rough, but still used up all my effort.
Further development: 1. Audio  2. Storyline
![FF53FFD8-E4CD-4AFD-9DD5-27868D449CC4.png](///raw/484/91/z/16909.png)

103576.name: Swords & Forks
103576.body:
The board ain't big enough for the both of us.
Construct buildings. Feed your peasants. Recruit knights, and wipe out the opponent.

I ran out of time and was unable to implement the tower, castle and the knight.
Overall, with a bit more work this could turn into a brutal micro-RTS.

Instructions
-----
To speed up use 1,2,3,4 keys.
Click on a building on the right and then pick a tile to place it on.
Houses automatically create 1 peasant.
Windmills plant wheat around itself.
Lumberyards plant trees around itself.
Peasants wonder around and pick up goods.
Click on a building to upgrade it. It will perform better, and faster.
Towers and castles don't do anything.
There is no way to win.

![ss (2018-08-12 at 10.09.31).png](///raw/f30/2/z/17ae2.png)

103579.name: CRUSHED - Rage Inducing Platformer
103579.body:
[I WARN YOU, THIS GAME IS NOT FOR THE FAINT OF HEART... THIS GAME GET'S HARD]


[A note on performance : Make sure you choose an appropriate quality setting before launching the game as it will have a major effect on how the game preforms]

During this game you will get to play as Bob a depressed character who is running out of space in his head, filled up with clutter of his past and fears. He strives to reach the end where he can finally reach his freedom from himself... This was the inspiration of the game, so I wanted it to make it a very dark theme so I hope everyone who plays it, will enjoy themselves.

We hope you can look past these missing points and see what this game could truly become with some time put into it, we hope to : 
- Add a lot more levels and obstacles
- Fix any remaining bugs
- Improve the player movement 

![Capture4.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/15e2e.png)

How to play?

- Use W to jump, A and D to move horizontally and S to shrink to half your size
- The mouse is very important in this game as it allows you to interact with the environment which is key to playing this game (it represents him clearing way in his mind and allowing him to pass through his negative thoughts)
- Most obstacles has be clicked and held on to suspend their motion which can be very helpful
- You can use the mouse to drag platforms around, but be careful there are hidden platforms and if you aren't smart enough to find them, it might just cost you, you're life.

P.S There is no checkpoints on purpose.

![Capture3.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/15e2f.png)



* IF you are willing to learn how to make games like this check out my YouTube Channel at * [https://www.youtube.com/user/batchprogrammer108]                     



Developers :

Ajay Venkat 
   - 15 years old, Lead Developer, Scene Management, 3D Art -> Twitter and Website : ]
      - YouTube : [https://www.youtube.com/user/batchprogrammer108]
      - >Advanced and Beginner Unity Tutorials!!
      - Twitter : @CodeWithAjay 
      - Website : [www.codewithajay.com]


I developed this game in ( < 20 hours) w/ :
 - Unity
 - Blender
 - FL Studio
 - Paint.Net + Photoshop
 - Visual Studio

![Capture2.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/15e30.png)
_____________________________________________
Please Remember : 

    Please leave feedback on what I can improve with the game
    Please inform us if you spot any bugs
    Leave a link to your game and we will check it out
:)
    
______________________________________________
Expected Improvements : 
- Larger Space to Play In
- Larger Item list for the Cards
- More enemy types and weapon types
- More detailed modelling
- More levels and more objective oriented
- Use guides etc...

![Capture.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/15e32.png)


All of these features were restricted due to time constraints :(

Creating this game was so much fun and I would be very grateful if you checked it out :) Have a nice day. If you rate my game I will be sure to leave a rating back, just leave a comment saying you did ;)

![LAST.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/176f2.png)

103609.name: Colony Collapse
103609.body:
A catastrophic failure of the AI system has led to the shutdown of the robot workforce. Just before they went offline they managed to destroy the communication system. Your only hope for your station is to last the thirty days until the next inspection.

Be careful though, because every so often new people will arrive, not realizing that the station is malfunctioning. Don't let the trash build up too much, and make sure your people are kept healthy and you might just keep your job.

W,A,S,D - moves the camera around

103618.name: The TV Install Man
103618.body:
You are a TV install man.  It isn't a glorious job, but someone's gotta do it.  And those pesky customers!  They never know quite how they want those wires set up.  Some want MORE exposed, and others like NONE exposed!  None of em can agree... It's a sad day for all man kind.  It is your duty to satisfy these customers, or else you might get fired!

Controls:
* Click and drag on an OUTPUT port to an INPUT.  The Output port looks kind of like an HDMI port (sorry for the terrible art).
* While dragging, the furniture will go transparent so you can see what you are doing :)  If only that was a thing in real life.
* You can hide the furniture without dragging by holding the "Tab" key.

Objectives:
On the right is a list of objectives for you to beat the level.
* Exposed wires counts the total number of wires, and those that are visible.  Some levels may require you to have the percentage of wires exposed be less than the percentage listed, while others require you to have more.
* You must connect up all of the output and input ports, which is shown on the right.  The devices will turn on when they are connected.
* The speech bubble on the bottom right gives contextual hints, so be sure and pay attention to that if you get lost!
* Generally speaking, each puzzle will have one (or a very small few) solutions, requiring all of the space supplied, thus "Running out of Space" (yeah, it's a little loose).

And if the sound gets annoying, there are volume sliders.

Have fun!

103655.name: CheatDay
103655.body:
![CutScenePngBreit.png](///raw/6e4/91/z/18245.png)

# Description

Now and then even BodyBuilders do CheatDays and eat everything they find. And even
if he is trained as hell he sees himself very differendt and has a guilty
conscience about eating all this. Help the poor guy to eat as much as he can while
avoiding your conscience. But be aware of the filling of your stomach, and gut.

![inGameMitMagenpng.png](///raw/6e4/91/z/1824b.png)

Oh and don't step into your own poop of course ;-D
![TrailOfPoopPng.png](///raw/6e4/91/z/18286.png)

This is our first Ludum Dare and in the begining our project was a litle
different. We first wanted the BodyBuilder to grow bigger and bigger but then the
time wasn’t on our side :-P 

So we decided to do the game as it is yet.

We hope you enjoy!

# Controlls

## Platformer 

Walk with Arrow Keys ore A and D

Jump with SpaceBar

Open your stomach to make more room for food with Q

## Stomach

Move With WASD or Arrow Keys

Attack arround you with SpaceBar

# Software used

Unity3d

Gimp

Audacity

# Explanations

We like a bit of gluttony here and there but the problem is there isn’t enogh
Space in your stomach and gut. Your are runnig out of space for food and also for
your poop in our game.

103657.name: Slime Exterminators : running out of space to walk
103657.body:
In slime exterminator you play as a  (you guessed it) a slime exterminator. You take to the streets to exterminate pesky slimes. However, when they die they pop into deadly goo that takes up the space around you.

*GAME RULES*  (There is a little area to see all of this but I'll put it here too)
Use WASD to move
* use your mouse location to look
* use the left mouse to shoot at slimes (you can hold it down)
* Slimes will pop if they get to close
* Don't step in the goo

*POWERUPS*
* RED LASER TOKEN: Turns your gun into a very powerful laser that penetrates targets for a while.
* PURPLE CLEANER TOKEN: Destroys all goo in a VERY BIG (almost everywhere) range.
* ORANGE REVIVE TOKEN:  Gives you an extra life (shown in the top left), when you stem in goo it will take a life, but instead of being killed it will clear some goo around you BUT NOT ENEMIES.

![Screenshot01.png](///raw/d78/7/z/179bd.png)

103668.name: Key Thieves
103668.body:
"The keys to your farm have been stolen. You will need to track down the thieves if you ever want to enter your house again."

This is a small adventure game where the hero needs to find and reclaim the keys to win the game. However, without any pockets, he can only carry two items at a time, one in each hand. Gather food and upgrade him to complete your quest.

You can control the hero with the following keys:

Out of combat:
- WASD                -> Movement
- Space               -> Jump
- Left mouse          -> Grab items
- Right mouse         -> Target enemy and swtich to combat mode. You need to hold down the right mouse button.
- Middle mouse button -> Show the way home. Hold down like the right mouse button.


In Combat:
- W          -> Advance towards opponent.
- AD         -> Circle opponent.
- Left Click -> Attack


Note: All keys can be rebound in the startup screen. Gamepad will also work, but wasn't tested a lot.

The enemy doesn't attack due to various reasons. Also, enemies that will drop items will have the item equiped on their back. Apples are used to upgrade your abilities and keys are needed to win. There is a start of a tutorial in the game, but not all controls are explained. 

Tips:
- Items will have a purple glow so you can find them when they drop in the grass and enemies are finite. There are more than enough apples to fully upgrade if you want. 

- The skeletons carrying the keys are spawned from the start of the game and are visible at large distances. Normal skeletons spawn when you get close to their start and will remain in the area.

- When you enter combat you will drop the two items you hold in your hands, but not the items you carry on your body. Upgrading your carry capacity will really speed up the game as you can do this up to four time, for six items max.

Good luck.

PS:
Note sure why the source link is not showing up.
Link: https://bitbucket.org/thijstak/ludumdare42

103721.name: The Crunch
103721.body:
In the year 1856 A.C. (After Core) apocalypse is imminent as the long feared big crunch is starting, luckily, in the year 0, humanity was able to extract the energy in a black hole to build The Core: A giant construction that is able to expand the universe by shooting out a massive wave of energy, the only problem is that, now that it's needed, it's also out of fuel (how convenient) your goal is to bring aboard the remaining life in the universe to gather enough oil to power The Core.
Good Luck.

![LD42 Thumbnail.png](///raw/9b0/21/z/171c4.png)

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
**Mechanics:**

**_Controls:_**
Left and right key to turn; Space bar to release from orbit, allowing you to fling yourself to another planet;

**_Fuel:_**
You can release collected crew members on green planets to gather oil, when the oil is collected, it goes directly to your fuel tank. **PAY ATTENTION TO YOUR FUEL**, turning uses a lot of it and when you're out, you can only hope that you enter an orbit.

**_Crew:_**
You can add lifeforms that are found on planets to your crew. Click the plus symbol in the top right corner to add lifeforms to your spaceship and the minus symbol to release them onto a planet to gather that precious oil.

**_The Core:_**
In the middle of the universe there is the core, when orbiting around it, you have the option to deposit fuel, when you have deposited a certain amount of fuel, the core will activate and re-expand the universe (this means you win). The core has a self-defense mechanism that destroys anything but authorised spaceships (against meteors and stuff) this means that any planet that touches it gets destroyed.

**_The Crunch:_**
While flying around, the universe is shrinking around you, anything that goes beyond it get's destroyed.
Your goal is to stop this from happening.
(touching it means instant death)

**_Planets:_**
There are random planets scatterd around the universe, these planets can contain lifeforms to help you gather the oil on green planets. Planet's will get absolutely annihaliated when they come in contact with the border or the core
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
![Start Screen (1).png](///raw/9b0/21/z/1782c.png)
__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
**Team:**
- Rik **ProAFKBoy** Fabri (Programmer/Music)
- Max **MutsKun** Mouling (Artist/Thinker of Ideas/Motivator of the Programmer/Writer of the Description/Tired)

**Special Thanks:**

- Youtube Autoplay (Music While Working for Distraction)

**Tools Used:**
- Programming: C++ & Allegro
- Art: Piskel ( https://www.piskelapp.com/ )

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Have Fun!
Good Luck.

103770.name: Running out of space
103770.body:
# Ludum Dare 42 "Running out of space"

I finished _something_ which means I've completed my goal.

The game is not great.  
The code is not great.

But, I did learn about a lot of things while making this :).

## Details

Developed in Unity 2018.2.1f1 Personal  
Sound effects by SFXR  
Background music from https://freesound.org  
Background image from royalty free image search on Google

## Gameplay

Asteroids fall from the top of the screen. Shoot your way through, but don't get hit by the falling debris.

Move - Left / Right  
Shoot - Space - You start with one "barrel" and it goes up to 5 as your score increases  
Grav Bomb - Left Control - You start with 2, and get a new one every 2000 points  
Extra Lives - You start with 1, and get a new one every 5000 points  
Health - Your ship has health, you take damage by hitting asteroids. The harder you hit, the more damage.  
Score - You get points by destroying asteroids. You don't get points for using the Grav Bomb though.  
Asteroids - You can't destroy the small ones, you just have to avoid them.

If you get sick of the short music loop you can turn toggle it with "M".

103786.name: Ludum Dare to be Messy!
103786.body:
![final_screen_01.png](///raw/c06/z/16b87.png)![final_screen_02.png](///raw/c06/z/16af0.png)![final_screen_03.png](///raw/c06/z/16af3.png)![final_screen_04.png](///raw/c06/z/16af6.png)



**Ludum Dare to be Messy!**

I went pretty meta with this entry.  In this game your roommate is participating in the Ludum Dare competition.  That's great and all, but the problem is that he's a huge slob!  He just throws his garbage on the ground.  Your sanity can't take the mess, so you must clean up after him!  How many items can you throw away before the mess drives you insane?



**Controls:**

WASD + mouse for movement.  Left click to pick up an item, left click over the proper bin to deposit the item in said bin.
  
Get as many items as you can in the bins.  What's your best score?  I got 45!



**Tools Used:**

Visual Studio, Notepad++, Blender, Photoshop, Audacity, Hiero Bitmap Font Tool, FL Studio.

This was created using my [custom C++ game library](https://github.com/jharler/ZeroTolerance).  All bugs are totally my fault.



**Feedback**

I hope you have fun and if you could, please leave me some feedback, even if it's just "hey, this sucks" or "hey, that was fun."


**Known Bugs**

I watched a let's play of this video and the textures weren't working.  If this happens to you, please copy the contents of log.txt and paste it into [https://pastebin.com/](https://pastebin.com/) and link in the comments below.  I would also appreciate it if you could hold off rating until you've played the fixed version once I've fixed it (game breaking bugs like this can be fixed per the rules).  I'm not able to replicate this problem, so I need assistance in fixing it.  The joys of creating your own engine. :)

103797.name: Closing Arena
103797.body:
YOU CAN ONLY PLAY THIS GAME WITH AN CONTROLLER


Before you read the explanations for the game stopp and download the game on itch.io. https://eric-neu.itch.io/closing-arena-ld-42

This is my first time participating in Ludum Dare and i rarely finished.
There was much more planned.

But now to the game.

You´re playing the black rectangle.
You can walk with the left joystick, you can jump with a and you can hit enemys with x, if you near enough to them.

The green rectangles are the enemys.

You loose if they hit you.
You win if no enemy is left.

If you hit an enemy the will get yellow.
You don´t loose if you get hit from the yellow enemy.



Now we´re coming to the LD theme.
Because there is this orange outside on the edge which will get closer to the main center every 10 second. If you touch the orange you loose. If an enemy touches the orange it dies. 

You also loose the game, if there still are enemys left after the orange would get closer the fourth time!


With y you can restart the easy level.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

103836.name: You Schmooze — You Lose
103836.body:
![schmooze.png](///raw/193/d/z/17e0c.png)
"A late night experiment gone wrong leads to the mad scientists home becoming the spawning ground of a new species of gelatinous ooze known to mankind only as... the Schmooze."

This is a two-player hot-seat game in which one player controls the Schmooze using the mouse and the other player controls the mad scientists using the keyboard. The schmooze player must place as much schmooze in the game area as possible while the mad scientist player must use the mop to mop up schmooze (destroying it), the axe to cut down walls to create shortcuts and gather material and the hammer to build walls (using the gathered materials) to contain the schmooze.

Schmooze controls:
LMB - Place schmooze spawner
LMB on existing spawner - Upgrade to blocking schmooze

Mad scientist controls:
WASD/Arrows - Move around
X - Pick up item or drop carried item
Y - Use carried item!

- Try to crack the last score
- Non
- Stop
- Forklift
- Action

## Controls
Earn points by stacking the boxes on the shelves and collecting power-ups.

- Steering: 		WASD
- Unload:		Press Q to unload your current box
- Fork: 			Hold Shift and use W and S to lift and lower the fork
- Nitro: 			After you collected the Power Up, you can use nitro by pressing N
- Jetpack:		After you collected the Power Up, you can use the jetpack by pressing the space bar
- Reset:			Reset the forklift by pressing R

103953.name: Foggy raft
103953.body:
![QQ20180813-005747@2x.png](///raw/016/91/z/172a1.png)
The sun is rising. 
Waken up from a deep sleep, you found yourself on a lonely, deserted island.
The  ocean around you is covered with mists, and though it was calm, you feel something unspeakable that seems to lurk in the mist.
Game goal: Gather 3 treasure boxes and defeat the monster in the heavy fog, before all the treasure boxes are assembled, please avoid the monster as far as possible.
![锤子.png](///raw/016/91/z/17a48.png)
Building your own raft
You have 80 pieces of wood at beginning, you can use them on the island optionally to extend your raft or to make tools.
![船舵.png](///raw/016/91/z/17a47.png)
Navigation
To sail alone on the foggy sea, enter navigation mode through the bottom left button. Moving on the chart by burning your deck, the more decks consumed, the farther you sailed.
![宝箱3.png](///raw/016/91/z/17a49.png)
Searching for the treasure
There’re all kinds of treasure in the sea, and your compass will point to the nearest treasure — if it still works.
![海岛.png](///raw/016/91/z/17a4b.png)
Islands
You can get wood on the islands.
![沉船.png](///raw/016/91/z/17a4c.png)
Sunken ships
You can find tools or wood on the sunken ship.
The explored islands will continue to provide light sources.
![qkz.png](///raw/016/91/z/17a4d.png)
To escape
It’s impossible to defeat the monster with the power of a mortal. If you are caught before assembled all the treasure boxes, run away as quickly as you can! Use ↑↓←→ to move, space to cut down the deck. To throw the wood into the smelter will make you run faster. If you are caught by the monster, you’ll die. After successfully escaping from the battle, you’ll get a quick sailing chance.
![大炮2攻击.png](///raw/016/91/z/17a4f.png)
Decisive battle
After assembled all the 3 treasure boxed, the monster will start to evade you. Chase it and win! 
How to build and navigate
![GIF1.gif](///raw/016/91/z/17e55.gif)
How to run away
![GIF2.gif](///raw/016/91/z/17e68.gif)
How to fire
![GIF3.gif](///raw/016/91/z/17e6c.gif)

103959.name: Dessert War
103959.body: It's time to answer the age old question. Which is the best desert, Cupcakes or Cookies? There is only so much space in this world. Can you claim that space for your favourite dessert?

103965.name: Toy Crusher
103965.body: Your a toy, and the kids are nasty. Avoid as much as possible the blocs they send to you !

103966.name: Dat Der Sidescrulluh Game
103966.body:
![GameImage1.jpg](///raw/5d9/21/z/1696b.jpg)
# Controls
- **W/Space** = Jump
- **A** = Move Left
- **D** = Move Right
- **E** = Unleash the space vaporizer.
- **Mouse** = Aim and shoot


# Story
An AT-ST head crash landed in yer backyard and, you know what? That'll look good on my tank tracks. Wait - what?! I can't do that?! Try and stop me!

The tank you made is too overpowered! The soldiers can't stop you. They'll keep sending in guys to stop your fun until you *run out of space*. Use the space vaporizer to give your self more space! Try and rack up the highest score and post it in the comments!


# Side Note
This was my first Compo and second LD challenge. I learned a lot - most importantly was probably *time management*. Because of that, I had to sprint the sprites and could not do audio; especially with life getting in the way. The sprites are images I pixelated from various images and concoctions - I was unaware I could not do that until the very end and because of that, I will opt out of graphics for voting. 


> Please post constructive criticism in the comments! What would you do to make the game better? I'm always excited to learn

103969.name: Snake the platformer
103969.body:
The title explains it all.

In the game, you collect coins while avoid colliding with your tail.

103989.body:
# Welcome to Overclocked

## Description
You are a CPU and have to manage incoming blocks of data and store them in the hard drive. Transfer data quickly to prevent overheating. Features retro graphics, original kick-ass music and a broad collection of upgrades.

104008.name: Hunt the Quantpus
104008.body:
A text-based dungeon crawler, based on the classic game 'Hunt the Wumpus'. You explore a multiverse that is being collapsed by the 'Quantpus'. You need to jump from universe to universe to find the Quantpus and stop the carnage. But as the universes around you keep dying, you need to avoid the annihilation.

The heart of this game runs on a quantum computer: specifically on one of IBM's publicly accessible prototype devices. If you believe in the Many Worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics, this means we create a real quantum multiverse for you to explore.

More details on the process and tools used can be found [here](https://medium.com/@decodoku/game-jamming-on-a-quantum-computer-36a13723a454).

104013.name: Lost in deep space
104013.body:
My personal interpretation of the theme was "running" in a "out of space" environnement. So a kind of galactic runner :D.

Game principle :

* Help the astronaut to repair his mess by collecting **a wrench, a screw and a nut** on 3 hostile planets.

* Watch out astronaut oxygen level and jet pack fuel level.

Details about controls available on the itch.io page.

Details about tools used for this game available in the source README file.

![lds-level3b.png](///raw/3b5/d/z/163ad.png)
![lds-intro.png](///raw/3b5/d/z/163b7.png)
![lds-level2.png](///raw/3b5/d/z/163a8.png)
![lds-level1.png](///raw/3b5/d/z/163a2.png)

104035.name: Don't Drown
104035.body:
Don't Drown is a survival game that takes place in a box that is filling up with water. Will you be submerged or will you escape? Even though you don't know how you got there, it's pretty clear that someone is trying to mess with you.

Please let me know if you have any suggestions for improvements!

Gif:

https://imgur.com/gallery/22Qq9wi

Video:
https://youtu.be/3-vdreJaPfI

Notes: 

1) Don't Drown is based on a large scale fluid simulation being done in real time using multiple cores on your CPU. However, this means that it is also pretty computationally intensive. Be warned if you are on a slightly weaker computer.

2) Even though I didn't include it in the instructions, if you have a gamepad you can use that instead of keyboard. I think it's a lot nicer!

Screen Shots:

![LD42 8_12_2018 3_02_44 PM.png](///raw/341/41/z/16d64.png)

![LD42 8_12_2018 3_04_39 PM (2).png](///raw/341/41/z/16d69.png)

![LD42 8_12_2018 3_04_04 PM (2).png](///raw/341/41/z/16d67.png)

104038.name: Augmented Shopping Rush
104038.body:
In the distant dystopian future, the last dominating store corporation enforces a strict rule:

_You can only go shopping for groceries once a month if you are a good citizen._
![warning.PNG](///raw/176/91/z/1724a.png)


You have managed to organize your hectic work schedule to accommodate your monthly trip for food. 


![warning2.PNG](///raw/176/91/z/1724b.png)
Unfortunately, today is not a good day for your augmented reality gear and annoying ads and spam threaten your focus.


Make your rare opportunity count and try to check off your shopping list!
![preview.png](///raw/176/91/z/17f8c.png)

104056.name: Ninja Bear
104056.body:
|     |     |     |
| --- | --- | --- |
|![screen6_small.png](///raw/e26/91/z/17684.png)|![screen5_small.png](///raw/e26/91/z/17685.png)|![screen4_small.png](///raw/e26/91/z/17688.png)|

To play the game, extract the folder from the .zip file and open Ninja_Bear.exe

**Controls:**

Arrow keys to move, X to jump.

**Story:**

While wandering through his mortal enemy's den, Ninja Bear has been caught in a trap-- a giant spiked wall is closing in on him! Run from the wall while avoiding obstacles and help the Ninja Bear escape! Or more specifically, run while avoiding bear traps, spikes, and blue flame-shooting flamethrowers! Actually, I'm not really sure what they are-- they shoot out lots of fire, but they don't really look like flamethrowers to me. Regardless, you should avoid them at all costs!

**Important Notes:**

- There are three levels of difficulty: Easy, Normal, and Hard. Easy gives infinity lives, Normal gives four, and Hard gives just one.

- Checkpoints are spread throughout the game. There's no indicator of when one has been reached, but just remember that they *are* there and you don't have to worry about doing flawless.

Also, seeing as I only had two days to make this, there's a great possibility that there are some bugs. I play tested the whole game and it seemed to work fine for me, but it could be different for you. If you come across any bugs, or anything that seems out of place, please let me know so I can try to fix it!


**Credits:**

Art, Music and Programming: Hunter Towe

Font: [Forced Square](https://www.dafont.com/forced-square.font) by [DrawPerfect](https://www.dafont.com/paul-ijsendoorn.d2557)

[BeepBox](https://www.beepbox.co/) was used to make all of the music

[Bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/) and [LabChirp](http://labbed.net/software/labchirp/) were used to make all of the sound effects

This game was made with Unity

___

A turn based strategy game where you have to use the available space to construct buildings 🔨

104105.name: Curses and Goblins
104105.body:
**Note:** Please try to reach the four merchant NPCs before rating this game, so that you can be sure you've really seen how it works. Thank you.

Try to keep up with the stronger and stronger goblins by finding more powerful items, while weighed down by cursed weaponry that won't let you drop it. Merchants can help you out, but it's up to you to make sure you're getting a good deal!

![sprite28.png](///raw/2f7/c/z/16a2e.png)

You must guess enemy behavior to win your fights, but they don't act totally randomly: Goblins will perform every move they can in a random order, before repeating in another random sequence. It is a game of luck, attention, and planning. (I hope.)

Tap arrow keys to move.
Press space to manage items and open chests.
Hold C and tap arrows to attack.
Tap X to block.
Hold Z and tap arrows to kick.
Press escape to open the menu.

In menus, press C to confirm and X to cancel.

The audio was made in Bfxr and Bosca Ceoil, like every other LD game probably. The game was made with GameMaker Studio 1.4. I used two half-baked GameMaker extensions of my own design for this project, which should be included in the source code. Let me know if I should provide a separate download for them on itch.

```Changelog: 10:00PM, August 12, fixed a pair of mistakes in the HUD code that made all indications of how much progress you had made disappear from the game over screen. Now you can brag about what section you reached. I left the original version of the project file available on the itch.io page. (By the way, this bug fix is allowed within the Ludum Dare rules according to the section labelled "Additional notes.")```

All blueprint code, music/sounds, animations and models were made during the jam.

104213.body:
Hello

This game was created for the Ludum Dare 42. I created this game in 12 hours. The theme is Running out of space

What is my game ?
![screen4.PNG](///raw/417/91/z/1746b.png)

It's very easy ! A user downloads and installs some softwares: you have to organize the bits in different computers, 1 in Zone One, 0 in Zone Zero. Beware not running out of space in the disk !
Also, chances are the user will download 10% file that you can't remove ! Finally, you can uninstall malwares that will give you -10% room on your disk, if you don't remove them, you will have a +10%!
[screen1.PNG](///raw/417/91/z/17468.png)

104241.name: Dead Zone
104241.body:
**Defeat each wave of enemies; don't touch the forcefields surrounding the arena. Each enemy bullet that hits a forcefield generator increases the size of the forcefield.**

Thanks for checking out my game.  Dead Zone is a pseudo twin-axis bullet-storm shooter with ten rounds of enemies to defeat.  Can you clear all ten?  Get hit and it's Game Over; but be careful: each bullet you dodge could hit one of the forcefield generators at the edge of the arena - each hit increases the size of the forcefield!

Optimised for controller support but mouse and keyboard input available: WASD to move around; LMB to fire; mouse movement to aim (move left to rotate left; move right to rotate right).

This is the first LD Jam I've entered; and the first game I've 'completed'.  Hope you enjoy and thanks in advance for any feedback.

![screenshotmain.png](///raw/c27/91/z/1753c.png)

*Complete waves by defeating all enemies.  Avoid projectiles and forcefields!*

![gameovercomp.png](///raw/c27/91/z/1754a.png)

*The arena will shrink as the enemy projectiles hit forcefield generators.  Comparison of early game vs. late game.*

**Software:**
Unity, 
Visual Studio, 
Blender, 
Inkscape, 
Bosca Ceoil.

104269.name: Escape from The Alliance
104269.body:
![cover_image.png](///content/dd3/z/16ccc.png)

Escape from The Alliance carrying as many refugees as you can by dropping equipment along the way.

Links
* **HTML5(WebGL)**: [dashingstrike.com/LudumDare/LD42](http://www.dashingstrike.com/LudumDare/LD42/)
* **Source Code**: [Jimbly/LD42-alliance-escape](https://github.com/Jimbly/LD42-alliance-escape)

I ended up making something that starts out pretty complicated, but gets, in some ways, simpler as you go along, although maintains its difficulty.  The game has 11 "Chapters" (short battles) to play though, although a couple of them are notably longer than others, especially if you're down a couple weapons.

Hopefully the tutorial and in-game stuff explains most of how things work well enough.  I've got some tips (after the screenshots below) if you're having trouble.  I might have been watching some Firefly recently and felt a bit inspired by that for the game's story =).

Screenshots:
![ss3.png](///raw/dd3/z/16afd.png)
![ss1.png](///raw/dd3/z/16aff.png)
![ss4.png](///raw/dd3/z/16b00.png)

TIPS:
* It's possible to ditch equipment on every port and still win
* If things are too confusing, you can pretty much just ignore Repair, Power, Engines, and (until the alarm goes off) Life Support
* Whenever any component is blinking because of Heat, just click it immediately!
* Try to keep 1 Shield, 2 Weapons, and 1 Life Support as long as you can
* When fighting a group of 2 Heavy Fighters, make sure to start charging your two weapons immediately, and you can take them out before they get off a second shot
* Make sure to always have some shield up and you'll take no damage
* Whenever the middle bar (Shield charge, O2 Generation, Evade, etc) gets full, immediately turn off the component, it's just generating heat at that point
* To survive more easily later, you'll definitely need to take the Etherians on board, so don't drop a Shield Generator until that event (around Chapter 4, I think)

Post-compo changes (just load-time optimizations/engine fixes):
* Fixed a bug causing the loading screen to go entirely black
* Applied minification and converted audio files to MP3 to greatly reduce load times

--

Tools Used
* Custom Engine: [GLOV.js](https://github.com/Jimbly/turbulenz-playground)
* Mtn Dew
* Some tiles in [Piskel](https://www.piskelapp.com/)
* Image postprocessing and other tiles in Photoshop
* Sound Effects in [Bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/)
* Music in Bosca Ceoil
* The PICO-8 color palette

Also, if you're read this far, check out my other game [Splody on Steam and PS4](http://www.splody.com/)!

104297.name: Storage Almost Full
104297.body: A defense game in which you destroy incoming files to keep your PC from running out of space![Screenshot (15).png](///raw/267/91/z/16d32.png)

104300.name: Galaxy Adventure, An Adventure In Spaaaaaace!
104300.body:
Its almost like an action board game!
Its a galaxy adventure in space! What more could you want? 

![TitleImage.png](///raw/7dd/11/z/17a92.png)

You and your crew can travel to distant planets and meet strange new people who could be real friendly-like or could end up being your worst nightmare. You never know what you'll find out there in space so why don't you come aboard and lead your crew on your next big adventure . . . IN SPACE!
Featuring: Running out of space for Ship Upgrades!

unfortunately for some odd reason the game only works in the unity editor. We wanted to build it for WebGL but when we did everything broke down. After an all nighter of debugging we finally had to give up. I guess youll just have to take out word for it that it works. Bummer for us and for you. :(

104311.name: Cosmic Escape 1999
104311.body:
The solar system you're visiting is starting to collapse. Everything is expanding, and you have to escape as fast as you can. Be quick, space is running out of space.

This game is a little 3D space simulator, where fleeing is the only option.  Default controls are mapped on WASD, shift and space, and mouse for camera/direction.

It's our entry for LDJam 42. We hadn't made any new game creation attempt for a long time, and the Ludum Dare was a good occasion to try again, as well as discovering Godot Engine. We hope to add more levels to this in the future. 

![Godot_v3 2018-08-13 18-28-31-76.png](///raw/477/91/z/17a78.png)

![Godot_v3 2018-08-13 18-28-24-08.png](///raw/477/91/z/17a7b.png)

104312.name: Don´t Hit The Ducks!
104312.body:
Made for LD42 : Theme "Running Out of Space"

Don´t Hit The Ducks!

Your father takes you to the forest to hunt and become a real man, but you don´t see the point. Why kill a animal is going to make you a man?. So You better not hit any animal, or you will be traumatized. Easy to say, but there are so many stupid animals in here. What a bad day you will have. 

Ps: Also hitting the red ballons counts as missing 10 shots for not good reason;

Have Fun!!![ScreenShoot1.jpg](///raw/a5c/81/z/181f0.jpg)![ScreenShoot2.jpg](///raw/a5c/81/z/181f8.jpg)

104322.name: Commute Simulator
104322.body:
We've all been there. The long, dreadful wait to get to work. The disorganized, overcrowded public transportation system. The discomfort in squeezing and squishing between people you're pretty sure haven't showered in days. It's time to do something about it. It's time to fight back.

![screenshot.png](///raw/2fa/c/z/171af.png)

## Team

- Chris Hurt
- Nick Teran
- Daniel Zhang
- Gio Lee

*Made in Unity for Ludum Dare 42*

104327.name: Mail Room
104327.body:
# The Game

A short little arcade game, made for Ludum Dare 42.

In Mail Room, you play as a mail room worker in a shrinking mail room, which is quickly filling up with mail. You must use the three mail chutes to send the mail to their corresponding recipients, matching the colour of the mail to the colour of the chutes.

[Try to avoid the clutter.](///raw/587/91/z/15dbb.png)

Throughout the game there are various power-ups which will affect the gameplay in a variety of ways, giving you the potential to accumulate a much higher score. The game also has a built-in leaderboard, though this is file-based, and thus is not global. See if you can beat your own high score, or compete with your friends to achieve the highest score!

# A Little Information
This is my first real project outside of school, and my first Ludum Dare game. I made it by myself, creating all of the assets, scripts, and sounds during the game jam, and, while it's not a particularly impressive game, I enjoyed making it, and hope you enjoy playing it!

I finished making the game a few hours before the end of the comp, but I was satisfied with the status of the game and have some other stuff to do today, so here it is!

The source files are also avail​able, but they are ​*incredibly messy​*! and very cluttered with unnecessary or poorly formatted files. Proceed with caution. If you make any changes to the game, please let me know! It would be great to see what changes and improvements people have made on this project.

104330.name: Forest Fighter
104330.body:
Forest Fighter is a game about a lumberjack fighting against a mutant forest. The lumberjack has to chop the rapidly growing trees while fighting mutant saplings before he gets cornered.

Here are some of the sprites for the game:

The Main character for this game!
![Lumberjack.png](///raw/e36/91/z/159d9.png)

A mutated tree, it spews out mutated saplings
![MutantTree.png](///raw/e36/91/z/159dd.png)

104333.name: Alpaca Bag
104333.body: A game with an Alpaca and chaos.

104335.name: Home Invasion
104335.body:
Hello, my 2nd game ever for the LD Jam is this sweet boy.

Home Invasion

Aliens crash into your house and eat all your food, while leaving a huge mess and breeding.
Your job is it to remove the poop, and sell these aliens.

Can you stand against the invasion?![Screenshot_6.png](///raw/3b0/31/z/17d96.png)
![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/3b0/31/z/17d9a.png)

This time I teamed up with my girlfriend who did a lot of the art.

104338.name: Open Spaces
104338.body:
![crowd.png](///raw/6c1/z/171ad.png)
Agoraphobia is the abnormal fear of being in crowds, public places, or open areas, sometimes accompanied by anxiety attacks. This is a visual novel designed to create awareness for this form, and other forms, of anxiety and depressive disorders. Your character decides how to interact with other characters, who either show you support or impatience. If you make decisions to isolate yourself, or let the negative thoughts take you, the dark mass of "Fear" creeps further and further into your mind.  There are many ways to combat anxiety, and there is no single solution for everyone, but seeking support is always a good first step. This is the first game I have written and designed and it could not have been completed without the incredible talent of the members of Tech Valley Game Space in Troy, New York.

Trigger Warning: This game includes depictions of anxiety through audio and visual elements which may be difficult for some.

104340.name: Space Grunge!
104340.body:
A Fast paced puzzle game , with a retro feel. Pace through traps and obstacles to reach the end checkpoint and progress. This game is nothing short of a challenge and is not meant for a gamer looking for a breeze. CAN YOU MAKE IT TO THE END?
I promise all levels are possible and there is in fact an end to Space Grunge even if only a few will reach it. Every level has been play tested by many people!

![lclclc.PNG](///raw/ef0/91/z/161c6.png)

-Use space & the cursor to move around
-Use the 'r' key to restart the level


You play as a space ship stuck in the middle of the galaxy with a limited amount of fuel. Use your fuel wisely in order to reach the checkpoint that is often located between a jungle of traps and obstacles.
HOW DOES THIS FIT THE THEME?:
Well your fuel is controlled by the Spacebar and your fuel is very limited. Therefore you are quite literally running out of SPACE! XD


https://youtu.be/qxn8Nl3RW_8


![scree.PNG](///raw/ef0/91/z/161c9.png)

Please give any feedback negative or positive, anything would be appreciated thanks everyone!
Available on: WINDOWS

104348.name: Nuclear Arms 6: Waste Wizard's Tricks
104348.body:
![Title6.png](///raw/c45/z/178d3.png)

![Desktop Screenshot 2018.08.13 - 12.09.41.73.png](///raw/c45/z/178d0.png)

![trashfight.gif](///raw/c45/z/178c8.gif)

![lazer.gif](///raw/c45/z/178c9.gif)

![SenatorFight.gif](///raw/c45/z/178cc.gif)

Craig Killbane is back! He has been abducted by the sinister Waste Wizard for destroying his Trash Star. Craig needs to survive the Wizard's arena by facing off against waves of Trash Bots. Only then will he be able to fight the Waste Wizard directly and escape from the arena!

As Craig, you'll fight against waves of enemies to make it to the final fight with the Wizard at the end:

- WASD or Arrow keys to move
- Mouse to aim
- Left Click to attack
- Hold right click to Charge up a punch
- Releasing it causes you to surge forward, pushing and damaging everything in your way
- Pickup powerups for various effects!

- Avoid falling garbage!
- Garbage will clutter up the arena, blocking you in. You'll need to fight your way through it to get to your enemies
- Destroying garbage may spawn powerups for you to use.

This game follows the adventures of Craig Killbane. You can check out the previous game in the series in our last Ludum Dare submission here:

[Nuclear Arms 5](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/40/nuclear-arms-5-orphan-overdrive)

Or the entire list of Nuclear Arms games from my profile [here](https://ldjam.com/users/logicon211/)

It was a busy weekend for us all. We had the usual crew this time around. The earlier start time gave us all a bit more of a window for work on the first day, but most of the team was exhausted by Sunday. Still, the quality of our work is improving with every game and we have a good time coming up with ideas for Craig Killbane and his next game. We hope you enjoy!

Credits

[@Logan Marks](https://twitter.com/Logicon211) - Programming (Enemies, Player, Effects, Implementing Assets), Art/Animations (Enemies, powerups, effects), Voice (Announcer)

[@Brodie Beaman](https://twitter.com/BrodieBeaman) - Programming (Tilemap, Obstacle Spawner, Boss Attack), Sound Editing (Announcer, Wizard), Level creation

104375.body:
The Ark has been built, all the animals loaded aboard and rain begins to pelt from the heavens.

104379.name: Battle Arena
104379.body:
This is my unreal engine 4 game for LD42 compo. Play single player or on a LAN to try and knock either the AI or another player into the wall that causes you to SLOWLY RUN OUT OF SPACE.

Controls
--------

* WASD: movement
* Space: jump
* LMB: shoot
* RMB: grapple
* Esc: quit

The balls shot out from the player apply force to the thing it hits and the goal of the game is to try
and knock the other player into the neon grid slowly getting smaller around them. After a player is knocked into the wall, the scores will be changed and a new round started.


Source can be viewed/downloaded on my github page: https://github.com/tbogdala/BattleArena

Tools used: Unreal Engine 4, Visual Studio Community 2017, ZBrush 2018, Blender, Rytmik Studio, Aseprite.

![BattleArenaScreenie.jpg](///raw/824/91/z/16c33.jpg)
![BattleArenaScreenie2.jpg](///raw/824/91/z/16c52.jpg)

104383.name: Home
104383.body:
You are the captain of a cargo named LD-42.

You running out of space. Your loads are Humans (alive).

Your mission, deport thems (every where you want), and go home.

Good Luck !

104384.body: Buy and sell organs. Drink, live a miserable life and die of sadness.

## HOW TO PLAY

You should survive as long as you can.Every wave that you reach is going to be harder than previous one.When you kill an enemy they drop some scraps.You can heal yourself and upgrade your weapon with them.

104402.name: CAVEMAN
104402.body:
Hi folks,

Thank you for checking our game!

Inspired by caveman paintings
![Article - Discover 3 Incredible Cave Art Sites in Europe.jpg](///raw/146/a/z/17374.jpg)
Paleolithic art adorns the walls of Lascaux Cave in southwest France.
PHOTOGRAPH BY COTTON COULSON, NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC CREATIVE

We wants to make simple 2.5D action adventure game using Unity texture projection 

You are a warrior living on top of a cave wall filled with prehistorical paintings.
![WalkInTheWoods_v2.jpg](///raw/146/a/z/173ae.jpg)

Your tribe is over populated and running out of space.
![PrideRock_v3.jpg](///raw/146/a/z/173a6.jpg)

Your mission is to help your tribe finding a place next to river for settlement.
![BisonRun_v3.jpg](///raw/146/a/z/173aa.jpg)

Watch out for wild animals, because they like to chase you around
![CryWolf_v2.jpg](///raw/146/a/z/173ad.jpg)

If you like the game, please rate it and give us your feedback
Add a link to your game in the comments; we want to check it out!

104422.name: Tower of Destiny
104422.body:
Enter the tower! Defeat the wizard! Face your destiny!

![ld 1116_0.gif](///raw/8ab/31/z/17262.gif) ![ld 1116_1.gif](///raw/8ab/31/z/17263.gif) ![ld 1116_2.gif](///raw/8ab/31/z/17264.gif)

Z to attack. Arrow keys move. Double tap an arrow key to dash.


The restart feature is super wonky and doesn't reset the map tiles, so if you want a full board again, you'll have to reboot the game. Also, the dash move is on a cool down timer that I didn't get to tune as much as I would have liked and I didn't get a chance to put in an indicator for it. I think it's about a 1 second gap between dashes



Made with PICO-8 at the RVA Game Jams (https://rvagamejams.com/) Ludum Dare 42 event. This is my first full, complete game I've made by myself. Hope you like it.

104439.name: This Is For You!
104439.body:

"This Is For You!", is a game about picking as many flowers as you can hold, so that you can make your mom happy!

104443.name: Not Enough Space
104443.body:
Walk - A,D or Left Arrow Keys,Right Arrow Keys

Jump - Space or W or Up Arrow (also there is double jumping)

Inventory - Tab

Dragging items - Hold tab and click and hold, until the item turns green, to drag it

Equipping weapons - Mouse Left or Right click any weapon to equip it in your primary or secondary hand. If a weapon is already equipped in that hand it will be swapped.

De-equip by pressing the weapon with with the mouse key that correspondence to the hand the gun is on.

Jump on enemies - You can kill enemies, at the expense of taking some damage, by jumping on their heads.

Shooting - Left click will fire your main gun and Right click will fire your secondary.


LD42: The goal was to make a a game about running out of space.

If you don't manage your inventory wisely you'll have a really hard time shooting as your screen runs out of space. Also dropping guns willy nilly will get you in a heap of trouble as you have to pick up any item that you interact with.!

I apologize for the music. It didn't turn out the way I wanted it to.!
[picture.png](///raw/a97/91/z/16ba0.png)

104464.name: Crash the Party
104464.body:
Crash the local party after a day at school.

Use the arrow keys to move and X to interact.

If Gamejolt hosting does not work, try the Personal hosting link.

104467.name: Oil Ball Thing!
104467.body:
Oil Ball Thing! Because I could not think of a better name! 
Take command of a ball of oil as you desperately try not to catch on fire!
The play area is shrinking and fire slimes are hunting you down, How long can you survive?


Controls: 
Left Button - Move left while midair.
Right Button - Move right while midair.
Space Bar - Hold the space bar to charge your jump, your jump's height depends on how long you hold it down!


Requires Java! Should work on Mac, Windows and Linux. (Linux not tested).
(Keep the jar file in the same folder as the res file)

I used:
Eclipse - Java Programming.
Gimp - Art.
Bosca Ceoil - Music.

104473.name: Rick Dervish - Space Cadet
104473.body:
# Rick Dervish - Space Cadet

## Synopsis

![RickDervishScreenshot1.jpg](///raw/986/7/z/1647c.jpg)

Rick dervish is a game about a boy, in a spaceship, which is powered by an engine that leaves behind a HUGE trail of fire.

![RickDervish2.jpg](///raw/986/7/z/16481.jpg)

Fight you way through the enemies that are coming to take you down. But be careful, because when they fly into your trail of fire, it only gets bigger.

![RickDervish3.jpg](///raw/986/7/z/1648b.jpg)

Hope you have fun with the game.

## Tools Used To Make The Game

### Engine
- Unity 3D
- Visual Studio 2017

### Image Editing
- GIMP

(by the way'm 10 years old so that's why the game sucks lol, but rate me like i'm older please)

104484.name: A Blob's Life
104484.body:
Awake as a strange creature in a stranger ecosystem.  Can you can figure out enough to survive or even thrive, before space runs out or you end up as lunch?

![Screenshot0.png](///raw/81b/z/16e6f.png)

![Screenshot1.png](///raw/81b/z/16e70.png)

![Screenshot2.png](///raw/81b/z/16e74.png)

This game is partly about exploring the systems...  I'm not sure if I got the balance of information vs mystery right, it's hard to tell when I already know the answers!  A few key things could be better telegraphed to you, though, so I put them on the game over screen in case you don't stumble across them the first time.

Hope you enjoy -- feedback appreciated!

104519.body:
​Where's Creepo? is a game where you play as a creepy old guy trying to record video of people. Your target person will be displayed in the bottom right corner of the screen. Your goal is to find your target person amongst a crowd of randomly generated people and record them/take their picture. Once you take their picture, you will receive a new target person in the crowd. Your goal is to record as many targets as possible before your camera runs out of space. Good luck!

CONTROLS: wasd to move and left click on your target

104556.name: Eating Sim
104556.body:
Compete in a realistic speed eating competition.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zh54V_VIUKc

Using the theme *Running out of space* we thought it would be fun to play with the idea of filling up your stomach.  So we took the idea of a food eating competition and all the things you have to physically manage in order to be successful at it.  Like chewing, swallowing, managing mouth moisture, gas, etc.

There's a single player high score mode, and a local versus mode where you share a keyboard with another player.

Features 4 types of foods that react to the body in unique ways. Burp and vomit to clear you esophagus and keep going!

104569.name: Dogs on the Bed
104569.body:
## **About**
Dogs on the Bed is a fun little puzzle game. You pick up dogs and rotate them to fit onto the bed. Make sure you dont leave dogs off the bed for too long, or they may get too cold and wake up. 

![SS1.png](///raw/a3e/81/z/177a2.png)


![SS2.png](///raw/a3e/81/z/177a3.png)


![SS3.png](///raw/a3e/81/z/177dd.png)

## **How to play**

	Left click = pick up/put down dog

	A + D = Rotate dog

## **Aim of the game**

Dont let your furry friends get too cold; keep them snuggly and warm in the bed.
 
Dogs that have been sleeping on the bed warm up and can be temporarily placed back on the floor (just dont let them get too cold).
    
Running out of space? You can stack certain dogs on top of each other (it also gets you more points).
  
Get as many points as possible, and aim to beat your high score! 

Get enough points to unlock a secret new dog. 

Let me know if you beat my current high score of 162!

## **Tips**

Watch out for the smaller dogs they get colder faster 

Remember you can move dogs on and off the bed

You receive more points the higher you can stack the dog

Bigger dogs are also worth more points

The more blue a dog is the colder it's getting

Dogs warm up on the bed and can last longer on the floor

## **Info**

This was created by a team of 2. 1 Programmer and 1 Artist. We finished with 7 hours to go out of the 72 hour time frame. Software used was Maya, Photoshop, Substance Painter, Audacity and Unity.

104582.name: ground_0
104582.body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_vQYvIA6X7k

ground_0 is a game where your play space is your ammunition. Absorb earth particles to power your weapon. If you're not careful, you'll run out of the ground beneath your feet and fall to your death. The corpses of enemies will leave behind extra earth particles, which can be a curse--if you let it build up too high up, you'll have less time to react to the flying enemies and their projectiles. But, usually you'll be rationing your earth and timing your shots to eliminate multiple enemies at a time. Just be careful where you reload--don't make any holes!

Comment with your time and death count when you beat it!

![ground01.png](///raw/388/91/z/1756d.png)

![ground02.png](///raw/388/91/z/1756e.png)

![Capture.PNG](///raw/388/91/z/17552.png)




Issues:
- Most graphics aren't pixel-perfect.
- The last few levels are pretty tough.

Updates:
- 8/13 4:43 AM PDT:
 - fixed an issue where you could get stuck in the dirt 
 - added a death counter to the credits

Created using Game Maker Studio 1.4


I scrapped an earlier concept, and had a false-start making this in Unity first, so I was a bit too late for Compo... but I did make all the music, sound (using SFXR), graphics, and code during the 72 window. Done solo, except my girlfriend who helped play test.

104583.name: Drifting Statuary
104583.body:
Once, the Drifting Isles were an idyllic place, where angels frolicked and merriment was endless. Today they are beset by demons who, for some reason, leave statues all over the place.

![action.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/1632f.png)

Drifting Statuary is a turn-based strategy game in an arcade style (in the sense that you play for score, and the game only ends when you lose). Lead a team of angels, two Assassins and two Bruisers, to fight back the demons as long as you can. Why did the idyllic land of angels and merriment have Assassins and Bruisers? Listen, you're gonna want to not ask so many questions about this game's backstory.

Play it now: https://squirmonkey.itch.io/drifting-statuary
(More links at bottom)

## How to play

### The Angels

On each turn, you'll move three of your angels. The number of moves you have remaining is shown on a counter in the bottom-left corner of the screen. If you have fewer than three angels remaining, you'll move each angel once. You must use all of your moves each turn.

To move an angel, click on it. Green boxes will appear depicting where that angel can move. Click on one of the green squares to move there, or click on the angel again to unselect it. You can move up to three spaces (no diagonals), but you can't move zero spaces. 

After you move, if you landed next to (again, no diagonals) a demon or statue, they'll be highlighted in red. You can click one of the red boxes to make an attack. You'll deal one damage, by default. If you don't want to attack, you can click on the angel again to not attack. If your attack kills a demon, you'll be healed one hit point and a statue will be left behind in the space the demon occupied. Killing demons also increases your score. 

![moveAndAttack.gif](///raw/1a7/91/z/1624b.gif)

If you aren't able to use all of your moves (if some of your angels are trapped) it's game over. 

#### The Assassin

![TheAssassin.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/1625e.png)

Your team starts with two Assassins. Dangerous angels of the night, they can be identified easily by their black and yellow garments and dual blades. The assassin has three health, and normally its attacks do one damage. However, if the assassin attacks a target that is also adjacent to another angel, the attack does two damage instead. 

![assassinPower.gif](///raw/1a7/91/z/162ba.gif)

#### The Bruiser

![TheBruiser.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/16260.png)

Your team starts with two Bruisers. Thuggish angelic enforcers, they can be identified easily by their blue and brown garb, wooden club, and awkwardly small shield. The bruiser has four health, and normally its attacks do one damage. However, if the bruiser attacks after moving exactly one space, the attack does two damage instead.

![bruiserPower.gif](///raw/1a7/91/z/16306.gif)

### The Demons

![TheDemons.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/16261.png)

Once you have used all of your moves, it will be the demons' turn. Usually, two demons will act during the demon turn. Fewer demons will act if there are fewer than two demons on the board. It is also possible for three demons to act if there are six demons on the board (there will never be more than six demons, that's plenty, trust me). 

Just like the angels, a demon that is acting will move up to three spaces (not zero, and not diagonally) and then attack an adjacent unit if possible, doing one damage. The demons only attack angels, never statues. If, after a demon attack, there are no more angels, it's game over.  

After a demon moves, it leaves a statue behind on the island it used to occupy. The only exception to this rule is if that island has a sigil. Demons won't leave statues behind on sigils (though it is possible to get a statue on a sigil by killing a demon there). 

Once all the demon moves are done, slain demons respawn. Any demons killed this round will re-appear on a random sigil-island (the islands in the corners with the pentagrams) that has no other units or statues on it. Throughout the course of the game, new demons will be added to the board during the demon respawn phase as well. If a demon attempts to spawn but no sigil is available, a new sigil will be placed on a random empty island for it.

![turn.gif](///raw/1a7/91/z/1631f.gif)

If the demons are forced to act with a demon that can't move, that demon spends its turn dying, and will respawn as normal. 

### Statues

Statues are left behind when demons move or die. They have two health, and neither demons nor angels can stand on an island with a statue on it. The more statues there are on the board, the more points you'll earn when you kill a demon. However, let too many accumulate, and you'll surely be trapped.

### Scoring

Whenever you kill a demon you get 50 points, plus 5 points for every statue on the board.
Additionally, at the end of the demons' turns, you get 2 points for every demon turn that has passed so far. 

## Strategy Advice

(take with a grain of salt, I probably don't have all the best strategies figured out)

**Remember to heal**
When you kill a demon, the angel who struck the killing blow heals a hit point. If you have injured angels, don't waste that heal by killing the demon with a full-health angel if you can.

**Smash statues**
Even though having statues on the board is worth points, they will get in your way. A demon who's near statues is much harder to kill than one that's not, so having fewer statues on the board will help you kill them faster. Your Bruisers are really good for this, because the statues never move, so you can plan ahead for your bruiser to be one space away and then break the statue in one hit. 

**Hide behind statues**
The demons can't stand on the statues either, and they can only move 3 spaces. This means that you can often get away from a demon who attacked you on a previous turn by moving near some statues. If you're not going to be able to kill the demon, this is probably better than taking another hit. 

**Let your assassins take hits**
If someone has to take a hit, let it be your assassins. Even though they have less health than the bruisers, it is much easier for them to strike the killing blow against a demon than it is for the bruisers. This means they typically heal faster than the bruisers do. 


## Misc

This is my first Ludum Dare! Exciting stuff. I decided to use LD as an excuse to learn Unity, so this is my first Unity project, and I've really enjoyed getting to know it. 

As required, everything in the game was made by me, except for the three fonts, which I downloaded from a free fonts site. 
Also, obviously, I did not make Unity. 

I'm gonna include a Mac and Linux build because Unity says I can and I think that's sweet. However, I don't have a Mac or Linux computer to test on, so those builds are completely untested. If you're using one of those systems and are having trouble with the build, I beg your forgiveness and encourage you to check out the web version. 


Tools I used:
- Unity
- Visual Studio
- Aseprite
- paint.net
- Bosca Ceoil
- Audacity

I think that's it...

My best score is 8391 points. I look forward to hearing your tales of beating it!

Source code: https://drive.google.com/uc?export=download&id=1yIoSQ8ATlcMvPGPLdHU0HmC31mCcL2ci

Big thanks to Icefox for hanging out with me during development and helping me brainstorm. Check out [his compo game too](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/running-in-to-space). Thanks also to anyone who tuned into the development livestream.

This is my first Ludum Dare! Only got a day and a half instead of 3 days to work on it!, but I hope you like it! Tell me what you think! 

(If possible, use the Windows version rather than the WebGL version which cropped one edge out for no reason. I'd fix it but I don't have time. It's still playable though)

BEWARE HEADPHONE USERS (just fyi)!

The idea was to mimic the feeling of claustrophobia. I thought to myself "how can I make a game FEEL claustrophobic".

104623.name: BurningLight
104623.body:
Burning light is about playing as a fire spirit, burning oxygen to fan your flames, and shooting fire at persistent water spirits to turn them to steam. You HP is indicated by the size of your fire, you loose HP each second, consume HP to shoot fire, and increase your HP by collecting air particles.

Controls use the arrows or WASD keys to move, and the left and right mouse buttons to shoot. 

This is my first LudemDare entry, and the first game I've made in Unity. There aren't any menus, and the game just automatically restarts when you die.

104811.name: Depot
104811.body:
# Description
Depot is a game about sorting parcels quickly, parcels come in on conveyor belts at ever increasing speeds. If the conveyor belts run out of space parcels begin to get damaged. If a conveyor belt only contains damaged parcels and is full it could jam, and you lose the game. This game was made for Ludum Dare 42 Compo "Running out of space"  and made in 48 hours. BTW I am @Yayiest here but @dagwoodland on GameJolt and GitHub.

# How To Play
## Aim
The aim of the game is to keep all the conveyor belts free of parcels, by dragging and dropping parcels. If a conveyor belt “runs out of space” for parcels, some parcels will start to become damaged. If all the parcels on a full conveyor belt are damaged the conveyor belt could jam, and you lose the game.
## Sorting Parcels
To get a good score you must correctly sort the parcels, the sorting rules are as follows:
* If a parcel looks damaged it must always be put in the damaged chute.
* If a parcel isn’t damaged, but weighs more than 5kg it must be put in the too heavy chute.
* If a parcel isn’t too heavy or damaged, it must go in the normal chute, unless it has a red stamp which must go in the priority chute.

The game will tell you what you did wrong if you make a mistake, so you should get the hang of it. Good luck! :smiley: 
![Depot 1.jpg](///raw/0bc/71/z/15ee5.jpg)

![Depot 2.jpg](///raw/0bc/71/z/15ee6.jpg)

Source Code: https://github.com/dagwoodland/Depot

104830.name: HouseMover
104830.body:
![Skjermbilde2.PNG](///raw/559/9/z/16652.png)

![Skjermbilde4.PNG](///raw/559/9/z/16654.png)

As my first ever Ludum Dare submission, i present to you HouseMover.

Story:

You have just moved to your new house, and your stuff from your old house is coming in boxes. Stack as many boxes as you can inside your house, if you leave any outside for too long its game over!

Controls:

Left mouse button to drag-and-drop

Tutorial/Notes:

- The game over counter dose not start before you move the first box.
- When you are holding a box, the tile under your mouse will turn green if you can place the box on the tile. It will turn 
    red otherwise.
- Each successful box placed inside will give you 10 points, try to get as many points as possible.
- The boxes is color coded based on size. Red is big box, Blue is medium box, Green is small box.
- You can stack smaller boxes on top of bigger boxes, but not the other way around. And you can not stack boxes of same 
    size on top of eachother.

Known bugs:

- If you try to place a box on a tile, but your mouse is hovering over other boxes, it will not place the box where you 
    want it, and most likely put it back where you picked it up from.

Tools used:

- Unity /w JetBrains Rider
- Bfxr
- Snippingtool :)

104901.name: Master The Space
104901.body:
### Ludum Dare:

This is JDA's submission to the ludum dare 42 game jam. It is our first submission to the jam. The theme of the jam is "running out of space".


### Story:

After the universe has collapsed, a big black hole arose. Planets were shattered into small pieces and are attracted by the black hole. If the pieces won't get assembled to planets by a space master, they will be lost. Your task is to assemble the pieces back together, before the black hole can strike.


### Game objective:

You have to put pieces from the same planet (same texture) together. If you put together 5 pieces (20 tiles) from the same planet and they touch each other the planet is assembled and disappears. When the planet is assembled, you get a point for every tile that touches the tile of another piece, so fit them together without creating any holes.

The black hole strikes if you didn't place a piece fast enough. When it strikes, it takes away your space and every piece that was placed on that space. So keep in mind to place your pieces fast enough.


### Controls:

Moving the active block: wasd or arrow keys
Rotating the active block: q (left), e (right)
Lock the active block to its current place: space

Play sound: u
Pause sound: i
Volume: o (up), p (down)
Next track: j


### Used Frameworks:

- libgdx
- piskel
- gimp
- abundant music

Bear-ly Escape is a game about a polar bear trying to escape a constantly shrinking 10x10 grid. Dotted across the grid are random traps and fishes for the player to collect or avoid during the escape. If the polar bear hits the water. Dead. If the polar bear gets trapped. Dead.

Please give feedback, even if it rips the game in half, I then know how to act upon it next time.
