104945.name: Shredder-Boy
104945.body:
Shredder Boy is trying to not get out of space by using the shredder

Use Arrow-Keys to Move and 'Z' to take/put objects


Keep the left (yellow)  platform free, scan packets/documents using the 'computer' and put expired (red-labeled) packets/documents into the shredder. Put the resulting waste onto then garbage-platform and try to get not out of space.


Game ends when not all new documents can arrive because the left (yellow) packets/documents is out of space

 * Green labeled documents/packets expire in more than 2 minutes
 * Yellow labeled documents/packets expire in less than 2 minutes
 * Red labeled documents/packets are expired and can be shredded
 * Grey labeled documents/packets needs to be scanned to see the colored label

Post LD42 Changes:

This version contains the following post-LD42 fixes:

 * Fix reset-bug that effects second round (some values were not reset)
 * Make Game-Over-Screen readable (change color + background + delay)
 * Make clean garbage-space as shown, not unpredictable

![screen2.gif](///raw/302/31/z/174bf.gif)

![shredderboy_game.gif](///raw/302/31/z/174cb.gif)

104958.name: Anatomically Drunk
104958.body:
My second Ludum Dare entry, Anatomically Drunk, is a survival horror for Playstation 1 about a drunken guy fighting his nightmares except it's not a survival horror and not for Playstation 1.

This LD my priority was to play with 3D graphics and finally take a stab at doing some audio. After years of making almost soundless, 2D games it's time to move out of the comfort zone! The first day and a half I've played with procedural animation, posting every step of the process on Twitter (@mrmoczan). That was really fun experience but I actually had to make a game out of it, so I've created a simple physics based game were you control not-so-cooperating character and have get rid of some basic shapes. The game doesn't really match the Theme, but it was a fun weekend nevertheless! Enjoy!

104960.name: The Most Unwinnable Unfinished Game Ever
104960.body:
As The Title Says 

WARNING
Extremely unwinnable/unfinished

oh btw first game jam and didnt make myself a good scedule :)

104965.name: Memory Leak
104965.body:
You are in cyberspace, but the simulation only has a limited amount of memory, and the memory is slowly increasing due to a memory leak. You must exit each process (level) before the process *runs out of memory space*. You can create cubes to get to the exit trigger, but these use up memory. You can remove a limited amount of cubes to free up memory, **but only at a limited distance**. Later levels require you to obtain keys before you can exit.

Controls: WASD to move. Press 0 for no ability, 1 for cube building and 2 for cube removing.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

104986.name: Let Us Eat the Sun!
104986.body:
The sun is turning into a black hole and is going to eat the universe and everything in it! How do we stop this? Simple! We must eat the sun first! We shall send our little magic creature to the sun so that we can eat it to prevent the universe from being destroyed!

The Making of:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xQbQnn9677A

104994.name: Get off my shelf!
104994.body:
# Description
You are a small cardboard box. Fighting for your place on the shelf! Other (bigger) boxes are trying to conquer it, but you wont let them! 

# How to play
|Action|Key(s)|
|------|---|
|Move Left|A or <-|
|Move Right|D or ->|
|Jump|Space|
|Power Up|F/E|

## Controller (works in WebGL)
|Action|Key(s)|
|------|---|
|Move Left|Joystick Left|
|Move Right|Joystick Right|
|Jump|X|
|Power Up|B|

# Play
[WebGL and Windows Versions](https://oneplusonens.itch.io/get-off-my-shelf)
Fullscreen is recommended

Post your highscores in the comments! :)

## Known Issues
- Rare: You might fly away when using the shield and landing on the ground while other boxes are in your way.
- Very rare: Random bug where you seem to have lost although you did not touch the ground nor did the boxes stack above the barrier.
- Using Forcefield and launching a box into the barrier can cause a Game Over

## Features I wanted to add
- Background music (now its just an AC :P)
- Generally improve overall sounds
- 2-3 difficulties which the player can choose from (in this case size of shelf)
- Few menu items could be visually more appealing
- Random rotated boxes (had this on my sheet since the start and forgot about it -.-)
- Check at the barrier that boxes only enter from below (was also on the plan)

## Screenshots
![Screenshot_1_ready.jpg](///raw/ad7/c/z/164e8.jpg)
![Forcefield.gif](///raw/ad7/c/z/164eb.gif)
![Screenshot_2_ready.jpg](///raw/ad7/c/z/16540.jpg)
![Screenshot_3_ready.jpg](///raw/ad7/c/z/16542.jpg)
![Screenshot_4_ready.jpg](///raw/ad7/c/z/16549.jpg)

## Development
Overall a lot better than the last Compo. The last game I did during LD41 (Compo) was a total mess. I didn't manage to follow my plan. This was mainly due to randomly implementing things. I started writing a feature and in the middle of it went to start on another one (because it maybe was somehow related or cooler). Well the result like I said a total mess. This time it worked out a lot better. The core game was done at around half time. Then I carried on implementing some additional features I had in mind right from the start. This also worked out, just one mechanic was changed completely around 5 hours before submission. I was also able to add sounds and a menu this time which was missing completely from LD41.
In general I am fairly happy with the result. Although it is not the greatest idea I do like it and enjoyed play testing quite a bit :).

## Day 1
I started out by writing down what came to my mind. Instantly I though of Super Hexagen. Also storage on hard drives, in parking garages and warehouses came to mind. I did follow a thought about trash cans and keeping the environment clean, but then went on to use the warehouse idea. At first it was suppose to be a kinda endless runner (doodle jump style) where boxses stack up and you follow them to infinity. However I thought this was to basic. While the idea that I finally took is not really that more complex I still think it is something different.
I began by first implementing the basic player controls. As its a cube/box I wanted to do it using physics so it's a lot of wiggly and twisty movements. That was done fairly quick, jumping was another thing. Although the first iteration was already quite close to how it is now, I iterated many times over it. Then I proceeded to get the spawner done. The amount and area where they spawn can all be modified from the inspector. They are calculated once at the start. After finishing the spawner I made a quick and small UI to keep track of the score and the yet to be implemented top barrier. Then (what a suprise) I proceeded to create that barrier. Basically the boxes are not allowed to stack up and reach the barrier. Cause else the storage is full. That was also done quite fast and only got one iteration over the day, because I needed to keep track of multiple objects crossing the line.
The rest of day 1 I actually went ahead and prepared some basic models. Designing the general outline of the scene. The player was then fully designed, as well as the other boxes to kick off the shelf. Also made some texture variations using Substance to give it a bit of diversity.
That was it mostly for day 1.

## Day 2
Day 2 I started out by creating the power ups. As the core game was basically done I went ahead and used the time to implement this because I felt like there was enough time. There was, but I did realize I got a bit more hectic while coding, so some things are done a bit dirty now. So note to myself stay structured until the end :P. I proceeded to finalize the scene and added a manu and gameover scene. Also added some sounds I recoreded on the site using some old cardboard boxes I had lying around. Those also made it into the final build, so I got some sound going on. Background music/sound is sadly just some nice. I did attempt a few melodies, but I am just way to bad at making music. I tweaked a lot of the settings and added a few more things in some scripts to kinda 'polish' the whole experience. Finally I needed some camera movement and used Cinemachine for that. Worked out great. I like it so much that I also used it for one thing in the menu :). Did some lighting and also some post processing to give the game a nice look. Several hours before the submission I tried the first build which failed (oh no the horrors), but it was just due to some random asset I didnt even use. Removed it and the build went through! Tweaked some of the unity settings and done was a proper build with most settings already in place.

# Software Used:
|Use|Software|
|------|---|
|Engine|Unity|
|Models|Blender|
|Textures|Affinity Designer/Photo & Substance Designer|
|Audio|Audacity & Rytmik Studio|
|Scripts|Visual Studio Code|


# Build Updates (due to game breaking bugs)
- New version was uploaded due to a game breaking bug (see 2nd comment), causing the main game scene (not the menu) to be mostly black. This occured on chrome and any chrome related (i.e. Vivaldi) browser.

104996.name: HITMAN: The Floor Is Lava
104996.body:
**HITMAN: The Floor Is Lava** is a tile-based puzzle game where you must eliminate your targets without backtracking, stepping on tiles that you've already been on, or being shot in the face by guards!

![logo.png](///raw/6b3/d/z/16f15.png)

This is my second submission for the Ludum Dare, and lemme tell you: it was just as exciting to create as the first! I was really lost with the theme in this one. *Running Out of Space* gave me ideas about making some kind of illness-infested village where the player gradually gets overcrowded by sick villagers and it's a struggle to survive. Meanwhile, my friend suggested a runner game where the player would be trying to escape a collapsing mine: also running out of space. Lots of ideas were thrown around, but eventually I came up with a 2D hitman game where you could never step where you've already been, slightly inspired by HITMAN GO, and obviously by the HITMAN series of games. At first the game was meant to include the ability to poison your targets and set up traps, but after realizing the time constraints I chose to focus the game entirely around a simplified range of mechanics, and I think working within the limits of my own game when designing the levels was a very fun challenge on its own!

I really hope you enjoy the game as much as I loved making it, and can leave me some feedback while you're at it. Enjoy Ludum Dare 42, everyone!

105010.name: Zombies Hate Fire...
105010.body:
In this highly original zombie survival game you must stay alive long enough to get rescued, but that won't be easy as the rescue fire has also attracted the undead who will stop at nothing to eat your brains and put out the fire.

Controls
	* WASD to move around
	* Left click to fire an arrow
	* Right click to pick up material, crates, and barrels
	* Spacebar to jump

Goal: Survive long enough for the rescue meter to fill up. However, the zombies will continue to poor in and and take over the space. As they do, zombies will break away weak floor tiles to open up new avenues of attack.

To keep the zombies at bay you must fight them back with your bow and use lumber to barricade doors throughout the level.You can also distract a group of zombies by picking up crates and barrels and placing them near the zombies. 

You Lose: If the fire gets put out or you die

Up to 3 pieces of lumber can be used to barricade a door. The more lumber the stronger the barricade.

Additional wood will heal the barricade and the metal doors at the start of the level.

Wooden barricades can be passed through by the player making it easier to get around

While holding an item press the attack button ti push zombies back

Shoot zombies in the head for instant kill


![Capture1.PNG](///raw/fdf/8/z/17c50.png)

![Capture2.PNG](///raw/fdf/8/z/17c52.png)

![Capture3.PNG](///raw/fdf/8/z/17c53.png)

105011.name: Reso Crawler
105011.body:
The game where your health is the screen resolution! Crawl through a randomly generated dungeon, collecting weapons and fighting monsters on your way to explore every nook and cranny. Be careful: every hit you take reduces the screen's resolution, and before you know it you'll die blind as a bat!

Playable on computers with a monitor resolution of AT LEAST 800x800.

### CONTROLS
WASD/Arrow Keys ---> Movement
Space ---> Shoot/Open Chest/Interact

### GAMEPLAY
The goal of the game is to go through various dungeons. You can beat each dungeon by simply finding and opening all locked doors. However, you only begin with 3 keys, so you must find the rest keys scattered among chests in different rooms. Guarding these chests are enemies called the Jellycrabs, which will lunge towards you if you get too close. Every time they hit you, the screen's window will shrink causing limited visibility. Fortunately, chests may also contain healing potions (increasing window size), increased damage potions, and most importantly weapons to fight with. Explore as many dungeons as you can before you get killed!![ResoCrawler.png](///raw/567/z/16bf6.png)

105015.name: Chroma Jump
105015.body:
​Jump through the colorful world as the ground falls beneath you.

Controls:

Movement - WASD

Camera control - mouse

Jump - Spacebar

Restart level - R

![titleanim.gif](///raw/db8/1/z/17ae5.gif)

Programming - Justin Luong https://twitter.com/CraziGame

Art - Shaddo

Music - Justin Walker

105029.name: Auction Hoarder
105029.body:
Auction Hoarder is an auctioning simulator. 

You go into auction and see the pieces being displayed. If you feel like it's worth it, you can place an offer. If not, you can just skip the offer! People will be bidding against you the whole time, so make sure the item is really worth the price.

Once you got all the items that you wanted from the auction, it's time to bring them home. However, your garage has limited space! What will you have to sacrifice to fit everything in?

![Logo.PNG](///raw/764/e/z/16c15.png)

![ImprovedGraphicShowcase.gif](///raw/764/e/z/16c0b.gif)
![GarageImprovShowcase.gif](///raw/764/e/z/16c0f.gif)



**Instructions**

![TutorialImage.PNG](///raw/764/e/z/16d27.png)

(A) Money Available to waste in auction

(B) Button used to raise the offer after choosing a value

(C) Value that is going to be added to the offer once it is placed

(D) Unit to add to the Offer Value (Click on it to change) and +/- buttons to add/remove from the offer 

(E) Current value being offered for the artifact

(F) Timer until the bidding is over. Resets everytime someone bids

(G) Description of the Artifact

![GarageTutorialImage.PNG](///raw/764/e/z/16df0.png)

(A) Items bought in the auction. Click to show description and choose to get rid of them.

(B) Space occupied / Total space. If space occupied is bigger than the total space, click on the artifacts to get rid of them.

**PS:** Shoutout to my girlfriend who midway through the jam decided to give digital art a shot, so some of the assets in the game were made by her. In honor of that, I fit her face in some of the artifacts as a little easter egg :)

**Enjoy!**

105035.name: Robo Revolt
105035.body:
While cleaning during the night shift, robots start attacking! Fend them off with your trusty broom, but make sure you clean their remains or your path might be blocked.

My first ever Ludum Dare Compo game, hoping for the best!
![Screenshot1.PNG](///raw/187/31/z/16796.png)

![Screenshot2.PNG](///raw/187/31/z/1679a.png)

105038.name: Final Wave TD
105038.body:
Build towers to outlast the waves of enemies and water. Careful, submerged build points can't build towers, so build towers before the tide rises.  Don't forget to build some extractors, otherwise you will run out of resources.

This was the first Ludum Dare we've participated in.  We're brand new to Unity, so we're happy with how far we got with our entry.   Blender and Substance Painter/Designer were used for creating the assets.

![screen1.jpg](///raw/21a/91/z/1737d.jpg)![screen2.jpg](///raw/21a/91/z/1737e.jpg)

105045.name: CRAMMM: Totally Accurate Studying Simulator
105045.body:
It's time to crack the books HARD and attain the ultimate in academic dominance over your peers in a variety of subject such as Maths, Trumpology and Communism.

Keep the distractions out of your limited headspace by tossing out the stuff not relevant to the exam!

This time there's a zero-effort Android version that works pretty much perfectly! Woo! :D

![Crammm_007_combo.gif](///raw/48/z/177cc.gif)

![Crammm_003_toss.gif](///raw/48/z/163ed.gif)

105049.name: Manoeuvre kings
105049.body:
Reach the targets spots in fewer manoeuvres possible and/or in less time.
Commands : arrow keys, R to reset, N/P to change level, 1 to 3 to change cars.
![0.png](///raw/35a/91/z/1667c.png)
![3.png](///raw/35a/91/z/16685.png)

105052.name: Too Many Cats
105052.body:
Your cat started reproducing asexually, and you need to get rid of the cats before you run out of space in your house!

Each cat will have one or two traits, and each adopter will have one or two traits they will put up with. As long as the adopter will put up with the traits shown, they will adopt it for $100. 

If the cat has one trait, the adopter must have that trait as one of the two, or if the adopter has one trait, the cat must have that one of it's two.

105054.name: Personal Bubble
105054.body:
BUBBLES! BUBBLES! BUBBLES!

Dash through the skies as you compete among your bubble brothers. Be victorious and become bubble overlord! 
Inspired by games like Agar.io, Personal Bubble is a game in which you try to become the biggest bubble in the room Be careful though, the bigger you are the likelier you are to pop! Don't run out of space! 

(Post-Comp edit):

-made bubble slowdown smaller.

-turned down music volume.

Tools Used:- - - - - - - -

-Unity Engine

-Bosca-Ceol

-Oculus Medium,

-Google SketchUp

Personal Bubble is my first game jam project and I hope you enjoy it! 

![Menu.gif](///raw/d5a/91/z/163c0.gif)
![Gameplay.gif](///raw/d5a/91/z/163c2.gif)

105064.name: defrag/delete
105064.body:
![banner.jpg](///content/8b7/3/z/16033.jpg)

Your PC is almost out of drive space! Time to perform disk cleanup.
Place files of the same type next to each other, delete files you can afford to delete, and free up your hard drive space.

Playable in-browser or as a download executable.

-----

Made in GameMaker Studio 1.4, with art assets created in PhotoShop and Paint Tool Sai. Sounds are generated from the default system sounds.

105072.name: LandFall
105072.body:
The year is today.
Our glorious Nation is in dire need of resources.
Do your part. Take to the fields. And collect what you can!
But beware: other, less glorious nations will surely interfere. They may even try to take the resources!
Do. Not. Let. Them!

GLORY TO THE MOTHERLAND! GLORY TO HER PEOPLE!
        
                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
A little versus game made by our merry band of three.

Content not created by us:
-Menu and Game background music. This two songs are from the amazing people over at FreeMusicArchive.org![LandFallImage.png](///raw/d7a/91/z/17f04.png)
![Untitled2.png](///raw/d7a/91/z/17f10.png)

105073.name: It's not genocide if it's for the good.
105073.body:
The world is in overpopulation. You have been chosen to decide who will live and who will die for the sake of Earth. For that, you just have to choose and push a button. But be careful, find the right middle between killing and saving people are you will lose. 


Use the Left and Right Arrow to chose the button you want to push.

It's a solo project to see what I am capable of.
Hope you will have some fun :)

105091.name: FactoryManager
105091.body:
A game about building a factory and trying to deal with the side products.

Features:
- Mute button (working)
- Building (working somewhat)
- Crafting
- Making money
- Losing money
- Browser support

105113.name: Rockdown
105113.body:
Hey guys, here comes our new game, ROCKDOWN!! It's a story is about a alien which is sumoned inside a pyramid and as soon as he arrives, he triggers a trap that makes he run out of space! Now our little friend Purple Glob Bob needs too climb to the top​ of this pyramid in order to SURVIVE!

Please do help him in his mission ;)

Controls:
Z - Jump
X - Push blocks
R - Restart game
Esc - Quit game

Font Matchup Pro by Eeve Somepx : https://www.patreon.com/somepx​

Game created by: @illugion and @rebelloeric

105126.name: Postman
105126.body:
# a game about sorting boxes

### Avoid having too many boxes in the room, sort them correctly or lose!
![postman.png](///raw/e45/e/z/163cb.png)

105132.name: Save the sheep
105132.body:
After our first game ever participation in LD41, here we are with a second game submission for ludum dare 42 under the theme "running out of space". This is the result few hours of development, bugs are there, and the ideas aren't well implemented.

Save the sheep by taking them to the save zone.

Use WASD to move.

Left mouse button to grab and release a sheep.

The playable zone becomes smaller over the time.

105140.name: The Cave In
105140.body:
Finding yourself trapped in a small mine shaft deep below the surface, you realise you don't have much time. The ceiling is starting to collapse making this small room even smaller. You are running out of space and need to do something.

You realize you can use the <Arrow Keys> to Move around the cave, and even push the boulders around.

You had heard tales of this magical cave and its powers to make things disappear, perhaps I am the caves next victim and I will disappear. No, Let's stay positive. The tale mentioned something about if 4 boulders are perfectly aligned in a row they will vanish right before your eyes. Although not every boulder will work the same way.

In a burst of self-motivating monologue, you remind yourself that someone will come for you, You just need to survive long enough. Even if they can't get down to you right away, they may be able to assist with dynamite!

![TheCaveIn_ScreenShot1.JPG](///raw/dcd/71/z/16118.jpg)

![TheCaveIn_ScreenShot3.JPG](///raw/dcd/71/z/1611c.jpg)

![TheCaveIn_ScreenShot4.JPG](///raw/dcd/71/z/1611f.jpg)

## Some Goals For My First LDJam

- [x] Complete an actual game
- [x] Create art that is not just a white square (using a new free-to-use online tool, stay away from photoshop)
- [x] Include background music (learn how to make music)
- [x] Include sound effects (learn how to make sound effects)
- [x] Save high score data - persist
- [x] Write a backstory
- [ ] Record Dialogue
- [ ] Create a bunch of different boulder types (only got to two, wanted more)

## Tools Used:

- Unity 2018.2.3f1
- https://www.pixilart.com - For the art
- Bosca Ceoil - for the music
- Bfxr - for the sound effects

## Github Source Code

https://github.com/JElbourne/LudumDare42

105141.name: Space Balls
105141.body:
You're an astronaut searching for your one true star. Run in and out of space, and use gravity to your advantage as you platform from level to level. 

![2SiMdLS2.png](///raw/3aa/91/z/18508.png)

Programming:
https://www.twitch.tv/shafournee

Art:
https://www.twitch.tv/bosscoffeecake

Music:
https://soundcloud.com/causticcrow
https://soundcloud.com/ambivalen

105145.name: Courier Panic!
105145.body:
https://youtu.be/SPt6k3exPgA

**NOTICE:** ***This is a difficult game, with a unique control scheme you're probably not used to. If you can, please take some time to read the instructions from the main menu.***


Courier Panic! is a top-down arcade game about being a parcel delivery driver. You have limited space on your truck for pickups, and a time limit before your shift ends. It may sound easy, but you lose money for every car you smash into, and it just happens to be rush hour! See how much money you can make (or lose!) before the end of the day!

The theme is incorporated in a few ways. For one, you have limited space on your truck for pickups. No-brainer. Two, there are a LOT of cars on the road, and the roads themselves are fairly narrow, giving you very limited space to move around. And on a smaller level, you've got to stop to pick up/drop off packages, so you need to time your stops carefully and not run out of space to stop.

Music and sound effects were made by my good friend, picoVolt. I like to call him "the Dark Lord of the Synth". <Link to his stuff here if he wants to show it off>

105154.name: Office Panic!
105154.body: Last night you were going to print a large document, but when you were fiddling around with the settings you made a grave mistake and printed one word per page. Now you have to erase all the words, but the printer is still printing paper, flooding your desk. How many words can you erase before your worktable is completely flooded?

105157.name: Data Escape by Maxialstar (first ever LD and first ever solo game!)
105157.body:
![Promo_2.jpg](///raw/d74/81/z/17fa6.jpg)

Hiya! This is my first ever Ludum Dare and this is also my first solo game I've done (both art and programming).  The result has been a bit rushed in order to meet the deadline and thankfully I have finished +-2 hours ahead of the deadline. 

Gotta be honest: The game is *crap*. This was mostly done for fun and give myself a challenge over the weekend. I got an idea from the theme and I did it (to some degree, stuff was cut, including a narrative to explain the context of the game), so I can rest assured that I did it and I did on time. 

Things I would change: - The visuals, I wish I could've worked on the visuals more, I feel it's a part that also needs polish, but I wanted to get the working product, the gameplay because that was my weakest point since I pretty much I don't have a background doing programming, so that was my Nº1 priority.

The gameplay - Thing is, when you die in the game, the object gets fully destroyed and I was trying to figure out (even asked a friend, who lended me a hand to figure out stuff in the later part of the jam) how to stop it from moving + displaying a death screen UI, and since I couldn't, I just ended up doing a restart level button you can see in the top right corner, which I do not like, but it has it's purpose. And I almost didn't also get that to work on time, but I did!

But in the end, I loved doing this, I knew this would be fun. I just wish I had prepared more code beforehand to implement  and work with and have a better understanding of C#.


So yeah, nothing much else to say. The game is available from itch.io in the link below!

Greetings!

105161.name: Shipping Error
105161.body: A puzzle game where you eventually run out of space

105167.name: Export Corp.
105167.body:
### What is this game? :video_game: 

This game is about arranging blocks and export them.

### Basic Controls

:mouse_three_button: Left Click: Select block

:mouse_three_button: (While Block is selected) Right Click: Destroy Block

:mouse_three_button: (While Block is selected) Left Click: Place Block

:mouse_three_button: Wheel Button or :keyboard: "W": skip Current Day/Night

:keyboard: R: Restart game

:keyboard: M: Mute BGM

:keyboard: P or Esc: Pause


### Screenshots
more screenshots on [itch.io page](https://r3c0d3r.itch.io/export-corp)
![scr10.png](///raw/cf5/21/z/15cc9.png)

105174.name: Edge of Abyss
105174.body: Edge of the Abyss is a quick town builder game that was made for Ludum Dare 42. The entire game takes place on the edge of the titular abyss that is constantly pulling your town to its doom. You'll need to think fast, build fast and occasionally throw half the town into the void to make room for new buildings.

105194.name: Exhaustion
105194.body:
Exhaustion is a collectible card game made for Ludum Dare 42. The theme was "Running out of Space," so to fit that theme, you are slowly becoming exhausted in battle, and as a result, you are running out of space for cards in your hand. You must act quickly, or exhaustion will render you almost useless in combat. There is a tutorial in-game, so go ahead and jump right in!
We're making a post-mortem too! If you want to see how this game was made, subscribe to The Koala Squad on YouTube​​​ and watch for the notification!

Cheers!
 - The Koala Squad

105201.name: Crispy's Planetary Survival
105201.body:
Hello,

This time we're working together as a team of 3, all just finished our first year of Gametechnology in University.

Our game is about the earth (or one of the other 2 playable 'characters') which is being sucked up by a black hole. You have to evade Spacerocks and even other planets to get to jumpboosts which let you get further away from the blackhole.

There are 2 powerups in the game: the jumpboost (which lets you jump away from the blackhole, destroying every rock and planet you touch in your path) and the shield (which shields you for 3 seconds from any rocks and planets).

It's an endless game, with slightly increasing difficulty overtime, and different difficulties per character. The goal is to get a score as high as possible. You get points for every second survived, and for every rock/planet destroyed with your shield/jump. If you destroy multiple rocks/planets in a single jump, you get a score multiplier for that jump. Jumps can be chained (with a bit of skill and a lot of luck!).

Hope you enjoy ^.^

105234.name: Introvert vs. Extrovert
105234.body:
![title_640.jpg](///raw/01b/91/z/16bb1.jpg)

The ultimate personality clash. EXTROVERTS draw energy from crowds, while INTROVERTS lose it!

Choose your identity, then battle it out with you ideological opposite. INTROVERTS gain energy when alone and lose energy when surrounded by others; EXTROVERTS are the opposite.

DASH in and out of your safe space. DROP barriers to corral the crowds (and your opponent!). Collect powerups ranging from your trusty cellphone to books to beer, the all-important social lubricant!

![gameplay0_640.jpg](///raw/01b/91/z/16bbd.jpg)

CONTROLS:

Player 1

MOVE: W A S D

DASH: R

DROP Barriers: E

Player 2

MOVE: O K L ;

DASH: U

DROP Barriers: I

![gameplay1_640.jpg](///raw/01b/91/z/16bc4.jpg)

BEER makes INTROVERTS tolerate crowds better, and gives EXTROVERTS more energy.

BOOKS make EXTROVERTS tolerate solitude better, and give INTROVERTS more energy.

COFFEE makes it cheaper to DASH for both INTROVERTS and EXTROVERTS.

EXTROVERTS use the PHONE to call in more friends! INTROVERTS use it to force more friends to leave.

![gameover_640.jpg](///raw/01b/91/z/16bcb.jpg)

105244.name: The Infinite Hotel
105244.body:
LD42. Ludum Dare number 12, for me. I'll admit, I nearly forgot about this one, causing it to become a 24-hour challenge. Nevertheless, here is my complete (no music) entry, all prepared for you to (hopefully) enjoy!

In this entry, you are managing a hotel during a busy tourist season. Your whole business revolves around your guests' reviews on popular fictional travel website 'journeyassistant'. If your guests are satisfied, they'll leave you with a positive review. However, if the crowds of tourists flooding into your hotel can't get a room, as your hotel will be constantly RUNNING OUT OF SPACE, they'll leave you a negative review. Enough of those, and you'll be out of business!

Expand your hotel by adding floors, hire plenty of staff, and hopefully, all of your guests will leave satisfied!

The game is entirely mouse driven, and you can use the scroll wheel when your hotel starts to grow larger. If you don't have a mouse wheel, the UP and DOWN arrow keys also work.

The game has quite a slow start, but after about 5 minutes or so, it should start to pick up and become more interesting. Either way, this is supposed to be more of a chill, run-in-the-background game.

And yes, the hotel can technically be built up infinitely (although some code changes will need to be made for that, I didn't have quite enough time to implement true infinity).

No music again this time (I only had 24 hours!), so plug in your favourite tunes, sit back, relax, and enjoy my game!

Thanks!

105272.name: Stop Climate Change!
105272.body:
# Play
## Online: [Play online](https://danielerdmann.itch.io/stop-climate-change)
## Windows: [Download](https://danielerdmann.itch.io/stop-climate-change)
## Android: [Google Play](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.danielerdmann.stopclimatechange)
## iOS: [App Store (in review)](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/stop-climate-change)

# Description
Stop Climate Change is a satirical game about the consequences of global warming in the antartic environment. You are a penguin on a melting ice floe . You have to fight against other penguins for the remaining and slowly shrinking space. You can walk on the slippery surface and use jump attacks to kick other penguin out of the platform. Only the most adapted penguins will remain and adaption means, be the last one on the floe. The game was created during the 48 hour game jam ludum dare 42.

The political message behind this: Stop the climate change! It is real! The penguins are running out of space, their habitat is vanishing! If you want to donate to a penguin preservation organisation, I would recommend you [this](https://penguin.birdlife.org/us/) one. 

# Controls
- Walk: WASD / Arrows
- Attack: Space / Mouseklick

# Trailer
https://youtu.be/bNGdzsql7Dk

105303.name: Out of Inventory Space!
105303.body:
![Out of Inventory Space!_menuscreen.png](///raw/926/z/16da9.png)

# Out of Inventory Space

A simple board game that takes you on a 4 man adventure around the castle. You will uncover various treasures and monsters! Due to your scrawny arms and small backpack you can only bring 3 things with you. Try to be the player with the most gold at the end of the last round!


## Instructions:
Similar to most board games you roll a dice to determine how far you can move and draw from card decks to determine what happens on the tile you land on. The cards are auto-drawn when you land on the tile.

> Red tiles are for Encounters, when you end your turn there you draw an Encounter card. (fights, buffs, rest)

> Brown tiles are for Treasure, when you end your turn there you draw a Treasure card. (items)

> White tile is the shop, this is where you sell items you accumulate for some extra gold.

## Controls

Use mouse to interact with the game

Left click for buttons

Right click (hold) + move mouse to look around

Mouse wheel to zoom in and out a bit.​



**Note: To the strict compo judges, please refer to Build2_NoAudio if you want to play without Audio, or just turn off your audio for that browser tab. I have opted out of Audio judging. Audio assets are by [Kevin MacLeod](http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Kevin_MacLeod/)**

105349.name: Scaling Up
105349.body:
![Title.png](///raw/5d3/z/16b23.png)

Congratulations dragon, you've been nominated for best horde by Better Crypts and Caverns; the only problem is, you don't have much of a horde, and well as much as you'd like to have one, you're running out of space.  But let's be a sensible dragon here; If you can't stuff more stuff in your horde, try swapping out some items for better ones at the local monster swap meet.  Better hurry though, you only have 5 days before the editors will be here to judge your horde.

The gameplay is pretty simple, you need to swap items with other monsters by exploiting their likes an dislikes.  Some things are obvious (demons like cursed items), but others are less obvious.  You can talk to monsters to learn more about that monster and others.  Additionally, you are a magic creature and can get a perk each day to help you with swapping or to magically enhance what you have.

Controls:
Directional buttons or digital pad on controller to move around menus
Space or A Button on controller to select the currently highlighted option or to advance text.

Constructive Criticize is always encouraged, and if you complete the game, let me know your final score.  The theoretical Max is 1,650,000.

![Screenshot1.png](///raw/5d3/z/16b25.png)
![Screenshot2.png](///raw/5d3/z/16b26.png)

P.S. 
Because of enormous amount of unoptimized CPU particles WebGL version lags on Galaxy select view.
If it is possible try Windows Standalone version.

105391.name: Astropocalypse
105391.body:
# Astropocalypse!

  https://youtu.be/PVT1v0mpf5I

**It's time to save outer space!** Gray goo has infested the solar system and is rapidly eating up every planet. Your job is to stop it!

Pilot a nimble ship around the universe, gunning down asteroids and enemy ships that impede your progress. Travel from planet to planet in search of "Escape" tanks that will help you defeat the goo. But hurry, the more you linger, the more the goo will spread, and the less planets you will have to visit!

This game does have an ending, with a thrilling conclusion! In fact, I'll lend you in on a secret: You don't need to get the "Escape" tanks to get to the ending (but they do help you). Can you beat it?


## Controls:


| Key        | Action           |
| ------------- |:-------------:|
| Up / Down     | Thrust forwards or backwards |
| Left / Right      | Turn Left or Right     |
| A / D | Strafe Left or Right. **Double Tap** for a quick dash      |
| W | Fire Machine Gun      |
| Tab | Open up Big map (see entire solar system)      |
| Space | Engage hyperdrive! (If your hyperdrive is loaded, that is.)      |
| Ctrl | (Optional) Space Brakes      |


## Screenshots:
![PlanetRise.png](///raw/66f/2/z/16a10.png)

![Hyper Drive Baby.png](///raw/66f/2/z/16a33.png)

![Big Map.png](///raw/66f/2/z/16a41.png)

![Danger Zone.png](///raw/66f/2/z/16a46.png)

## Known issues:

If your monitor refresh rate is greater than 60Hz, the HTML5 game will run way faster than its intended speed. I'll try and patch that up, but in the meantime if you have this problem you'll have to use the Windows Download.

105466.name: Astronaughty
105466.body:
# Astronaughty

![Astronaughty's cover image](///content/7a1/91/z/1703f.png "Cover Art")

Run as far as you can from the emerging black hole in this love oriented space arcade shooter.

My project entry for Ludum Dare 42, the Compo.





# Windows

1. Download [this](https://gitlab.com/0rganic/astronaughty.love/blob/master/distribution/windows/astronaughty.zip "For Windows") file

2. Extract the ZIP file

3. Run "astronaughty.exe"

# Linux

1. Download [this](https://gitlab.com/0rganic/astronaughty.love/blob/master/distribution/linux/astronaughty.love "For Linux") file

2. Open the terminal in the directory where the file is located

3. Enter the following command in the terminal: ```love astronaughty.love```

# macOS

* Download [this](https://gitlab.com/0rganic/astronaughty.love/blob/master/distribution/macOS/astronaughty.zip "For macOS") file...rest I'm not so sure due to lack of knowledge...but I tried to follow the official steps to package the game

I don't have a lot of experience with macOS, so I think you should read the official guide yourself

* Follow the instructions: https://love2d.org/wiki/Game_Distribution#Creating_a_Mac_OS_X_Application

If you want to follow the process yourself, you can use the [Linux](https://gitlab.com/0rganic/astronaughty.love/blob/master/distribution/linux/astronaughty.love) downloadable file to make the macOS application yourself






# Controls:

* "Space" to send love

* "E" to spray hearts

* "M" to mute/unmute the game

* "Escape" to quit the game

# Libraries used:

* ["class"](https://github.com/rxi/classic "GitHub repository and its author")

* ["fps"](https://github.com/bjornbytes/tick "GitHub repository and its author")

* ["tick"](https://github.com/rxi/tick "GitHub repository and its author")

# Tools used:

105481.name: Quadrata Minima
105481.body:
![Quadrata Minima Cover Shot.jpg](///raw/893/d/z/17412.jpg)

I love this theme. All I could envision was a match three with an ever shrinking play area. To keep it fun, it starts out fairly simple (3 dots, 3 colors), but it gets harder each level (max 5 dots and 8 colors). As it stands, this all me. I designed the game, wrote the code, made the 3D and 2D art, and just for giggles this time I made all my own sounds using nothing but my mouth, an African drum, and a Logitech headset with Audacity. However, since sounds are really a matter of taste, there is a full customization menu to turn of any or all the sounds. You can even reset the local high score.

Tomorrow is the first day of Back to School for teachers like me, so I won't be working any more on this tomorrow unless I get off a bit early on the first day. If I do, I will try to implement worldwide leader boards using Dreamlo. I have used it before, but it has been a while. Besides, I need to get familiar with it again so I can show my students how to use it. :^)

So in case I don't get back to this before the deadline, I give you Quadrata Minima (Latin for Minimal Square). I hope you have fun playing it, because I had a blast making it! Enjoy!

105566.name: Civilisation Afloat
105566.body:
Civilisation Afloat is a City Building Game set on a tiny floating island! The island will shrink as you mine it for the resources you need to grow and build your massive sky-scrapers. This is my first Game Jam and Ludum Dare, it was difficult to call something so unfinished and unpolished... finished. But here we go!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ETsXW6NciE8

![screenie.png](///raw/d5c/91/z/164dd.png)

Made in under 48 hours for Ludum Dare 42 (Compo), "Running out of Space"

**Instructions**
WASD or Arrow Keys to Move Camera

R to reset Selection, Click in-line with diagonal rows to select and view one row at a time.

**Tips**

- **Civilian Housing** - Produces Population, At the end of each day you will receive money based on how high your population is. Requires **food** to survive.
- **Food Production** - Produces Food, costs Power and Currency to run, must be placed on a **Powered Tile**.
- **Food Storage** - Increases max storage of **Food** and increases the production of nearby **Food Production** Buildings
- **Power Generators** - Produces Power, must be placed on a **Powered Tile**

- **Tower Extension** - Increases max height of towers.
- **Tile Expansion** - Allows you to create a new Tile

The following can only be placed on a **Ground Tile**.

- **Power Supply** - This **Powers the Tile**, which allows you to place **Food Production** and **Power Generator** buildings on top of it.
- **Resource Miner** - This will mine the tile of its resources, once depleted that Tile and all buildings placed on it 
will be destroyed.
- **Bank** - Increases Maximum Supply of Currency/Money

 
The Coloured Squares down the bottom are your building selection buttons (believe it or not). Clicking on them will give you a rundown of what they do.

Basic concept = Population need food, food require power, power require resources/money

**Tools Used**

 - Visual Studio Code
 - Reaper/Kontakt 5

**Change Log**  (Post deadline bug-fixes as per Rules)
- Fixed resource bug (food and power will no longer go below 0)
- Creating a new Tile of land where an old one was mined out will no longer create a new tile with 0 available resources.

105597.name: ShipIt
105597.body:
From your crappy shipping company, you daydream about somewhere you'd rather be....like a cruise.  Time to make it happen.  Save up enough cash to buy the essentials you need for your dream cruise, all while actually improving the shipping company that you work at.  Though be mindful of the screenspace, there's only so much to go around, and the UI seems...stubborn.  

All controlled from your mouse, use the 2 panels (bottom and right side) to both create income and spend it on upgrades/cruise items while dealing with the fact that each item hogs the screen, causing things to need to be moved around in order to get things done.  Also note that any cruise items you buy, while getting you more upgrades and closer to the end, are on the screen until the end of the game.  You gotta longingly stare at all that sunscreen you bulk purchased, right?

105639.name: Into the Light
105639.body:

A Lightbulb moves its way to each tunnel that's created.

![Capture1.PNG](///raw/6ac/91/z/16e69.png)



![Capture3.PNG](///raw/6ac/91/z/16e6d.png)

I did it! Stayin awake for more then 25 hours is worth it. Buggy, but this was a little bit overly ambitious on my part. Pulled an all nighter to make this ;_;! The art and animations I feel like were really good and there were still a lot of things I wanted to change about it. But oh well. Gave it my best shot.

My first Ludum Dare by the way :D

Things I've used to create this:

* Game Engine: Game Maker Studio 2
* Music and Sfx: Audacity/Soundtrap
* Art: Aesprite/In-Game Maker Art Plugin

105640.name: Closing In: Barney's Daring Escape
105640.body:
![2018-08-12 18_24_28-Mesen - ld42_space.png](///raw/e58/2/z/16bf0.png)

Closing in is a new game for the original Nintendo Entertainment System.

You are Barney, a dog in a world that is running out of space. An unknown power is swallowing the world whole, and to survive you have to move! 

Rumor has it there are scientists that can reverse the damage with Vacuum Stabilizer parts. But, the world is collapsing beneath your feet, so you must travel quickly while collecting them. 

Can you make it out alive?

PS: The web-based emulator isn't that good. If you know how, please download the ROM and play it on an NES emulator, such as [Mesen](https://www.mesen.ca/) or [FCEUX](http://www.fceux.com/).

## Controls

A Button (Z): Talk

Directional Pad (Arrow Keys): Move

Start (Enter): Pause

## Changelog

### [Initial Release](https://s3.amazonaws.com/ld42-space/master/ld42_space.20.nes) (#20)
- Game release :)

### [Bugfix Release](https://s3.amazonaws.com/ld42-space/master/ld42_space.21.nes) (#21)
- Close off a section of the 7th map where you could walk out - this could trigger a corruption or a crash

![2018-08-12 18_25_42-Mesen - ld42_space.png](///raw/e58/2/z/16bf5.png)

105769.name: Bay Area Traffic: Disaster Simulator
105769.body:
![logo_resize_1920x1080.png](///raw/f35/6/z/173b7.png)

This is our attempt at submitting something for Ludum Dare! It was an awesome learning experience and tons of fun, we look forward to participating again in December :) Even though we did not finish (or really even get to making) a game, we have the basis of a prototype for an interesting city-builder/disaster-management game that we will build upon moving forward.

# The Dream
Bay Area Traffic: Disaster Simulator was intended to be a game about managing traffic, resources, and people as ocean levels continue to rise and threaten the Bay Area. The game would begin with a normal simulation, but rising water would begin to flood and then destroy city tiles, killing all the residents unless you successfully evacuate them to another, safer location in time. As time progressed, you would be forced to make decisions about which cities to save, where to send your emergency evac crews, and where to spend your resources to most efficiently improve the flow of traffic. Meanwhile, citizens would go about their normal daily life, oblivious to the crisis at hand. By the end of the game, most tiles would be flooded and you would be scored based on how many people you saved.

# Reality
Unfortunately, these were just dreams. The current game is merely a tech demo, featuring a procedurally generated Bay Area with a functioning traffic prototype.

# Controls

## WASD / Arrow Keys - Pan Camera
## Mouse Scrolls Wheel - Zoom Camera
## Mouse Click - Select cars

105779.name: Evil Forest Battle
105779.body:
You are a wizard, and the village needs you! The evil forest is expanding at a terrifying rate, threatening to consume all available space, and you must use your spells to stop it.

Screenshots:

![2018-08-13-0223_FinalGameplay.png](///raw/a4e/01/z/1745b.png)

![2018-08-13-0318_Spells.png](///raw/a4e/01/z/1746e.png)

![2018-08-13-0228_LevelSelect.png](///raw/a4e/01/z/17461.png)

**How to play:**

- Cast spells by clicking on one of the evil trees
- Use the buttons at the bottom of the screen to choose which of the six elements to use
- Evil trees are immune to their same colored element, so choose wisely!
- Collect magic orbs of each element as you cast magic
- Upgrade your spells to damage more tiles at once

**Development Notes:**

This was built as an experiment using ReactJS, and due to time constraints wasn't able to do anything fancy with the visuals or include any animations or sounds. It also would've been nice to be able to explore the balancing and level progression more, and in retrospect I probably should've chosen something simpler for a single-weekend project.

105809.name: Cactus Madness!
105809.body:
With a restricted time (about 31 hours) we ended up changing the game from what we originally intended and finished up early cause of other IRL plans. We originally planned to make an story based futuristic RPG, with robots and androids (NPC) with each having a side quests, multiple areas (City, Wasteland), lots of trash (each area with it own set of trash, was gonna be very trashy, lol) etc.
This will probably be a minigame in the full version with another name, which we will finish up at an later date. More art was made but not added this time around. (Hope to add that in for the full version) but at least we managed to upload something!

For this theme we ended up making it an tilted 2D game. 
How to play: 
Simple, you move around with arrow keys:

Up ↑	
Down ↓	
Right →	
Left ←	
or W, S, A, D

Objective:
You play as the main character, Zero (and only one for now, lol) and have have to go around with his classywalk (lol) and gather as much orbs (points!) as possible, while trying to avoid the cacti. The sign gives no damage, so feel free to pass trough it. It will get harder to to as the space fills up with them (as seen in the pictures below). You can pass trough the cactus, but be aware that you will lose some HP! The bottle restores HP sightly. The Blue Orb give 10 points while the purple on, 100.

Cactus - Damage/Lose HP

Sign - No Damage

Bottle - Restores HP Sightly

Blue Orb - 10 points

Purple Orb - 100 points

![153406426633200587.jpg](///raw/12f/11/z/15d06.jpg)



Have fun, and would be nice to get some feedback and possibly ideas for both this minigame and the full game, memes references are welcome if you got an idea related to that, as well as items and characters and story related to them that might fit the setting >.O

*We will put your name in the credits if we end up using your idea. >.O

And feel free to share your score in the comment section, would be nice to know how everyone did! ( ᐛ )و

To Do: Complete city + possibly make 2 more city areas, NPCs (4 robots, 2 types from each gen), complete heroine, 3 extra NPCs for side quest ++ maybe more later, feel free to give idea for thing to make to.





NOTE: As good as everything is created from scratch, exluding the music, which is by Miyuu (Royalty Free). We hope you enjoy this minigame! C:
And for those wondering the game is made in gamemaker and art is drawn by hand.![153406432753618684.jpg](///raw/12f/11/z/15d07.jpg)

Looking forward to your comments. Thank you.

105829.name: Kessler Syndrome
105829.body:
An asteroidsalike about too much junk in space!


## Story
The buildup of debris from repeated launches is causing a hazard for other space traffic. You have been assigned to keep the debris under control as more and more vessels are launched.

## Instructions
Use your ship to collect space debris before it collides and spawns more, smaller pieces.

You will be paid for each piece of junk you safely deorbit.

You are not permitted to deorbit radioactive junk as no-one wants the planet to glow in the dark.

You can mute the music with M, and the sound effects with N. Press ESC to return to the main menu.

You can control your ship with WSAD or the arrow keys. SHIFT fires thrusters to bring you to a halt.

You can activate equipment either by the hotkeys or by clicking on it in the menu. You can purchase new equipment, additional inventory space or ship upgrades by clicking on them in the menu. Mouseover a piece of equipment to see more details.

You can jettison a piece of junk from the inventory by clicking on it. Collect junk by flying in to it. If you have no inventory space available, you will take damage and cause the junk to shatter.

Try and stop junk building up to the point where a collision can set off a chain reaction.

The game ends when you run out of hull integrity due to repeated collisions.

How long can you last? (My top was 7:52)


## Tools Used
- Unity
- Visual Studio 2017
- Gimp
- Blender
- FreeCAD
- Piskel
- Audacity
- sfxr
- Audiotool

105830.name: SERL: Space Empires RogueLike
105830.body:
The galaxy is a small place, filled with lots of hostile nations, each trying to conquer the galaxy as well. Will you be the one to conquer all?

The game is a real time pauseable space strategy game built with roguelike themes. Colonise planets, build ships, attack enemies until you are the sole empire left in the galaxy, which is random each time. Everything is keyboard control, though you can use a mouse on the buttons on the various menus.

A space themed strategy roguelike(like). ![devpic4.PNG](///raw/26d/91/z/17c75.png) ![devpic6.PNG](///raw/26d/91/z/17c67.png)![devpic7.PNG](///raw/26d/91/z/17c6e.png)

Ranbling blog post mortem:
https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/serl-space-empires-roguelike/first-ld-done

105850.name: Geobreak
105850.body:
![Desktop Screenshot 2018.08.12 - 23.34.41.38.png](///raw/5bb/2/z/173a7.png)
![Desktop Screenshot 2018.08.12 - 23.54.34.75.png](///raw/5bb/2/z/173ba.png)
![Desktop Screenshot 2018.08.12 - 23.54.49.51.png](///raw/5bb/2/z/173bb.png)

Destroy geometric oddities while avoiding the closing walls.

HOW TO PLAY:

The arena is composed of four walls with a nexus in the center. Depending on certain statistics, the walls close in and recede.

TOP WALL - closes when player is hit by explosion

LEFT WALL - closes when player shoots

BOTTOM WALL - closes when nexus takes damage

RIGHT WALL - doesn't close

Survive the tenth wave to win.




OTHER DETAILS:

I had very little time to devote to this game, so expect many bugs, less gameplay, and no sound. I only had the time to create up to ten waves, but it's still enjoyable nonetheless.

Unfortunally we ran out of time a little bit, so this is only a beta-version and if you like it we're going to revise the game and develope a complete version. In fact there aren't much features but we have really big plans, so maybe you can write a comment with offers of things you think that can make our game better. 

Description of the game:

Sinking island is a game in that you - the player - are the leader of the catastrophic managment of a little island that get's flooded by tsunami waves and you have to protect and evacuate the people on it. But pay attention to the people because they aren't... really intelligent.

Our plans: 
Sounds (we have sounds but we had no time to add them, we only added a main menu soundtrack)
You can buy additional rescue helicopters
blood effects...


PS.: Sorry if our English is bad, because we're from Austria and many words are from google translate. :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes:

105984.name: Bookbinding
105984.body:
![Untitled-2.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/16ce2.png)

Like that of any good bibliophile, your bookshelf seems to fill up on its own. Mash titles together to create strange new books -- books with titles so bad that you can finally bear to get rid of them. Comment with your best ones!

**Left/Right arrow keys:** select books

**Hold Z while moving:** swap adjacent books

**Hold X while moving:** bind adjacent books

**Enter:** confirm your anagram

**Escape:** cancel your anagram

A new book comes in each time the hand on the clock goes around. You can press Enter to add one yourself.

![ss1.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/16bca.png)

![ss4.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/16de5.png)

![ss5.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/16ef4.png)

Done in Unity/C#. Also used FL Studio, Audacity, Photoshop, and Illustrator. Recorded the sound effects by thumping some books together. Thanks to Kevin Atkinson for the parts-of-speech index, C.J. Kimberlin for the easing functions, and Peter Norvig for the compilation of the one-third-of-one-million most common English words.

106033.name: René in outer space
106033.body:
# René in outer space



![screen.png](///raw/edd/91/z/180fe.png)




## René needs your help !

The universe is collapsing, space is running out and René needs to escape.  
Use your navigation skills to help René survive as long as possible.

## Navigate through space

Press WASD (or click on the keyboard to switch to ZQSD) to move René  
Press the space bar to use the bonuses in your inventory

## Avoid harm

The vacuum not only attracts you, but also asteroids and other space hazards.  
Try not to hit them or they will push René to his doom !

IndestructiBalls (blue shield spheres) won't be affected by gravity or any other variable, don't mess with them.  
TrackingBalls (red shield spheres) work the same but also have an unexplainable attraction towards René, be sure to gather vertical speed to get through their control.

## Use some help

### Collect stardust

At a regular pace, stardust will be attracted towards the vacuum.  
If René eats it, he'll be able to use some pretty handy powers.

### But there's a catch !

Each time René eats stardust, he'll inflate and take more and more space on screen.  
René's elasticity has a limit and he won't be able to retain more than 3 units of stardust.

### Catch all you can

Do not miss on stardust, if it gets vacuumed,
universe's collapse will speed up and bigger elements will be attracted.  
You cannot collect anymore stardust with a full belly, think ahead to not let it go to waste.

### Use some powerfull abilities

Three powerups are at your disposal, The bigger you are using them, the stronger they are.  
Choose wisely when to use them for maximum effect !  
Do not forget that only asteroids can be destroyed and other space objects won't be affected by powers.

#### Green stardust

-**Small René** will shoot an energy pellet in a straight line, breaking the first meteor it will encounter.  
-**Medium René** will shoot three energy pellets in a steady spread.  
-**Big René** will shoot a powerful laser straight ahead, destroying every single meteor on its way.

#### Blue stardust

-**Small René** will slow down time for asteroids, leaving them easier to avoid until gravity pulls them again.  
-**Medium René** will stop time for asteroids during 4 seconds, after that, they will move exactly like they used to.  
-**Big René** will bend time and space to space out new hazards' arrivals.

#### Violet stardust

-**Small René** will spin intensely until stopped by an object. His spinning speed will break an asteroid.  
-**Medium René** will spin and lunge towards the right end of the screen, he will go through any item, breaking all  
 asteroids on his way.  
-**Big René** will firmly spin through any item, for 4 seconds without stopping.

#### Grey stardust

Nothing magical about this dust, only stomach pain. Its only use is to fill René up to use other powerups at their best.
Do not forget to use it quickly as it does not have any use as is.

## Note on the jam

I made everything myself, using JS and Phaser 3.  
It was the first time for me using this lib and, although I did not understand everything in the making of this game,  
it has been a pleasure to use.

I've been wanting to participate into Ludum Dare for a while and I'm glad to do it for the first time.  
Been passionate about game making for a while now but rarely finished a satisfying project.  
Now I can proudly say that it is the case here.

I used audacity and a mic to do all the sound and bgm.  
I used Gimp and a graphic tablet for the art (not a big drawer but I know a few tricks)

The font used for the cover image is named "Potra" and can be found here :  
https://www.dafont.com/potra.font

106041.name: Crowded at the runway
106041.body:
![screen.PNG](///raw/0e3/z/160e9.png)
It's getting crowded at the runway!

As the air control it's your job to safely guide the ever increasing number of planes to the runway.

Use your cursor and left mouse button to control and land planes keeping them from colliding with eachother.

Don't forget you can change the game speed with the number keys on the keyboard.

Made with C++ and SFML 2.5.

Most probably have it, but nevertheless requires the Visual Studio 2017 runtime: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=746572

Landing troubleshooting in case someone needs it:

Keep the left mouse button held down and make sure to pass the beginning of the runway, when successful the path will turn cyan and you won't control the plane anymore.

### CLAUSTRO is small puzzle arcade game about fear. The aim of the game is to place as may words as possible before you run out of space. Feel free to show us your high-score (press 'R' to display)!

106073.body:
Running out of S.P.A.C.E. is a text adventure, written in inform7. I tried doing that sort of thing briefly around ten years ago, and I decided to give it another go for my first ldjam.

It's playable on the web, or you can download the gblorb file and play using your preferred glulx interpreter.

There are no graphics or audio in this game, so I opted out of those categories.

(added post-submission) For those who haven't played this sort of thing before, there's a very nice short introduction at http://pr-if.org/doc/play-if-card/play-if-card.pdf . Next time I'll remember to include a help command!

106079.name: Super LD42
106079.body:
This is heavily inspired by Space Invaders, Breakout, Yar's Revenge, Galaga, a touch of DoDonPachi (not really) and Space Megaforce. The idea is to help your 'friends' in the diamond-shaped escape vessel MacGuffin to escape from some extremely generic space baddies in an interstellar space race. There was only time to build the first level... but thats at least something. Also: Lots of particle effects.

Severely lacking: Balance... It starts out very difficult but gets super easy quick.

## Gameplay Tip 1:
### Charge your power [multiplier] by killing [small enemies], then you can hurt the bigger ones... but beware: multiplier drops when you don't kill quickly. So keep a balance between focusing small and big enemies!

## Gameplay Tip 2:
### Always shooting makes it harder. Let small enemies spawn in number, then kill a mass of them to boost your power multiplier.

![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 01.04.42.png](///raw/24e/1/z/16f1e.png)

![superld42.gif](///raw/24e/1/z/16fe4.gif)

### Post submission Updates:
- Fixed a bug with the RNG
- Added a HTML5 build
- Addad a version with improved visual signifiers. Should make the game more accessible.

### Ongoing issues:
- Windows: Player can't move.

106085.name: Exodus Terminus
106085.body:
Short Description:

A multiple choice game where you play the role of a border patrol officer. You can choose who enters and who's sent away.  Your country Perfectia, is the country everyone wants to be in. Your neighbor:  Kelica, Aberia and  Strentevia are going through civil war, a genocidal dictatorship and a war on drugs. Help people survive or choose to be corrupt and heartless in this short adventure game. And remember even if you run out of space, there's always something you can do to help.

Why I made this game.

I wanted to bring to light the recent immigrant crisis, but without sounding overly political. So I chose to blend sadness and humor within a minimalistic experience. Exodus Terminus is somewhat of a mockery on how the news portrays immigrants and refugees as just another person with a sad face. How even a few of your choices and actions can completely change the future of a nation and it's people. I hope I've contributed something worthwhile. Cheers!

106086.name: CLAMPRESSOR File Archiver
106086.body:
Is your​ phone clogged up with lots of files? ( YES )
Are you getting constant notifications that you have no free space on your device? ( YES )
Would you please stop downloading image reactions, cat gifs and viral videos? ( NO )

Then this is the app for you!

Clampressor File Archiver will compress all your problems away! Try now for a free 1-hour trial with no ads! Come get it now!

EDIT: KEEP IN MIND THAT YOU CAN CHANGE CONTROLS BEFORE HITTING PLAY IF YOU FIND THEM UNCOMFORTABLE

106099.name: SocialCapacity
106099.body:
Manage your social life as you compartmentalise your friends into neat social groups, but be weary you only have so much space in your life to accommodate those little boxes. Lose too many friends and your happiness dwindles but manage them wisely and they're reward you with the time of your life.

*Please note that social compartmentalisation is a defense mechanism that social anxious people often use, this game does not aim to parody nor mock that mechanism*

106108.name: Space Opera
106108.body:
The crowds want to hear the magic that you can bring to their ears. Compose as precisely as possible - no crotchet or quaver can go to waste.

![](///raw/bc0/6/z/1636f.gif)

Best played in an up to date Firefox or Chrome. The game can take a few seconds to load. There's a known issue with music playing out of sync at the end of the level, so please ignore that.

106115.name: From Hell
106115.body: A 2D platformer where you escape from the devil himself !

106129.name: Summons Vs Bullets
106129.body:
[screenshotMain.jpg](///raw/09e/91/z/17b61.jpg)

A hybrid of tower defense and bullet hell shoot em up!

How to Play :

-The player character will follow your mouse

-Press Z / X or 1/2 to summon familiar with red / blue color respectively

-A familiar can block bullets with the same color

-Familiar will disappear once their time runs out

-Be careful, you can't move past familiars, so the more you summon, the less space you have for evading difficult bullets

106133.name: Glowium
106133.body:
Controls:
WASD = To move forwards, back and to turn
QE = To rotate the Camera
Escape = Pause Menu
Darkium Detector = Spacebar

Creators:
Koltonix (Chris) - Programmer
@JoeDB100 (Joe) - Programmer/Arist
mutantdevle (Devlin) - Level Designer

Extra Pieces:
Tosh200 (Josh) - Created the main menu and pause sound track
@daniel_neale (Dan) - Created the in game sound track

How our Game Relates to the Theme?:
Our game relates to the theme mainly in the sense that as time goes on your camera size which is orthographic is reduced over time until a value of about 5 in Unity.

Bugs/Issue:
The main issues consist of the AI being abosuletely abhorrent and being generally buggy mainly in the sense of moving and following the player. The second primary issue is optimisation which is due to the game being 'procedurally generated', but I will use that term loosely, which I would have liked to make much more optimised, but due to time contrainsts wasn't quite possible. Due to time constraints due to the AI needing to be changed we also didn't get a chance to include sound effects, but our friends were able to produce some tracks to fit the game.

Software Used:
Unity C#
Maya
Photoshop
Muse Score 2(Dan)


Showcase:
![InGame.png](///raw/98e/91/z/18128.png)

106149.name: Character Assassin
106149.body:
![screen.png](///raw/36a/z/16313.png)

Doing a two player game was probably a bad idea, but bad ideas are my forte. Work with a friend to kill people, just like in real life.

I never got around to implement rejoining games properly, so don't refresh the page or anything in the middle of a game. If anything breaks just click the link again and get a new game ID.

106152.name: Overpopulation
106152.body:
**Overpopulation** is a **science fiction game**, where humanity must be **saved from extinction** by sending **rockets** to colonize other planets. 
Have controls on the rocket, managing its **fuel**, **temperature**, **oxygen** and **stabilization**...! This game combines **narrative experience** and **arcade** in **randomly generated planetary systems.** The piloting of the rocket is **realistic**, it is necessary to know how to manage its various gauges and sensors.

VIDEO TRAILER : https://youtu.be/ocuoJi9-bnM

## ** HOW TO PLAY ?**

- Turn on electricity
- Fuel the engine
- Supply oxygen
- Cool the rocket
- Provides stabilization **even during flight**.

## **ABOUT THE THEME**

*My vision of the lack of space is relatively abstract, rather than thinking of a classic context, I invented a dystopia where the player must save the Earth from overpopulation.*

## **TOOLS**

I programmed this game in **48H** in **C#** with **MonoGame framework**. For the graphic aspect, I used **GIMP** and for audio **AUDACITY** as well as **BEEPBOX**.

![menu.gif](///raw/683/91/z/16faa.gif)
![SCREEN1.jpg](///raw/683/91/z/16fac.jpg)
![SCREEN2.jpg](///raw/683/91/z/16fad.jpg)
![SCREEN3.jpg](///raw/683/91/z/16fae.jpg)
![SCREEN5.jpg](///raw/683/91/z/16faf.jpg)
![arrived.gif](///raw/683/91/z/16fb0.gif)
![Peek 13-08-2018 02-29.gif](///raw/683/91/z/170a2.gif)

106159.name: Ouch!
106159.body:
![ouch_thumb.PNG](///raw/831/b/z/169c9.png)
Ouch! is an Atari 2600 inspired game where you are constantly running out of space. Spike walls are closing in on you and you must collect as many coins as possible before your inevitable... fate. collect power ups to help you maximize your score. 

Rules:

- The yellow coins will grant you 1 points. 

- all power ups will grant you 10 points

- purple power ups freeze the spikes for 5 seconds

- blue power ups miniaturize you for 5 seconds

- red power ups double you score for 5 seconds

Bug Fixes:

 - canvas sizing fixed

 - score text has fixed location

 - missing audio glitch fixed

 - Power ups are functional

Bug Fixes in the works:

- Coin location randomizing glitch

I’m 13 and this is my third Ludum Dare. I had a chest surgery in the beginning of August and, although I shouldn’t, I spent late nights putting this project together. Had a blast and hope you enjoy playing my game as much as I did making it

106162.name: Running Out of Space
106162.body: This was our first Ludum dare and we enjoyed it a lot. It was pretty chaotic and we learned a lot. its a small buggy game and we wil rebuild it and make it better when we are less stressed in the future.

106166.name: Crate Stacker 📦
106166.body:
![intro.gif](///raw/3e3/3/z/1741f.gif)

![keys.png](///raw/3e3/3/z/174f9.png)

🎮 Supported!

WASD / Arrow Keys - Movement

​X - Pick Up / Drop Crate

Y - Raise / Lower Crate

---

* Crates that are ready to be picked up become purple.
* Crates that are picked up become green.
* Crates can be raised and lowered.

![crate.gif](///raw/3e3/3/z/173f5.gif)

* Stacks of crates cannot be carried, only the topmost crate can be picked up.
* The direction cannot be flipped while carrying a crate.
* If blocked, holding down the movement button before dropping it will throw the crate.

![throw-crate.gif](///raw/3e3/3/z/17409.gif)

---
Changelog (after compo):

>* Updated WebGL build as the previous one didn't work at all. Enabling exceptions without changing anything else made it work.

>* Music loop fix for WebGL build.

---
