106167.body:
You must help Trig the triangle get back to his girlfriend by pushing pieces into the maze. The maze also has treasure but getting too greedy might just cost you your life. How far can you get?

![Action1.png](///raw/5be/91/z/15eb7.png)

![Action2.png](///raw/5be/91/z/15eb8.png)

106172.name: Deluge
106172.body: Deluge is a thematic boat rescue game. You play as a boat with a grappling hook attempting to save as many people as possible.![Screenshot (11).png](///raw/d5d/f/z/16bbc.png)

106179.name: Desktop Clout!
106179.body:
![ldjamcoverimage.png](///raw/d35/91/z/1690f.png)

A game about the management of time, space, money, and clout. Play a few runs and figure out how things work- there are right and wrongs things to do based on your situation. Too bad I didn't have time to make sound effects or music, but pretty happy with the end result!

![screenshot1.PNG](///raw/d35/91/z/16d5b.png)

meta.link-01-name: The game's itch page, where you can download it

106183.name: BugStorm
106183.body:
![bugstorm.png](///raw/dbe/91/z/16e03.png)

An RTS game, based off of the idea of Netstorm. I had a lot of fun learning new stuff on this really strict timer, especially pathing and grid based building. As I would've expected, making a game of this scale, I had to cut very many features I wanted to make. In this game you must prevent insect hives from spreading across your last surviving floating islands by destroying the Mother Nest.

Build bridges to the Storm Geysers and collect crystals with Golems 
Build a siege army to destroy the insect threat!
Cannons can only shoot airborne targets, and the trucks spawn flying soldiers to attack ground units.

Controls :

    Build bridges to Geysers and use Golems to collect money
    WASD to move the camera
    Left click to select and place buildings,
    Right click to order units/unselect building.
    Number 1 and 2 to quick-build bridges.

There is only one level in the game, all assets were made during the 48 hour LD compo period.



Tools used: GameMaker Studios
Paint.net
Audacity

Source file%LS� ���

106203.name: Extremely Hungry
106203.body:
You are extremly hungry in a strange labyrinth, you need more and more meat, but you can't stand this load, because of this your vision falls constantly. Survive!

WASD + Mouse to Move![screen.png](///raw/7de/91/z/15e73.png)

106206.name: Blockage
106206.body:
Do you like blocks? Do you like going from one end of a level to the other? Then I have a game for you!

![UE4Editor_2018-08-12_17-19-43.png](///raw/9d3/z/16b98.png)
Blocks!

![UE4Editor_2018-08-12_17-30-22.png](///raw/9d3/z/16c64.png)
Lots of blocks!

![UE4Editor_2018-08-12_17-27-22.png](///raw/9d3/z/16c20.png)
Even more blocks!

Now that we're all excited about blocks, here's some explanation:

* Pick up and place blocks to go from level to level.
* You can only hold one color of block at a time.
* Exit each level through the end-level door.
* Open the door by picking up all blocks of the same color.
* Your inventory is preserved between levels.

106208.name: Running Out Of Space
106208.body:
This was my first game jam and I made a platformer where you are trying to survive as long as possible while blocks and coins are falling down from the sky.

Programs used to make this:  
-Unity  
-https://www.pixilart.com/draw#  
-Bosca Ceoil

106241.name: Faster than space
106241.body:
Faster than space is a game about managing a space ship that is trying to escape from a collapsing universe by reaching a wormhole at the center of the universe.
While on this journey random events happen that might wipe you out before you reach the wormhole (or might not :D).

![screenshot_1.jpeg](///raw/349/z/17132.jpg)

What to do
----

You manage a small space craft, you can order the crewmen around to man different systems to increase their efficiency as needed on your journey.
Manage your resources well to survive the random events that range from a crewman hurting himself at work to apocalyptic asteroid barrages.
Make sure to check out the tutorial in the game before you start playing :>

Tools used
----
- Unity3D Engine
- UnityTK (https://github.com/kennux/UnityTK)
- Blender
- Substance Painter
- Paint.NET
- Gimp
- Audacity

106245.name: Build Build Build!
106245.body: A game where you play as a city planner who has to build new housing and amenities as the city is running out of space and cannot support the waves of refugees that are arriving.

106265.name: SpaceDos
106265.body:
Your computer is running out of space. You're getting evicted if you don't pay up 1 000 000 bitcoin to the bank... What do you do? You start clearing space and mining, of course!

Destroy the files to free up space, then download bitcoin miners and make money. Easy, right?
But beware of the viruses that strike randomly with applications and take a bit of your bitcoin away. How do you know what's safe? You don't...

Good luck

![screenshot_2.png](///raw/8a7/z/1661c.png)
![screenshot_3.png](///raw/8a7/z/1661e.png)
![screenshot_4.png](///raw/8a7/z/16620.png)

NOTE: Pressing 'Del' deletes all of the save data! Beware! Also viruses don't do that much harm :P
SPOILER ALERT: BonziMiner may or may not be very virus. So please buy it

106267.name: In The Dark
106267.body: A semi-easy rage platformer made with Clickteam Fusion 2.5.

106268.name: ZombieEnclosure
106268.body: my first game jam, hope you like it.![photo.PNG](///raw/97f/81/z/16874.png)

106285.name: Borderblast
106285.body:
I haven't made any Games for a few months now due to School. But when I saw that Ludum Dare would be during my Summer break, I thought I'll just give it a go and here is what I came up with: There are to Borders, one is coming down from the top of the display and one comes up from the bottom. When the Player touches one of the Borders he dies, so he **"Runs out of Space" to move! **
Try to make it to the castle on the other side, and try to collect the coin to get an extra 15 points added to your score.

**To Play the Game: **   
  1. Download the zip File                                                                                                                                                                                                            
  2. Extract the zip File                                                                                                      
  3. Run the jar File                                                                                                      
  4. Have fun^

** Tools: ** 
  - Language: Java
  - Graphics: Photoshop
  - Maps: Tiled Map Editor                                                                              


**Controls:**                                                                                                                           
 - A -> Left                                                                                                               
 - D -> Right                                                                                                               
 - W -> Jump

106289.name: iPhone Defender
106289.body:
![d.png](///raw/813/e/z/1800a.png)![e.png](///raw/813/e/z/1800e.png)![b.PNG](///raw/813/e/z/18010.png)

Defend your iPhone from Storage wasting viruses, a game that you have never experienced before.

Controls

Movement - W/A/S/D or Arrow Keys
Jump - Space Bar
Shoot - Left Mouse Button

106290.name: Plug It!
106290.body:
A blackhole has opened, and you have a strange device that should close it.
Build farms and laboratories to rack up gold and science in order to plug this blackhole before it eat all the terrain.

106309.name: Sprout!
106309.body:
3rd person 3D game where you play as little Kanna who has to grow giant flowers in order to reach the sky!

Play using an xbox controller, there's in-game instructions but forgot to put in that you gotta press A in order to climb a fully grown flower.

![giphy.gif](///raw/14f/91/z/17b6c.gif)

Game is made by:

Miguel Blix - Programming & Music using Unity & FL studio

Genmai - Art & dialogue Using Blender & Clip Studio Paint

This is our first Ludum Dare! we did a small 2D project on Global Game Jam long ago but this was a fun small thing to test what we know.

Please leave feedback! all is appreciated.

106317.name: Slay The Slimes
106317.body: You wake up from napping on the cold dungeon floor to find slimes raining in from the ceiling. Quick, grab your dagger and slay them before their toxins kill you! (again)![SlayTheSlimes00.png](///raw/53f/91/z/16fdb.png)

106318.name: Captain Starbeard and the Curse of the Wonky Equipment
106318.body:
Captain Starbeard once again finds himself escaping the enemy in a stolen spaceship!

Help him avoid capture and death by powering the weapons and defending the ship against the seemingly endless onslaught.

Click and drag the Pentaminos onto undamaged parts of the power grid to deliver power to the weapon systems. You can rotate them with q/e

If the lights are green, the system is operational! Red means the grid is damaged somewhere.

Weapons:
Shields -> Beats Lasers
Lasers -> Beats Rockets
Rockets -> Beats Shields

106328.name: Type It!
106328.body:
Type as quick as you can to survive! 
The words are floating from left to right and will stop at the end. When there will be no space for new words, the game will be over.

![typeitscr - Copy - Copy.png](///raw/85e/91/z/1681b.png)

It's a nice way to check and (maybe) improve your typing skills.

106330.name: Geometry Merge
106330.body:
![2018-08-12 (6).png](///raw/d9d/91/z/16ebf.png)


This little puzzle game is all about merging blocks (and not running out of space and steps...)!
Control one block at a time and try to match it with a similar block, without using up all of your moves.
If you merge a block 3 times, it disappears and gives you extra steps plus lots of juicy points.
Reach for the highest score possible!
Developer high score: 27 000.






Controls:

Move        - Arrow Keys

Place block - Spacebar

106408.name: Continuum
106408.body:
## Description
Teddy, an Alien from the planet Zhar has been trapped inside a glitch in the fabric of SPACE-TIME.
Can you help him escape the glitch before the Black Hole closes up on him?
He will be forever grateful to you.

## Gameplay
- **The goal is to bring the BlackHole's pressure to 0%**
- After you click "Start", use the Arrow Keyboard keys to follow the patterns quickly.
- Every correct Keypress will bring the pressure down.
- Every wrong Keypress will bring the pressure up and hurt Teddy.
- Press "Space" bar to restart the game.

## Tools
This game has been proudly made with only Open Source Software : 
- Godot 3.0 Game engine
- Inkscape & Gimp
- LMMS & Audacity


![Teddy2.png](///raw/b9f/91/z/166c3.png)

106411.name: Space Smash
106411.body: Space Smash is a Top Down Shooter where the goal is to avoid being crushed by the space storm. Have fun trying to break your own record =)

106412.name: Don't mess up
106412.body:
A Puzzle game about push and pull boxes. (Gamepad supported tested: xbox one)!

Keyboard: 
- Arrow keys to move
- SPACE to push and pull
- R to restart level

Gamepad (press A to activate the gamepad):
- DPad/Joystick to move
- A to push and pull
- Y to restart

7 Levels (10-15min duration)

[level1.png](///raw/7af/91/z/177a0.png)

106421.name: BugSurvive
106421.body:
## Controls
W - Up

A - Left

S - Down

D - Right

Space - Jump

Left-Click - Shoot

## Instructions
Stay on the platform and shoot the bugs coming at you.

Watch out for your health and aim for the highest score.

Thank you for playing!

106443.name: The last step to move
106443.body:
for 1p, use arrow key to move and shoot blocks with num1, shot bombs with num2 to kill block which cost 10s.
for 2p, it's WASD and JK.
Your purpose is to survive as long as possible. If you stack in a block, you will certainly die.
You will produce a killer item which set up an alarm. As it works, it will kill you if you touch it, or, it will produce a new block to mess up the space.
AI are really stupid that it's hard for them to kill you. But still, they can shoot blocks to limit the space.

106461.name: Escape through the Void
106461.body:
Game made for [Ludum Dare 42](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42)

## Tech used:

* ReactJS
* Konva

## Audio tech:

* Audacity: for audio effects
* LMMS: for the annoying music

## Comments

This is my first game for Ludum Dare and pretty much ever. I didn't spend nearly as much time on it as I'd liked but at least I have a complete game. It's not very good and the music is pretty bad but it's complete (in a very minimal-viable-product way). So I'm pretty happy with myself, this is a first step that will hopefully lead to better games in the future.

106462.name: Keyboard Crash
106462.body:
Read before playing XD

Your aim is to break down a keyboard of a guy who is playing computer games. You can break it by pouring cola on his keyboard or removing key caps from his keyboard. Importantly,  if one area of his keyboard is poured by cola, it is broken. Also, if one key cap is removed ,it is broken too.
Remember, if he is concentrating on playing computer games, you can't break the keyboard, or his anger value will increase. If his anger value is max, you will lose. So you should distract him by clicking on "Click this guy" button or giving him hamburgers. You even can turn of the light to make him blind. When he is blind, eating or looking around, it is the best time to break his keyboard. If his keyboard is totally crashed, you win.

The only thing that you need to do is left clicking. There are some items and four buttons, including "Cola" button(give you cola), "Hamburger" button(give you hamburger), "Light Switch" button(turn off the light) and "Click this guy" button.

If his keyboard is totally broken, you will win. If his anger value is max, you will lose.  

Things that you can do in the right screen.
1. Pour cola.
Click cola on the table. I t will be poured on the keyboard and make this area broken. 	
2.Click on key caps to remove them. 
3.Give him hamburger, click on "Click this guy" button or click on "Light Switch" button 
to make him distracted or blind.	
Have fun XD

106475.name: Gravity Well
106475.body:
## Description

From the minds that brought you "Collosal Cat Adventures 2", and "Eskimonster: Pingus Rising" comes their new title "Gravity Well".

Take control of your crippled vessel and utilize dangerous singularities to reach the jump gate at the end of each level. With only direct control of forwards and reverse thrust you will have to deploy singularities to effect your ship's trajectory. Be careful! If you get too close to the singularities you will get shredded by their powerful gravity wells!

There may be plenty of room in space, but in space there is no room for error.

## Screenshot

![GravityWellGif1.gif](///raw/d2f/2/z/16ab4.gif)

## How-To

This is a top-down action puzzler. Alternate between placing singularities in 'Edit Mode' and flying your ship in 'Play Mode'. Reach the gate to progress to the next level.

### Edit Mode:

Click and drag singularities from the toolbar into the starfield.
Click on placed singularities in the starfield to remove them.
Press the play button to transition to 'Play Mode'.

### Play Mode:
Left Mouse Button -> Thrust Forwards.
Right Mouse Button -> Reverse Thrust.
Press the restart button to transition to 'Edit Mode'.

![GravityWellGif2.gif](///raw/d2f/2/z/16bee.gif)

## Tools/Resources Used
### Engine
Unity 2018
### Audio
NewGrounds

freesound.org

Bsfxr
### Assets
Piskel

OpenGameArt.org (50% original assets. 50% premade assets.)

106477.body:
This is not a scam!

Windows 10 Cleaner Free is a fun little game about deleting files on your harddisk. But you can't simply delete them, no, the files are aggresive! They will resist and fight back!
![s1.png](///raw/dfc/d/z/1827b.png)![s2.png](///raw/dfc/d/z/1827d.png)![s3 - Kopie.png](///raw/dfc/d/z/1827e.png)

you are a square

106490.name: Journey of the Crab
106490.body:
You play as the Crab. Your goal is to survive the journey across the ocean (so far 2 levels). As time passes, you would get hungry, so you have to eat various food. Firstly, you can eat algae. It is very nutritious and also common. Secondly, you can encounter some swimming shrimps. They aren't as nutritious as algae, but they contain valuable chitin. As you grow up, you are running out of space in your crab shell. Luckily, you can make it bigger if you eat enough shrimps!

This is kind of typical platformer.
![screenshot2.png](///raw/824/c/z/17f1b.png)

I created everything myself, except for:

106491.body:
Made for LD42 in just 17 hours.

Oculus Rift Required.

Use the grip buttons on the touch controllers to pick up boxes. letting go of the grip buttons will drop them. Sort the boxes into their corresponding category by colour.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-R9CzYYyV6Q

106525.name: Slay The Slime - Too Much Loot
106525.body:
You're a "Slime Slayer". Your work is simple - kill any slimes that you encounter. But there is something wrong with them. They drop so much loot that you can't even pick up all of it. They are comming for you from the moment you entered this "Green Forest". There is so many of them that the only thing you can do is throw all of dropped loot at them as fast as possible. You're the only one who can stop them!

Good luck! Have fun!

![menu.png](///raw/610/a1/z/178d7.png)

![green forest.png](///raw/610/a1/z/178c7.png)

Instructions:

You can only have 5 items at once.

You can see how much space is free by looking at the bar in right-down corner of the screen.

Your health bar is in left-down corner of the screen.

Attack - drag one of your items to the attack area. At the top of the screen you can see your opponent's name and his health bar.

Looting - drag one of dropped items to your inventory area (bottom of the screen). There is limited time for looting after each slime killed (only 5 seconds). You can also attack with these dropped items even if they are not in your inventory.

Press "ESC" to back to the main menu.

![gameplay.png](///raw/610/a1/z/178cd.png)

A game.

106573.name: Hoarding Hank
106573.body:
![Unity_2018-08-12_11-43-58.png](///raw/fe5/z/161c1.png)

Things keep arriving in the mail, where will you put all your stuff?

Bed => Sleep

Stove => Hunger

TV => Entertainment

Toilet => Bathroom

106594.name: Warehouse
106594.body:
![Screenshot2.png](///raw/940/a1/z/1795b.png)

You play a worker in a warehouse. Your job is to take the boxes that get delivered and place them neatly on the floor. It's a pretty hard job! Your boss may fire you if you don't do it properly.

# Controls

Key | Action(s)
--- | ---
Arrows | Move/Pull Box/Push Box/Spin Box
Z | Grab Box/Press Exit Button
X | Flip Box

While grabbing a box you can move backwards/forwards to pull/push the block, you can move sideways to spin the block (maybe this takes some getting used to) and you can flip the box over your head.

# Gameplay

Move the boxes that come through on the conveyor belt onto the score area (marked with the large square on the floor). Boxes that aren't completely in the score area won't count towards your score.

You must be fast and efficient since boxes you miss will be deducted from your score! If you let too many boxes go you might be fired!

When you're ready to finish press the button (using your character) in the top right just outside the score area. This will stop the conveyor belt and end your shift.

# Updates

After reading EatThePath's comment I added an easier difficulty mode as well as adding a toggle grab option. Hopefully this makes playing more comfortable for some players.

106672.name: Closing In
106672.body:
This is my LDJam42 submission. The game was built with Unity, all code, graphics, and music done by me. The music was done in Garage Band and is an original composition. Sound effects are from Freesound.com users BehanSean and strexet and are under the Creative Commons 0 License.

This game was created in less than 36 hours with probably less than 20 hours of actual dev work.![Screen Shot 2018-08-11 at 10.35.53 PM.png](///raw/2a0/a1/z/15c0e.png)

The object of the game is to get as far as possible before the walls close in. The procedural generated obstacles will slow you down, but touching the walls will end the game. There are orange rings that will give you a boost so you want to use them to get the best score possible. You can control your ship with WASD or the arrow keys.

Enjoy!

106693.name: WASH UR BALLZ
106693.body:
Controls:

WSDA for movement
Mouse for Camera 
Spacebar for Jump

GOAL:

Keep the field under 95% painted for as long as you can

-> Jumping and landing without immediately rejumping will have an increased area of painted be cleaned 
-> Jumping directly ontop of an enemy roller and then landing will SUPER boost your cleaned area when you land. The more times you land or hope on an enemy before you touch ground will increase this.  Will max out when it will whipe the whole arena and auto trigger. 

-> Yellow ( active cleaning mode )
-> Blue ( you are stunned ) 
-> White ( you are immune to stun ) 

Active field painted % is in upper right

Time passed upper left

-------------------------

Suggested strategies, move around constantly and weave through areas to keep a constant removal, use jump to scan and find areas with less enemy rollers to land and clean.   Don't try too hard to jump off of enemies head, if you fail you will stun yourself. 

Use the arena rebound wall to help boost you around. 

-------------------------

RETROSPECTIVE:

I know this will not be the "prettiest game" nor will it be the most "put together game"  but the goal that I wanted to make here was a game that makes you focus in goes from mild intensity to high intensity very quickly.  I wanted every jump, movement, and execution of weaving through the enemy rollers to feel amazing.  I wanted you to feel like a fighter pilot in STARWARS weaving through the death star haha.    I think I got close to this, I hope you enjoy it, and I want to hear some of the high score.  So far, mine is 560 seconds. 

Thank you so much for playing my game.

106727.name: Space Trap
106727.body:
You have been trapped in the rebel base to die. How long can you survive?

While trying to escape the rebel base, you fell into one of their traps. You are now stuck in an ever shrinking rooms with rebel bots (or are the bots stuck in the room with you?). Survive for as long as you can hoping for someone to hear your screams.

Fight and survive an endless horde of rebel bots in an ever shrinking room. Dash your way through enemy bullets to dodge them. Defeating the bots will keep the walls in their place and will grant you more time to live, stronger the enemy, more time you get to live. Watch out for power drops which can grant you a shield or can slow down time.

106777.name: Space Factory
106777.body:
**Overview**

![LDinline.jpg](///raw/1e4/1/z/17900.jpg)

You are an entrepreneur running (out of space) a business on an unstable planetoid.

There is limited usable landmass available, and you will find yourself running out of space.

You will also have to juggle your production capacity to optimise production, because if you run out of space for your goods, your factories products will go to waste.

Also the products you are making are space running shoes, and their tagline is running out of space.

Because the theme is running out of space, yeah?


This is my tenth LD, and as always I like to try something I haven't tried before, and I like to throw my assets onto Open GameArt when I'm done with them, because why waste assets?


**Tools Used**
* Unity for a lot of the heavy lifting
* Blender for my 3D stuffs
* Photoshop Elements for some 2D stuff like the selection cursor and emissiving the hell out of my planet
* Font used is Xolonium under the Open Font Licence
* I used the super cool [SpaceScape](http://alexcpeterson.com/spacescape/) for that kickass skybox
* Bosca Coeil for the audio (such as it is) - I always leave audio until last, and it always suffers...

**Known Bugs**
* A little more ambitious design meant a lot of stuff got cut, so its not really a game as such, but more of a sandbox builder. I usually like to have *at least* a win or lose condition... 
* Some last minute player notifications skipped thorough playtesting, so you'll get told staff are joining even if you have no room to keep them, and you'll get told you earned whatever your current money is even though you didn't.
* Was seriously short on time this Jam, so a lot of niceties I usually include like a splash screen, pause menu, restart and quit options don't exist, but its an HTML5 only build, so just refresh the page if you paint yourself into a corner.

106883.name: Delete After Reading
106883.body:
You are a Cia Operative trying to solve a case of international espionage by grabbing information from diskettes to store on a limited hard drive. You have to quickly read and delete extraneous data as new data comes in to solve the case!  

Controls: All controls are mouse based.
*  Diskettes fall into the bin on the right.  Click and drag them to the drive on the computer to load them.
*  Interact with buttons on the computer screen.  Save disks to the hard drive if they are relevant.  Only keywords from saved disks can be used to solve the case.
*  Review saved files by clicking on the diskette icon on the computer.  Delete them if they are not necessary to make room for new disks.
*  To solve the puzzle at the end click on the keyword that matches the highlighted replacement character to fill it in.
*  If you're ready to solve and don't want to wait for the timer, click it to instantly jump to the solver.

[Click here to play in HTML5 now!](https://androidlabs.itch.io/ludum-dare-42)

![dar_ss1.PNG](///raw/93d/d/z/17af3.png)![dar_ss2.PNG](///raw/93d/d/z/17af5.png)![dar_ss3.PNG](///raw/93d/d/z/17af6.png)

Ideas and Play testing:  Tristan Jenkins, Orion Crocker, Daniel Shaffran, Wes Socia

KEYS

106964.name: Memory Manager
106964.body:
You ARE the Memory Manager. Allocate memory and handle requests as programs run and clear or request more memory.

Instructions: Drag and Drop Memory into place

Notes:
The idea of playing as the memory manager and shuffling memory I think has a really solid game in but I was pressed for polish time and balancing which is key. I was also hoping to add multiple types of storage. This was the 1st time I've used SFML but its a solid simple 2d base for gamedev. Might use it for small protos or jams in the future.

106985.body:
First ludum dare entry.

As a disease rampages across the lands, Plague Runner puts you in the shoes of a solitary grave keeper tasked with putting the growing numbers of dead to rest.

107005.name: Warehouse madness
107005.body: This is a game where you are a robot that works in a warehouse and you get shipments into that warehouse that you have to get ready to send out but if your warehouse starts running out of space and if you completely run out of space then you lose there are no winning conditions it is endless.

107017.name: Space Evaders
107017.body:
Space is out to get you!

Literally run away from it, because the theme of the jam is running out of space.

Use WASD to navigate your way through a fierce asteroid field. But most importantly, run away from your impending doom. A massive explosion is quickly catching up to you. There will also be enemies that block your path. Use Spacebar to shoot missiles at them! Be sure to avoid their mines though.

That's it. One level. One chance. Good luck!

P.S. If you are getting weird behavior (like dying too quickly to the explosion), run the game on lower quality/graphics settings. Unity makes that pretty easy. It should fix your problems.

Bug Fixes:
* Score correctly resets after each game

![Screenshot (2).png](///raw/27c/21/z/16e25.png)

107019.name: Mancha!
107019.body:
![title.png](///raw/f91/a1/z/16791.png)

Hello, my name is Lakso and this is MANCHA!, the classic game of tag.

This is my first entry to a Ludum Dare.

In Mancha! you'll be playing tag against an AI, in a constantly shrinking field.

![screenshot1.png](///raw/f91/a1/z/16829.png)

Try not to be taged until the time is over.

![screenshot2.png](///raw/f91/a1/z/1682c.png)

As this was my first game, I tried to keep it simple while fun. The game was made with [Löve](https://love2d.org/) and edited with [atom](https://atom.io/). The sound effect where made with [sfxr](http://www.drpetter.se/project_sfxr.html).

for some reason the source code isn't apearing on the links, so [Here it is](https://github.com/Laks0/Mancha).

107021.name: Space Golf

107024.name: Jumpy Guy
107024.body: First Game jam ever! Just a jumpy guy on an (short) adventure

107028.name: Tunnel Ride
107028.body:
A relatively fast-paced game with minimalistic graphics and some fun... I guess. :D

In the game, you are a white cube with a gun. Red cubes are spawning and you have to shoot them to gather points and to avoid them so you don't end up dragged in the spikes at the bottom. The catch is that the room you are in is shrinking until it becomes like a small tunnel, hence the "Running out of space" theme of the jam.

107052.name: Rey Trace
107052.body:
The Dark Shadow is encroaching and it's up to Rey to protect last remaining Path of Light!

### Controls
- Ship follows your mouse cursor
- Click to shoot

### How To Play
- Start the game by clicking on the screen
- Nodes will begin to spawn from the left and move to the right at a random angle
- Your goal is to shoot and destroy the nodes before they attach themselves to the wall
- If a node is on a wall and a subsequent node attaches itself to the opposite wall, the shadow will extend itself there
- The white lines are your "Tracers" to show where all the nodes are including the ones that are traveling through the shadow
- If you are hit by a node or come in contact with the shadow, the game is over

![RayTrace.PNG](///raw/5e6/f/z/172b4.png)

### Credits
- @wiredoverload: code, game design, art
- @gizmolo: code, music, fx

This game was built entirely with [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/) and makes heavy use of the HTML5 canvas element as well as some CSS3. Check out the source code here: [GitHub](https://github.com/WiredOverload/LD42)

107055.name: Ludicrous Lift
107055.body: RUNNING OUT OF SPACE! In ludicrous lift you play as a man in a constantly filling elevator that just cannot stay  together. Your goal is to move the hordes of people entering onto tiles that are going to fall(marked in red) and keep yourself up for as long as possible OR until you reach your floor.![cover.png](///raw/052/a1/z/18577.png)![fc6e9a71df31a45485611451a2bd9f10.png](///raw/052/a1/z/1857a.png)![9c11016361d1d76ea1c4864b022d6fbb.png](///raw/052/a1/z/1857d.png)![5af12e35d860ebc996f16dff89b2ae2e.png](///raw/052/a1/z/1857f.png)![b4ff424b5ead24d04076ef1f9ab1928e.png](///raw/052/a1/z/18583.png)

107064.name: Petra
107064.body:
![petra1.gif](///raw/4c1/91/z/16120.gif)

**Petra** is a puzzle game where your goals are constantly getting in the way!

Push the colored blocks around to match the target shapes at the bottom. But beware -- once you make a target shape, the blocks will become immovable! Be careful where you put the shapes, or you might just run out of space! ;)

There are 18 levels. I wanted to do 20, but... you know how it is.

**Controls:**
- **Arrow keys** to move.
- **R** to reset the puzzle.
- **M** to toggle music.
- **SHIFT+X** to delete your save file.

**Tools used:**
- **Music**: FL Studio with the wonderful _SQ8L_ VST
- **Sound effect** (there's only one): bfxr
- **Graphics**: The GIMP
- **Code**: Just plain ol' javascript and HTML5 canvas!

This is my first LD, but I really enjoyed it!

![petra2.gif](///raw/4c1/91/z/1613b.gif)

107070.name: Get To The Park
107070.body:

107083.name: Ludum Delivery
107083.body:
# Introduction 

You are in charge of filling the trucks of the Ludum Delivery (r) transport agency. In this puzzle, a set of packages suspiciously similar to tetris pieces are moving on a conveyor belt. Your mission is to assign them to the trucks before they reach the barrier.

# Controls

- Left-click (mouse) to grab a package. Another left-click to release it.
- Right-click (mouse) to rotate the selected package.
- Number 1 (keyboard) to send truck #01 
- Number 2 (keyboard) to send truck #02

# Rules 
- Load the trucks as much as you can. To send a truck you need to fill it almost completely, until the corresponding indicator changes to green. 
- Prevent the packages from coming off the conveyor belt.
- Be careful. You can't return a package to the conveyor belt once selected.


![ingame.PNG](///raw/690/a1/z/16d7c.png)

107103.name: Satellites - Running out of Space!
107103.body:
This is a game about running out of space in Earth's orbit.

Try to launch as many satellites as possible to get as much coverage as possible!
But try not to smash them together.

![SatellitesFlare.png](///raw/e9f/81/z/1651e.png)

Or this will happen!
![Satellites_Explosion.png](///raw/e9f/81/z/161d4.png)

![Satellites_debris.png](///raw/e9f/81/z/1636b.png)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P_uGDy9l0ik

How much coverage did you get? Share in comments!

EDIT: Game is built using latest Unreal engine so it is possible that there are some issues running the game. Updating graphics drivers might fix some issues.

meta.link-01-name: Windows Build - Download zip, run exe

107110.name: Stacked Odds
107110.body:
![1.png](///raw/24/z/16631.png)

Create columns adding up to 21 as long as you can. Run out of space on a column and it will be removed from the game! 

Controls​

W/Up Arrow
A/Left Arrow
S/Down Arrow
D/Right Arrow
Escape - Pause
Space - Add a new block

---------------------------------------------------

So, I started over twice over the course of this one, but I think it turned out alright. If you want to check out the games I abandoned, I'm going to try and included the solutions in my source code upload. Let me know if you have any bugs or performance issues. I planned to do some optimizing toward the end of the project, but it seems to run ok on my machine, at least.

107119.name: Stop the Darkness
107119.body:
![screenshotld42_1.png](///raw/ac8/3/z/16f13.png)

Darkness is taking over your land, but you can still stop it! Upgrade areas by building villages, towers and more. The available upgrade is based on the adjacent areas and areas boost each other, so make sure to experiment and discover all possibilities. There are two ways to win; one of them is a bit harder if you like a challenge.

107130.name: Deadpan Gulch
107130.body:
![duel backdrop.png](///raw/b46/z/17338.png)

A week ago I had a dream about panning for gold with Oprah, this is the game inspired by that dream.

Claim territory and gold in competition with computer players. Challenge them to duels to the death.

Be the last prospector standing.

Click to interact, choose the tile you want to claim, clear, or challenge.

![PreDuel.PNG](///raw/b46/z/17331.png)

Claim     - Claim the gold on the tile as yours
Clear     - Remove debris from the tile, this must be done before capturing
Challenge - Challenge an enemy to a duel. If they decline you automatically claim or clear that tile. If they accept then you fight to the death
Dueling   - There is a count to 3 and then the word "DRAW" will show on screen. Click anywhere before your opponent to kill them, freeing up all of their territory. Lose the duel and lose your life.

Winning - Have the most gold when all land is claimed or kill all your opponents

Programming and UI art by Andy  
Art by Karl  

Font from https://www.1001fonts.com/vanilla-whale-font.html  
Tried to include music but couldn't get it to work. Listen here while you play: http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Lobo_Loco/Welcome/Glueworm_Blues_ID_994

107133.name: Dearth of Mana
107133.body:
Click on groups of 3 or more orbs to collect them. Each time you click on a orb though, a block will be created at that location. Aim for big combos and carefully chosen placements to score as high as possible.

Made for Ludum Dare 42 by Joel Barr (BitJester Media).

I didn't have a lot of time this weekend, so this is pretty basic. I wanted to add a Puzzle Quest style combat system where you're drawing magical energy from the land to fight, trying to wear the enemy down before you run out of space, which is where the name comes from.

107139.name: TARGET: EARTH
107139.body:
![Logo.PNG](///raw/5a8/z/160ac.png)

Your space exploration journey has come to an halt as your ship's navigation system has broken.
Now you must find your way back to earth using the wormholes scattered throughout the emptiness of space.
Can you find your way back home, or will you be crushed by the rolling asteroids?

meta.link-01-name: Seems to only work with Firefox

107141.name: Bat-Chan!
107141.body:
![Untitled-fff.jpg](///raw/ac4/81/z/18243.jpg)

This is my first ludum dare game. It is about a vampire who transformed into a bat and he has to stay under his friend the cloud and kill some enemies to survive.
 
How to play: 
- You move the player (The bath) with either WASD or the arrow keys.
 
Rules:
- You have to stay under the cloud.
- The cloud is constantly following you so don't run from it.
- The cloud is your only friend.
- Kill the enemies.
- Enemies don't hurt you but they hurt your friend the cloud which kills her then kills you.

Credits:
- Programming: Djillali Seba
- Game Designing: Alex foyt 
- Audio + SFX: Djillali Seba
- UI Designing: Djillali Seba
- Contact Alex foyt's : email: foyalex@gmail.com, twitter: @AlexFoyt
- Contact Me: djillalise@gmail.com

107146.name: Indiana Snake and the Room of Doom
107146.body:
## Motiviation
I wanted to be as close as possible to the theme "Running out of space". I thought *What classic game personifies Running out of space?* .. And I came up with _Snake_. This is my attempt at giving the classic a real twist

## Environment
1. You're in dark place.. and so hungry
2. You're food is moving somewhere in the dark
3. Use the clues (changing face color / written text) to find your food (it becomes red when found)
4. Be careful of the _converging walls_
5. Eating the food will push the walls out but only for a few seconds
6. Survive

## Gameplay
1. Use arrow keys to move the snake
2. Dont crash into walls
3. Find and eat the food to stay alive
4. Don't panic

## Source code
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bEbilhzXl0pWTRcXdpY1qKOsRpTc2Eag/view?usp=sharing

## Game
http://sourabhsaha.me/unity-ludum-dare-42-game/

## Side note
If the game doesn't load, please refresh the page

107149.name: Just Balloon: Move or Lose edition 3
107149.body:
![gameplay (4) 600x451.gif](///raw/b90/3/z/177af.gif)

___

### [Download](https://zeu31.itch.io/just-balloon-move-or-lose-edition-3) (Windows)
___

### Description:
Help the little balloon stay safe in this hostile environment where everything can kill. But be careful! Because you are running out of space and all you can do is move.

### Instructions: 
- hold the Left Mouse Button to push the balloon away from the cursor
- hold the Right Mouse Button to pull the balloon to the cursor


### Controls: 
- Mouse-only

### Credits:
All programming, design, art, and music was done by me ([Zeu31](https://twitter.com/zeu31 ) ).


### Tools:

- Unity3D.
- Gimp.
- LMMS.
- BFX.
- Audacity.

### Notes:
 
 * any feedback will be greatly appreciated! 

 * I will play (rate and comment) the game of everyone who comment here as long the game run on my computer (that is a windows 32bits potato). If I did not play you game this is probably the reason. I am sorry! :(
---

107152.name: Memory Muncher
107152.body:
This game's assets are all made by myself except for the Font. Magik Voxel was used extensively in this project and the 2D font is "A Goblin Appeared!"

Thanks for taking the time to play this game and I hope you enjoy it!

Play as Mem and try to escape the evil clutches of the task manager as it tries to wipe the memory clear!

WASD keys to move, avoid in memory blocks with other programs in them or you'll segment fault!

reach the end to move on to the next level!

107156.name: Trash Flood
107156.body:
Trash Flood is a game about sorting rubbish before it can accumulate too much.

![TrashFlood.PNG](///raw/63e/d/z/15fec.png)

107179.name: Crash·Data
107179.body:
![23nx5R.jpg](///raw/64f/91/z/177f8.jpg)

In Crash·Data you play as a cursor inside what appears to be an 80's computer. Your mission is to stop the viruses trying to corrupt the system as they fall from the top of the screen.

The player must shoot to destroy the viruses and to re-arrange the files that will fall from above, accumulating at the bottom of the screen. The game ends when the maximum corruption level has been reached.

CONTROLS (Controller):
Left Joystick - Move
Right Joystick - Aim and Shoot
Start - Pause
X/A - Select

CONTROLS (Keyboard):
W/A/S/D - Move
Mouse - Aim and Shoot
Esc/P - Pause
Left Click - Select

Crash·Data has an online leaderboard system. Compete against players all around the globe and get the highest score!

![captura.png](///raw/64f/91/z/17809.png)

107185.name: Space Collapse

107192.name: Escape from Space
107192.body:
![Escape.png](///raw/a57/41/z/16a64.png)

Escape from Space is a top down shooter where you play a marine who is in a desperate need for a vacation.
The space frigate you are on has been hit by heavy alien infestation, which is consuming the entire ship.
Armed with a rifle and occasionally explosives you run through the metal corridors trying to escape in time before the entire space is filled with toxic alien bio mass and dangerous alien lifeforms.

How to play:
 - Movement: WSAD
 - Aim: Mouse
 - Shoot: Left Click
 - Manual Reload: R

(All keys can be remapped in-game.)

Tools used to create the game:
 - Engine: FTE QuakeWorld
 - Editor/Compiler/Debugger: fteqccgui
 - 3D: Blender
 - Level editor: Trenchbroom
 - 2D: GIMP
 - Audio: Audacity and Sunvox

The source code is included with the main downloads, it can be found in game/source/ directory, alongside the fteqccgui executable you can use to build the game code.

107220.name: Overminers Inc.
107220.body:
![1534104133513.png](///raw/215/z/16963.png)
![1534104240128.png](///raw/215/z/169b3.png)

In Overminers Inc. you must quickly mine the shrinking floating platforms for valuable ore. Have the most ore at the end to win. You only have around 14 turns, so make each action count!

**Controls:**
* Left Click - Select
* Right Click - Move
* 1 - Select Mine
* 2 - Select Strider
* 3 - Select Buggy
* 4 - Select Turret
* V - Show time left on hexes
* R - Return to main menu

**Notes:**
* Units cannot move between two hexes threatened by an enemy unit.

107223.name: Finger Noodles
107223.body:
![Image_itch.io.png](///raw/ff4/3/z/16aee.png)
Those twisting fingers on your keyboard look so yummy... I'll pick the first one sticking out !

107229.name: Spaced Out
107229.body:
Spaced Out is an asteroids dodge 'em up!

Your ship gets larger as time passes, and the asteroids get larger every time they collide with something. Collect the power-ups to stay as small as possible, and don't crash into anything or it's game over.

107248.name: Out of Graves
107248.body:
![apresentacao.jpg](///raw/2e8/8/z/17ded.jpg)

**Description**  
Being the gravekeeper of the Dead's Town graveyard isn't easy.
Suffering of an epidemic disease that turns its citizens into zombies, people started to casually throw bodies in the graveyard.
And now the graveyard is running out of graves!

> "Too many bodies, too many zombies, too few graves!"  
> **Dead's Town Gravekeeper**

**Commands**  
**WASD** - Movement  
**Space bar** - Action (Hold it to grab bodies and bury them / Press and release for an attack)

**Tools Used**  
Unity 2018.1  
DOTween (http://dotween.demigiant.com)  
Visual Studio Community 2017  
Audacity  
Photoshop CS6  
Illustrator CS6  

**Musics**

**"Villainous Treachery"** Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

**"Evil Plan"** Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

**"Fun in a Bottle"** Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

107253.name: Requiem for the Postman
107253.body:
## **Sorting the mail.**

You are Hopkins, a postman. You mission is to sort the letters destined to reach four small villages in England... however, not all is as easy as it sounds. False destinations, no postcodes, a deadly thirst, bloody foreigners from all over the world, your annoying boss, and a nefarious clock ALL conspire against you.

Made in 10 or so hours, because my Saturdays tend to be quite thoroughly occupied by other activities.


### CONTROLS
Described in-game, but still. **Left mouse + hold** to pick up and move objects. **E** to interact with them, if possible. **W, S, A, D, Q, R** to rotate a held object. ***Read the information at the top of the screen! And keep an eye on your thirst! Letters dropped in the void count as misdelivered!***

### Read and sort letters...
![1.png](///raw/2e4/51/z/16bc6.png)

### ... check your phone...
![2.png](///raw/2e4/51/z/16c27.png)

### ... redirect letters for faraway places...
![3.png](///raw/2e4/51/z/16c41.png)

### ... use dictionaries to decipher foreign languages...
![4.png](///raw/2e4/51/z/1772e.png)

### ... amass a pile of them...
![5.png](///raw/2e4/51/z/16c75.png)

### ... and drink a nice cup of tea whilst you *run out of space*!
![6.png](///raw/2e4/51/z/16c93.png)

107254.name: Figura Bellum
107254.body: A game with shapes and stuff.

107255.name: La Flèche du Bon Sens
107255.body:
Tap the **right arrows** as shown on the screen.
Beware, keep a **combo** for more points and be careful to not be crushed by the **shrinking window**.

107271.name: Pizza Defender
107271.body:
![630x300_cover.png](///raw/7d8/d/z/1760e.png)

You play as a piece of mozarella with a machinegun, on a pizza. Zombie ingredients come towards the pizza and start noming on it shrinking the pizza. You can only walk on pizza so you need to defend it.
If the pizza gets too small, you will have no are to move on, and you will most certainly get eaten. 

Unimplemented ideas:
- You win after a certan amount of waves. 
- If you kill the zombie ingredients, they become normal. And if you get a certain amount of needed normal ingredients, than you win the level. (Missions style)
- If a zombie that does not eat pizza gets to the Basilic Braga(basilics name.. Don't ask), you lose. 

![screen3.png](///raw/7d8/d/z/17606.png)

PS: Its my first time, so there were a lot of unclear rules and submission uncertanties..

#### Controls:
- WASD to move
- Mouse to aim
- Space or mouse click to shoot. The [HTML version on itch.io](https://sloyd.itch.io/pizza-defender) the controls start to lag when firing with the mouse. [Download executable](https://www.dropbox.com/s/1djje2y9laf3c7l/PizzaDefender_fixed_exe.rar?dl=0) for best experience! ..or fire using "Space".


Game was made from scratch using:
Photoshop. hand drawn and animated.
FlashDevelop for coding (no engine whatsoever. basic actionscript3). Didnt use AS3 for a long time. This was a bit of a bad idea.
Flash IDE - just because I was lazy to import some images using FlashDevelop.
No sound :( didn't succeed to. too little time :(

![CherryTomatoWalk.gif](///raw/7d8/d/z/17486.gif)

I wasted time drawing and animating 3 aditional monsters that I didnt get to include (though they were 80-90% finished).. It was tough! Here are some of them:
![BroccoliWalk.gif](///raw/7d8/d/z/17014.gif) 

![zombieOlive.png](///raw/7d8/d/z/17016.png)

Submitted in the last minute directly from DropBox :D Almost failed because of hosting. (forgot there was an aditional hour to submit the game). But later added to [itch.io](https://sloyd.itch.io/pizza-defender)

I think I will compile a timelapse..

#### After submission notes:
Goddammit! There's a bug when the pizza bites are squared instead of toothmarked!!!!!!!! :(((
Also didn't get to finish the deathScreen :). if you die, you need to close and restart the game. Should I change it afterwise? can I? Its some trivial bs..
**Update:** I will have 2 versions linked.


#### Important:
The download version is made within Compo time restrictions (for me until 1:00 AM).
In the itch.io version I corrected a fiew minor bugs after the timelimit.
There will always be a link to the original(compo restricted) version!

## Enjoy!!!

107292.name: Delusional Thoughts
107292.body:
Fast paced arcade action game play with and interesting scoring mechanic. Stay grounded to build up combos, take risks to build up multipliers, you can jump to avoid holes/enemies at the cost of your combo.. Collect rusty spoons because, well, who doesn't love rusty spoons... Wish I had tomorrow but have to call it a game, hope you enjoy it... PS it takes a few goes to get the hang of it, but you may find the WASD controls work a bit better than anticipated... eeeeeek...

WASD - move 
LeftShift - sprint
SpaceBar - jump
Smile - have a good time

107305.name: Anxiety Bumper Cars
107305.body: I think i took the running out of space theme too seriously. Its a game of bumper cars except the space you play in gets smaller and smaller

107339.name: Macabre Hollow
107339.body: A bug-free\* dungeon crawling game. By compressing character stats together I demonstrate how to use data without loss of information\*.

107371.name: Relocation
107371.body:
The world has advanced as far as extremely fast travel, but everyone seems to want to fight about it. There are only 3800 people left on earth and every second counts in order to save them all.

Use cars, boats, planes, or even just walk to try and prevent everyone from being nuked. Only some will survive and it is up to you on how many that is.

Your score would be however many people you have left alive at the end of the timer in the bottom left corner.

---CONTROLS---
Z-Planes, X-Boats, C-Cars, V-Walk

Planes are the fastest and walking is slowest
Planes carry 10 people, Boats carry 15, Cars carry 20 and walking you can have 30![Screenshot (23).png](///raw/f53/a1/z/17e96.png)![Screenshot (24).png](///raw/f53/a1/z/17e99.png)![Screenshot (25).png](///raw/f53/a1/z/17e9c.png)![Screenshot (26).png](///raw/f53/a1/z/17e9e.png)![Screenshot (27).png](///raw/f53/a1/z/17ea1.png)![Screenshot (28).png](///raw/f53/a1/z/17ea2.png)![Screenshot (29).png](///raw/f53/a1/z/17ea3.png)

107390.name: No place for light
107390.body:
Click on a light platform to jump to it. But beware, platforms run out of space quickly! Look for another platform to keep alive
![gif 1.gif](///raw/799/81/z/171d6.gif)

107401.name: LaserJuice (Top Down Shooter)
107401.body:
This was my first Ludum Dare entry and im quite happy with how it turned out. I used:

-Aseprite for the pixel art

-sfxr for the shooting sound

-BeepBox.com for the music track

-Visual Studio Community 2015 for everything code related

-notepad for the readme (yes im going to note that here.)

The project turned out way better than i expected, and even though its lacking a bit in content, it does have some charming low resolution pixel art graphics, a color shader to swap colors on the fly, and a killer soundtrack, which was my first experience in making music, ever, which also turned out nicely.

One issue i have is that norton says the exe file is "potentially harmful" which is probably because i didnt sign the file with any credible author signature, but hey. at least it works finally. if you dont trust my exe, you can also just compile the included source code, and replace the exe, that way you "know whats inside".

Oh yeah, source code. fully documented, for those who care :)

some images:

![lj1.png](///raw/247/d/z/166cd.png)
![lj2.png](///raw/247/d/z/166d1.png)
![lj3.png](///raw/247/d/z/166d2.png)
![lj4.png](///raw/247/d/z/166d4.png)
![banner.png](///raw/247/d/z/166d6.png)

107408.name: Nighttime Fortress
107408.body:
Fight off hordes of enemies in a shrinking arena

WASD - Movement

Mouse0 - Fire

F - Throw light grenade (pushes back darkness)

G - Build light farm (creates light over time)

107438.name: Horder
107438.body:
Hello this is Horder
Johny is a Horder(stacker) he keeps all the useless stuff in his house so his wife decided to play on him by putting him into a reality show he better be start cleaning.

![ld42_1.gif](///raw/abf/11/z/16454.gif)


![tutorial.png](///raw/abf/11/z/16455.png)

107447.name: Ultimate Question Game
107447.body:
ALARANDO presents the game about escaping from the collapsing galaxy.

You are the creature with the strong desire to live. Try to survive in this living hell, use only one button in you spacecraft, jump forward deep into space and stay alive.

And maybe in this adventure you will get the answer to the Ultimate Question of EVERYTHING.

![uq 0.jpg](///raw/c93/a1/z/15d8e.jpg)

![uq 1.jpg](///raw/c93/a1/z/15d8f.jpg)

![uq 2.jpg](///raw/c93/a1/z/15d90.jpg)

![uq 3.jpg](///raw/c93/a1/z/15d91.jpg)

Click below to watch the trailer:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vyNuEDWr6Sw

Sounds and music by Soundsnap.com

107459.name: Skee-A-Ton
107459.body:
Draw slopes to guide your friend Bob Skele to the goal! Careful though, the slopes persist!!! 

## Controls:
Click and hold the mouse to draw a slope. Make parabolas to go faster.

![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 3.26.36 PM.png](///raw/766/61/z/1689a.png) [Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 3.24.30 PM.png](///raw/766/61/z/1689e.png)![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 3.23.27 PM.png](///raw/766/61/z/1689f.png)![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 3.27.01 PM.png](///raw/766/61/z/168a2.png)

meta.link-01-name: It's at the bottom of the page.
meta.link-02-name: Just hit run game and you gucci. Source code at the bottom.

107467.name: Space Escape Shooter
107467.body:
__Description__

You wake up in intergalactic space. Your only way home is a dangerous rainbow road. You must __run out of space!__

__Goal__

Get back to Earth safely. Avoid holes in the road or you'll die! You can move left and right, or jump over them.

*Be careful:* As you progress through the zones your screen gets smaller!

__Controls__

Keyboard:

> Jump: Space

> Left: Left Arrow, or A

> Right: Right Arrow, or D



Gamepad:

> Jump: A

> Left: Dpad-Left

> Right: Dpad-Right

__Zones__

There are four zones you must get through to make it to Earth: Intergalactic, Interstellar, Interplanetary, and Geospace.

__Tools Used__

Programming Environment: Godot

Music Editor: Milkytracker

Image Editor: Gimp

107498.name: Tiny Garbage Man
107498.body:
You're a tiny Garbage Man living inside a semi underground waste container.
All kinds of garbage are being dumped here and it's your job to recycle it!

* WASD to Move
* Mouse to aim
* Right Mouse Button to grab an item
* Hold Left Mouse Button to charge up power 
* Release Left Mouse Button to launch the item you're holding


Keep an eye on the Garbage Meter
When it's full you're covered in garbage
and the game is over!

Try to recycle as many items as you can!
![TGM1.png](///raw/b26/c/z/167c2.png)

![TGM2.png](///raw/b26/c/z/167c4.png)

![TGM3.png](///raw/b26/c/z/167c5.png)

https://twitter.com/Fryderider

107500.name: Roham!
107500.body:
### You are closed in a circle that's continously shrinking. The goal is to survive for as long as you can and reach the highest score and combo you can.

![screenshot_1.png](///raw/719/21/z/167e8.png)
![screenshot_2.png](///raw/719/21/z/167e6.png)

### Controls:

move - WASD

aim - IJKL

dash - SPACE


### How to play:

Move around to dodge enemies and to pick up heals and shrink stoppers.

Aim your spikes at an enemy and dash through them.


### Programs used:

Game Engine: Godot

Art: Aseprite

Music: BoscaCeoil

Sound: Bfxr and Chiptone

### You can download the game from Itchio:
https://fenderbate.itch.io/roham

### And you can find the sourecode here:
https://github.com/Fenderbate/Roham



(No web export this time, Godot's html exported games don't work quite well :( )

If you have any ideas or complaitns make sure to leave them in the comments!

107509.name: Book Crook!
107509.body:
**"You find yourself with the opportunity to steal some of the most sought after magical books in all the land!"**

**You must fill up your stash with books until you are out of space! Afterwards you will see the total price of all the money you made along with your Top 3 books. There's randomization with the shelf and stash sizes, books and book names so replay it a couple of times to get different results!**

**Controls: Mouse Only, just point and click!**

![Gameplay01.png](///raw/ce0/81/z/16c2e.png)

![Gameplay02.png](///raw/ce0/81/z/16c35.png)

Phew! I managed to finish just in time! I'm pretty happy with how it turned out even though I didn't get to implement everything I wanted. I wanted to get a timer in there and a button to respawn the bookshelf so you can be more strategic in what books you take. Other than that I'm super glad I managed to finish! Thanks for playing!

(Mac version not tested so if it doesn't work or there are bugs then, sorry!)

Software Used:
- Unity 5.6.6f2 (Game Engine)
- Bosca Ceoil   (Music)
- Bfxr          (Sound Effects)

[My Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ossi101)

107526.name: Grid Jumper
107526.body:
das ist mein erstes Ludum Dare
	
When the player moves the 
walls move in the direction of the players

meta.link-01-name: the walls move parallel too the player

107548.name: SnowOut!
107548.body:
Left click to shoot enemies

Right click over a tile to reload ammo, will destroy the tile

By:

Dani Barca

Hermann Plass

Noa Durán

Tomás Banzas

107556.name: VOID - SOLLUS - First Ludam dare (and game)
107556.body:
A game about deactivating construction droids in space before you run out of room.

My first game started learning code few days before LD42 learned a lot.

You can find my game here - https://drive.google.com/open?id=1sXlQYnPJvlCuUY8jzPkao0d64IVh78ff

![Untitled-1.png](///raw/a04/a1/z/182c1.png)

107560.name: Tales Of Steel And Mana: Empire's Birth

107566.name: How to Bee a MailBee
107566.body:
![png_1 5890.png](///raw/0ed/7/z/1793b.png)
## Transfer Packages ...by Flying!     :package:<---:bee:
> You are a Intern to Become a MailBee at _Bee-Happy Co._

![Info.png](///raw/0ed/7/z/17dfa.png)
                       
> **Transferring Packages to their Rightful Recipients,**              
> **While Maneuvering Through Air and Avoiding Red Walls.**

* **Grab/Hold ** - Space

## Made with :tools:

107567.name: I'm Azon
107567.body:
You're Azon, an employee of some anonymous department store. As a good employee, you'll have to take the correct packages to the correct delivery zone. You'll have to dodge someother sad employee while you carry the packages and also there will be special packages that can make a huge mess or benefit you so much.All this while your boss is seeking for you to see if you're doing you job properly aaand... be careful to not anger him or he will fire you!


https://youtu.be/7EXy5-6RSUg
![Página 1.jpg](///raw/fe8/d/z/17df2.jpg)![Página 2.jpg](///raw/fe8/d/z/17df3.jpg)![Página 3.png](///raw/fe8/d/z/17df4.png)![Página 4.jpg](///raw/fe8/d/z/17df7.jpg)

107595.name: Neon Sign Placer Pro
107595.body:
![neonsignplacerproscreenshot3.jpg](///raw/b1a/z/16e0e.jpg)

Click the Sides of the Buildings to Place Neon Signs! How Many can you Place in the Time Allowed??

Font Lemon/Milk by https://twitter.com/MARSNEV

107597.name: Malpractice
107597.body:
Malpractice is a game about an over burdened hospital. You have to ensure the worthy patients survive!

![mainMenu.PNG](///raw/034/a1/z/16976.png)

![Score.PNG](///raw/034/a1/z/1697a.png)



CONTROLS

Click Patients to select them. Then click to assign them to a bed.

Patients will receive treatment once in a bed and cannot be moved.

Selecting a bed will show an option 'Malpractice' which will allow to free up that bed for a more deserving patient.

RAMBLE

Okay so this is my first ever Jam - and it was crazy hard and exciting! I didn't think to put any sort of instructions in the game, and I'm a bit disappointed that I never got the balance quite right. I'm quite exhausted so this might all be nonsense words. I guess that's normal?

(I added a link to my itch.io version. No changes made.)

107606.name: King of the Crows Nest
107606.body:
A small king of the hill like pirate Game. As we aren't the biggest Fans of the Jam Rules, we followed all the Compo Rules (except for Team Size ofc).

Controls:

Movement: WASD |

Jump: Space |

Low Punch: Left Mouse Button Or Left CTRL |

High Punch: Right Mouse Button Or Left Alt

107618.name: More and More Gravestones
107618.body:
Hi, it's my first ludum dare experience.

In the game you are a gravedigger who needs to accommodate all the bodies that come to you, each body must be placed in a specific grave that refers to the social class of the body.

Controls:
AWSD - Move
E - Intereract
Mouse - Use menus

Gameplay:
Your goal in the game is to bury as many bodies as possible.

For this you must use the mechanics of the game to create new graves and enlarge them.

The game is arcade. I think you can win, but you will have to play for too long, do not worth the time.


If you download, thanks and don't forgive to give me a rate and a comment.
![screen1.PNG](///raw/064/a1/z/16d3d.png)

107667.name: Into the Void!
107667.body:
The goal of Into the Void! is to run out of the space continuum as fast as you can, while avoiding asteroids that are determined to make your efforts at running out of space unsuccessful! Can you break the continuum wall? See for yourself!

![screenshot1.PNG](///raw/2d3/z/158b3.png)

Into the Void! was made in under 8 hours, using Pixi.js. Unfortunately that was all the time I had this competition, so this was all I got done!

107682.name: Yet Another One of Those Pesky VR Experiences
107682.body:
----

## **Requires a SteamVR headset to play.**

----

Welcome to your office. Do things.

![workd.png](///raw/875/2/z/169dd.png)

Made for Jam during LD42 in under 48h. Models are from Poly by Google, rest is by rava.games.

107685.name: Crate Rush
107685.body: Our heroic package handler Brawn has been chosen to work overtime! Alone he faces the drudgery of having to sort packages onto the proper warehouse racks. Will he be able to complete his task in time!?

107690.name: Tricky Truck
107690.body:
Tricky Truck is an Arcade game where you need to keep the city clean.

This was the first time I used Unity for making an entire game, please feel free to give me advice.

![capture.png](///raw/2bb/2/z/16917.png)

How to play :
The goal is to keep the city clean. Game ends when you get fired (trust me, you won't win :D).

* Use [Arrows] to move.
* Hold [Space] to pick up and drop off garbage.

Garbage can only be dropped-off in the Dump (your starting point).
The orange bar indicates the city's level of dirtyness.
The green bar indicates your truck can carry. The more you fill your truck, the slowest it will drive !

> PS : Collisions / triggers are a bit messy, if you can't pick up a garbage, try to leave and enter again on the spot in order to perform the action.

Good luck !

Musics credit : (as I'm a bad musician)

* [Car engine by qubodup](https://freesound.org/people/qubodup/sounds/147242/)
* [Background generated with WolframTones](http://tones.wolfram.com/generate/GqcHeHeC8749h8pUBOq7l8zJlogamWJPrvwFHaavzGoxDCn)

107697.name: You Are Being Hunted
107697.body:
[![screen1.png](///raw/e98/z/16557.png)](https://unentokku.itch.io/ld42)
Simple game about fighting against enemy that blocks off areas.
Main thing to remember would be that unless busy with something(resting, building, fighting) defender has the advantage in battles.
You can use mouse or number keys, R and T to control the game.

107718.name: FIREBALL
107718.body:
## Needs at least two players & two controllers to play! Sorry :(

edit: Post compo version fixes a few tiny bugs. Otherwise identical at present.

Wizards shoot fireballs to try and knock one another off a bizarro floating space island. Avoid falling to your doom. It's quite hard.

#### Controls: 
+ Move - Left stick 
+ Aim - Right stick
+ Fireball - Right shoulder button (Hold to charge)
+ Dash - Left shoulder button

Destroy a lush and mysterious green environment
![FIREBALLS2b.gif](///raw/faf/z/16f05.gif)

Charge your fireballs for maximum power!
![FIREBALL1.gif](///raw/faf/z/16f90.gif)

Dash over gaps and away from danger!
![FIREBALLS3.gif](///raw/faf/z/16f0c.gif)

Be careful though.
![FIREBALLSDOH.gif](///raw/faf/z/16f11.gif)

xinput pads definitely work. dinput pads should work but who knows.

Game might also be kind of loud. I made the sounds in the last hour, you know how it is.

Given I developed this solo and as of writing this still haven't played it with anyone I have no idea if it is good or fun. ENJOY.

107723.name: Beyond Space
107723.body:
Hi, I am a 13 year old teen who is passionate on creating! indie games. I been eager to join Ludum dare for a long time. I am grateful to give you a project I devoted at least 24 hours into.
![Screenshot (39).png](///raw/64a/91/z/166e6.png)

Story:

The Earth demands more space for us humans. Luckily, the government has found more space in Space. You have been sent on behalf of the government to exterminate all life forms necessary so that it is available to us. Be careful though, The life forms have sent a defence protocol, meaning that you can't stay for too long.


How to Play:

- Use the Mouse to move and shoot
- Kill enemies to progress
- if you are low on fuel or health, return to shop, which is located at where you spawn.
- Use the mini maps on the bottom right to locate your destination
- Explore new enemies and items!

![Screenshot (42).png](///raw/64a/91/z/166e5.png)

107751.name: Box Me Up
107751.body:
This is my first submission for ludum dare 42 Theme :Running out of space.

The game is about not getting buried alive by Boxes Or Take to much damage from spiked boxes and reach the exit at the top.

There was a lot of stuff planed like a wider variety of boxes, power ups, story, sound but i underestimated the time dose things would take so a lot is missing.

Thank you for playing my game i know i will do better next time :frog: :gun: 

Controls:
- Esc = Pause/Menu
- A, D, L.Arrow, R.Arrow = left right movement
- Space = Jump
- Space + Space = Double jump
- Shift + Space = SuperJump (Usefull if you get Stuck/buried)  You only get 3 no UI
- R = Quick Restart



Game is made in Unity and Art in PyxelEdit.
![BoxMeUp Cover.PNG](///raw/e62/91/z/16a58.png)

meta.link-03-name: My src is not showing up so i am adding extra

107757.name: Planetoid
107757.body:
![Banner.PNG](///raw/2c7/c/z/16abf.png)

📕 STORY 📕

Planetoid is a top down adventure style game where you play as a planetoid named Timmy who is trying to escape space (namely to run out of it) because space is running out of space and Timmy needs somewhere to live.. Timmy needs to collect the four shards of the spacekey to unlock the great space door and then run the heck out of space. Unfortunately, the SPF (Space Protection Federation) wants to keep the spacekey all to themselves, so watch out for their ships and turrets.

🕹️ CONTROLS 🕹️

A/D: Tilt Left And Right
Space: Tuck in to be affected by the gravity of nearby planets.
Shift: Charge up a boost. When fully charged, release to get a burst of speed. You can use your boost to dispatch enemies.
Ctrl: Brake
F: Toggle Fullscreen

🛰️ OTHER 🛰️

If you see purple arrows around Timmy, they are showing you where a nearby black hole is. Make sure to steer clear. You can see your progress on assembling the key in the top left corner of the screen. Collecting a key shard gives you extra health.

🌌 SCREENSHOTS 🌌

![Cap1.PNG](///raw/2c7/c/z/16d59.png)

![Cap2.PNG](///raw/2c7/c/z/16d5a.png)

107772.name: Beeb's Adventure
107772.body: Help Beeb run out of space!

107783.name: Waterlogged
107783.body:
Waterlogged is yet another survival crafting game. The water level is constantly rising, and you must construct a houseboat before it drowns you.

Or at least, that was the original plan. You can only craft three separate items so far (fire, stick with rocks on it, and a bed). You can consume berries and cut down trees, too.

Screenshots:

107785.name: Gariani - The GariBoy
107785.body:
You are a garbageman and you have to put the trashes in correct trash can

Use the arrow keys or WASD to move/get the trash/ put in the trash can

Use Q or Space Bar and a Directional to drop the trash on the ground


This is our fist Game Jam, hope you enjoy playing the game

107801.name: End.of.Line
107801.body:
![titlescreen.png](///raw/b86/1/z/1663b.png)

End.of.Line is an infinite platformer with only a singular button. Hold down to ride the line, release to jump, and hold again when you're about to land. How many ends of lines can you reach?

Tools: Unity, Gimp, VSCode, Github

107807.name: Tale of the Bagger: A Love Story
107807.body:
Don't run out of bag space. Fall in love.

![screenshot1.PNG](///raw/b5a/81/z/1727d.png)
![screenshot2.PNG](///raw/b5a/81/z/1727e.png)
![screenshot3.PNG](///raw/b5a/81/z/1727f.png)

107812.name: Shapes
107812.body:
My entry for Ludum Dare 42, this was my first Ludum Dare so I set my sights low not knowing what to expect, too low in hindsight.

![thumbnail.png](///raw/80d/81/z/1739b.png)

Shapes is a game where you eat other shapes to stay small because you are constantly growing, the more shapes you eat the bigger your smallest size is. Eating lots of shapes fast will give you lots of points! Try to get the highest score on the leaderboard! It took me a long time to integrate GameJolt API into Godot.

107825.name: The Perennial Dead
107825.body:
The dead are rising, and rising, and rising. The main issue is that they are leaving their corpses all over the place, so be sure not to kill too many of them or you'll have a serious space issue.

Whenever you die, or rest at the camp, all zombies will respawn, but their old corpses will remain, taking up a bunch of space.

IMPORTANT: It has come to my attention that the WebGL build is a little glitchy, so if possible, play a downloadable build. Thanks :)

107827.name: Petri Panic!
107827.body:
You play as a scientist who dropped a beaker of some strange purple goo.  It seems to multiply both on the ground and in your handy bucket.  Scoop it up and flush it down the toilet before it makes an irreversible mess!

WASD/Arrows to move, R to restart

C. Tyler Hart - Code  
Kaitlin Quick - Art

107828.name: The Flesh Pit
107828.body:
Welcome to the flesh pit.

![Cover.gif](///raw/9b1/3/z/171f5.gif)

The god of flesh demands FLESH TRIBUTE.
Slay monsters and accumulate meat!

Arrow keys move, X jumps, C attacks.

Up+C to throw items

Down+C to pick up weapons and healing potions.

Throwing a weapon is very powerful, but severely damages the item.

![screen1.gif](///raw/9b1/3/z/171f7.gif)

![screen2.gif](///raw/9b1/3/z/171f8.gif)

107835.name: Splinter $ell
107835.body:
**Congratulations !**
Now you're a **Splinter seller** ! Unfortunately, our process is a big mess. Our boss buy great splinters printers but don't care about stock.
So, it's your task to manage all orders and be careful on stock ! If it's full, it's explode *(We know, splinters are quite dangerous).*

I'm confident, you seems to be the seller we need (not we deserve, thanks for you time).

This is a simply game on which you have to move splinters *(color blocks)* to booked orders and extend your stock.

![Splinter Sell Animation.gif](///raw/2a3/91/z/17da3.gif)

**_Controls :_**
- Move splinters -> Left mouse button on the splinter you would move and another left mouse button click on where you would move it (If you move on another splinter, they will switch their position).
- Select splinters and Orders -> Right mouse button to select Splinters and Orders. To book an order, you have to select all splinters ask and the order.
- Pause - Escape to Pause the game (Escape another time and it's stop the pause).
- ~~Ctrl + F4 - Don't use it, legends says that it could destroy our reality (or at least reality in your screen).~~

*Short advice, it's very tricky with trackpad. A mouse would be a good friend ;)*

**_Credits :_**
- *Game Design => Colletto Gregory and Alc0l*
- *Code => Colletto Gregory*
- *Visual and Sound => Alc0l*

107870.name: Stock Overflow
107870.body:
![Capture.PNG](///raw/ec6/z/16ac5.png)

You are the manager of a warehouse. Your goal will be to store the arrivals of stocks but also to prepare customer orders.

Be careful not to neglect the customers too long because it will lead to your loss.

Controls:
Directional arrows to move
Space to select
Escape to exit the selection menu

Game made in C ++ with the SFML library.

107878.name: Space? Spike? Squid.
107878.body:
You, you little sucker pal, have been trapped in a tower in the core of space. You must jump from platform to platform to get out before being crushed by the terrible tower of celestial heights, or any of its nefarious spikes and traps. For squiddom, old chum!


The Jump sound effect can be found [here](http://soundbible.com/1343-Jump.html) and is licensed under Attribution 3.0, which can be found [here](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/).

107880.name: Sandpiles
107880.body:
![2018-08-13.png](///raw/8da/11/z/16df9.png)

Vastly inspired by Minesweeper and the concept of Sandpiles (Abelian sandpile model).

You are presented with a grid of values. You're able to add values to the cells (sand piles) of the grid , but as soon as the value of a cell reaches its maximum, the cell topples, spreading everything it contained to the adjacent cells. If, however, the cell is located at the border of the grid, some of its value will be forever lost in the abyss of nothingness. As more sand gets gone, the grid will become smaller and smaller, until you eventually...

... run out of space.

Try to get as much score as possible.

107903.name: Hydrogenic
107903.body:
## Description:
Eliminate unnecessary electrons to form a hydrogen particle before it collapses into itself.

## Controls:

- **Right Arrow:** Spin clockwise.
- **Left Arrow:** Spin counter clockwise.
- **Space:** Jump.
- **Ctrl+R:** Restart level.
- **Ctrl+F:** Toggle fullscreen.
- **Escape:** Return to menu.

## Screenshots:
![Capture2.PNG](///raw/e04/z/16316.png)
