107914.name: Spikes For Spots (of tea)
107914.body:
Good day, your majesty, your fine spot of tea awaits through these rooms.
Please make your way carefully through these rooms. You may or may not have to solve puzzles along the way... 
Oh and the walls are closing in on you, not to mention the spikes. Good luck and God speed, fine player!![ss1.png](///raw/3fa/01/z/180d1.png)![ss2.png](///raw/3fa/01/z/180d5.png)![ss3.png](///raw/3fa/01/z/180d9.png)![ss4.png](///raw/3fa/01/z/180de.png)

107919.name: Mitosis
107919.body:
You are a little cell, happily dividing away. You do your best to keep your DNA in order, but sometimes mutations just occur. You shouldn't allow them to spread very far though.

It's a game about area control, I think. Initially I had other plans but this is what I ended up with.
You control it by clicking. Use Escape to bring up a menu. I need sleep.

![Progress_002.png](///raw/ea3/2/z/16752.png)

Btw: Cytokinesis simply didn't sound very good in my opinion.

107938.name: Runnig out of Playables
107938.body:
Running out of Playables is a cardgame? But as you play the playground disappears and you run out of space to place your creatures. 

Well this turned out to be be more complicated then expected.
The game has 3 phases main/move/attack:
- Main Phase: Click on the spells that you want to play(the get marked green). click next round to confirm your input.
- Move Phase: Click on creatures that you want to move then cliuck again to choose the move direction. Click next round to confirm movements.
- Attack Phase: Click on one of your creatures and then on a enemy creature in range to attack that creature.
- You can attack the enemy with a creature by CLICKING ON THEIR HAND after selecting a creature.

Tipps:
- Spells glow blue or yellow if you can play them.
- Yellow spells can be played in all 3 phases, blue spells only in the main phase
- A spell has a cost(upper right corner), and a speed(down left corner). Spells with higher speed values get casted first-.
- Creatures have hp/dmg and movementspeed(yellow) and attackspeed(blue). Movementspeed decides move order and how far a unit moves, attackspeed decides the attack order.
- You can revoke a spell by cklicking on it again before you advance to the next round.

#Gameplay walkthrough
https://youtu.be/R657IoADoDs

107939.name: Crate Chaos
107939.body:
Welcome to Crate Chaos, my entry for the Ludum Dare 42.

It's basically a puzzle platformer where you need to bring the golden crate back to the exit of the level. In order to do that, you will need to grab and push other crates to make a path all the way to the exit. But be warned that this game is pretty hard, especially starting the 4th level, and it will try to kick your butt by making rain crates on your character (and also by using totally not glitches but features) >:D

(Don't worry about the different sound effects in level 2. I changed them like 5 times in Unity but for some reason they always came back... I have no idea why...)

There are 6 levels + 1 "hidden" level (its entrance is pretty obvious but it's not easy to get to it). Have fun, and don't hesitate to give me feedback ! ![capture_0.PNG](///raw/c55/a1/z/169b9.png)
![capture_1.PNG](///raw/c55/a1/z/169be.png)![capture_2.PNG](///raw/c55/a1/z/169c2.png)![capture_3.PNG](///raw/c55/a1/z/169c7.png)![capture_4.PNG](///raw/c55/a1/z/169ca.png)

107975.name: Slime Lines
107975.body:
For this entry i made a puzzle game :smile: .

![ld42-inicio.gif](///raw/a42/z/16eca.gif)


**I used**

> Love2d framework for the code

> Paint.NET for the art

> FL Studio for the music

> and Notepadd++ as my editor :laughing: 


![ld42-cover.gif](///raw/a42/z/16dd1.gif)

**RULES**

> Click on the arrows to move a line.

> Every 5 movemets a new line will be created.

> Connect 3 or more slimes for destroy them and increment points.

> If you connect 5 slimes, the whole line will be dissapear.

> If you fill the grid with slimes, you lose, it's simple!




**I hope you enjoy it, and good look in the jam!** :sunglasses:

108009.name: Package Packager
108009.body:
This game is about stuffing things into trucks. You don't need to know much more.
![Capture.PNG](///raw/cfa/z/164e2.png)

108014.name: Housebreaker
108014.body:
Hello,
I made a game where the understanding of theme is a bit abstract.

I'm sure every person who codes knows something called "The rucksack problem?" That's what I was thinking about. I created a game about a thief who has limited space in his backpack. I will let you see everything else the game has to offer.

![Screenshot2.png](///raw/b6d/3/z/17000.png)

I know it's far from perfect, but I'm happy about implementing a lot of elements, many of which were something new for me. I think of this more of an idea or a demo of a game that I might improve in future if I people find it interesting.

![Screenshot1.png](///raw/b6d/3/z/16f9a.png)

Let me know what you think!
PS. If you don't like anything about my game, I will blame it on the lack of time to make it better, so here you go :P

108029.name: Heart Breaker
108029.body:
Setting:

You are an aspiring master martial artist! Life is great!

Unfortunately, icky girls keep trying to play with you! You don't have time to play! You need to train!

You've managed to give them the slip so far, but it looks they are determined to not take "NO" for an answer...

It looks like you might not be able to punch your way out of this one...

 

-------------
Goal:

Reach an exit to move to escape to the next level.

​Survive as long as you can!​

Achieve a high score!

 

--------------
Controls:

Aim: Mouse Cursor

Punch + Move: Left Click

Pause Menu: ESC Key

108049.name: Go Pack Yourself!
108049.body:
![gopackyourself title.jpg](///raw/444/1/z/18095.jpg)
Go Pack Yourself! Is a game about packing your bags as quickly and efficiently as possible.  This game was made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 42. 

There are over 40 unique items with their own descriptions and shapes! It's a real test of your spacial thinking under pressure.

Credits to
@sudojess, @alexbpart @jyrkface and @frankydink

![Capture-2018-08-13_21-18-30.jpg](///raw/444/1/z/1808a.jpg)
![Capture-2018-08-13_21-19-59.jpg](///raw/444/1/z/18084.jpg)
![Capture-2018-08-13_21-19-26.jpg](///raw/444/1/z/18087.jpg)

108050.name: Shblow
108050.body:
![Shblow_Logo2.png](///raw/da5/d/z/17703.png)

### (JAM)

Theme : Running out of space

**STATE : polishing (for it to be shiny)**
But you can already play (without the music) right [here](https://zblah.itch.io/shblow)

_
![Visuel Shblow.png](///raw/da5/d/z/176d6.png)

_


## **_Kill it !_ Kill it with _GUNS_ !**

![FightShblow.png](///raw/da5/d/z/17729.png)     
_

**Get your sh*t together, and show them who's the boss ! **

_


Grab your shotgun and your stimpaks, this insectoid filth wants to eat your brain. On top of that, the ennemies' body turn into stone when dead, absorbing bullets, and blocking your path.

Your combat space is shriking every time you kill 


_Cut the mustard man ! It's your moment !_

_


![CREDITSV3small.png](///raw/da5/d/z/176d3.png)

by Team Zblah

108066.name: TuaCheap7
108066.body:
**TuaCheap7 is a game about a computer repair store from a small town. There are a few computers there for repair, coincidentally all are running out of space. Your job is to clean them. Just run your shop's anti-virus and cache cleaner. That's it, your done! No need to do anything else, ok? And try not to snoop on people's business, will 'ya?... :upside_down: **


-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-


How to Play:

- in the main menu, hit PLAY
- in the store walk to a computer using WASD
- to enter a computer, press E (be sure to be close and facing the one you want to open)
- in the computer use the mouse to navigate
- click the flashing icon to run anti-virus and cache cleaner
- when you're done, click the Door icon, and select shutdown


-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-


How to Exit:

- in the store, press ESC
-- Yes
or
- in the menu, click the exit button

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

Game made by **José Machado** and **Sofia Afonso**.
Special thanks to **Pedro Sá** for the help!

Every single asset used in this game is original and made from scratch. That even includes things like font and synthesizer presets. I went ultra hardcore. XD!

108076.name: Running out of RAM - an 80s BASIC programming simulator for C64
108076.body:
![roor_title.PNG](///raw/7e5/a1/z/16e17.png)

"Running out of RAM" is an 80s BASIC programming simulator written for C64 in BASIC V2.

You earned your first job as a programmer: write a video cassette collection database for a friend of your father.

Now you have to deal with food, sleep and the 38911 BASIC bytes free on your Commodore 64.  

Unfortunaly I was not able to make this run in a HTML5 C64 emulator, although it's simple BASIC. So you need a real C64 or at least an emulator like VICE. 

The d64 image includes two programs. The smaller one (roor.prg) is uncompiled BASIC and runs really slow. Better use Warp on VICE. The larger file (+roor.prg) is compiled with BasicBoss and might crash. Your choice. ;)

108084.name: TCGD AntiVirus '98
108084.body:
# TCGD AntiVirus '98

![img](///content/636/21/z/17e3c.png)



## State Of The Art Virus Protection for the new Millennium!
TCGD Antivirus '98 is the best software to really take control and destroy those pesky viruses and Memory flooding applications.

### About This Software:
* ##### Made for Ludum Dare 42!
    * ###### Theme: Running out of Space.
    
* Take Control of out patented Anti-Malware avatar and manually destroy them clearing your computer's memory!
* If the memory fills up or the Avatar takes too much damage, TCGD '98 will crash!
* The computer is constantly spawning memory eating viruses and you must destroy the spawners to keep the computer from filling up!
    * As you destroy spawners, closed doors will become open and you can fight the boss virus! 

### Controls!
* Movement
    * Arrow Keys or WASD
* Shooting:
    * Space
* Pause:
    * Escape

### Team Members!

* Allen Oliver
    * Coding, Design, and Planning 
    *  [http://aribaa.com/](http://aribaa.com/)
* Gerald Burke
    * Coding, design, Art
    * [http://www.geraldburke.com/](http://www.geraldburke.com/)
* Josh Petty
    * Art
    * [http://www.brainjargames.com/](http://www.brainjargames.com/)
* Erik Diep
    * Coding

108088.name: Transporter Royale
108088.body:
Players of a battle royale game are tired of waiting for safe area shrinkage.
Deliver as many of them to the final destination as you can, in your pickup truck with a very limited space available.

108099.name: Stomacho
108099.body:
In this game you'll have to eat as much as you can.  
But beware of your stomach's filling or you'll be sick.  
In five minutes we'll see how much you handle to eat.

### Rules
Each fast food restaurant give you different quantity of food  
If you run you'll eliminate food quickly  
Each fast food restaurant have a timeout  
If you eat too much, run too quickly, you'll puke on the floor

### Control
Arrow: move the player  
Shift: run

### Credits
* Code by [louckousse](https://twitter.com/louckousse)
* Powered by [Godot](https://godotengine.org/)
* Sprite source https://ansimuz.itch.io/tiny-rpg-town
* Sound design by nobody, there is no sound, I was running out of time

---
I've realized this game in two days, which is for me, a huge success. I wanted to try [Godot](https://godotengine.org/) and it was my first game engine ever used. I am very satisfied of this experience, you can be assured that my next entry will be more interesting.

108111.name: Get out of my space!
108111.body:
You are a selfish little planet and don't want anyone in your space!

Hit the enemies in the same direction to push them out.
If you are really fast, you can blow them up.

Opposite directions are not cool.

- W S to control orbit
- A D to control speed

**Block Drop**

A isometric puzzle game with 10 levels, the goal is to remove all the blocks on the level

Found this a weird theme to design for, however, I class this one as a success, in that its not another infinite level arena like game, it has levels! Made a nice change to to my previous entries. Hope to keep this up for next time!

108180.name: the shitty shooter
108180.body:
## How come

My first entry and my first kinda finished game in a long time. Basically, just a shitty shooter. Enemies don't despawn when killed, so you're running out of space! Please enjoy and thank you for letting me waste your time.

## Play in the browser

[Play the shitty shooter directly in your browser thank's to the absolutely not shitty itch.io](https://peterrr.itch.io/ld42)

Thank you for playing. Please leave a rating.

## How to play

![ship.png](///raw/366/a1/z/167f9.png) Move your ship with WASD. Use the mouse to shoot.

![egg.png](///raw/366/a1/z/167f7.png) Interdimensional eggs will spawn aliens. These eggs are interdimensional and cannot be messed with.

![alien.png](///raw/366/a1/z/167f1.png )Don't let them get you. They will lay interdimensional eggs after some time.

## I did this

I created all the pixels, all the sounds and all the code. Things I used:

- [Phaser](https://phaser.io)
- [Javascript](https://www.ecma-international.org/publications/standards/Ecma-262.htm)
- [bfxr](http://www.bfxr.net) for the sounds
- [Pixen](http://pixenapp.com) for the pixelmess
- [Webstorm](https://www.jetbrains.com/webstorm/) for coding
- webpack and yarn and such for packing and building and things
- Affinity Designer for the shitty cover image

### What went well

I did finish and submit my first game to a game jam. I actually finished this thing. It has a start, a playable part and an end. Usually I loose interest and chicken out, when I have my basic interactions going. The "art" is pretty shitty, but I don't hate it.

### What went not so well

I decided to participate half an hour before ludum dare startet. I had other stuff to do this weekend. And even when I had time to work on the project, it was quite hard to remain focused during the day.

I startet playing with rytimik studio for some music, but I hated what I came up with. So there's no music. A happy little accident.


## Screenshots

![shitty1.gif](///raw/366/a1/z/16797.gif)


![shitty2.gif](///raw/366/a1/z/167a0.gif)

108190.name: Logistic Dumping
108190.body:
Congratulations! You've been hired by the prestigious Logistics Dumping (LD) Waste Management Corporation to operate vehicle #0042!

As you well know, the trash depositories (or "dumps" as the locals call them) are getting rather full. In order to manage how much waste is being processed at any one time, we at LD Waste Management require our operators to think creatively in deciding when to pick up our customers' waste.

While some may view any waste sitting outside as a problem, we understand that technically, to fulfill our contractual obligation to the state, we need to remove waste only when a sizable amount has accumulated.

Be wary, however, as keeping homes at a high level of waste buildup will increase the potential for their owners or the state to file a complaint against us, and unfortunately, we are required by law to fire you on the spot if you have accumulated five (5) or more complaints.

Remember, you're paid based on the volume of waste collected, so get out there and manage that waste like a pro!

Have a great first day, and congratulations again on your new career in waste management!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

==Controls==

W/Up Arrow — Forward

S/Down Arrow — Reverse

A/Left Arrow — Turn Left (Only while moving)

D/Right Arrow — Turn Right (Only while moving)

ESC - End your run early and quit the game

When you begin, trash will accumulate in front of homes in the neighborhood. Position your truck in front of a home to collect its waste. A meter will fill above the truck to show how full it is, and when the meter is full, you will no longer be able to pick things up until you go back to the dump and wait for the truck to empty.

You will have to plot a course that allows you to regularly hit each home — if you allow trash to accumulate too much, the residents will start submitting complaints against you. When a home is getting near that limit, a yellow "!" will appear above it.

Try to gather as much trash as you can before the complaints pile up!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tools Used:

Unity3d 2018

Visual Studio Community 2017

MagicaVoxel

Bfxr

Microsoft Paint

BeepBox (https://www.beepbox.co/)

![Dumping.PNG](///raw/6b8/21/z/16955.png)
![RunningOur.PNG](///raw/6b8/21/z/1695f.png)
![GameOver.PNG](///raw/6b8/21/z/16961.png)

108197.name: Tetromatcher
108197.body:
Tetromatcher is a block-stacking game which features elements of Tetris and color-matching puzzle games.

Post your highscores!

## Controls

Move left/right: arrow left/right
Fast drop: arrow down
Rotate right: space, X, F
Rotate left: Z, W, Y, Q

## Rules

Basic Tetris rules apply, with weaker scoring to encourage use of color matching chains.

Matching 4 or more of one color clears only those blocks, and applies gravity only to the columns that were occupied. Clearing a group of blocks counts as clearing a line, with the score scaling based on the number of blocks in the group.

Chain reactions start a combo multiplier, which resets at the end of the chain. Chains give more points than simply clearing lines.

Speed increases with lines cleared.

No advanced Tetris scoring is present (e.g. back-to-backs, T-spins, etc.).

![tetromatcher.png](///raw/f14/1/z/17462.png)

108199.name: City Gardener
108199.body:
![BG.png](///raw/ac0/c/z/17bdd.png)

## STORY

You have arrived to the city of Technopolis. The first thing you notice in this modern city is that there's nothing natural to be found. However, you manage to acquire the only piece of land left with nothing built on it. So you decide to create your own garden to bring some life to this soulless city.


## HOW TO PLAY

Your piece of land consists on a 10x10 grid and you can move from square to square in a first person view. You can sow a plant on each square, and after that you must water it regularly or else it will wither and die. You can sow other plants in other squares while the already existing plants are growing. Once a plant has fully grown into a tree, you won't need to water it anymore. Your objective is to grow the highest amount of trees that you can before the time runs out.

But be careful! If you step on a square that contains a plant, you will damage it and it will take longer to fully grow. Sometimes you will have to step on a plant in order to reach and water another plant. So plan carefully where do you start sowing you plants and watch your steps to avoid damaging your plants as much as you can. Fully grown trees, along with 10 random rocks scattered through the land will block your way. They can make things harder for you!

This is the cycle of a plant as long as you water it in time:
- Nothing  ->   Seed planted   ->   Small plant   ->   Bush   ->   Tree

If you don't water the plant in time or if you step on it, it will go back one step as follows:
- Bush   ->   Small plant   ->   Nothing

Remember that trees won't die, and if a plant fully dies, you'll have to plant the seed again.


## CONTROLS

- W: Move Forward
- S: Move Backward
- A: Rotate Left
- D: Rotate Right
- Q: Strafe Left
- E: Strafe Right
- 1: Plant a seed
- 2: Water the seed / plant

108200.name: DataSkream
108200.body:
###DataSkream
___

Welcome to DataSkream, a game that will test your reflexes and awareness! DataSkream is a music based plat former designed to draw you in to test just how far you can get and how many points you can achieve! As the song becomes more intense you will have less and less options to survive. You will have 3 lives in total, if you fall off the platforms into the abyss you lose a life, once your lives hit 0 its game over! If by sheer skill (or luck) you make it to the end your reward will be the huge amount of points you would of earned by making it that far, the further you get, the more you will receive!

___

##Theme
The theme, 'Running out of space' is represented within our game with the use of our platform system. The more 'Hype' the song becomes the less platforms you will be able to jump to, this gets progressively harder throughout the song leading to less and less space!

___

##Development
The development for this game was completed in the Unity Engine, using Maya, ZBrush and Blender to create all of the models, Photoshop and the Unity Particle System to create all particles and Visual Studio for all of the programming and the amazing song was created using Ableton (Thanks Lewis <3). GitKraken was used so that we could all work collectively on the project at the same time.

 

- Controls (PC)
WASD for movement
SPACE for Jump

-Controls (Console Pad)
Left Analog for movement
A Button for Jump

- Used Tools:
Unity
Maya
Blender
Photoshop
GitKraken
Ableton
Visual Studio Code
ZBrush

108238.body:
"Where the Cloud Lives" is a game I made in 48 hours for the Compo. Theme is "running out of space".

You control the freshly hired supervisor of a new division in an established tech company: Cloud storage.  Their motto is: "You never run out of space"... We'll see how that goes. There are two endings.

You can pan the screen with WASD or Alt-Click. Spacebar will advance textboxes. All other controls are explained in game... I think.

Thanks for checking this out! I really enjoyed putting it together. This was my first Ludum Dare, and also my first completed game.

Source is available on the itch.io page. Linking it here doesn't seem to be working. I'll put it on GitHub soon.

108269.body:
## Objective

## Controls

* M to toggle sound on/off
* R to restart the current level
* T to restart from the first level

## Tech
* Haxeflixel + Flash develop as implementation language/library/IDE of choice

I spent maybe 6-7 hours on the code this game, 2-3 hours on the music, and maybe an hour to package it up and put it on my website.  Less than 12 hours.

I really did try to get the game to work in WebGL, but it would never load.  I didn't build a 64-bit version of the game because it runs fine in 32.

108400.name: LANDESCAPE
108400.body:
OK, this came in super hot and on fire so I apologize for the bugs and lack of controls listed in game.

On a hostile planet, all law and infrastructure has broken down. Everyone is heading for "The Tower", the last hope of survival. There are only a certain amount of places in the tower and they are running out of space! Get there before they are full. Evil bounty hunters are tying to get there too and will do anything to stop you. Kill them before they kill you. 

CONTROLS

WASD - SPACE BAR and F / Right Shift

Game Pad - A button and Right Trigger 

Kill the low enemies with gunfire and try to take out flying enemies with water charges. 

Ammo is hidden in the environment. Shoot stuff to see where.

![Screenshot.png](///raw/7fa/z/1702d.png)

patches incoming I am SURE of it!

*** UPDATE 11am Monday 13/08/2018 ***

Fixed a bug where you couldn't complete the game. One variable change has fixed this and also noticed that the second audio wasn't playing when near death. Fixed collision on ship and now using the correct audio channel for explosions!

Thanks to my wife and friends for finding these issues.

108412.name: Claustrophobia
108412.body:
Hordes of friendly zombies huggers are coming for you. But... you are quite claustrophobic. And you dont like zombies.
Kill as many zombies as possible but, be carefull, if you get to close to too many zombies, or to their corpse, your SANITY will decrease. If it reaches 0, it's Game Over.

**Aim for the highest score!**


![StartMenuCapture.PNG](///raw/2ef/81/z/16a1a.png)


**[ INPUTS ]**

**W/A/S/D** or **UP/LEFT/DOWN/RIGHT** => **Move**
**LEFT CLICK** => **Shoot** (aim with the mouse cursor)
**RIGHT CLICK** => **"Megalazor"**  (aim with the mouse cursor) ​(only when charged)
The Megalazor charge depending on your Sanity. The lower your Sanity is, the faster it charges.

**[ GOAL ]**

Try to score as high as you can.
You lose if your Sanity reaches 0. Your sanity decreases ​depending on the number of enemies, corpses or walls that are close to your character.


![InGameCapture.PNG](///raw/2ef/81/z/16a44.png)

Oh and... unfortunately, their no music, I wanted to make one, but I was running out of time...
Same for two very little features i wanted to add : printing the score on game over screen and slightly randomizing pitch some sound effects. It would have taken only a few minutes to do it but that's the game :D

< Edit > I just noticed that i forgot to reset the score when the game restart^^ dear me -_-

Hope you'll enjoy plying this as much as I enjoyed making it!

108417.name: Gargleblaster
108417.body:
Working title, kind of stuck. A fitting name though for Ludum Dare **42**, don't you think.

Gargleblaster is a game about running out of space, literally.
You play as an astronaut who has to jump from asteroid to asteroid in order to return to earth. Use the **SPACE** key to **jump and change direction** in mid air (or much rather vacuum). 
But be careful, you have a **limited amount of jumps** available. You run out of jumps, and you go flying off into the depths of outer space. Lucky for you your jumps are **replenished whenever you land on an asteroid**.
On your way down you might encounter some strange objects. They are not really useful, except for the **COINS** which **give you extra jumps** and might save you from certain death.

Anyway, have fun playing and good luck getting back to earth (the destination will have been worth the journey).

![MainMenu.png](///raw/03a/z/16938.png)

![InGame.png](///raw/03a/z/1693b.png)

108494.name: Amazing Deliveries

108545.name: Return to Garbage World
108545.body:
Get yourself out of space and back onto the terrible planet that you love.

Control with keyboard or gamepad. Make as many landings as you can to maximize your score. The planet terrain gets more extreme as the levels go on.

![capture_001_12082018_083844.png](///raw/c7f/2/z/15fea.png)

![capture_003_12082018_083948.png](///raw/c7f/2/z/15fe8.png)

![capture_005_12082018_084053.png](///raw/c7f/2/z/15fe9.png)

How to play:

You start in orbit around a small planet. You want to bring your orbit in until you are close to the planet, then separate your lander from the booster to make your final descent. The lander has more thrust, since it is less massive, but it also has much less fuel, so time your separation carefully. If you've played a space game like Kerbal Space Program or Lunar Lander, it will be familiar. If not, [this video](https://youtu.be/eOMS8Y3ULdY?list=PLYu7z3I8tdEmqpOkQZCl5SZB5t0vXuxE0&t=295) talks about a similar landing in KSP. But the basic idea is that if you burn facing away from your current heading you will slow down, and if you slow down your orbit will get lower.

The camera in this game is always oriented so that the planet is beneath you, so down on the screen is the direction of gravity, and the direction you will need to go to reach land.

Your UI from left to right is:

ALT (altitude): Your altitude with maximum being your starting altitude, and minimum being sea level of the planet (note that terrain can be higher than sea level!)

VEL (velocity): Your current heading relative to your viewpoint. If the yellow line is facing right, then you are going clockwise around the planet. If it's facing down, you're heading straight for the surface!

ORBIT: A simple map of your position relative to the planet. This view is not adjusted to your perspective.

LVL (level): The current level you're on.

SCORE: How many points you've earned. You earn points for each level you beat, and the more fuel you have left over the more points you earn.

GAS: The amount of fuel left in your current stage. The booster and lander have separate fuel reserves, but the lander has much less, so use it wisely.

Controls:

A/D or left arrow/right arrow - Rotate counterclockwise/clockwise

W or up arrow - Thrust

Space or return - separate the lander from the booster

Escape - return to the main menu

108593.name: Boxed
108593.body:
For my first ever entry to Ludum Dare, I present to you my submission for Ludum Dare #42! 

![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/038/a1/z/16f49.png)

Boxed is a very simple game where you rush around trying to deliver parcels to impatient customers before they leave or your warehouse runs out of space!

I am not a 3D modeller or artist by any rate so the whole game was made as best as I can with the tools and knowledge I had. The art style is very basic but I think it turned out well. I think i "Might" have deviated from the initial theme a bit, but I will admit I got carried away haha!

The controls are very basic and honestly could use work. All controls are listed in the game but I will quickly go over them now!

Left click: Move
Right-click: Pick up box / Give the box

To Give a box, Simply right click on the customer in front of the queue (You need to be close enough to interact with them)

The story of the game is, your colleagues have gone out for coffee during a quiet hour, and you have been left on your own with your friend Dodger Jammie. Out of nowhere many customers started to pour in, so Dodger rushed into the back and started passing you boxes gently to help with the incoming horde of unruly postal office users.

I do not expect to go far in my first entry, But I hold good expectations with my project just because of its quirkiness. 

I hope you enjoy playing my game, as I enjoyed making it! 

I hope to continue the development of this project when the comp is over! So stay tuned for that! 

Have a good day, My name is Mark Dearman (Devio) and enjoy!!!!!

-------------------

Tools Used :

 - Unity
 - Paint.net
 - Blender
 - Visual Studio

-------------------

NOTE: No audio currently in the game, I couldn't make any due to lack of skill. Sorry about this :(

PS: I had to do a quick bug fix to stop getting stuck at level 2 (game breaking) I hope this is okay with you. (Done before the last hour)

108606.name: Space Sale
108606.body:
![ludumdare_image.png](///raw/197/3/z/1714a.png)
# The Most Immersive Story of All Time
The universe has expanded to the edge of space and has begun to turn in on itself. As intergalactic corporations begin to run out of storage facilities, stores have started giving sales at ridiculously low prices! As one of the most intelligent of space creatures, you are trying to get some amazing deals!

# Meet the collectabiles
## Dr.Unidentified
![DrUnidentified.png](///raw/197/3/z/17d11.png)
A carbonated drink made of at least several unknown illegal substances. Luckily the FDA was abolished long ago so we can drink this sweet (salty?) drink in peace.

## Galaxy Bleach
![Galaxy Bleach.png](///raw/197/3/z/17d1a.png)
An offbrand Solar Bleach. With it being the end of the universe and all, this item has been especially popular.

## Solar Bleach
![Solar Bleach.png](///raw/197/3/z/17d1b.png)
A bleach that was bleached by the sun itself before being put on retail shelves. It is the most luxorous type of bleach available for the common extra terrestrial.

## Solar Dew
![Solar Dew.png](///raw/197/3/z/17d1d.png)
From the same people who created Solar Bleach comes Solar Dew. "It's the same thing as Solar Bleach but we removed all the toxins" - Solar Corp. Official

## Space Chips
![spacechips.png](///raw/197/3/z/17d59.png)
Baked in a solar oven, Space Chips are the perfect meal for any occasion. For parties, movies, breakfast, dinner, Space Chips goes well with any side of Space Chips!


# Gameplay
*Play as the mythical alien with a shopping cart!*
![alien.PNG](///raw/197/3/z/15a04.png)
*Collect as many items as you can to get the best deals!*
![run.png](///raw/197/3/z/17d90.png)

# Credits
**[Joseph Manley](https://ldjam.com/users/joseph-manley)** - Code, Game Design, UI

**[Mortifix](https://ldjam.com/users/mortifix)** - Modeling, Animation, Art, Voice Acting

**[Literal Filth](https://ldjam.com/users/literal-filth)** - Music and Assistance with Art and Game Design

Widgets are built, widgets are shipped!  You are the shipping manager trying to keep up with shipping orders.  Jump on a same colored box to ship it, different colors swap your color.  Let them stack or stack them yourselves to build combos.  Don't let the stack get out of control!  

Link to my website hosting the game in webGL (didn't work in chrome but firefox seemed to do okay).   Will post a binary later tonight.

Software used:

Unity and Visual Studio
Bummed some sound Effects from an older game of mine.
Wanted to use MagicaVoxel for art, didn't get around to it (and I am a programmer not an artist Jim!)


Controls: 

Left ctrl picks up boxes.
Place a box on another box only
Space jumps

(Binary will work with a gamepad)


Known issues:


Sometimes the game just ends (bad states on falling blocks) rare but it happens.
The floatyness of the jump is a pain, more time I would totally of cleaned this up.

Future work:
Art redux
Sound effects Redux
Music
Clean up the jump/move in air mechanic.
Add more levels.
Add a puzzle mode where you have to clear a floor with limited jumps
Add powerups for endless mode.

http://shanethomasphotography.com/ShippingFast/

108626.name: Sink or Swim
108626.body:
## **Story**

> The humans arrived late that evening, they wished each other a good night and conveniently ignored my imploring plight for food (fuck’em) and so I watched them march upstairs with my tail held high,  their voices slowly subsiding to the silence of the night. I began contemplating the day when they will give me their full attention and bow down to me. However, I’m not alone; in the foggy mist of the room there is something; something that looks at me from time to time, a penetrating shine that pierces my eyes; It’s smell invigorates me and I loath for the day that I can get close to it and clasp it’s small silky body into my jaws, oh yes...It will be puuuuuuurfect...

> Tomorrow will a great day; human n03 is quite fond of it and I heard her say that she will be cleaning its home and putting it in the sink for the time being; I’ve been waiting for this day for far too long; but like my old man “Victorious” once said; patience…meow... I shall wait my time, hide in a place where no one will expect me; yes, a quiet place that no one will ever know….
 

## **Controls**

- Purrrrrrresssss Left click on the faucet to add water.
- click around the sink that is submerged in water so that the fish goes to that point.

## **How to play**

- Click and hold on the faucet/tap to add water to the sink.
- Click around the sink so that the fish moves to that point.
- Collect the worms for a surpppppppppppprise! 

## **Screenshots**

![Screenshot2.jpg](///raw/b4f/2/z/1644c.jpg)

![Screenshot3.jpg](///raw/b4f/2/z/1644d.jpg)

## **Credits**

- @LoudEyes, 2D & UI
- @Coltron, Music & SFX
- @wrexialmt, Programming
- @rainbowez, A cat in a box

## **Notes from the humans...Meow**

> Please vote in all tabs, and we love comments, both positive and negative and we encourage anonymous comments if you're shy. Please take a minute to let us know what you think.!

108703.name: Too Many Boxes
108703.body:
In Too Many Boxes, you have a roommate that will not stop ordering things online. You have to figure out ways to dispose of the boxes before your house is overrun. 

There's a lot that I wanted to put in the game but didn't have time for, and there's only one way to get rid of the boxes, so you likely won't need to play the game very long to see everything in it's current state. Planned if I continue to work on the game, are things you, the player, can buy on the computer in the office to help get rid of the boxes (such as wood for your fireplace, some sort of shredder, etc.). The catch there would be that those items would come in boxes of their own, which you would have to weigh the cost of in terms of the space available in your house. Also I would want it to have something in the ui that shows how close you are to losing, but I didn't get around to it. There is a debug menu that shows how close you are to losing, though, if you want to see. I think it's a decent idea for a game and wanted to finish it, I just had other things come up that I needed to do and couldn't finish it.

![screenshot-1.png](///raw/5a8/1/z/16c4f.png)

![screenshot-2.png](///raw/5a8/1/z/16ca1.png)

![screenshot-3.png](///raw/5a8/1/z/16ca3.png)

![screenshot-4.png](///raw/5a8/1/z/16ca6.png)

![screenshot-5.png](///raw/5a8/1/z/16ca8.png)

### Controls
- **WASD** to move
- **Mouse** to move camera
- **LMB** to pick up/drop boxes
- **F** to fold boxes
- **F3** to open/close the debug menu
- **.** to spawn a bunch of boxes quickly (no actual gameplay purpose, just there if you want to see a bunch of boxes)

### Tools
- Unity 2018
- Visual Studio Code
- Blender / ProBuilder
- PhotoShop

I put a link to the source code, but it's not showing it for me, so here's the link: https://github.com/jasperarmstrong/LD42

Also, I was only able to test the Mac and Windows builds, but the Linux one should work fine too since it's a Unity game. My computer might just not be good enough, but the game can get kind of laggy when there are a lot of boxes, try turning down the settings in the Unity launcher if that happens.

I opted out of audio ratings because the game has no audio.

108777.name: Abernanthium
108777.body:
MUSIC WARNING: A midi file does play as this is a rhythm game, so it might be loud depending on your current speaker settings.


## Simple Pat is back!

![abernathium-main.png](///raw/90c/2/z/18270.png)

**Can you use Abernathium to gain enough speed to run out of (outer) space?**

Status: Incomplete. The game is playable, but a bit not fully completed.

Graphics for the main game didn't get completed in time, nor did some flushing out of scenes. A lot of the feeling and setting are lost without the rest of the graphics.

The overall idea was the red circle was to be a black hole (eventually), and Simple Pat discovered that with the help of Abernathium, he was able to run on the fabric of space, and phase jump to different beams.

The goal was to gain enough speed running on light beams (from the black hole) while collecting the light energy to run "through" the black hole with enough speed to run "out" of space.

108786.body:
You appear to have a suspicious file on your desktop. What could it be?

![ss_0.png](///raw/1f8/a1/z/17033.png)

![ss_1.png](///raw/1f8/a1/z/17036.png)

![ss_2.png](///raw/1f8/a1/z/17037.png)

Ver 1.1 Bug Fix Change Log:
- You can no longer keep antivirus files in the recycle bin after a successful game to restore them once a new 42.zip appears and has been started for a head start.
- The recycle bin no longer keeps the score from previous games (it added on previously to files fully recycled).
- Events weren't being de-registered, causing an issue upon scene reloads.

Ver 1.2 Bug Fix Change Log:
- Virus and Antivirus file names start counting at 0 rather than using the last used number at the start of each zip bomb attack.
- New files will appear below all previous files (prevents held files from being masked).
- Trash can no longer accidentally be selected during certain input spamming (and therefore accidentally deleted).
- When deleting groups of icons, the trash bin will always occur last, rather than depending on index.
- File selection should no longer drag files in some odd input cases.
- Double clicking to unzip files was preventing regular clicks until a right click occurred. Double clicking no longer unzips - now it's purely right click > unzip.
- Some panels had ratios changed for WebGL.

Side Notes:
- Power off buttons are not applicable for WebGL (closes the application normally).
- Backspace and Delete are shortcuts to delete selected files!

108800.name: Test Subject 42
108800.body:
Have you ever had trouble organizing your desk? Well, how about you be forced to be organized? In Test Subject 42, you will play as the... well, Test Subject 42, trying to go through series of tasks in a limited table. Can you complete all of them before you end up toasted?

__Instruction:__
1. Movement and interaction
   - Mouse (X/Y, Left Button, Right Button, Wheel)
   - Arrows (Up, Down)
2. Objective
   - Follow your instructions and don't die
3. If you fail, the game will restart automatically. If you win, the game will close itself.

__Tools:__
Unreal Engine 4
Blender
Gimp
Audacity

__Announcements:__

__/**************************************************/__
After almost 2 years, I am back for some jamming! A lot of stress during this time, but I __was__ able to learn a couple of new things! For this project, mainly the new tools I'm using~ I do have other skills I would like to test, but let's just wait for the next jam 😋

Well, more about the __game__ now, very simple one, but I tested a lot of my new skills in it, so I'm actually satisfied with the end result (of course it can always be better though). After a long time jamming again, and not being able to just stay 2 days straight working, and using new software, I had a rough start, but everything ended well 😄 So it was actually good for me to do forget about compo and do it in a slower pace in jam.

No BGM and no fancy art, but I think this game didn't ask for it, and I was able to make (mostly) everything by myself~ so it actually follows compo rules, except the time constraint!

Anyway, that's it for me, I hope you enjoyed this small time playing my game, and as always, any feedback is much appreciated! 🙌
__/**************************************************/__

108803.name: Tower Crunch
108803.body:
Instructions: Defend the tower against hordes of enemies. Every time the tower takes damage, the stage becomes smaller! Keep going until the tower is destroyed.

Controls: Use WASD to move, Shift to run, Click/Space to Fire.

108812.name: Loneliness
108812.body:
![title 1920x1080.jpg](///raw/dbd/31/z/17b6a.jpg)

Loneliness is our entry for Ludum Dare #42 and our second Ludum Dare game. We were 4 working during the 72 hours.

Loneliness is a first person immersive game where you're walking through a motel. We were not really inspired by the theme to be honest, and because we didn't want to create a game with a basic idea, we decided to create a game from the idea that inspired us the most.

We eventually made a game that we like and that allowed each one of us to learn things and experiment (which is great since we are students and want to keep on learning and discovering things in our main skill areas). And after all, game jams are also made to have fun and learn, aren't they ? :D

![02.jpg](///raw/dbd/31/z/17b69.jpg)

/!\
Due to the short development time we did not really optimize the game and there are some issues with the web version. You can still experience it on your browser, it takes a few minutes to load but it works even if there are some shaders missing and other little problems like that, but don't hesitate to download it on your computer for a much better outcome ! :) Thanks for your understanding !
/!\

Hope you guys will like the game, feel free to tell us what you think and we will gladly try your games !
Cheers !

108815.name: The Dishaster
108815.body:
This is my first time doing something like this and I'm pretty excited. I'll try and play and rate everyone who does mine :)

==The Dishaster==
Your SO is washing up the dishes, and is 'Running out of space' on the dish rack, help them by stacking as many dishes as you can. The higher the dish, the more points it's worth.
Controls:
W/A/D To peek the camera Up/Left/Right.
Click and drag to move the dishes, scroll wheel moves the dish away/towards camera.
R to restart
Dishes will rotate in a random direction when you pick them up, 
pick them up again to rotate in another direction.
Game will end when all dishes are broken or in the goal zone

108818.name: CowHerd - machine trained cows
108818.body:
CowHerd
========

![cowherd_cover.jpg](///raw/d09/a1/z/16065.jpg)

You play as a **dog** that has to help the **cows** get to **grass**, so they can eat. If they don't eat, they'll starve.
The cows run away from you or to the nearest grass patch. And since there is limited amount of grass, you run out of food.
(connection to the theme, but with a big emphasis on -running- due to the running technique the cows use. The computer taught them the best way to run forward using **machine learning**)

The idea of this game was to play around with unity's machine learning capabilities.
We started with a simple rigidbody - joint character and trained multiple using tensorflow.
During the training, Martin modeled the map and the cow model.

Special thanks to Renke Müller for creating these amazing sounds for this jam!

Below are some gifs of the progress.

![ldjam10comp.gif](///raw/d09/a1/z/16388.gif)

https://twitter.com/oddstack/status/1028232777618137088
https://twitter.com/oddstack/status/1028241360124567552
https://twitter.com/oddstack/status/1028304204010610688
![cowherdpic1.PNG](///raw/d09/a1/z/16057.png)

![cowherdpic2.PNG](///raw/d09/a1/z/16059.png)

108820.name: Airlock Gridlock
108820.body:
**DESCRIPTION**

Ever seen Interstellar? If you have, you’d know there’s a lot to do on a space station, and not a whole lot of docking ports. Our game takes that one step further.

You are the space-traffic control operator of an overcrowded trade station. Your job is to process as many trades as possible, while at the same time keeping docking ports clear and preventing merchant vessel collisions. Manage ships of all different shapes and sizes, all while fending off raiders and trying to distribute resources evenly to stay in the game!

**CONTROLS**

[Mouse] -> General interaction

[Space] -> Advance tutorials

[Escape, P] -> Pause/Unpause

**DETAILS**

Made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 42. All assets, including font and music, are original and were created within the allotted jam time. Custom engine can be found here: https://github.com/osreboot/Ridhvl

Please message us here on or twitter with questions/concerns @hyprgloo or visit our github profiles at /osreboot /basset10 /haveaniceday33.

108829.name: Mad Desert
108829.body:
Another jam that we can successfully finish the game, this time simple ideas have been implemented with an easy mechanics to master, about the difficulty level will be improved in the future, as well as adding new features, I hope you have fun too.
![Icon.ico](///raw/507/6/z/17f1c.image/x-icon)
developed by Djosef Wytemalhos (instagram: @ jofih.nho) and Sabrina Lacerda (instagram: @sachiartist).
![Menu.png](///raw/507/6/z/17e11.png)
Controls: :
  you can play with keyboard or joystick.

  MENU:
    * Spacebar (keyboard) to Start the Game.
    * A or B (joystick) to start the Game.
    * ESC to Quit the Game at any time.

  GAMEPLAY:
    * Directional arrows to Move.
    * Z or spacebar (keyboard) to push a Block.
    * A or B (joystick) to push a Block.

Make as many points as possible, have fun. :v:

108846.name: After the Future
108846.body:
It is the year 3042. The machines have taken the control of the universe. Only a few groups of humans remain in the recondite corners of the space. After ages fighting against the machines, these has taken the control of a bunch numbers of human subjects. And the artificial intelligences are experiment with them; knowing their weakness; learning from their enemies. 

After the Future is a sci-fi videogame made in 72h by Jordi Garcia aka @bichodust for the Ludum Dare Jam 42. The theme was "Running out of space". In this context, you have to play with the different mechanics to analyze the human subjects and balance everything to have enough data space to keep doing it.

The mechanics will challenge your reflexes and micromanagement skills. While you are repeating a simple key patterns, you have to stay aware of the hard disk state; the model batteries; and the subject time. 

I made all the design, coding and art. For the music and sound effects, I have used royalty free resources from freesound.org and looperman.com.

I would appreciate some feedback a lot. Hope you enjoy it :D!

**Mechanic Rules:**

- You have to analyse 10 human subjects. Each one remains 32 seconds maximum to you to do it.


- Middle screen: Shows the key pattern you have to repeat (it refreshes every 3 seconds), to gain one analysing cell. When the bar is full, the human subject is analysed.


- Left screen: It shows you the amount of space used in disk(white). Each subject analysed fill 2 cells. If you run out of space, the next subject will be disintegrated by the system and 2 cells of space will be freed.


- Top right screen: It shows you the time remaining (white) of the current subject to be analysed.


- Three little screen on right bottom: The boost has a percentage to fill all the subject bar or burn the current subject; the bolt fills one battery of the model XhJG48_X. If the robot runs out of energy, you have to wait a few seconds until he is working again; the file removes one cell of data from the hard disk.

![S113 at 17.13.21 (2).png](///raw/829/a1/z/17848.png)

![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 17.13.51 (2).png](///raw/829/a1/z/1784b.png)

![Screen Shot 20asd13 at 17.13.51 (2) copy.png](///raw/829/a1/z/1784d.png)

108860.name: Gone in dark cave
108860.body:
![cover.jpg](///raw/c58/2/z/1615a.jpg)

Your enter the dark cave, a strange place with dark magic and weird monsters.
With your bag of cards, you have to defeat all the 5 floors to win.

The game is a card game, where every card you play and every hit you take go on board. The board represent your energy, if full you're dead.
Manage your board, discover combo and fight your way through victory !

The game contains 12 cards, 4 bosses and 6 enemies offering a good replay value for a gamejam game.

this is my 10th ( i think ?) ludum dare and the most polished game i have made. I’m very proud of this game and i hope you will like it too !

if you have any feedback or questions, you can follow me on twitter : [helscar](https://twitter.com/helscar)

![gameplay3.JPG](///raw/c58/2/z/16531.jpg)

![gameplay2.JPG](///raw/c58/2/z/16533.jpg)

108903.name: Running Out Of Space
108903.body:
An experimental, slightly mysterious take on the theme **Running out of space**, with a twist.

How long will you last? Will you discover the truth?

(I don't want to spoil the surprise for you, so I will keep the description short.)

108905.name: Jelly Thoughts
108905.body:
Life is a constant barrage of facts. Human biology does an amazing job of managing information, but what if we had to do it manually?

Store facts and memories in the brain. With each new experience, facts and memories assault the brain. Forget! Too many facts will give you a headache, and might crowd over important stuff. Remember! Missing critical facts can cause disasters.

Not really finished, but I felt like I had enough to share. I started scripting out a tutorial and ran out of time before adding any real content. The plan was to make it a sort of VN where failing to manage the thoughts quickly enough would cause wacky failures, like forgetting where to walk.

![screenshot.PNG](///raw/9da/81/z/17317.png)

108912.name: Roomy's Room
108912.body:
Arrow Keys to Move.

Intruders are trying to crash your party of one, as they are uninvited. Resist them for as long as you can!![theparty.png](///raw/b69/a1/z/16ee7.png)

108915.name: OVERKILL
108915.body:
# Feel the Heat

![GameCharacter.jpg](///raw/440/8/z/168f0.jpg)

![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 4.00.48 PM.JPG](///raw/440/8/z/168fa.jpg)

> A platformer shoot-em-up as the level fills up with the enemy corpses giving you less and less space to fight in. With procedurally generated bullets and a difficulty based wave system.

### Use Arrow Keys to move, Space to Jump and Click to shoot

108942.name: Automata Resist
108942.body:
My first entry to a Ludum Dare Comp! I only use the windows console for my programs as I can't draw!

Objective: Survive!
Use Arrow keys to move player around map. Use Space Bar to deploy bombs to resist the ever encroaching automata! You will need to pick up more bombs as you use them up. Don't blow yourself up! Don't get trapped by the automata!

I use an engine I developed called olcConsoleGameEngine, which you can see loads of applications on [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/javidx9), which I find is great for quick prototypes of ideas. I coded the game live on [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/videos/295730019) where you can see the VOD.

There is no install just download and run on windows, for linux, modify the .cpp file as instructed to include the correct header, it will need to link with SDL2.

http://onelonecoder.com/olcLudumDare42.gif <- Take A Look!

Update R1) Made Player More visible, fixed end-game lockup glitch, Thanks guys that tested it!

108946.name: Thoughts In My Head
108946.body:
Hey guys, me again.
This Time I made another "Not A Game" game.:smile:



## Game Description:

It's a game about those thoughts in my head.


![Snipaste_2018-08-13_00-04-05.png](///raw/24f/2/z/16021.png)
**Black thoughts**: 
>They are bad thoughts, they will stay in my head unless you eliminate them. 
>Click Left Mouse to eliminate them.


![Snipaste_2018-08-13_00-00-37.png](///raw/24f/2/z/16017.png)
**Colorful thoughts**: 
>They are good, they'll pass my head unless you catch them. 
>Click Right Mouse to catch them for me. 


**Result sheet**:

![蜂蜜浏览器_Snipaste_2018-08-12_23-51-05.png](///raw/24f/2/z/16031.png)




## Game Controls：


**Left Mouse: Eliminate.**


**Right Mouse: Catch.**

108954.name: Path Blox
108954.body:
A Puyo-Puyo inspired take to the puzzle genre, *Path Blox* is a game about using tiles that fall from the top of the grid to form paths that cross the screen.

CONTROLS:
Press Z to start
Press Enter to pause
Players will use the left and right arrow keys to move blocks across the grid, and the down arrow key to move the blocks down faster

GAMEPLAY:
The goal of *Path Blox* is to create paths with blocks that fall from the top of the grid. 
Paths will start from the left or right side of the screen and loop into themselves.
![pathblox.p8_6.gif](///raw/269/2/z/166fe.gif)
Paths can also end at an edge of the screen, including the bottom- this can be done for extra points.
![pathblox.p8_4.gif](///raw/269/2/z/16706.gif)
At certain intervals, "garbage" tiles will fall from the top of the grid. To get rid of these, paths are made that lead into them.
![pathblox.p8_5.gif](///raw/269/2/z/16703.gif)

108969.name: Don't touch the glass!
108969.body: You. Zombies. A glass floor. It can only support so many of you. Knock them off before it collapses.

108989.name: Lab
108989.body:
You wake up and immediately notice something's very wrong.
The automated intelligence agent assistant seems to be glitching out.
The lab you work in is crashing down.
High voltage arcs from the walls as sections of ceiling and lights crash to the ground.
Can you make it out before the escape is cut off?
Its going to be a rough day at work.

Lab is a simple turn based game. 
Press WASD or Arrow Keys to move. 
Each turn there is a chance that a section of the lab will collapse nearby making progress more difficult (or impossable).
Touch a wall and die. Find the opening in the outer wall and win.

goOd lUck hUman!

108993.name: Follow The Light
108993.body:
Follow The Light is a free running/drop game where the walls close in on you + with some chill music. Didn't get much time this Jam, but Enjoy.

Controls:
WASD - Move
Mouse - Look
SPACE - Jump/Double Jump

108997.name: Disk Driver
108997.body:
![diskdriver_screenshot.png](///raw/e5e/z/16d71.png)

Drive between blocks of memory.
Each loop around the disk adds blocks.
Inspired by Cubefield.

- Models and Level Design: Corey Jackson

109002.name: Slime Running.
109002.body:
Hello everyone!!!

All ready! We are delighted with the game, we are also very excited. Our first LDJAM !!!

It is incredible all the experiences that we lived in these short days, we really loved it.

But hey, no longer, for the game:

SLIME RUNNING

Can you leave the mine?

Help our friend get out of the mine, which is being invaded by SLIMES! Use your mental agility to escape from these strange creatures and thus overcome each level.

And you, at what level can you reach?

-----------

The video game focuses on being able to escape from each room, which will be constantly filled with slimes that will overwhelm you. For that you must escape.

Live a unique adventure: Each level is random and your difficulty will increase.

109004.name: Pick up space toys!
109004.body:
We're running out of space, mom says we have to clean up. 

She said to clean up the space toys, right?


Look around to find the space toys and click on them to pick them up. Can you make it through all the levels? Can you find the secrets?

109005.body:
![](///content/be3/z/15603.jpg)

SACCULOS is a game about the relationship between the owner and the owned; an interactive essay on the perpetual sadness of our generation.
Created by a trans-continental artist collective, SACCULOS aims to project the inherent quality of chronological processes in tangible entities.

109006.name: Box Warehousing
109006.body:
![Cover.PNG](///raw/bc8/31/z/17977.png)

**How to play:**

Fill the truck up with boxes to get score. When the boxes starts to get close to the drop height, then tell the truck to extract them to clear it out.

Everytime you tell the truck to extract, the faster the falling speed will become.

**Controls:**

- R - Rotate the box
- Space - Tells the truck to extract the boxes.
- A D - Move 1 column to the left or the right

**Getting score:**

- You get 25 score per box placed
- You get 100 score per 1x1 box extracted
- You get 125 score per 2x1 box extracted

109011.name: Box Co.® - Monster Storage
109011.body:
*NOTE* 8-11 The current version is what I was able to complete on Saturday. It has a few bugs I need to iron out if I have the chance on Sunday, but it is a fully working game from start to finish. 

EDIT: New version is up and labeled v2. Bugs should be gone. I also spruced up the page to make it match. Enjoy!

Welcome, new employee to the great company of Box Co.®! It's good to have you after our last employee... left. Suddenly. Your job is simple! Just put the boxes of monster away. Make sure you pack them neat and tight! Just don't run out of room. That would be... unfortunate. For you.

Box Co. is a game about cramming boxes of monsters into a tiny storage unit. You're short on space, so beware! If you run out of room, you'll need to fight to make some.

109043.name: High Castle
109043.body:
![showoff.png](///raw/91b/3/z/168ad.png)

***

### Summary

To escape a dying world (or maybe just for fun), a wizard has lifted up his castle on a chunk of earth to soar it through the void and to a new world. Island's aren't exactly built for flying, though, so the journey might get a little rough. Plus the void is filled with all sorts of unsavory folk.

### Gameplay

- Charge up and fire spells at baddies that want to break your stuff
- Grab junk floating around in the void and use it to build walls
- Capture land by completely enclosing it in walls to increase your spell power
- Place magical guard towers to help fend off enemies
- Your guard towers will lose power if they aren't inside an enclosure, so keep your walls repaired
- Capture crystal structures by enclosing them with walls to harness their power

### Tools

- Game Maker Studio 1.4 (Engine)
- Bfxr (Sound Effects)
- Bosca Ceoil (Music)
- Audacity (Audio Editing)

***

109064.name: The Espacito
109064.body:
**The Espacito** is a shmup where you may **run out of space** if you get careless. It's also the name of your ship, but that's not relevant.

There are four laser walls which can kill you instantly. Every few seconds one of their "eyes" will wake up and begin moving, shrinking your available area until you hit it.

- W,S,A,D: move your ship
- Mouse: move your target
- Mouse-1: shoot
- Esc: instantly quits

109069.name: Annoyingly malfunctional space shuttle simulator
109069.body:
Annoyingly Malfunctional Space Shuttle Simulator
================================================
## Important
>Unfinished, and I have no plan on finishing. I haven't got that much time to deal with all the bugs I created...

## Story (if there is any)
>You were sent to the space for a certain space station courier service. When you reach the station and start collecting goods, you notice something big and bad coming for you from deep space. Now you need to run out of space (station) and get back to mother Earth, for human have bigger and badder things that prevents the big and bad space something from actually going into the atmosphere.
>
>Bad news is that your shuttle is never ready for such intense entry to the atmosphere so it burns out as you get closer to the ground (or the sea). Good news is that the space station is fully automated and no one would really stop you from taking whatever you think might be useful, be it a fire extinguisher or a box of frozen pizza or the space station's backup fuel tank, as long as your shuttle can hold it.
## Description
>A console based adventure game.
>
>Very simple and has annoying controls.
>
>Grab what you think you might need and what others think valuable, and try to safely land on the Earth.

109070.name: Echo
109070.body:
---
## Description
---
You wake up and find yourself trapped in a room inside a ruined structure.  The ceiling is closing, and you have no way to climb out.  You're a slime after all, how can you climb.  Once the ceiling has closed in, it will fall, squishing you like it has done to so may before.  You're only hope is to find some way to stop the ceiling from completely closing in on you.  Are you only going to be prolonging your eventual death?


The theme for Ludum Dare 42 was to "Running out of space".  In this game, the ceiling is sealing itself off. You have to scramble to find active nodes to delay the inevitable.  Eventually, the ceiling will close off and fall on you.  While managing this, you also have to fight off a horde of dead slimes who have died before you.  They close in fast and overwhelm quickly if not dealt with. 

---
## How to play
---  

### THERE IS A TUTORIAL IN GAME, IT IS RECOMMENDED COMPLETING IT


**Controls**  
Keyboard and Mouse. No Gamepad.
 
Esc will pause the game  

**Movement**

​You can move using the Up, Down, Left, or Right arrow keys, or WSAD on your keyboard.  
Holding Shift will allow you to move faster 

![echold3.png](///raw/9cc/d/z/173da.png)

​**Attack**

Pressing Left Click on mouse will allow you to swing your sword to attack. You attack in the direction you are facing. 

![echold1.png](///raw/9cc/d/z/173d6.png)  

**How to win**

As the ceiling closes in, nodes will become active.  Standing on an active node will push the walls back, but only if you have energy to do so. Energy is gained by killing enemies.

![echold2.png](///raw/9cc/d/z/173d9.png)

Can you survive?  Is it possible? Will you eventually die? Find out.

---
## Tools Used  
---
**Sound Effects**  
"Squish" sound effect was recorded with Audacity, and the vocal provided by my friend ehrgeiziges

**Graphics**  
Graphics were done using Aseprite https://www.aseprite.org

**Level Maps**
Level maps were created using OGMO Editor http://www.ogmoeditor.com/

**Frameworks**  
The primary framework used is the MonoGame framework. http://www.monogame.net/

Along with that, I have a custom framework called Psiren which is a combination of my own code and Monocle  
Psiren: https://gitlab.com/manbeardgames/Psiren  
Monocle: https://bitbucket.org/MattThorson/monocle-engine

And lastly, I used MonoGame Extended for Bitmap importing. https://craftworkgames.github.io/MonoGame.Extended/


---
## Notes
---
I'm submitting to jam, but this was a solo endeavor.  The only assets I was unable to create my own was the music, as usual.  There is music in the game, I just didn't make it. Credits to music are below.  As such, I am removing the **Audio** category for voting.  

---
## Music Credits
---

**Title Music**  
"Man Down" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)  
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License  
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/  

**Game Music**  
"Grim Idol" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)  
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License  
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/  


---
# Change Log
---

**This fix was made at 5:50 PM EDT: 10 minutes before time closed for page submission.   There was a small audio bug in the game where the background music would not loop, it would play once and stop.  It was a simple "IsLooping = true" adjustment. No other changes were made to the game except this.  As such, I have provided two downloads for the game. The one I uploaded at ~4am Monday morning that has the audio non-looping, and the one I'm uploading now at 5:50 PM Monday, 10 minutes before submissions close.**

Even though I have opted out of the audio category for Ludum, I wanted to be completely transparent about this.  Again, there is no difference between the original build and the audio fix build except the one line of code telling the audio to repeat. You can view the source code at to verify

109078.name: Boom Boom Farms!
109078.body:
# PLAY HERE: 

- HTML: https://telefrag-entertainment.itch.io/boom-boom-farms
- Windows: https://telefrag-entertainment.itch.io/boom-boom-farms2

# Video of Game Play:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j1n-BKVOrno

You've found that farming these weird little dudes can be quite lucrative! However, these little weirdos aren't without their dangers. Let the ugly monsters make you rich, but be careful about how you let them mingle!

# Controls:
Keyboard WASD and Shift to run.
Mouse to aim and click on the dudes.

# Gameplay:
The little monsters will wander around the farm searching for buried coins. They'll then dive into the dirt and start pulling out what they find. You have to run around collecting the coins. Simple!
The weird little buggers have a strange quirk though, if another one gets too close to them while they're digging, they start getting angry. They'll begin to heat up and smoke and flash red. If this goes on too long, they explode!
You need to find any angry dudes and separate them from the pack before they set off a chain reaction and destroy your farm.

# Friday:

Built the first Dude. Nasty looking bugger.
![dudeBlender1.png](///raw/51a/a1/z/1560a.png)

Textured and rigged in Unity:
![dudesInUnity.png](///raw/51a/a1/z/1561a.png)

Here's the farm stand with a few dudes around.
![farm.png](///raw/51a/a1/z/157f2.png)

Got the little buggers running around:
https://youtu.be/MJigsGg6P5c

# Saturday

We can throw them around now!:
https://youtu.be/wxtPHc6QeSA

Watch out, they don't like to be near each other while digging:
https://youtu.be/iaKn85SNU0w

When there's just too many and you RUN OUT OF SPACE!
https://youtu.be/LOlgsz4e3IU

Did some play testing with my brother. Game was fun, had a steep difficulty progression so I'll smooth that out and handle some bugs.

Here's a look at the game in the final stages. Just a few more touch ups and some difficulty tweaks!
https://youtu.be/j1n-BKVOrno

109235.name: Running out of Space
109235.body:
![covergif.gif](///raw/22d/71/z/15b9a.gif)

## Gameplay
- This game is inspired by Teries - blocks are falling from sky and you need to destroy them before you are running out of **Space**.
- This game is also inspired by Typing games - you need to type a word on screen, but this time it can be any word form a path from any golden block to space bar. You always need Space bar to destroy blocks, so don't waste them otherwise you will be running out of **Space** (bar).
- On the right side you can see the words and spaces that are coming next. Also, it tells story.
- The words, speed, difficulty will change when you play through it.

## Rule
- Push the key that correspond to a golden block.
- If that block is a letter, then it will turn into brown. All non-brown neighbor (left,right,up,down) will turn to golden.
- If that block is a space bar (a 1x6 bar without text), all brown block and that space bar will be destroyed.
- If you can't reach any space bar, we will reset the brown blocks.
- There is a progress bar on top, when it run out of time new block will appear.
- When the block stuck in the top row, game will over.

## Control
- Keyboard only
- Use Enter to join game and restart.
- Use key 'A' - 'Z', space bar to play.
- Use Esc to force Game Over.

## Development
- Engine: http://www.amulet.xyz
- Sound: SFXR in http://www.amulet.xyz/editor.html
- Picture: draw by hand using Microsoft Paint

109238.name: Tight Space
109238.body:
More blocks you make, less space you have! 

Try to hold on as much as possible in this minimalistic game. Don't hit the walls and don't create too many blocks. It becomes pretty INTENSE after a few seconds!
![Peek 2018-08-11 08-15.gif](///raw/a0b/f/z/156a9.gif)

Hold left mouse button to charge earn points. 

Release to create new block.

More blocks = bigger points multiplier

:smile:Have fun!:smile:

109244.name: Johnny's Flipbook Space Adventure
109244.body:
Johnny is not allowed to play on the computer right now, so he decided to play his favorite space shooter on paper.  Johnny has created a flipbook of his adventure fighting aliens, complete with sound effects he created.  Every so often, his little brother tears some of the paper so Johnny's spaceship has less and less space to fly.

This is my entry for Ludum Dare 42's theme "Running Out of Space".

## Controls:

* A/D or Left/Right Arrow Keys to rotate ship.

* W or Up Arrow Key to thrust.

* Spacebar to fire bullets.

![Screen-640x400.png](///raw/021/z/160e3.png)

109246.name: MinoFall
109246.body:
This is my entry for Ludum Dare 42 game jam. This is my second time participating in LD, although it is my first time doing it alone.

It's sort of like Tetris in terms of rules (clear when a row is filled etc), but you control a little avatar that indirectly moves the blocks. The game is slow paced to start, but sit through it and it gets more intense. Give the game a chance and I think you'll enjoy it.

All versions (WebGL, Windows, MacOS) can be found in the link below that says HTML5 build. I hope you have fun!
(If you're playing the web build, reload the page to play again.

Update: Thanks for all the comments everyone, I really appreciate it. Based on feedback I have sped up the game and also added the ability to fast forward by pressing down arrow. Thanks again!

![LD42_SS.png](///raw/27a/a/z/171fb.png)

Made with:

Unity3D

Aseprite

bfxr

Music comes from Bloma under the CC4.0 license. You can find it here: https://bloma.bandcamp.com/album/ds13

109257.name: OutOfSense
109257.body:
Can you beat this game before it beats you. Awinner is you :).
Its a mix of passion for game development, and a critic to extortious behaviour of publishers towards game developers.
Games quality is reducing and the messages behind story is plastic and platonic. 
Its time for a change.


Sound is taken form Half Life 2 original game.
And Super Mario Nintendo.
Can is an asset taken from : https://www.blendswap.com/blends/view/12341

109262.body:
![Screen3.png](///raw/e18/3/z/16847.png)![Screen2.png](///raw/e18/3/z/16849.png)

You are a zombie hunter protecting your screen. Your goal is to beat all the zombies to save the screen.
Each hit you take shrinks the screen, so keep that screen intact!

Controls:

Secondary fire: RightMouse

Art: Aseprite

109267.name: Hallway Deathtrap
109267.body:
### Back Story:

In this game you play as Wilson. Wilson was searching through an abandoned house when he heard weird sounds from the hallway. He decided to go check it out. When he entered the hallway he saw the shadow of a weird figure, he then started running away when he got trapped at the end of the hallway.

### How to Play:

When you start the game enemies will start to run at you. Use [Mouse 1] to shoot at the enemies. Use [Mouse 2] to scope in with Sniper.!

You can change weapon with using the numbers [1], [2] and [3]. Reload with [R].

109279.name: Cubed
109279.body:
My first game with pico-8 and the first game i've made since I was a child playing with game maker 7 :)

it's an endless runner of a man trapped in a shrinking cube, ever power up expands the cube, but watch out for spikes!

109301.name: Overgrowth
109301.body:
My first ludum dare game!
It's the year 2150, and the population on earth as exceeded 10 billion people.
There is no longer enough space on earth for this amount of people and food is running out.
Your goal will be to manage the population on earth and find a new place for the human race to live.

**Tools used**
- Construct 2 (Engine)
- Audacity (Audio)
- Bfxr (Audio)
- Otomata (Music)

**How to play**
Mouse only
Build buildings and pass policies to avoid running out of food and increase the research points.
See in-game tutorial for detailed instructions.

The game can be challenging to finish, but there's multiple strategies/ways to finish it.
I've included three strategies between others in the link below to reach the end, but I suggest you try it by yourself first! https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gcYz8AjmyqiypFJ8VZcCTOYRrOCotGii/view?usp=sharing

![MainMenu.PNG](///raw/02e/7/z/16adc.png)

109308.name: Space Cleanup - When the Space was running out of space!
109308.body:
My first time Ludum Dare. This is a space shooter game where the space is running out of space because every country started launching a large number of satellites! Your job is to shoot down the unusable(red) satellites, but your bullets should not touch the usable(green) satellites. If you miss a red satellite, it will take space in Space. If you run out of space or lives, the game is over. Try to score as much as possible. And please leave a review so that I can improve.
Thanks.![screenshot1.JPG](///raw/44c/71/z/17f2d.jpg)![screenshot2.JPG](///raw/44c/71/z/17f3e.jpg)![screenshot3.JPG](///raw/44c/71/z/17f58.jpg)

109311.name: Totally Slammed
109311.body:
![Logo.png](///raw/143/41/z/1670f.png)
**Totally Slammed** - the *ultimately hard timekiller* game.
In Totally Slammed you are an office worker. The main aim of the game is to place stamps on documents as fast as you can and sort documents as fast as you can. Because if not, you will ran out of space in your office room, which means that you will be left there forever.
Good Luck and Have Fun!!
Note: The correct actions will increase your score. The wrong - decrease.
![1.png](///raw/143/41/z/1676a.png)
![2.png](///raw/143/41/z/1676d.png)
![4.png](///raw/143/41/z/16771.png)
![5.png](///raw/143/41/z/16775.png)

109325.name: Meteor Shower
109325.body:
This is my Ludum Dare 42 submission, I did not have the amount of time I would have liked to due to work. However, this is what I could do in the time allotted. I took the theme in a more straightforward manner. Basically you are an astronaut in space during a meteor shower, your goal is to survive and the platforms you stand on are limited. You get points for walking on as many tiles as you can. Also there is a chance to find coins, which in turn give you more points. The objective is just to score as high as possible. Meteors are randomly generated to destroy the only platforms you have to stand on! You may jump from platform to platform, in hopes to survive the waves of flaming meteors!


 ![MeteorShower1.PNG](///raw/99a/d/z/17fac.png) ![Ludum Dare 3.PNG](///raw/99a/d/z/17faf.png)  ![Ludumdare42-2.PNG](///raw/99a/d/z/17fb5.png) ![Ludum Dare 4.PNG](///raw/99a/d/z/17fb9.png)

109330.name: The Flash drive is trapped inside the computer and is being attacked by Files
109330.body:
And yes :smile: , since I can't think of any good title, I entitled it:  
**"The Flash drive is trapped inside the computer and is being attacked by Files"**
It's a top down shooter,very simple mechanics, avoid and delete files by shooting them. 
**Controls are:**  
:arrow_right: W,A,S,D for moving.  
:arrow_right: SPACE for dashing.  
:arrow_right: Left and Right Mouse Button (HOLD) for shooting.  
:arrow_right: Left is faster but weaker damage.  
:arrow_right: Right is Area of Effect, Stronger Damage, but slower.  
  
![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/1d1/a/z/15e99.gif)
  
**Notes:** Viruses cant be deleted by shooting, you have no choice but to grab it. And then find the nearest  
Antivirus.exe, to clean the flash drive. Also, Recycle Bin gives gives you +25% space.
** Also, There's a BOSS, just prepare for it and wait for it to appear**
  
**My published apps [ANDROID] Check it out!:**  
Color Rush(Game): https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.colorrush.colorswitch  
TheBitcoinBlockchain(EducApp): https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.Blockchain.Bitcoin  

**Twitter**:bird:@SenshiMartin

109334.body:
2D arena top down shooter game

Game Design & Art by Aaron Lehnen & Him                                         
Music & SFX by Aaron Lehnen                                           
Programming by Him

![2018-08-13 19_31_03-The Room Of Death.png](///raw/fbf/e/z/17991.png)

109337.name: Emissary
109337.body:
Whew, that was fun.

Emissary is a game where you destroy planets to prevent marauding terraformers from claiming them as their own.  You are responsible for the diminishing space, but there's a risk/reward factor: as the surface becomes more barren, survival becomes more difficult.

The game will save your score across planets until you fail, so try to make it as long as you can!  Each planet will be a bit more difficult than the last, and your score is determined by how quickly you destroy them. The main menu has some helpful hints at the bottom. 

I'm really looking forward to playing everyone else's games and to getting some feedback on Emissary.  Thank you for checking it out.

![EmissarySuperSmall.gif](///raw/dd3/c/z/16b65.gif)

![EmissarySS3small.png](///raw/dd3/c/z/16ab9.png)

![EmissarySS2small.png](///raw/dd3/c/z/16ac1.png)

![EmissarySS1small.png](///raw/dd3/c/z/16aca.png)

I fixed a minor but important bug that changed movement speed depending on framerate.  Should be solid now.

Tools used: Unity, Sketchbook pro, SFXR, Garageband, FLStudio, Modo

109344.name: Hivemind
109344.body:
![hivemind-header-v2.png](///raw/1e4/3/z/16022.png)

In **Hivemind** you are presented with a semi random **Reddit post** and one top level comment from it. Your goal is to guess whether the shown comment has **positive or negative karma**. You get points equal to the absolute value of the karma but you will lose the same amount if you fail to answer correctly.

**How well do you know your Redditors?**

---

### 🎮🕹️ [Download from itch.io](https://anttihaavikko.itch.io/hivemind) 🕹️🎮

---

Unfortunately I couldn't make a web version because Unity doesn't allow changing of user agent on web version, Reddit limits the API usage based on it and obviously the default browser ones are under some heavy use. Also, there was the CORS issue with loading images on the web version.

---

![hivemind-cover.gif](///raw/1e4/3/z/16231.gif)

---

### 🛠️ Tools used
- Unity 2018 (with Post Processing and Anima2D)
- Adobe Illustrator
- Bfxr
- Garage Band
- SunVox

---
