109377.name: Bob's Budget Bomb Disposal
109377.body:
A game about decommissioning audinance on a budget! 
use the arrow keys to steer and space to drop a bomb your carrying,
bombs are collected by driving into them.

Bombs come in three classes, Red, Green and Yellow. Each class must placed into the correct machine, red will become green, green will become yellow and yellow will be decommissioned. Machines take time to process bombs.

Bombs are delivered to your receiving bays, each can hold three bombs. If a bay is full when a new delivery drops off then it will expload!

![Capture03.PNG](///raw/070/51/z/16400.png)
![Capture06.PNG](///raw/070/51/z/16404.png)

109393.name: Grim Sim
109393.body:
Grim Sim
---------------------------------------------------

You play as a Grim Reaper who has to collect Souls!
The Gods will monitor your work, and if they are unsatisfied they will demote you.

---------------------------------------------------

Instructions:

When people die their soul will appear. If you dont manage to collect their soul in a certain time, they will turn into ghosts. If too many ghosts appears the gods will be mad, and demote you!

When five minutes has passed, you will be given a score on how well you did as a Reaper.

Controls:

WASD - Movement
Left Mouse button - Swing your scythe to collect souls, and kill ghosts

---------------------------------------------------

Made in 72-hours for the Ludum Dare Jam by Cobo, Dragion, Fina & Theix.

Written in C#(unity)

Tools:
Unity
Visual Studio
Clip Studio Paint
Audacity

---------------------------------------------------

109394.name: Rumble
109394.body:
![Tight.png](///raw/453/d/z/16045.png)

## Game 
You are trapped in a collapsing cave. There is no way out, but you can live in peace... as long as you keep throwing falling rocks on the walls.

- Gather rocks to replenish ammo
- The more ammo you gather the faster it will spawn
- Walls will start closing in faster the longer you are alive

Controls: WASD + Mouse


*Personal High Score: 59*

## Implementation
- Engine - Godot3

- Music - Music slapped together in BoscaCeoil

- Effects - Audacity

109399.name: Inventory Management Adventure
109399.body:
![cover.png](///raw/f0c/a1/z/1835d.png)
The game is not finished.

Have you ever played an RPG game and wondered: "I want a game, where somebody else has fun, and I'm only managing his inventory.", well... then this is a game for you! 

The player that hired you for free, needs to have the best possible equipment. What will you choose?
More potions, or maybe better armor? (game balance not included) Choose wisely, because carry weight is heavily limited.

Drag items to your inventory with left mouse button
Equip items with right mouse button

Interesting facts:
- Background music may or may not sound bad on speakers, try headphones if possible!
- This is our first Ludum Dare entry, and while typing this Description (1 hour before Deadline), 
we still have problems getting it to work :)
- We had problems with representing our Game in Cover Image, so looks liiiitle bit different.

109401.name: Monkey Beat
109401.body:
Monkey Beat is a one-button rhythm game heavily inspired by PaRappa the Rapper. In this game you will face charming characters in rap battles.
![unknown.png](///raw/85b/a1/z/17548.png)
For you to sing, you must hit the Space button when the notes of the music come over the vinyl disk. But be careful, miss too much notes and the crowd will get really mad!

This was our first gamejam so please be kind :D

109417.name: Quickshot Yellow: The Quest for Green Flags
109417.body:
So I wanted to make a puzzle game and this is definitely a puzzle game. Puzzle games are hard...  
![screenshot.png](///raw/68a/3/z/172ee.png)  

I think I did... okay. My biggest mistake I think is giving the player two abilities instead of three, but I only realized that about an hour before submission and I didn't think I had enough time to redo the puzzles. The theme only comes out really in the last two puzzles because of this.

109424.name: STORAGE TYCOON [LD42]
109424.body:
Here is a game which recpect the theme: "Running out of space".

It is easy to handle with Wasd controls and the use of the mouse.

Do not reach the limit of the storage and don't hesitate to call the trucks!!

Hope you will enjoy it!!!

Have a good game!!

https://gamejolt.com/games/TruckandBox/360798

109433.name: Guard 'em
109433.body:
Don't let the aliens get into the portal.Yellow orbs give you bullets.Made it in a rush, so it's kind of rough.
ad to move, k to jump, j to shoot

109439.name: Shrinkage
109439.body:
Shrinkage is a take on Tetris where the difficulty is generated by the fact that the game area shrinks when you complete rows. Score combos to expand, or die when you run out of space...

109512.name: The Subway: horror within
109512.body:
You’re an ordinary (almost) subway passenger. Your mission is to stay on board as other passengers are arriving and trying to push you outside. You have a set of skills and need to use them wisely to stay inside the wagon as long as possible. When the passengers reach you, they push you closer to the doors.

Your skills are:

Shrink. You become almost flat and passengers can’t push you outside (except the Big Guy and the Lady).

Scream. You scream and all the passengers take several steps back (except the Student and the Granny)

Stink. You stink! All the passengers around you run away and you step all the way back from the doors.

Burst of rage - the ultimate skill. You increase your rage level by getting rid of passengers and also when they push you. When you reach max of your rage level (the skull becomes red), you can use the skill.

Passengers are:

The Big Guy. He pushes you two steps back and you can’t avoid him by the shrinking.

The Lady. You can’t avoid her by the shrinking.

The Student. He can’t hear you! Scream doesn’t work on him.

The Granny. She also can’t hear your screaming (maybe she just doesn’t care).

The Ordinary man. He doesn’t have any abilities. You can use any skill on him.

109523.name: The Lonely Moon
109523.body:
# The Moon is coming!

When astronomers noticed the moon getting a bit closer, they thought it was cute. "The Moon is lonely!", they said. "It's coming to give us a hug!". Only you understood what it means - that if the Moon gets too close, then the Earth's days are numbered...

Once you realised what to do, you quickly founded a start-up to build satellites and rockets, with the secret goal of building the ultimate space ship - The Ark. The Ark will be the ship to sail civilisation to another world (and most importantly, save you). The plan is simple - you will put satellites into orbit, and use the income they generate to fund research and development for The Ark. But be warned - things might not go quite to plan. Your satellites could collide and create fields of debris. The moon's gravity could modify your trajectories, and send your satellites spinning away. Antagonistic space agencies could shoot you down, and really ruin your day. You might quickly find yourself running out of space...

# Instructions

The objective of the game is to build The Ark and to sail it all the way to outer space. Good luck! :rocket:

## The Shop

You can buy things (including satellites) with the shop. If you have enough bitcoin to spend, click a satellite and it will start building. Once the build is complete, it will launch from Earth.

Hover the mouse over the items in the shop to find out more about it - like how long it takes to build, and the starting income. Special shop items have usage instructions in their hover-text.

If you don't have any bitcoin, you can always hold a press conference to try and raise some money.

## Orbital Play

When a satellite launches, it will appear on a rocket and slowly head into orbit. You can select a satellite by creating a selection box around it with the mouse. Once selected, you can control the satellite by pushing 'W' to speed up and 'S' to slow down. The orbital trajectory is shown as a blue line, and the satellite target region is shown as a green ring. The satellite statistics are shown in the info box in the bottom-right of the screen (including fuel/delta-V remaining).

Remember, satellites will only make money while they are in their target area, and you have to move them there yourself! Your satellites income will decrease over time as they wear out, but you can boost your income by creating constellations of the same satellite type.

You'll receive notifications in the top-right of the screen when something interesting happens, like your satellite getting smashed to bits. Keep an eye on these. You can also view statistics about the whole game by opening the "Orbital Statistics" screen. You can find that button in the bottom-left of the screen.

## Endgame

If you manage to make enough money before the moon gets too close and starts wreaking havoc, then you can launch The Ark! To win, simply sail it out to the target region.

109528.name: Cube Disposer
109528.body:
![ezgif-3-9846d3632f.gif](///raw/fef/2/z/166a4.gif)

Cube Disposer is an isometric shooter where you are shooting incoming cubes.

## How to play
Kill the cubes that comes.
The cubes will leave black blocks after they die and they will block your shots and your path but they will not block the cubes.

Pick up the black blocks and destroy them by dropping them in the shredder in the middle.

If you don't destroy the black blocks you will soon **run out of space**

## Controls
**Mouse** - Aim

**Left mouse button** - Fire

**WASD** - Movement

**R** - Reload

**Q/E** - Turn view 90 degrees

**Space** - Pick up and drop blocks

## Notes
Linux and Mac versions are untested and might not work.

WebGL version to say the least not very tested and optimized.

How to Play
===========

:headphones: Turn up the sound and [play the game online on Itch.io](https://nidup.itch.io/sorry-oh-sorry) :headphones:

Commands:
 - **arrow keys** to move :arrow_left: :arrow_up: :arrow_right: :arrow_down:

Please note, you can spam the key but caution, the use of the space key is limited and you may run out of space :wink: 

Credits
=======

We built this game as a small crew, everything is hand-crafted with :heart: from code to assets:

- [pierallard](https://twitter.com/Pierrallard) - Code, game design, graphics, SFX, Music, Voices

Tools
=====

109647.name: Crumbling Dungeon
109647.body:
![title.png](///raw/3c9/a/z/1687d.png)

# Crumbling Dungeon

Long ago, the evil wizard Agharamish stole the Great Tome of Light, bringing darkness to the land, and eternal life to himself.  
He secluded himself in a castle of his own creation, hiding the book in the depths of its dungeon. 

Many centuries have passed, and his castle now shows visible signs of decay - his power must be fading!  
The Grand Council of Wizards and Magics have appointed you to invade Agharamish's castle and end his reign.  

"In the castle's dungeon you will find two scrolls, each required to open the way to Agharamish. Go now, and good luck!"  

Use the arrow keys to move. Space to attack. Attacking kills small enemies, reflects projectiles and pushes around bigger enemies.  
Be careful! Each step you take creates a hole behind you - if you fall, you lose! Enemies will also die if they are pushed into a hole.

# About the development

This is my entry for the Ludum Dare 42 Compo, following the theme "Running out of space".

Even before voting began, I wanted make a game with a Game Boy-like graphical style (4 tones of gray, a resolution of 160x144, the works). I feel the limitations of such a style would make for an interesting challenge, and would give me some direction when drawing the graphics.  
One interesting feature I wanted to implement, that would go hand-in-hand with the graphical style, was to allow the player to change the palette used by the game - so one could choose tones of gray or the greenish tones of the Game Boy screen, for example. Unfortunately, technical difficulties meant I had to drop that last idea (read: I didn't have quite enough time to implement it).

Once the theme was reveled, the idea of exploring a dungeon where each step you make would create a hole quickly came to mind, and seemed like a good fit for the graphic style. I took inspiration from "The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening" (and other 2D Zelda titles) when designing the crumbling dungeon, giving each gameplay feature (the holes, the attack, the teleporters, etc...) some interesting scenarios to play with. The crumbling floor, however, made balancing very difficult - any required backtracking would represent an incredible spike in difficulty.  
Designing a Zelda dungeon in two days (when it probably takes weeks or months for a team of professionals to do the same) was very intimidating, but given the restraints, I am happy with how it came out.

This time, I also composed the music for the game (rather than tweaking an AI to do it for me) and, while the tunes are short, I am happy with how they came to be. If possible, do give a moment to listen to Agharamish's Battle theme - depending now how long it takes you to beat him, you might not hear the actual melody.

Finally, I'm happy I was able to give the game a proper introduction, title screen, main menu, ending, and even some scripted events! These little details really do make the game feel much more polished.

Still, some things were left out: the game has no sound effects, no ending music, the player gets no upgrades, there's no pause function (oops! This was half implemented, but I forgot about finishing it), the dungeon only has one floor. I though of doing an introductory sequence where the player would approach the castle, but that too was cut.

Overall, I'm glad with the final result. I hope you enjoy it too!

Game Engine: GameMaker Studio 2  
Graphics: Paint.net, Paint  
Music: Bosca Ceoil

## Screenshots

![main_menu.PNG](///raw/3c9/a/z/168d7.png)

![entrance.PNG](///raw/3c9/a/z/168d8.png)

![fight.PNG](///raw/3c9/a/z/168dc.png)

## Help

So, this game is pretty hard, and you might get lost easily. I have developed a quick guide for you, in case you need it!  
Here you'll be able to see the complete map, as well as some tips for each room. https://imgur.com/1MZ7LDY.png  
Good luck conquering the Crumbling Dungeon!

109666.name: Bag Man
109666.body:
![Shot1.png](///raw/937/6/z/167df.png)

![Shot5-title.png](///raw/937/6/z/167e5.png)

BAG MAN

(created for Ludum Dare 42. Theme: Running Out of Space)

You are a greedy adventurer and an evil wizard has put a curse on you. You want gold, you shall have gold! The wizard will put gold in your backpack but due to the curse, if your backpack fills up you will die. You must find 16 bags to increase the size of your pack and show the Wizard you skill, then he will life the curse. 

Avoid enemy/hazard contact as that also adds gold to your backpack. If you get hit too much you cannot finish.

You're best advised to pick a direction and go vs changing directions a lot. The game is very simple but challenging due to the ticking clock. As you get better at jumping the game gets easier. Make mental notes of where bags are if they are out of your reach, so you can run back for them.

MOVE: Left/Right Arrows
JUMP: Space/Up Arrow 

The game consists of 32 rooms that are randomly generated and populated similarly to the 2600 Pitfall game. The rooms have a random number from 1-32 associated with them and I check the bits of the byte of the room value to determine what and where to spawn things. The level is a circle with the end rooms wrapping around.

109693.name: The Amazing Shrinking Game
109693.body:
The gameboard shrinks as you move -- that is, you're literally running out of space -- and there's a time limit in play to boot. Stay on top by picking up powerups!

Here's what I like about this game: 
 - It's fast and frenetic. You can't stop playing, or else you lose.
 - You need actual skill to progress. Simply moving around will result in a game over in seconds.
 - The scale effect is very effective in telling you how big the board is, without any other kind of indicator
 - The powerups move with the board as you play.

I'm very happy with the result, especially given that for the first day I was working on a different concept entirely. Hope you like it too!

If you play this game, _please_ provide some feedback. Ideally, let me know the _one thing_ that you'd like to see that would make the game more enjoyable to play.

![Skjermbilde 2018-08-12 kl. 17.07.33.png](///raw/97c/a1/z/15f97.png)

109704.name: Mother Ship
109704.body:
Hello there !

This is my first game jam ever (and the first "real" game that I made), so don't expect something great or even slightly good. I made this in around 30 hours (sleep included) using Godot Engine.
I'd love to hear what you think about it, so don't hesitate to comment below about what could be improved !

With that said... have fun ! o/



![mother_ship_1.png](///raw/78c/a1/z/170d1.png)



The galaxy is collapsing. A giant, nightmarish black hole is slowly growing, consuming everything in its path. 
And on this path is our own solar system.
 
You are an highly advanced A.I operating the Ark, the first faster-than-light colony ship, fitted with hundred of millions of cryogenic pods to carry humans through the depths of space. Yet, it is not enough to carry the entirety of Earth's population, and building the Ark has mostly depleted the planet of its resources. You must colonize other star systems and exploit them in order to upgrade the Ark and further improve its capacity, while fleeing from the ever growing black hole. 

Of course, you're not supposed to save everyone... some sacrifices are necessary. Because you're running out of time. And out of space.


_________________________________________________



- Probe and colonize nearby systems to gather the minerals you will need to upgrade the Ark. The bigger the population, the quicker it will mine.
 
- Population will grow over time, depending on the system's habitability. If habitability is under 40%, it will instead decline.

- After some time, the black hole will arrive. When it approaches a system, it will slowly decrease its habitability until it reaches 0, so evacuate it quickly !

- Keep fleeing upward. You may or may not find a way to escape.


_________________________________________________


Controls :

- Use the MOUSE to interact.
- WASD or ARROW KEYS to move the camera.
- Don't forget to press SPACE or E anytime to pause the game. It will give you more time to plan ahead and navigate through the messy UI.
- You can press F to toggle fullscreen, but I heavily advise you AGAINST it. I didn't have enough time to properly scale the UI, it will mess it even more. The text won't be correctly centered either.

__________________________________________________

Changelog :

13/08 : Added a Linux and Mac OSX release (didn't test, tell me if it doesn't work). 
Made some bugfixing : sound not properly playing, menu not showing when clicking on another system, black hole danger radius not growing with the hole itself. Fixed pop growth rate. ~~Changed pause key from SPACE to E because of some weird engine bug with the SPACE key (don't press it or you might mess with the menus !~~

13/08 : Added back SPACE as a pause key, but you still can use E if you prefer. Fixed a bug where the menus wouldn't close properly.

Known bugs/problems :

- The interface. I didn't have enough time to make it more readable before compo's end, but I'm still working on it.
- You may not be able to interact with some systems. For lack of better solution, moving the camera around usually seems to fix it.

If you see any bug, don't hesitate to report it in the comments !

-Graphics : Aseprite

-Sound : sfxr

Obviously, this is something that goes against Amaranth's principle, our floor-loving heroine. She has come to the Purple Void through.. uh... Purple portal. The game is basically a boss fight. The boss will keep destroying the floor, so you'll get less and less space to maneuver around. Ranged attack has limited ammo, you can gain more by using the melee attack. 

You can play the game single-handedly or tackle it co-op with a friend.

109839.name: The Big Crunch
109839.body:
In 1927 Belgian astronomer Georges Lemaitre theorised that the expansion of the universe could reverse, eventually resulting in the collapse of all matter into a singularity triggering another big bang.

This theory later became known as THE BIG CRUNCH.


This is my first ever Ludum Dare project. I created the whole game and all the source code, shaders, graphics and sound effects from scratch in 48 hours. Please don't judge the sound effects too harshly, they were made in a rush in the last hour of the game jam. There is no music, sorry I ran out of time before I could make any. The Big Crunch was made using Unity 2018.2.3f1, visual studio community, gimp & sfxr.

The concept of The Big Crunch is quite simple. Collide matching planets and stars to compress them together as the universe shrinks. Its basically match 2! With the gameplay itself being quite simple my priority was to make a more well rounded and polished looking game. I have a title screen, in game UI and even a small tutorial. A lot of my time went into making the planets and collisions look as good as possible, not so easy for someone like me who isn't very artistic. 

During development I wasn't sure about the shrinking mechanic, I had 2 different ideas: The planets and star shrink towards the centre and you lose when 2 collide OR the planets and stars stay in the same place and you lose when the edge of the shrinking universe hits them. In the end I implemented them both as Mode A and Mode B which can be selected from the title screen.


In a rapidly collapsing universe smash and compress planets and stars together before running out of space.

109875.name: Triple Tribble Trouble
109875.body:
![ld42_splash.png](///raw/4c6/2/z/165cc.png)
Puzzle platformer where you will have some tribble trouble. Please guide our friendly robot to the exit, and try not hurting too many fluffy critters. Or maybe do?

### Theme
Tribbles will multiply when you jump over them and sometimes randomly, which will easily take up all the space on the platforms.

### Gameplay
Get to the exit door. They can be locked, if so you may need to use button to open it. When in dire need, self-destruct with Escape. Jumping on critters will give you extra high jump.

### Controls
WASD, Arrows, Space, Escape.

## Project info
- **Graphics**: Made during the jam by Weina and Tova.
- **Music**: Made by @treqie
- **Audio**: Phrases syntesized with MaryTTS. Other effects made by ourselves in various ways with Audacity.
- **Code**: @freso, @Lakrits, @weine using Unity 2018.2.2 with Bitbucket as git server.

110018.name: Lúcia Teve uma Má ideia (Lúcia's Bad Idea)
110018.body: "Lúcia Teve Uma Má Ideia" (“Lúcia’s Bad Idea”) tells the story about a little girl named Lúcia, who is a very stubborn and curious 10-year-old kid. There's an old saying in her city that warns people about an abandoned house inside the town's forest. Rumour has it that the place is haunted by ghosts and spirits, and if someone tries to enter the mansion, they may never get out. But Lúcia doesn't buy that idea. She is a smart girl, and knows better. One day, she decides to see for herself. Now, she's locked inside the old mansion! And guess what! The ghosts are chasing her! Help Lucia run from the ghosts, in which seems to be an infinite-storey building! Hurry up! They are almost reaching her!

110115.name: Super Poopsgiving 69
110115.body:
![ld-title.jpg](///raw/eb5/z/17345.jpg)

### Objective

It's Thanksgiving Day at your Aunt Mary's house and you're surrounded by a feast of traditional food items.
Eat the right combinations of food to increase your "I-gotta-poop-meter".
Once your stomach has run out of space, drink the prune juice that appears and go to the bathroom.

💩Careful you only have 69 seconds!💩

![ld-game.jpg](///raw/eb5/z/17346.jpg)

### Controls

Up/Down Arrows - Move player

Space - Grab food item

R - Refresh food items on table ( Takes away 7 seconds on timer )

---

### Built Using

- **Devices:** MacBook Pro 15" and iPad Pro
- **Game Engine and Coding:** Unity and Visual Studio on macOS
- **SFX and Music:** Ableton Live 10
- **Character, Items and Environments:** Procreate

---

### About Dev
What started as a joke between my girlfriend and I waking up Sunday morning immediately turned into a reason to get out of bed and work on a game for the first time together. 

We raced to put this all together on the last day of LD42 and we are proud to say that **All art, code and music were created for this in a little over 12 hours.**

Hope you enjoy this stupid little game concept!
![ld-team.jpg](///raw/eb5/z/17336.jpg)

110163.body:
This is a maze game where the maze changes while you are running it.  Your space to maneuver gradually dwindles.

It is written in the programming language Go (on Google, search for golang to find it.  Go is really too common a name for a Google search)  It has been tested on a Linux system.  It uses SDL2.

I have no Windows or Mac system to test it on, but if Go is what is purports to be, there's a good chance you'll be able to compile it on those systems once you install Go and the required libraries.

-- hendrik

110206.name: UEDJ - A Crime-Solving Desk Job
110206.body:
![logo_dark_4x.png](///raw/0d8/z/16221.png)
## Summary ##
The year is _2505_. You have just gotten hired at the _**UEDJ**_, the _United Eart Department of Justice_, as a crime-analyst.

Whenever you sit down to work at your shared-working-environment desk and fire up your barely functional computer, you are greeted with a bunch of files, images, audio, and text, sent to you by the police. Your job is to analyse the evidence, select the necessary ones to burn onto a single 4-10MB _nano-DVD_. Send the right evidence and the culprit is caught, send the wrong and he walks free or, even worse, an innocent life is ruined! :knife:

Now go out and earn that sweet, 26th century, 3000 Credits minimum wage!

[**Download on itch.io!**](https://ovidios.itch.io/uedj)

---

## Game Info ##
_**UEDJ**_ features **2½ cases** to solve, kinda **okay art**, **pretty bad writing**, and absolutely **horrible music**.

The game was made using the following tools:
- [LÖVE](https://love2d.org/) as the game framework
- [Bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/) for sounds
- [Bosca Ceoil](https://boscaceoil.net/) for "music"

---

![screenshot_cases.png](///raw/0d8/z/1622f.png)

110269.name: Forklift Frenzy
110269.body:
Organise and ship pallets of goods. Make use of what little space there is before it fills up, and ship as many pallets as you can before they overwhelm you!

![screenshot.png](///raw/3d8/e/z/16723.png)

Instructions:

"W A S D" Keys  OR Arrow Keys to Move.
F Key OR Space Bar to raise/lower forklift.

Pallets (Wood, Iron, and Bricks) arrive at regular intervals, and must be removed from the loading area. 

Game Over if the Pallets cannot find a loading bay 5 times.

Pallets can be stacked to a height of 2. Reversing will release any Pallet carried if there is another Pallet (or floor) below.

Use the space in the centre for storing Pallets.

Deposit required pallets at the delivery area (Unwanted pallets will block delivery)

Scoring
100 pts per item delivered

Game Over if Pallets cannot be delivered 5 times.

Both source code (LD42_Warehouse.zip) and EXE are available on https://malith.itch.io/forklift-frenzy

110278.name: Postgirl
110278.body:
As a good postgirl, you need to send to delivery all packages you receive before to be overflowed, the place is limited in the office!

![gameplay.gif](///raw/654/z/15f86.gif)


# [Play here!](https://noxalus.github.io/LD42/index.html)

# Controls

## Keyboard & Mouse

- Left/Right arrow keys or Q/D: move left/right
- Left CTRL/Right mouse button: pick up packages 
- Space/Up arrow key: jump
- Left shift/Down arrow key: crouch

## Gamepad

- Joystick left/right: move left/right
- X: pick up packages
- A: jump
- B: crouch

# Info

  - First solo jam
  - Cumulative time spent: 15h
  - Tools used:
    - :tools: Game engine: Unity3D
    - :art: Graphics: Inkscape
    - :control_knobs: Sounds: Bfxr, Audacity
    - :musical_score: Music: Bosca Ceoil

# Dev progress

110280.name: Space Shack
110280.body:
![Logo_10x.png](///raw/b26/1/z/162bd.png)


Have you ever tried to _run_ out of a hostile _space_ in a small space shack with your lazy, but inexplicably rich friend? Well, now's your chance! Survive long enough to reach Victory station, open deliveries for your friend or burn them to keep yourself afloat (I mean, it's not a boat, but I can't find a better word. And objects do _technically_ float in space, so whatever). Keep your shield _space_ from _running out_ and your fuel tanks (as well as your friend's heart) full!

![Cabin_Friend_10x.gif](///raw/b26/1/z/16282.gif)

Features:
- Highly animated cartoony art style;
- Fast paced platforming action;
- Jetpack!
- Polish!
- Cutscenes!
- Stuff!
- Excitement! 

Screenshot:

_(not here yet, I can't find the code I used for proper way to make in-editor screenshots, sorry. Just... It looks nice, okay! Trust me)_

(it's not like you need more than one, it's taking place entirely on one screen)



A few notes on technical issues, unrelated to the overly-excited marketing thingy above.

Web build has some framerate issues and audio bugs. They aren't enough to ruin the whole experience, but still, it's not ideal. Windows and Linux Builds are coming tomorrow (you aren't downloading them anyway _itch has stats, I can see how pointless they are_).

Also, it's using "Space" for flying around on a jetpack, so it's better to go full screen or you might experience some issues.

Also-also, no idea why LD site isn't showing the link to BitBucket in it's _proper place_, so here it is, just to be safe (also, I think, it's one of my better written jam entry, no comments, though) https://bitbucket.org/fshpsmgc/ld42/src/

110330.name: Space Eaters
110330.body:
TLDR: Kill stuff, dodge, and don't shoot at the planets.
Apparently, performances vary depending on the computer/browser. Its really smooth on Firefox but suddenly drops frames, and not-so-smooth on Chrome but doesn't drop frames.



Since the theme was "Running out of space", I decided to make a space shooter focused on saving space. How original, huh?

Your goal is to protect the planets (the big coloured spheres) from the enemies you can see flying around everywhere. Those will automatically target the planets and ignore you, but *will* hurt you if you touch them.

It plays like a twin stick shooter, you move with WASD and shoot with the arrow keys. Your keyboard layout will not influence this (azerty, etc, it doesn't matter.)

You will gain powerups upon reaching a certain amount of score (top-left corner, alongside with your health, in pink). Those powerups change your projectiles, enhance their damage, reach, etc. But they also make it easier to friendly-fire your allies, the planets. Be careful...

Of course, upon firing on a planet, you will see your points removed (by a fixed amount depending on the planet size). And your weapon downgrade. Where would be the fun otherwise? :P

The game is won when you kill all the monsters, and is lost when you die, or when all the planets are destroyed.

Please excuse the bugs, the roughness, etc. Its only my second gamejam and I kind of jumped into it 6hrs late because "fuck it, why not after all". I also used a technology I'm not familiar with (the canvas) and struggle a lot mostly with this, losing a lot of time on stupid stuff.

Written in vanilla JS. Uses the canvas, the Web Audio API and thats pretty much it. I tested mostly in Google Chrome so it should fine on anything Webkit or Blink related.

Tools used:

- WebStorm

- Paint.NET

- Bfxr

Big thanks to @ericoporto from https://github.com/ericoporto/png-font ! That crispy pixel font is perfect.

110344.name: The Super Olympic Death Race From Space Leaving Space Relay Septathalon 199996
110344.body:
## ...Turbo Edition Deluxe 2!

Hm. It would appear I **ran out of space** for my title.

### Incoming transmission from the far future.

Set your phasers to Fun. It's the summer of 199996 and the Olympics are about to be in full throttle. You play the relay team of Planet Sports, in the grandest race of the summer. Starting hundreds of miles above earth's surface (somewhere **in space**) You will pass the baton from athlete to athlete in the zero gravity septathalon, to see who will be the first team to **Run** their way **out of space**! The first team to reach earth wins!

**The player physics are intentionally wacky.**

**The game is easier if you don't try to speedrun-full-throttle-maximum-turbo your way through the game**

![Septathalon_1.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/16018.png)

![Septathalon_2.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/16019.png)

![Septathalon_3.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/1601a.png)

**Controls: W A S D to move, Spacebar to jump.**

**I Repeat: The player physics are intentionally wacky.**

**The game will take you back to the first event if you die, but it's not too bad because the game isn't too difficult**

heads up:

## The issue with running the game has been solved. 
I guess it **Ran out of space** and the file path was too big to execute.

110350.name: SHTACKITT
110350.body:
![screen_1.png](///raw/c0f/a1/z/17230.png)

The shipping, stacking, packing game!

Enter the exciting world of precision cargo container packing. Each round you are tasked with filling and shipping a full container with cargo. It is possible to fully fill every container with the cargo provided. Click and drag the cargo into the container. You may rotate the camera, but not the pieces. The bigger the piece the higher the value. 

RULES:
- Ship containers to increase your score
- You must fill each container to at least 50%
- Fill to 75% for a 2x multiplier
- Fill to 100% for a 10x multiplier
- The bigger the cargo, the higher the value.
- Cargo that sticks out of the container does not count
- You have 5 minutes

CONTROLS:
- CLICK & DRAG to move cargo
- Q & E to rotate the camera
- SPACE to SHIP the container
- R to RESET with new cargo
- ESCAPE to quit

110368.name: Tetris with Physics
110368.body:
Title explains all.

![ss1.jpg](///raw/758/6/z/177e6.jpg)

It has 2 difficulties. In Easy mode, you are allowed to continue controlling the piece after the landing. You decide when a new piece is created. Hard mode is like the Tetris you know, a new piece is created once your piece touches the others.

**Controls**

Press Z and X (or up-down) buttons to rotate the pieces.
M to mute/unmute the music.


**Development story**

I swear that I had its idea in 2008. Neither I knew programming good enough, nor it was easy to make a physics based game at that time like now. I have seen that there are games like Not Tetris 2 and Tricky Towers, but I think the easy mode in this game is unique.

**Musics**

I got permission from Talha Kaya to use his music, Çubuklar, in this game. It's a great piece from his album, Small Games. https://talhakaya.bandcamp.com/album/small-games

110380.body:
You're stuck in a trash compactor! The only way out is the green exit. 

This game was loosely based off that scene from Star Wars IV. (The one where they're stuck in the trash compactor.) 

Gameplay information:
• How to win: get to the green exit!
• Power outages: Sometimes the power will go out, this will lock the exit door, use the interact key to power it back on. 

Controls:
• Camera Look >> Mouse
• Movement >> WASD
• Run >> Left Shift
• Interact >> F

110400.name: CrumbleDungeon
110400.body:
![header.png](///raw/c3f/a1/z/18257.png)

Make your way through the dungeon by killing all the monsters while avoiding the deadly pits left in your wake.

Also manage your inventory, what else is new.

#### Controls
Use the arrow keys to move your character around.

The mouse is used to move items around by clicking and draging.

You can press R at any time to restart.

#### Gameplay
When you are on top of an item, you can move it into your inventory.

Once it's in, drag it out of the inventory to use it.

Weapons will allow you to kill one monster before you have to apply another weapon.

The feather allows you to move a few spaces without breaking the floor.

The construction kit repairs a 3x3 area around you.

A floor tile will give in and kill you when you walk over it for the 3rd time.

#### Other stuff
So I decided to join this about 1/3rd of the way through.
Never really finished a game either, so this is a first.
Though I wouldn't really call this game finished, it's more of a prototype.
There are many things I would've liked to add or refine, like sound or a point system, but time ran out for me.
One of the first things I would change is how inventory works right now, it's way too small and finicky, and I didn't have time to add object rotation.

The whole game was made in GameMaker 2, with the art made by a good friend of mine, you can find his stuff here:

https://www.deviantart.com/gauphastus

110583.name: Ranger Danger
110583.body:
![cover.PNG](///raw/4ff/a1/z/17bc5.png)
Hello everyone!
The goal is to escape  before the entire forest burns down, or your escape is blocked. It is a procedural generation game, so each time you play it's a different experience!

The Algorithms used:
- Poisson-Disk Sampling to place the trees
- Voronoi Diagram to create points and complex paths
- Dijkstra Algorithm to find the shortest path from player to the goal, and dead end endpoints.

Team:
- Ryan Wickman: Programming/Unity Developer
- Austin Fisk: Art
- Katie Robinson: Art
- Derek Crowder: Sounds

110586.name: RUNNING OUT OF SPACE (1997)
110586.body:
https://youtu.be/WoSo_AsLz1o

![vlcsnap-2018-08-11-15h40m02s246.png](///raw/b01/z/159ef.png)

You challenge the Rocky Corridor, a narrow space route filled with dangerous space rocks. It is thought impossible to enter one side and exit the other---can you prove them wrong? No, but you can set a high score!

Use WASD to move and J to shoot.

---

## Requires [EXAPUNKS](http://www.zachtronics.com/exapunks/) to play.

1. Download the cartridge file: https://i.imgur.com/BH0ZFQq.png
2. In EXAPUNKS, open the "REDSHIFT HOMEBREW" mission.
3. Open the solution browser (top left folder button).
4. Drag the cartridge file from your file system onto the EXAPUNKS window. (Dragging from your web browser into the game window doesn't work!)
5. Load the imported solution.
6. Press F5 to start the game. (To retry after dying, press ESC then F5.)

110602.name: Brick by Brick
110602.body:
Brick by brick is an arcade style shooter. Your bullets create more bricks on the wall if they miss the enemies, causing less space the more you play. Be on the lookout for health packs, energy packs, and bombs (to remove bricks). Try to last as long as you can and get the highest score!

KNOWN BUGS:
- On very rare occasion, bombs won't explode, I honestly don't know why this happens at the moment.
- It's possible to trap yourself, however you mostly have to be trying to for this to happen.
- Brick mechanics are not perfect. so it is very much possible to glitch yourself out of the map :D
- you move slowly for a little bit when entering a 1x1 area. [just a collider sizing bug, will be fixed very soon]
- in the shop, the storekeeper's text overlaps the stat windows.

- it is NOT a bug that at times a brick appears where you kill an enemy. This is a feature in the game. There is a 5% chance that this will occur causing more of a challenge and less space.

CONTROLS:
- WASD to move
- Arrow keys to shoot
- Q to drop bomb
- ESC to pause

![Screenshot (30).png](///raw/6a7/41/z/164a2.png)

![Screenshot (31).png](///raw/6a7/41/z/164a3.png)

![Screenshot (32).png](///raw/6a7/41/z/164a4.png)

![Screenshot (34).png](///raw/6a7/41/z/164a5.png)

![Screenshot (33).png](///raw/6a7/41/z/164a7.png)

I'm really happy with how this turned out. I'm motivated to turn it into a full game with levels, bosses, special items, maybe a worldwide leaderboard. let me know what you think it needs in the comments.

110616.name: The Collapse
110616.body:
### Description

It looked like just another uninteresting day. I flew with my space ship around the stars, but then i saw the blinding flash. It felt like the whole universe shattered into million pieces. But wait... what is going on with the sensors? Oh no! The universe isn't expanding anymore! It started collapsing into itself! And to make matters worse, there are some enemy ships! Thousands of them!

Your job is to drive the ship in the collapsing universe and don't crash into enemy ships or borders. 

### Controls

 - Mouse - turning yourself around
 - Space - fire
 - L. Shift - pause
 - Alt + Enter or cmd + F - toggle fullscreen
 - Esc - exit![0.png](///raw/f00/b1/z/16646.png)

110631.name: Key Chase!
110631.body: Collect all the keys to open the warp gate!

110635.name: Plastic Patch Cleanup
110635.body:
The year is 2018.

Humans have littered the oceans with plastic.
There is a huge plastic patch building up in the Pacific.
It's up to you to clean it up.
The governments will pay you cents for your efforts
so you can upgrade and get better.

----

![ingame.png](///raw/a20/b1/z/17da7.png)

Codewise the game is sadly a big mess. I wanted to do a JS build script and some proper unit testing, but I realised JavaScript is as broken as ever with new processes since a quarter ago. In any case, I had loads of fun building it, and I hope it can raise some awareness about that pesky plastic patch. 

Built with Three JS for GFX library. Used SFXR for sounds. Sprites are hand drawn with Clip Studio Paint (Formerly Anime Studio). I almost managed to squeeze in an hour or two for music, but then I realised I hadn't reinstalled Live etc. since the last cleaning of my basement box.

Big thanks to my wife for putting up with me prioritizing this over family this week-end. :)

Hope you enjoy it.

If you like this subject, then you should check out this other entry which is so much more beautiful and on the same note:  
https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/polar-bear-ballads

110641.name: GRANDMA KNIGHT
110641.body:
Slay some Bearballs for dinner before returning home. Time passes inexorabily.

Silver knightress. In memory of my granda, the greatest fighter I've ever known.
She worked hard as a butcher's pawn in times of spanish civil war.
She made of our family the happy bunch we're today. 
This game is for her, but I hope you can enjoy it as well. If so, let me know in the comments bellow.

Game design:
by Manu Scythe & Lau Donutella

110642.name: Stuck!
110642.body:
![introGif.gif](///raw/030/b1/z/16071.gif)

Reach the door before the next stop!

-Controls-

Move : Arrow Keys

Start : Return

Quit : Alt+F4

![ss01.jpg](///raw/030/b1/z/16049.jpg)

![banner.jpg](///raw/030/b1/z/16058.jpg)

110654.name: Classic Snake
110654.body:
I am 12 years old and this is my first Ludum Dare. I have been programming since 3rd grade. The idea of the game is not original but I thought it would be fun to tag along in the compo! I had already been creating a snake game (I started over entirely for the compo) and I thought the idea was not too overwhelming and so I started. Eventually, I hope to put this game on my retropie arcade machine!

Stream: 
http://youtu.be/vjQQo1Sg50A

110665.name: Inventorious
110665.body:
![KO4C7cm.png](///raw/3a/z/18170.png)
![OCGxBlO.png](///raw/3a/z/18198.png)

**Craft, arrange and disassemble your way through a game that's all about RPG inventory management.**

110670.name: The Hero's incredible Chronicles
110670.body:
![ld.png](///raw/f48/c/z/178bf.png)


Play as the Hero and come to the end of riddles, fearsome enemies, and discover the most incredible story of video game in a gigantic open world.

Despite its ambition, this game has been realized with far less time than you would expect. Let's say we runned out of time for this LD :)



![ldcontent.png](///raw/f48/c/z/178bd.png)

110672.name: No Space For Corpses
110672.body:
Top-down shooter where enemy corpses take up space. Corpses block bullets so you will need to upgrade your weapons and manage your surroundings to get a high score!

Movement: 
Use [W],[A],[S],[D] to move your character around the battlefield, shooting zombies toward your cursor with [Left Click]. 

Guns:
There are three available guns: pistol, rifle, and submachinegun. Each has their own unique damage, reload speed, clip size, and penetration (how many zombies 1 bullet can go through). Toggle between these guns with [Q] and [E].

Items:
There are three available items: bomb, decoy, and shield. Each has their own unique cooldown and behavior. 

-Bomb: Use the bomb [1] to deal massive damage to all zombies within the blast zone. The bomb will destroy corpses!
Note: We are aware of a bug where the bomb can only be used once.

-Shield: Use the shield [2] to block all zombie damage for a set amount of time.

-Decoy: Use the decoy [3] to distract the zombies and get them off you. The decoy is placed on the cursor, so place wisely!

After each wave, player will be teleported to a shop where they can upgrade their gun's clip size, accuracy, damage, and penetration!

110695.name: Running Out of Space
110695.body:
![Screen Shot 2018-08-11 at 4.44.14 PM.png](///content/660/b1/z/15afc.png)

This is a game where you try to survive by blowing up the blocks with your bombs before you run out of space. Don't get hit by your own bombs!

The game is similar to Bomberman, but different. Check out the source code and remix the game!

----------

Controls:
* Arrow keys: Move
* Space: Plant bomb

Powerups:
* Bomb Up: Have one more bomb on the screen at the time.
* Power Up: Bombs explode bigger. Watch out!
* Health Up: Recover 1 HP.

----------

Note from [Coda Highland](https://ldjam.com/users/coda-highland): My son Jason is 11 years old and built this mostly on his own in about 8 hours. I provided some technical advice and showed him how to use the tools, but he did most of the work by himself, including picking out the graphics and sound effects and scripting the game mechanics.

Assets used:

* Tileset: https://opengameart.org/content/mage-city-arcanos
* Bomb: https://opengameart.org/content/bomb | https://opengameart.org/content/bomb-party-expansion
* Sounds: https://opengameart.org/content/8-bit-sound-effects-library | https://opengameart.org/content/rpg-sound-pack | https://opengameart.org/content/80-cc0-creature-sfx
* Powerups: https://opengameart.org/content/140-military-icons-set-fixed
* Character: https://opengameart.org/content/js-actors-aeon-warriors-field-battle-sprites

110696.name: Cold Land
110696.body:
Hello everyone! Here our my first Ludum Dare game!
This is a small clicker about hard life in space. Can you live a bit longer in this city in space before it runs out of space or somebody tries to kill you?
HOW TO PLAY:
We have 3 barrels: resource, space and loyalty. When the resources of one barrel are over, then you lose. The main goal is to hold out as long as possible.
Press right mouse button on barrel to gain it's resource. 
Also you may left click on characters and kill them to gain space and loose loyalty.
![image](///content/560/b1/z/17d1c.jpg)

110706.name: Collapising Reality
110706.body:
You’re the universe’s last hope. 

![capa.png](///raw/59e/31/z/17d28.png)


Ancient void creatures want to destroy the fabric of reality itself, for the void to reign once again. But with yours Dimensional Stabilizer and your weapon, it’s your job to defend the universe. Just be careful to not waken the sleeping beast.

![Collapsing Reality 13_08_2018 16_05_23.png](///raw/59e/31/z/17d3c.png)

Tutorial:

The area affected by the Stabilizers decreases when the enemies attack it, or when the turrets arrond shots, you can use your energy bar to restore the Stabilizers by shooting at then.



Avoid the enemies, they can hit you, and do not go to the dark.

Enemies drop energy orbs that the player can pick it up, or if it’s close enough the Stabilisers can pick as well, restoring it’s life.

Placing more Stabilizers consumes half of your energy bar.

Controls:

Use WASD to move.
Lesft Mouse button to shoot 
Spacebar to place the Dimensional Stabilizer![Collapsing Reality 13_08_2018 16_03_34.png](///raw/59e/31/z/17d3a.png)

110708.name: Ping
110708.body:
_Ping_ is a top-down shooter where your enemies continue to beleaguer you even in death. Destroy and evade them to triumph.

![ping hero shot](///raw/d83/1/z/16e9f.png)

# Post-Jam Updates

I’m still adding new features! Version 1.1, available on the downloads page below, has the following:

- gamepad controls! move with left stick; aim with right; shoot with right trigger; fire laser with right shoulder or left trigger
- enemies flash when they take damage
- camera shakes when you get hit
- bug fixes

If you’re rating the game, you should download the original version (1.0.1), but if you like it then I highly recommend you play the improved one too.


# How to play

Move with WASD and aim with the mouse. Left-click fires regular shots (hold it down to fire continuously); right-click fires a charged laser beam. Quickly destroying multiple enemies in sequence will earn you a combo bonus. Enemies turn gray when they die—they can’t hurt you after that, but they will get in the way.


# Tools used
- Unreal Engine
- Cinema 4D
- Substance Designer
- Photoshop
- Audacity

110710.name: Terror Cave: Redux
110710.body:
![ludumdarething.gif](///raw/42e/z/15a51.gif)

Terror Cave: Redux is a revamp of a game by @sylviefluff.
http://love-game.net/terrorcave

# Story

You decided to explore the Terror Cave.
An evil cursor tries to smash you with blocks, spikes, tetrominos and even more spikes.
Try to avoid the blocks and escape the cavern before you are dead for good.

# Controls

Arrows - move

Up arrow - jump

R - restart

ESC - exit

# Credits

Original idea by @sylviefluff
Revamp and music by Adrian Makes Games
Sounds made with SFXR

# HAVE FUN!

110714.name: Astro Spider
110714.body:
Astro Spider LD42

Blast and net your way through space to clean the sky clear of stray light.

Lift off will start in T minus ten seconds. 
We are running out of space,
overrunned by all the light....

Lift Off - Space / X / A
Move - A & D / Arrow Keys / D-pad / Joystick

Music By Andrew Codeman

Sound effects see Creative Common link

![AstroSpider-ScreenShot2.png](///raw/279/1/z/16a9d.png)

110716.name: Moving Out!
110716.body:
# The game
You're about to *move out* of your home, but the economy is in shambles making you move to smaller and smaller places.
Everything you leave in your former home will be sold, and everything you take with you, you'll keep. But fashion changes and *so does pricing*!

Try to hoard everything you think will be more valuable later, and sell the rest.

Beware of leaving things outside for too long, or the ***ratmen*** will take them.

# [>> Play online here <<<](http://2bam.com/LudumDare/LD42/MovingOut/)

# Controllers
Works with **joysticks (stick + button)** or **keyboard (arrows + space)**.
Can be played **cooperatively with two joysticks** (just press a button to join).

# Dev note
There is no audio and the idea was to have more procedurally generated levels and price progress patterns, but I couldn't make.
Also got no time for a lose state, so ***imagine*** you lose if you don't get enough $$$ when moving :P .
This game was made in around 20 hours.

# Screenshots

![LD42_screen1.png](///raw/ffe/f/z/16dcf.png)

![LD42_screen2.png](///raw/ffe/f/z/16e0a.png)

![LD42_screen3.png](///raw/ffe/f/z/16e1f.png)

# Changelog
Had to fix a bug that was preventing the end scene from running, and player 2 couldn't progress the tutorial. Nothing outside the rules!

# ---

110717.name: Running out of Graves
110717.body:
In Running out of graves you are the gravekeeper on a spooky graveyard. Your job is to burry the corpses before they rot and turn into evil zombies.

But not only the undead have evil in mind!

< more description to come >

110724.name: Corrupted Corners
110724.body:
You find yourself on a field surrounded by strange spores which appear to be corrupting the lands. Build sunflower farms to produce the valuable sunflower currency which you can spend to build beacons that can protect a small area around them from the corruption. Or you may want to invest into arrow towers, because I have a feeling that once the corruption has spread a bit there may be other dangers creeping out of it... SURVIVE...

- Play: https://cbehler.de/ld42/
- SourceCode: https://cbehler.de/ld42/sourcecode.zip

![2.png](///raw/3e7/3/z/162fd.png)

### Comments
The initial corruption seeds, the spreading of the corruption, the creation of spawners are all random, therefore the experience and difficulty may vary from game to game. I's not possible to win ( I don't think so ), at some point the monsters and the corruption will overrun you, so just try to survive as long as possible, there is a score in the gameover screen. Also depending on your system, the game may slow down late game, js/html5 isn't that optimized I noticed, try to turn off the damage texts. Have fun :)

### Tools
- Technology: HTML5 / js
- Images: Photoshop
- Music: http://tones.wolfram.com/, Audacity 
- Sounds: https://jfxr.frozenfractal.com/, Audacity
- Editor: Notepad++/Geany

### Controls
- Use the buttons at the right side to build buildings or use the keys indicated on the buttons for quick building selection
- Place buildings with left click, right click cancels building

110733.name: The Recycler
110733.body: You're in charge of recycling the colony's waste and converting it into power for the colony.  Only recyclables can be converted to power .. trash will reduce the colony's power.

110749.name: Personal Space
110749.body:
You play the part of an introvert at a party. People make you uncomfortable. Avoid them at all costs.

If you are to near people, you will get more anxious. If you hide in the bathroom for too long, you feel like people are judging you, and you get more anxious. If somebody tries to talk to you, you get more anxious. The dog is pretty okay, though. Keep yourself from panicking before the end of the party, and keep your personal space clear, and you will be just fine.

Just. Stay. Calm.

110758.name: BioRampage
110758.body:
!![Peek 2018-08-12 23-37.gif](///raw/583/5/z/167d2.gif)

I used Unity, Blender, VSCode, Audacity,Reaper.
I used  on Linux for this one, and it worked like a charm!

About the game: the tropical forest is spreading like crazy! Use your gas powered vehicles to claim your territory back. Don't forget to plant some palm trees along the way, it's a great way to make money and expand your business.

Controls: arrows to move the camera around. Right and left click to give or remove cutting orders. Space to plant palm tree. Click on factory to upgrade or buy more vehicles.

Not the greatest game around, but I still feel like i've improved a ton sinced last year!
Anyway, I hope you'll have some fun with this one

110765.name: Avarus
110765.body:
https://youtu.be/rOIGoMALv5k

![avarusGiphy.gif](///raw/697/6/z/17278.gif)

![avarusGiphy2.gif](///raw/697/6/z/1727c.gif)

Avarus is a mobile game about collecting pairs of anti-colored coins. Collect as many coins as you can, but be wary; Your greed will be your undoing. 

- Stephen Young | Programming & Game Design 
- Justin Palmer | Game Design & Graphics Scrub
- Jonathan Marlin | Musician Overlord

110781.name: Pop it!
110781.body: You are the microwave! You do not like when popcorn spoils your surface because people clean you is not often. So you have to blow corn very carefully. You need to not let the popcorn or corn run out of the bowl!

110785.name: Space Equations
110785.body:
![2018-08-12_17-21-16.png](///raw/03a/d/z/166fc.png)

**Frantic Math for Fast Fingers**

---

## Downloads and Links:
* WebGL: https://fussenkuh.itch.io/space-equations
* Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.FussenKuh.SpaceEquations
* Source: https://fussenkuh.itch.io/space-equations ( Follow the **Download** link at the bottom of the page )

---

## Description:

Space Equations marks my third entry into the Ludum Dare Competition! When making games, my goal tends to create something that works on both a PC and my Android phone. So, feel free to check out my game via **WebGL** or **Android**, the choice is yours!

I decided to try something new with **Space Equations**... making a (rather simple) educational game. The goal is simple, don't let the game board fill up with nasty Red Boxes. The more equations you solve, the longer you live. You (or more likely your young child) might just learn something in the process.

---

## How To Play
- Touch a Red Box
- A Math Equation Will Appear
- Touch Two Numbers to Solve the Equation
- Watch the Red Box Explode

---

## Developer Notes:

Due to a crazy, hectic weekend schedule, I almost wasn't able to pull the trigger on joining this Compo. I got to clock in roughly 20 hours on this labor of love. As a result, the game's scope is rather small, which lead to some shortcomings. As always, the usual programmer graphics and sounds/music are in full effect. While I'm happy enough with the music, I wish I had more time to create and integrate better effects. I would have also liked to polish the presentation much more. 

That said, I kept my requirements creep urges at bay and fought to stay focused on getting out a working game.

Overall, I'm happy with what I've accomplished and I'm looking forward to hear what everyone thinks about it! **Thanks for playing :-)** 

---

## Tools:

* Unity 2018.2
* Inkscape
* Audacity
* 1998 Fender Toronado

---

## Screen Shots:
![2018-08-12_17-23-38.png](///raw/03a/d/z/16709.png)
Clicking on numbers to solve Equations

110809.name: running out of space
110809.body: first ludum dare! very happy that I was able to do this at age 12! you can view in here https://ezra-h.itch.io/running-out-of-space

110812.name: Nimble in the Dark
110812.body:
![2018-08-13_21-18-02.png](///raw/ad0/b1/z/17e82.png)

You are running out of light! Collect stars to bring it back up. Should it go out completely, you'll die.
Avoid incoming projectiles by moving your mouse.
Survive 60 seconds to win, but feel free to keep going and see how long you can last.
Choose one out of 5 difficulties.

Can you beat the last 2 difficulties?!
No.

-----------------------------------------

This was my first LD, went for something simple. Took around 5 or 6 hours to make using Godot.

110823.name: Squabr
110823.body:
2D Unity Game I made.

Sorry, that it didn't follow the theme, but I didn't know by, "Running out of space"

110828.name: Calorie Killers
110828.body:
Fight off hoards of burgers before you grow so large that you run out of space!

WASD to move, mouse to aim and shoot. Hold mouse down for rapid fire.

Designed, animated and developed by Daniel Black, audio and enemy concept art by Robert Shaffer.

I'm new to Game Maker so used this as a learning project, expanding on the DnD tutorial code to add features, mechanics and art for the game jam theme.

![header.jpg](///raw/119/91/z/164e4.jpg)

110835.name: Ultimate Heat Death
110835.body:
It's the year 3035, and the Ultimate Heat Death of the Universe is happening much sooner and faster than expected.

Fairly simple 2D speedrunning platformer with unique character movement mechanics

![Capture1.PNG](///raw/6b5/2/z/16830.png)

![Capture2.PNG](///raw/6b5/2/z/16834.png)

![Capture3.PNG](///raw/6b5/2/z/16836.png)

110843.name: Running out of space
110843.body:
Main reason i made this game is: i just wanted to join the contest so other people can try out my games lol. Don't actually care if i win or not.
Controls are as listed:
arrow keys: movement
z and x: action buttons
shift key: run

110846.name: The Big Crunch: Cosmic Horizon
110846.body:
#### Note: This game is best played with a mouse

You are the last survivor of a dying universe. With the Big Crunch imminent and Cosmic Horizon incoming you are literally **running out of space**.

Collapse nearby stars into black holes by knocking nearby asteroids into them. Then, attempt to escape to a new universe through each black hole.

![LD42logo2.png](///raw/d1b/5/z/16ca5.png)

#### The Big Crunch: Cosmic Horizon was made for Ludum Dare 42 in under 24 hours while camping.

110864.name: Hatches
110864.body:
LD42 entry. 

Theme: Running out of space.


Game Hatches. A digital pirate/student simulator, where you enter into shady agreements in order to get money to survive.

You sell Flash Drives full of new digital releases.

You get those via ultimate JetGet program, provided by your partner.

Make sure you keep all you disks clean while trying to get money for education payment!


Controls: mouse.
Platform: PC, downloadable.

110872.name: Dot Connector
110872.body: First game submitted to Ludum Dare, lots of room for improvement. Dot Connector is a fairly simple game where your goal is to connect the red dot to the green dot by turning a trail of black dots into red dots until you reach the green one. The catch is that every time you complete one "chain" those dots can no longer be used in future chains, thus you have to attempt to be as space efficient as possible in order to fit the most chains into the grid. Good luck.

meta.link-02-name: Setup program and zipped build files

110876.name: NHYRGLYOTRAGHN
110876.body:
The infamous NHYRGLYOTRAGHN, a monster from outer space, has driven the Blob nation into slavery...  
As the mighty Blob Hero, will you be able to defeat your Nemesis ??  
  
![Cover](///content/282/01/z/17a6a.png)
  
This is a little twin-stick shooter boss fight (actually playing with keyboard and mouse).  
  
I used my own little game engine : https://github.com/Legulysse/gugu-engine  
Art was created with Krita, and music with FL Studio.  

Tutorial :  
- Use wasd/zqsd/arrows to move !
- Use the Spacebar to dash !!
- Use the left mouse button to fire magic bullets !!!
- Destroy NHYRGLYOTRAGHN !!!!

110877.name: Password Camp
110877.body:
![coverimg.png](///raw/e40/3/z/16db5.png)

# Password Camp!
Inspired on "Friday The 13th" for NES.

![ld42_24.gif](///raw/e40/3/z/16da1.gif)  
  
![ld42_18.gif](///raw/e40/3/z/16db1.gif)  


## Theme interpretation
- "Run out of space"
- A guy runs out of space for memories in his brain. And what he remembers is crucial to advance in the game.

## Objective
1. Kill zombie priests to obtain potions. You'll need them.  
(Don't worry about using them, as the game makes Billy drink one if he's low on health and it has just been hit).  
2. Go inside cabins to obtain clues to where your murderer is located.  
3. You only have 3 slots of memory, you have to decide if the information presented to you is worth remembering or not.  
4. Once you have enough clues you can go into the direction you think your murderer is, and if you really have all the clues, then the guard will simply let you pass.  

## Constraints
You need all 3 memories to quit the city.  

## Notes
- Dying doesn't erase your memory.  
- If you loose at the final boss you can keep trying. The guards die once you see the final boss face.  

## So Theme
You run out of space in your brain... 'cause you're dead... so there's that.

## Personal comments
- Due to pico 8's token limit I had to cut out a pseudo 3D cabin section.  
![ld42_9.gif](///raw/e40/3/z/16d4a.gif)  
- I had planned 5 cities, but could only make one D:  

Hope you enjoy the game!

110917.name: Jelly Belly & his friend Octo
110917.body:
![fun3.gif](///raw/f7e/c/z/15b7b.gif)

A cooperative multiplayer game. Jelly belly and Octo trying to escape from rooms by picking the key and opening the coral doors. Movement consumes energy so you need to collect the items and fill your belly. However, it you eat so much, you are gonna explode! Don't forget to avoid the little cute monster in every room which is out of space :))

One player uses WASD keys other one uses arrow keys.
Press enter to start, space to restart, and escape to return to the main menu.

For music and effects, mouth harp is used.

![o2.png](///raw/f7e/c/z/162c3.png)

Music and Art by Salvija Vaičikonytė

Programming by Merve Tuncel

110923.name: Smack my Beach Up
110923.body:
the tetalab summer university is proud to offer you this special game for your entertainment during you holidays.
The game was crafted by a special team made of  people from different hackerspace around south of france.
enjoy !![Sans titre.png](///raw/a41/b1/z/15b7a.png)

working on godot 3.0.6

![Screenshot_20180813_085255.png](///raw/a41/b1/z/173fa.png)

110928.name: Space Jack
110928.body:
Drag and drop items on a spaceship crew while your inventory slowly runs out of space!

![Splash.PNG](///raw/48c/71/z/173f7.png)
### Synopsis

You’re a hacker who has snuck onto the USS Perspicacious. You must download as much sensitive data to your flash drive as possible without getting caught. In order to do that, you had to disable the ship’s replicator, which means you'll have to deliver all the required objects that the crew requests before they get frustrated and report you to security!

Items will come in the pipeline and you'll need to add them to the cargo hold before the handing out items to the crew. Be careful, though, you have limited space so you'll need to make sure all the items you need fit in the cargo hold!

### How to play

Click on the pipeline on the right as items come in. 

Drag and Drop items in your cargo hold on the left on to any crew members that have the matching item pop up in their word bubbles.

If you get it right, they respond with a heart and your stealth level (basically HP) goes up. Get it wrong or don't get the correct item to them in time and they get angry and you lose stealth level.

Stay alive until the timer runs out and you beat the level! Go below 0 stealth and you're found by the crew and lose the game!

110952.name: Out of Fuel
110952.body: Hard game, Space, Out , Out of Fuel![portada.png](///raw/761/b1/z/15b61.png)

110979.name: Personal Space Invaders
110979.body:
*So, I forgot about the Dare again. Here's a 1-day entry.*

![Splash.png](///raw/496/41/z/1642b.png)

Have you ever wondered what happens to all the debris left behind during your epic space battles? Unfortunately, few people do, and the waste-management space-elves who normally deal with such mundane issues have taken industrial action, downing tools and leaving piles of space debris where it is. The crew of the intrepid SS FancyPolygon have decided to ignore the issue in hopes that it will all go away, but the waste-management space-elves are getting restless...

Fight off the angry space-elves as debris slowly litters the field, but be careful not to trap yourself in a mountain of trash.

--Controls--
Arrow keys/WASD - Move/turn

Spacebar/Q - Fire

R/Return - Start/Restart

 *I'm bad at button selection*

110983.name: Sewage Control
110983.body:
Made for Ludum Dare 42 - The theme was "Running out of space"

Sewer Control started out as a simple intepretation of of the theme.
Tetris, a game where you are already running out of space, but with yet another challenge. Sewer!

You are a mysterious person that have the ability to clear out sewer playing
tetris with mysterious squishy blocks that somehow make their way down tha manholes.

Use your abilities to protect the people on the streets.

Screenshots can be found at the bottom of the post.

Gameplay
========

While you are fighting the falling pieces,
you also have to battle the sewage clogging up.
To fight back clear lines. Clearing 4 lines will clear all the sewage.

While the game is a rather simple twist on tetris I had a great time making it
,and I am already looking forward to the next LD where
I get some sort of idea/actually have time to do it

Controls:
=========
- Esc        - Pause
- Up         - Rotate
- Down       - Soft landing
- Left/Right - Move piece left/right
- Space      - Hard landing
- C          - Hold item


What I used:
============
- C
- SDL2,image,mixer
- Aseprite
- Sfxr!

Screenshots
===========

110993.body:
2-? player couch game. The goal is to knock out the others from the platform, which will shrink. First to 3 wins.

2 players can play on the same gamepad, and 2 players can play on the keyboard.

* a/left/joystick_left and d/right/joystick_right to move

111011.name: Shiznipples
111011.body:
![Banner.png](///raw/1a1/b1/z/15bc3.png)

My goal for this project was to learn GameMaker Studio 2 while participating in my first ever  Ludum Dare. I wanted to captivate a little moment of in life and based on their theme of "Running out of space" I chose a shit idea.  You know how people get lost finding a restroom? This experience gives the player the opportunity to try finding a toilet while avoiding the rush hour commute hoards.

![Screenshots_0002_3.png](///raw/1a1/b1/z/15bc5.png)

I did all the artwork & programming which was heavily inspired by by the creative Keita Takahashi. I've been analyzing his recent work recently and love the tone he captivates. Soundtrack wise from from a peer Eric Moen and I used the two sound effects via Youtube's Audio Library. Completed within 24 hours, I'm proud to achieve my small goals for this weekend.

https://youtu.be/6PJ7ZGNE7YU

111046.name: Alon Analytics
111046.body:
You are the latest hire of the Alon Analytics Corporation. Due to recent laws passed outlawing the use of advanced AI for repetitive labor you have been brought in as the the storage controller. Your job is to make sure that the disk resources provided are properly used while delivering the desired files of logged in users. Also due to the rather large lawsuit involving the AI that had been doing your job previously we've had to cut down on our storage.
Simply put, you will have to deliver files to clients while making sure our hard drives don't run out of space.

111065.name: Jelly!
111065.body:
Help control the growth of the Jellies so that they can all share before space runs out!![jellysnap3.PNG](///raw/696/41/z/17d15.png)![jellysnap4.PNG](///raw/696/41/z/17d18.png)

Controls: 

Click to place/unplace blocks\n

Enter to run game

R to reset

Jellies like to Share! Jellies may be a little greedy, but with your helpful nudging they will grow to encompass the same area and truly be Happy!!

Jellies like to Grow! Jellies will grow from their oldest square with their most preferred possible direction.

Jellies like to be Unique! Jellies like to go certain directions.

Red: ↑↓→←↗↙↘↖

Blue:↗↙↘↖↑↓→←

Green:↑↗→↘↓↙←↖

Yellow:↓↘→↗↑↖←↙

Made for Ludum Dare 42

111073.body:

The highway came through, bringing a boom to your neighboring city.  Now they need land - your land.

Acquire the money to delay them as long as possible, through means legal or otherwise.

The game ends when you're 500 gold in debt, you are in debt with no plants on the field, or the last field is claimed - whichever occurs first.

111171.name: Simple Expantion
111171.body:
Game made for the LD42 (Running out of space)

This is a basic strategy game where 4 colours (1 player and 3 AI) try to defeat each other so that they have the limited space all to them selves.

This is done by halving there life to create another unit of them selves and redistributing life other units.

When two different coloured units are next to each other the lower health dies and the higher health looses life.

If a colours original unit dies all of it dies.

![start.png](///raw/639/8/z/15c98.png) 
This is what the start of the game looks like 

![end.png](///raw/639/8/z/15c99.png) 
Mid way through and green has died.

Controls:

Click on a unit to control it

Q allows you to give one unit another units health (between 1 and 3)

Clicking on a new unit after Q will select the unit you want to give health to

E allows you to create another unit (halving the selected units life)

W A S D after E is for choosing the direction the new unit will spawn at

(I didn't put in music as I had limited time not to do with the 48 hours)

111201.name: Dog Game #2
111201.body:
Window shrinking arena shooter mayhem for LD42

Avoid everything.
Shoot everything.
Especially the things trying to make your window smaller.
Hold fire to lock your direction of fire.
Survive as long as you can. 
The game will close when the window gets to small. 
You have to re-run in to play again. 
It's meant to be like that. 
Your best time is shown in the title bar.

I managed 295 seconds. I'm sure I can do better but it's time for a break. 

Have fun.

![screen1.png](///raw/103/a/z/165c7.png)

![screen2.png](///raw/103/a/z/165ca.png)

There was a problem with the OS X version. I'll upload that version later. So Windows only at the moment.

Wally is preparing for the World Eating Tourney! In order to get to full strength, he has to power up and devour everything in his path, as the world around him gets smaller!

111250.name: shipme (Starbase Shipping Simulation)
111250.body:
![jam1.png](///raw/f82/b1/z/16b0e.png)

![jam2.png](///raw/f82/b1/z/16b13.png)

![jam3.png](///raw/f82/b1/z/16b15.png)

![jam4.png](///raw/f82/b1/z/16b16.png)

After getting promoted to a management role in the shipping department for the starbase LRX47, it is up to you to carefully handle the shipping of products across the empire...

Music, SFX, Font, 3D Models, 2D art - all made from scratch for the jam.

Credit to:
Music by GreyScreen (Kevin Stebner)
greyscreen.bandcamp.com

My micro postmortem:

- The UI pop-ups works OK. If I could do it again, I’d build it a stacking dialog system combined with a toast system (as I seem to spend more time just hitting OK to get the darn message out of the way).
- I drafted up the concepts of red space pirates to steal stuff, I never got around to finishing that part, but I fee like that could have been a cool addition.
- The game is a bit of an active clicker but started originally as a strategy design.
- Found it is helpful to turn off the feeders (dock area) to save cash while waiting for new transport ships
- I would have like time to add a skip-tutorial button
- I also had another crate/box/object type that I didn’t incorporate that I pictured as an accidental bomb-type

Source included.  Models done in blender.  Audio generated in bfxr.  Font made in fontstruct.  Intro song done in beepbox.  2D models, UI layout items done in gimp.

Main game song made by Kevin (see above).

111283.name: Panic Trial
111283.body: The game is about a gloomy, but brave guy who got into an unpleasant situation. Wandering through an abandoned mansion, he meets what he most fears. The only companion of the guy will be a dim candle and his courage.![Снимок экрана (112).png](///raw/fe7/81/z/15df3.png)![Снимок экрана (110).png](///raw/fe7/81/z/15df4.png)![Снимок экрана (108).png](///raw/fe7/81/z/15df7.png)

111291.body: Hey guys our team has created a game , we hope that you play the game, do give some feedback about the game and although the game is a prototype, we hope yall be considerate

111294.name: Days 'til Darkness
111294.body:
So this game is lacking in the fun department. I ran out of time to do the features I think were kinda core and I should have focused on them earlier!
It's my first ludum dare, and I've only recently started playing with Unity, so this is essentially a practice and learn attempt from me. I had fun!

The concept I had for the theme was for a universe that is shrinking due to some great event. It's called the Darkness, and all the planets that are caught by it are gone forever. So, literally, the universe is running out of space.

You are some kind of divine/celestial being. You choose some people on these planets to be your Heralds. They'll try to build a Vessel to escape the Darkness over 300 days. Along the way you can smite the planet if they're panicking or rioting, or you can influence them to follow your Herald.

It's not very clear in game :stuck_out_tongue: 

![1.PNG](///raw/5c5/91/z/15e57.png)
![2.PNG](///raw/5c5/91/z/15e58.png)
![3.PNG](///raw/5c5/91/z/15e5a.png)
![4.PNG](///raw/5c5/91/z/15e5b.png)

111299.name: Inner Space
111299.body:
![Screenshot_2.jpg](///raw/1fb/d/z/181b5.jpg)

Your inner space is being disturbed, your sanity faints. Don't let your blank spaces in memory get you, cause some things should be left forgotten.​​

Use SPACEBAR near the wall to regain sanity. ​

(Use windows download version for best experience)

Designed and created : Alexander Ponomariov
https://twitter.com/SengiGames​

111305.name: The Last Robot
111305.body:
![Unity_2018-08-13_02-08-48.png](///raw/bd3/a/z/16f29.png). 

You are a robot that wakes up in a cave. You quickly discover that your movement module is bugged and due to that you are slowly leaking memory. The goal is to stop the memory leak before you run out of memory space and die. There are different upgrades that can be found throughout the cave system. Some upgrades will also limit your maximum memory so you will have to choose between them. Ancient technology containing potentially harmful viruses and other dangers are also present.    
Terminals can be found in the cave that reveal useful information.  

Controls:  
Left/Right arrow keys  - move  
Up / Space             - jump  
hold Down arrow        - dance(unintended bug that is now a feature)  
Z and X                - interact  

Heavily inspired by Broken Cave Robot.


CHANGELOG:  

v1.0.0:  
* Initial release  

v1.1.0:  
* First web build  
* Light shape around player is no longer dependent on aspect ratio (always a circle now)  
* Fixed terminal text being closed automatically and immediately when interacted with  
* Fixed main menu background not covering the whole screen  

v1.1.1:
* Added version number to main menu  
* Added icon to .exe file   

v1.2.0:  
* Fixed dying multiple times after the initial death being possible

meta.link-04-name: from v1.1.0 onwards (always the latest version)

111307.name: Shelf Space
111307.body:
​![ShelfSpaceWithBooks.PNG](///raw/2e8/1/z/15d22.png)
Shelf Space is my Ludum Dare 42 compo entry. All assets were created within the 48 hour time limit.

Shelf Space is a game where you are placed in an infinite void and are given a simple task: put books on a shelf. 

![screenshot.PNG](///raw/2e8/1/z/15d23.png)

Put as many books on the shelf as you can in 3:00 minutes, be forewarned the books keep coming and you are quickly RUNNING OUT OF SPACE! The books also have a fussy bit of physics to them, you'll need to learn their quirks to be effective at putting books up on a shelf. 

--Instructions--

WASD to move, shift to run.

Space to jump.

Mouse-click to pick up or drop a book.

![smallergif.gif](///raw/2e8/1/z/15d24.gif)

Puzzle game. Push colored blocks to their colored bins.

you have an energy shield that shrinks over time, shoot aliens to recharge it and make sure that you stay inside.

Space to shoot

111343.name: Running out of houses

111354.name: Cure Your World

Drive a car named Derek and pick up blue pill. They will heal your world and you will get more space. You have to be quick tho as the world below you gets smaller over time. The poor fella is sick :(. Avoid those evil poisoned pills or the world will die and you with it!! 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You can drive forward and backwards by using W and S.
You steer your weels by using A and D.
