112094.name: Rotmeta
112094.body: This game has two opposite features. It's funny and it is one of the biggest crimes commited on code. The only excuse I have is a little amount of time (had only few hours) and using Godot for first time (it's pretty nice).![theme.png](///raw/4d3/3/z/166f8.png)

112097.name: Squish
112097.body:
A ceiling is descending on you and you are running for your life. Remove obstacles from you path to speed up your escape. Get hit by them and you will slow down. Survive the first ceiling and new challenges await.

If you would like to try my game, please send me your Apple ID so I can add you to TestFlight.

Optimized for iPhone X.

112098.name: Window Hopper
112098.body:
It's a game where you gotta move between windows real slick like y'know, or else a black box will eat you and you'll lose. Stuff gets harder the longer you go.

Controls:

WASD - Movement

Space - Open a new window

Been a while since I partook in a LD, I made this with Java and LWJGL3 which was a bit of a rockier start compared to my previous entries so I didn't find time for real graphics, or sound, or text, or really anything of value.

If your red square gets overtaken by the darkness all of your windows will self-destruct and it's game over man. The game should spit out a nice little highscores text file though marking your longest times hopping windows. glhf![hopper1.gif](///raw/813/1/z/16897.gif)

112104.name: Goo Building
112104.body: In Goo Building a hoard of zombies are coming after you. To defend yourself, build a base and place down traps. But be careful, the grid's gonna come in and if you're caught in you start losing health, fast. So you're running out of room to build defenses![ludumDareshot3.png](///raw/8f7/f/z/1657b.png).![ludumDareshot2.png](///raw/8f7/f/z/1657d.png)![ludumDareshot1.png](///raw/8f7/f/z/1657e.png)

112112.name: Hasty Fruits
112112.body:
### Idea ###
This is "Hurry Fruits". The idea is to implement something like the well known “Candy Crush” with a twist:
**The space for the fruits is shrinking!** The side of which the space is shrinking is random :sweat_smile: 
Goal is to collect as much fruits as possible until there is no space for fruits left.
Hope you enjoy the track i've chosen for this one. Credits to DJ Quads (https://soundcloud.com/aka-dj-quads)!

### How To Play: ###
Just **drag and drop** a fruit to the next fruit. The fruit will only swap the place with another fruit, if at least three fruits in a row are matching.

### LINK TO GAME ###
** For whatever reason does the WEBGL version have a critical bug: the board does not shrink. I am working on this in the next days... The exe works fine!** Best resolution to play: 1080p.

:video_game: https://marinwin.itch.io/hurry-fruits (WEBGL, EXE)

### Screens ###
![hurry_fruits_menu.PNG](///raw/81f/2/z/18111.png) ![hurry_fruits_gameplay.PNG](///raw/81f/2/z/18114.png)

### Credits ###
In my very limited development time, i've got to fall back on using existing GFX and SFX. Hopefully i have more time to invest next jam :smile:.

Sounds and GFX are not mine:
- GUI graphics are from https://www.gameart2d.com/free-game-gui.html
- SFX are from https://www.noiseforfun.com
- Fruits Sprites: https://image.freepik.com/free-vector/fruits-set-pixel-icons_1185-143.jpg

112113.name: Gunventory
112113.body:
**2D Side-scroll shooting with tetris inventory management.**

Keep the enemies from reaching the side of the screen by using your guns, but make sure you're in the right lane when you run out of bullets, so your gun gets put in your bag where there is space!

## Controls

Move lanes - W/S or Up/Down

Shoot - Space or Click or Control

## Game Rules

#### Lane Control
![GunventoryLanes.gif](///raw/f23/5/z/177a4.gif)

Your current gun will be placed into the inventory based on the lane your character is in.

#### Reloading
![GunventoryReloading.gif](///raw/f23/5/z/17791.gif)

When a column is filled in the inventory, all the guns included in that line will be removed and added back into your gun count.

#### Scoring
![GunventoryScoreSheet.PNG](///raw/f23/5/z/177ae.png)

Once the round timer has ended, your score will be the lane scores (which go down each time an enemy gets to the end of a lane) plus your gun count.

112114.name: Stack Overflow
112114.body:
![S1Gameplay.png](///raw/882/2/z/1678c.png)

## About the game

Stack different 3D shapes and try to score as many points as you can before you run out of space.

Buy some time to score more points by completely filling layers to clear those blocks.

Dark, intense sound and an 80s inspired retro neon aesthetic.

## Tools

Made in Unity, using Blender, Photoshop, and Audacity.

## Controls

W,A,S,D Move the falling shape.

Q,E Rotate the Camera

Arrow Keys: Rotate the falling shape.

Spacebar: Fast forward.

## Scoring

Each block that successfully gets set down before the stack overflows the play area gives a small amount of points. 

Each layer cleared gives a large amount of points AND it makes room to set more blocks.

# Thanks for playing!

112116.name: Packboy
112116.body:
Packboy is a game where you pack things - quickly!
It's all about managing your space and keeping track of customers. 
How far can you get before you're fired? Good luck!

![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/f40/2/z/16947.png)

112120.name: M3 (working title)
112120.body:
## Introduction

I've done a bunch of Ludum Dares in jam mode but this is my first time doing compo. I made a simple match 3 game.

## Instructions

Use left and right arrows to move from column to column and up and down arrows to shift the current column. Any run of 3 or more of the same color in a column scores you points.

## Technical notes

I built the engine from scratch using HTML5 canvas 2D context. Wrote the whole thing in CoffeeScript.

Created the music and sound effects using LMMS and some default instrument samples included therein.

## Building from source

The source code is included so you can build the game yourself using NPM.

```sh
npm i
npm run build
npm run serve
```

And then point your browser to localhost:8080

112121.name: The Cactus accident
112121.body:
![cactus zone.jpg](///raw/6f5/b1/z/16a1c.jpg)

Hi everyone!! This is my first ludum dare ever, and my first working game as a coder!
I'm excited!

This is a very simple choice-based text adventure, but I even managed to put some graphics into it :)
Written in C#, for console.

112124.name: Too Many Pucks
112124.body:
Get as many pucks to the other side as you can.

This took me about 4 hours.

112135.name: Kakapo
112135.body:
![Captura.JPG](///raw/4e2/1/z/16694.jpg)

![Captura2.JPG](///raw/4e2/1/z/16698.jpg)

Kakapo is a game about one of the most endangered species in the world.

If you want to donate or learn more please check:

https://www.doc.govt.nz/kakapo-recovery

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Made in 48h for the Ludum Dare 42 Compo by Alberto "_beta" Mellado.

-----------------------

Written in C# on Unity.

Tools:

Unity

Adobe Photoshop

Audacity

Maya

-----------------------

Controls:

Movement -> WASD

Sing -> SpaceBar 

------------------------

If you do not know what to do:

If the cats see you will have to restart that level. Be patient. 

When you are inside of the bushes (you turn blue) you are hidden and enemies wont see you.

------------------------

![Captura3.JPG](///raw/4e2/1/z/1669c.jpg)

------------------------

Contact:

albertomelladoc@gmail.com

https://twitter.com/_beta_dev

-----------------------

This was my 9h Ludum Dare entry and I am quite happy with the result.  I wanted to make this game since some time ago and this Ludum's theme was the perfect excuse. I hope this brings some awareness about the Kakapos situation. I know the gameplay is kind of flat but I want this game to be easy to access.

Hope you enjoy it!

112143.name: They Came while I was jogging
112143.body:
![banner.png](///raw/b39/1/z/16725.png)

An action-packed morning jog, with aliens and a rocking soundtrack.

**I have been made aware of some (relatively rare) crashes happening in the second and third levels; I will look into this when I have the time and try to publish a post-LD version with the crashes fixes (no gameplay changes). If you have any reproduction steps please let me know (or if the game had been lagging for you before the crash)**

The game can be completed in under 5 minutes, though it's hard to judge the difficulty until I get more feedback.

I recommend you try to work out how to beat each level on your own, but if you do get stuck [here's a walkthrough](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/amras0000/2034bb8db7fc556d4a704a9090cbe62b/raw/9c1dddbee826bd942012c00c9f0803487ac3bdf2/walkthrough)

I don't know how obvious my interpretation of the theme is. The direct interpretation is baked into the mechanics; the longer you play the less space you have to play with. I also borrowed from both parts of the theme (Running and Out of Space) to create the story (runner being attacked by aliens).

Oh, and please excuse the programmer art.


For anyone who follows my work, this isn't as ambitious as I tend to make my games. I took things easy this time around and just made a simple linear adventure without too much mechanical fluff.

Soundtrack is here:
https://soundcloud.com/amras0000/the-giant-buzzsaw-from-space

112145.name: Point & Sin
112145.body:
![5a030775c5fc4da56ac434fbf2933658.gif](///raw/5a1/01/z/180d0.gif)

THERE IS NO MORE ROOM IN HELL

MAKE SOME FOR YOUR FRIENDS


Instructions:
- point and left click to move
- point and left click to melee attack
- point and right click to fireball
- point and sin

112146.name: Escape The Space
112146.body:
Escape the Space is a game I did in about 10 hours between the day of my birthday (11) and today. The day I returned to the city I live, 8 hours of travel.


![1f6583e08cdfd2a561721bb50016a369.png](///raw/ac4/1/z/16bb7.png)

The objective of the game is survive until the people in your planet escape the system.

Controls with WASD or Arrow Keys.


Made with love and stress

![7fef82c6f06e2e562e95e2976f6de7ce.png](///raw/ac4/1/z/16bce.png)

112151.name: Whatefs
112151.body: First attempt at a game for a Ludum Dare. This game was made in GameMaker Studio 2. I am just a beginner at this whole game-making thing, but am enjoying it a lot! Use WASD + mouse to control your character. Shoot zombies to prevent the darkness getting to you, and try to survive as long as possible! :)!

112153.name: Home
112153.body:
Home is a 2d top down shooter wehre every time you shoot an enemy your playable space is getting smaller. But you can allso make it bigger again if you shoot the blue orbs and red enemys will make your playtime harder but they give you a lot of score too.
so have fun beating your scores and slowly unlock the Storry of Home!

![screenshot1.PNG](///raw/516/b1/z/16c3a.png)
![screenshot 2.PNG](///raw/516/b1/z/16c40.png)
![screenshot3.PNG](///raw/516/b1/z/16c48.png)

112157.name: There is Never Enough Space!!!
112157.body:
A silly game about solving the problems of everyday life in limited spaces.
Uses mouse, click and drag controls only.

112158.name: Drone Gardening League
112158.body:
![anim4.gif](///raw/7aa/z/172f6.gif)

The top drone racing pilots in the world are turning their sights to the the hyper-competitive world of gardening! In this arena of aeration, these pilots' seeds will surely be tested. Sign-ups open now! You could be the next top sky-mulcher!

In Drone Gardening League, pilot your drone around the small offshore island arena. Each round of the tournament lasts just a few minutes. Periodically, your garden will be scored. The drone with the highest score at the end of the round wins. Between rounds you can re-equip your drone with other modules to help reach victory. Maybe bring new flower seeds in. If those flowers defend themselves or you accidentally spill some high-test weedkiller, well, that's just drone gardening for you.

### Mechanics
 - You have a deck of cards that control various features of your drone. You can swap out cards between rounds.
 - Each card requires various resources listed on the card.
   - Battery (white): recharge by returning to your base station
   - Water (blue): suck up water by hovering over the water offshore
   - Elixer (purple): acquired automatically, or extract some from purple goop deposits around the island
 - A panel of judges score your garden every 10 seconds
   - 4 fully-grown plants are worth a star
   - Starflower and royal starflowers are worth more
   - The current standings are shown in the top left

### Reviwer Notes
 - you are the red player
 - The first level is a bit of a tutorial, mostly to get used to the controls
 - There is no penalty for losing a round
 - you must have 15 cards in your deck to start a new round. You will have to add cards after the tutorial
 - There is no end state. There are three maps after the tutorial that are picked at random

### Change Log
 - 8/13/18: card rendering fixes, fix sorting in the deckbuilder and remember which drone you picked, fix arrow keys, prevent base from being killed, fix some grid highlights, AI fixes

112165.name: Territory
112165.body:
A strategy game where you are running out of space (For your empire!)

All the instructions are included in the game.

There is no audio as I ran out of time before I could make any. I have opted out of the audio category for that reason but PLEASE DO NOT OVERLOOK THIS WHEN VOTING!!! I couldn't make music, sure, but that doesn't mean that shouldn't affect your review. If you think there was an eerie silence, make your review reflect that.

Anyways, I hope you enjoy playing the game and please do rate and comment!

![Title.PNG](///raw/41d/c/z/16664.png)

112166.name: Zombie Invasion
112166.body: Zombies take control of territory and you need to slow there progress and survive as long as possible!![zombieinvasionbanner.PNG](///raw/7bd/71/z/16c44.png)

112167.name: Hose Moose
112167.body:
![screenshot02.png](///raw/592/z/165d3.png)

Fire, fire everywhere !!!

Moose up and fight

MOVE: WASD or Arrow keys

WATER: left click

USE POWER UP: right click

Go in the lake to refill water!

112179.name: Pet Shelter Sim
112179.body:
You run a pet shelter. You provide a temporary home to homeless and unwanted animals, and you try your best to care for them. But abandonments are more frequent than adoptions, so they just keep coming, and you can't house them all, and you're coming short on money...

![firefox_2018-08-13_18-28-33.png](///raw/566/41/z/1797d.png)

![firefox_2018-08-13_18-29-14.png](///raw/566/41/z/1797e.png)

You'll have to make decisions.

![firefox_2018-08-13_18-30-23.png](///raw/566/41/z/1797f.png)

112180.name: Acreage
112180.body:
## About
A tile laying game where you lay tiles and try gain victory points by chopping trees planting and smelling flowers, building houses and carving statues. 
Maximize routes by using the strategic placement of the boots, and paying attention to the movement cost of your tile selections.

## Input
Drag to place tiles from the belt into the board during the Pick phase.
Click in adjacent tiles to move, chop or build.

Screenshots on itch
![AcreageScreenshot_0003_small.png](///raw/f3c/f/z/16777.png)

112182.name: Vertigo
112182.body:
[Screenshot_1.png](///content/a57/3/z/16543.png)

Small solo game I made for the jam. I'm just glad I managed to finish it this time.

Escape to Quit.

WASD to move. Don't fall.

Left click swings your sword. Beware of the bombs.

Right click pushes bombs away. Beware of the drill bots.

Don't let them destroy the center block.

Survive to win!!

112184.name: Arctic Arctic Adventure
112184.body:
You play as Pengy the Penguin.  You live on a patch of ice in the middle of the ocean.  There are lots of hungry Walruses around, luckily, you have plenty of curry!  Feed the walruses and they will leave you alone!  Do it quick before they eat all of your ice!  Don't get caught on a collapsing piece of ice!

- USE ARROW KEYS TO MOVE AROUND
- PRESS Z TO THROW CURRY
- FEED THE WALRUSES BEFORE THEY EAT ALL OF THE ICE AND YOU RUN OUT OF SPACE
- IF YOU FALL IN THE ICE, YOU DIE. YOU HAVE 3 LIVES
- WHAT LEVEL CAN YOU GET TO?
This game was made for THREE DIFFERENT GAME JAMS!

This game was created in less than 48 hours for LUDUM DARE 42. The theme was "Running out of Space".  The walruses will eat the ice if you don't feed them, thus you run out of space on the ice!

It was also created for LOWREZJAM 2018. It was made with a resolution of 64x64 pixels!

It was also created for A GAME BY ITS COVER 2018, a jam using the Famicase Exhibition as inspiration! I made my game based on this cover by Shiratama. The optional theme was CHILL, which my game fit perfectly with.

GRIPES:  I am overall pretty happy with this game.  I think it could use more balance, I'm not really sure if it's too easy or too hard.  I was going to add a mechanic to add ice back to the playing field, but ran out of time.  I also added music and sound to this game, which I usually neglect, I'm not really happy with the sound, and I would like to learn how to make better music/sound in the next jam.  Lastly, my code is a mess, please don't look at it. :)

I hope you enjoy the game!

112190.name: Will Survive
112190.body:
![poster_Will_Survive.jpg](///raw/2ee/41/z/17730.jpg)

Hey everyone, this is our game Will Survive. It's a survival arcade where you are Will, a lumberjack who accidentally treads on some mysterious mushrooms in the woods. After that, he begins to have visions of monsters hidden in the shadows. Is it just his imagination or some terrible danger really lurking? Discover playing Will Survive!

![Scaaaared.gif](///raw/2ee/41/z/17735.gif)

![We-cutting-baby.gif](///raw/2ee/41/z/17736.gif)

For more info about the team access:

Kleber Tangioni (artist): https://www.facebook.com/kleber.tangioni

Danielle Serranú (sound designer and composer): https://soundcloud.com/danielle-serranu

Denilson Soares (programmer): https://www.facebook.com/denilson.efsoares

Thomas Lessa (artist and programmer): https://twitter.com/ovomaltinex

112194.name: Claustrophobic Muscle Man
112194.body:
This is my first time doing a game jam! Unfortunately, I couldn't solve some issues, but I'm nonetheless glad I was able to get this far. ![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 1.44.07 PM.png](///raw/046/b1/z/16590.png)

Link to Download: https://chanoyun.itch.io/claustrophobic-muscle-man

112196.name: Housing Crisis Island Wars
112196.body:
It's a familiar problem. You've got a lot of people, they keep making more people, and the lot of them all want roofs over their heads. Building houses is pretty fast with the fancy crystal energy generators your people have, but there's a bit of a complication. The trouble is that you happen to live on an island in the sky, and there isn't all that much space to go around. There are more islands to expand to, but they're infested with weird blue bug things. Looks like if you want to avoid running out of space to put houses, you'll have to put the 'aggressive' in 'aggressively expansionist.'

- Controls: Mouse + Hotkeys (1-4)

- Left click an island to select it.

- Use the buttons or hotkeys to create buildings and units at the selected island.

- With an island selected, right click another island to send units from the first island to the second.

- Your population will grow over time. If you have more population than housing space, excess population will drain your 
crystals. If you run out of crystals, you lose.

- Use small units to fight small enemies and big units to fight big enemies


Known issues:
- Unit sprites sometimes flicker or hide behind islands.
- Victory condition is not implemented. Just try to conquer every island.


![LD42--1.png](///raw/168/z/16ee6.png)
![LD42-0.png](///raw/168/z/16ee9.png)

112197.name: Running out of space, literally.
112197.body:
(Webplayer available)

Your objective is to run out of space, to do this you must stay inside the wormhole. Use the blinkers, radar, and what you see outside to your advantage. The further you get, the less help you get.

![Screenshot.png](///raw/927/41/z/16624.png)
![Screenshot2.png](///raw/927/41/z/16617.png)

112199.name: Deposition
112199.body:
![screen-Ld-post.jpg](///raw/b75/z/1760b.jpg)In deposition, you can be a policemen that take statements, or be the judge that read statements and accuse.

Merely, today, there is a small problem: there is no more sheet of paper at the police station...

Made in javascript with Phaser library.
Source are on the itch page.

In the post-jam version, three players each take a different statement, and the judge see all the three. That's what I had planned but didn't have time to do....

(there are a really small serve-part code that isn't in source, because, you know...)

Edit: 08/13/2018: just change a layout order that was annoying for the judge (source files aren't change)

112200.name: Get Off My Lawn
112200.body:
![640x480.png](///raw/6c4/1/z/165b4.png)

Play as a grumpy old bean trying to stop intruders from messing up his lawn.  Beware of children, delinquents and hippies who won't respect your boundaries.  Scream at them to leave while simultaneously caring for your lawn, watering and keeping it free from garbage or it will surely perish. 

**Controls:**

**Move: WASD or ARROWS**

**Aim: Mouse**

**Action: L-click or Space**

**Cycle Actions: R-click or J**

How many waves will your lawn survive?

112213.name: Running out of Hell
112213.body:
Extremely short rhythm/bullet hell game where your run out of space not filled with bullets.

Created in like 5 hours partly because I am lazy and also cause I didn't have all weekend free.

![image3.png](///raw/f13/z/165e9.png)

Controls:

WASD to move.
Mouse to click things in the menu.
Escape to exit level.
R to restart.


Don't forget the game is "turn" based - you can basically move through bullets.

![image2.png](///raw/f13/z/165e5.png)

Made using:

Unity3D, Photoshop, my guitar, some bad free version of Ableton "Live" I got.

112221.name: Street Sucker
112221.body:
Two Vampires of The Nosferatu Clan are Battling to Death with every Sunstrike stealing Masquerade Points from Them! Which Vampire is the Fastest, The Healthiest?

Controls: WASD for 1st player, Left-Up-Right-Down for 2nd player

112227.name: Munster
112227.body:
![slice1.png](///raw/b0a/1/z/167b7.png)

# Munster

## This is a story about the day to day life of a little vampire told through game mechanics.

Created in 48 hours by @savethejets

112233.name: Lava Rider
112233.body:
Are you a cool kid?
I mean, are you a **cool** kid? Like, do you even surf on lava during your holidays?

Well, that's what Zombie Tony does. And that's what you're about to do!

![screen_002.png](///raw/8ef/z/1669f.png)

Your goal is pretty simple: grab some Crystal Coins to get some points and stay alive as long as you can!
Use the **arrows** to move around,crouch and jump to avoid obstacles. The **spacebar** (or **Enter**) can be use to validate your choices in the menus.

In case you have to quickly quit your game, you can use **Escape** to commit suicide...

![screen_001.png](///raw/8ef/z/166ae.png)

You seem to think that's fairly easy. The thing is the volcano who's currently erupting also emits that dark smoke which blinds you more and more as each second goes by.
That, and the fact the screen will soon be filled with enemies to avoid. Almost like you're *surfing out of space to be safe*...

![screen_003.png](///raw/8ef/z/166bf.png)

Oh, and be sure to check out Tony's reaction after each try. He'll say different things based on your rank.

(Also, for some obscure reason, I can't clear the highscore table... Well, guess you'll be able to see if you're better at riding lava than I am! Try to beat my scores!)


*Softwares used:*
- *GameMaker Studio 1.4*
- *Paint*
- *cGMusic*
- *GXSCC*

112238.name: The Kessler Problem
112238.body:
Earth's orbit is filling up! Some might say we're literally ...running out of space...

Your objective is to put as many satellites as possible into orbit whilst avoiding collisions.

Your performance is scored on how many satellites you can get orbiting at once. See how you compare to everyone else who has played on the online scoreboard!

https://youtu.be/sHS0WhiVtnE

### Controls: 
**[A][D]** for changing the direction to send your satellite into orbit. 

**[Left Click]** and grab will move the camera around earth (arrow keys also function as camera movement).

**[Mouse Scroll]** T​o Zoom.

Hold **[Space]** to increase launch power (how large of an orbit your satellite will have). 

Release **[Space]** to launch.

**[F]** Toggle display of Satellite Trajectories

## Tips & Tricks:
Satellites orbiting at the same height will have the same speed, and orbital period.

Holding Space past maximum launch power will start to decrease launch power.

112246.name: Zombie Wackers
112246.body:
This game is all about wacking zombies. It's a mix between platformers and 2D shooters.

Controls:
WASD to move, space to jump. CTRL to fire or use mouse button. I recommend gamepad for this game.

![2018-08-12_20-31-05.gif](///raw/a44/a/z/16683.gif)

112247.name: Upwards
112247.body:
This was my first jam.
Made this for Ludum Dare 42. 
A simple fast paced action game. 
Reach as far up as you can while dodging bullets, spikes and enemies.
( Please note : The game may not run smoothly on web browsers. I have added a downladable rar file for that purpose.There will be an option to download the game from itch.io page. Optimisation is something that i would be doing this week. Thank you for reading this and reviewing the game)

meta.link-03-name: Rar archive. Just extract and play

112251.name: Gulp
112251.body:
This is a game about a hungry little plush monster that doesn't know too much cake is bad for it. Thus you will need to guide him away from the cake, which happens to fall from the sky. The tricky part is, the monster will grow whenever it eats a cake, which makes your mission harder each time.

How long will your monster survive?

![screenshot1.png](///raw/e99/1/z/1672d.png)

Tools:

- Löwe 2D
- Gimp
- Audacity

112252.name: Spatris
112252.body:
Tetris in space.

Pick up a tetromino, place it on the board. Making one (or several) lines horizontally or vertically will clear them from the board. Each time something is cleared from the board, the speed will increase slightly. You better try to clear several lines together because it only counts for one clear, so the speed will only be increased once. Don't forget you can make lines VERTICALLY.

If you don't put the tetromino at an empty spot on the board or don't pick a tetromino you'll lose 1 HP.

Try to stay up as long as you can! Share your time in the comments !

= Controls =

Arrows to move.

A, Q to rotate a tetromino counter clockwise.

D, F, SPACE to rotate a tetromino clockwise.

Alt + F4 to quit.

![spartis_screen.png](///raw/a3b/z/16fe6.png)

112253.name: Blast
112253.body:
A space shooter with a shrinking map border. 
See the in-game "tutorial" button for more information. 

Thank you for playing, and for any feedback :) 

![1.png](///raw/b1c/e/z/1664f.png)

(Source link doesn't seem to always appear for me so here's a link: https://github.com/JPatrickDev/LD42)

112261.name: WAREHOUSE
112261.body:
![screenshot.png](///raw/286/b1/z/16d43.png)
WAREHOUSE is a game about driving a forklift truck around a warehouse. Try not to run out of space and make those deliveries on time!

Controls
========
Arrow Keys to move Forklift

Hold Spacebar to raise Forks

Scoreboard
==========

There are 4 levels. Please comment with your total accumulated score so we can get a scoreboard going! :smiley: :clipboard: 
![anim.gif](///raw/286/b1/z/16f7d.gif)
![screen3.png](///raw/286/b1/z/16cfb.png)
![screen2.png](///raw/286/b1/z/16cf4.png)
![screen1.png](///raw/286/b1/z/16cea.png)

112264.name: Tetrish
112264.body: I kinda mashed up a tetris game and a platformer.

112270.name: Clean Your Room !
112270.body:
Hi,
The goal of the game is to clean your room as fast as you can, for this put the objects in the ground in the good place.

Move your character with: 

W / Z / Up Arrow : Move in the direction

A / Q / Left Arrow : Left Rotation

D/ Right Arrow  : Right Rotation

Take object with : [Space]

Lead object with ( only if an object has been taken): [Space]

  -> Execute LD42.exe in LD42\LD42\bin\DesktopGL\AnyCPU\Debug

Good Game

A remix of "Snake", with a focus on shrinking playable area.

---

This world is impure, and you are the cause.
Press WASD/arrow keys to move.
When you step on a tile, it will become temporarily poisoned.
If a small group of tiles get cut off by poison, they will become incurably infected.

112280.body:

![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 08.31.57.png](///raw/835/z/173a1.png)

![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 08.32.33.png](///raw/835/z/173a2.png)
Unload them and get harsher passengers:
![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 08.32.56.png](///raw/835/z/173a3.png)

## Story:
Your job is seating passangers in an airline company. One day, marketing department of your airline came with "great" promotion: "From now on, everyone can make up any requirements on seating." Well that's easy to be said but who will fit all that people with crazy requirements into the plane? Guess what, you!

## Controls: 
Just drag and drop passangers onto seets you want to assign them

**Cmd/Ctrl + Q** to quit game any time

## Team:
[Martin Novák](http://www.twitter.com/wolaroj) - Coding, some 2D Graphics, Audio

**Ondřej Dovec** - Idea, 2D Graphics

**Wolar Games** (Our company) -  [Web](http://www.wolargames.com) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/wolargames) | [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/wolargames)

Unity, Photoshop, Pixaki, Aseprite, DoTween (Unity Plugin) 

## Notes:
First two levels are tutorials and will be very easy, 3+ level will be much harder.

This time we worked for around 16 hours in total as we didn't have more time. We had quite hard time fixing everything and polish the game "enough" in time.

**We did not create all the Audio (we have downloaded music and some sound effects) so we opt-out Audio category.**

112289.name: Outrunning Space!
112289.body:
Dear player, we had to keep the main area of the web page to display a word from our sponsors. Sadly, it means that we are **running out of space to display the wonderful game that you want to play**.

Therefore, we had to use the only space left to display the game: **the URL address bar at the top of your browser window**.

[![outrunning_space_coverD.png](///raw/df3/z/1686d.png)](https://v6p9d9t4.ssl.hwcdn.net/html/998148/index.html)

## How to play?

**Look up at the URL bar!**

You are the *"X"* running out from the deadly **"Space"** at the left of the screen.

From time to time, you'll see **"o" shaped obstacles** on the floor.

Press **any key to jump** over the obstacles.

You'll earn **1 point** each time you evade an obstacle.

If you **hit an obstacle**, you'll fall back and will come closer to the space of the left.

**Once the space catches you, you're dead!**

*Your current score is displayed between the two "#" signs.* 

## About the game

Sadly, due to real life constraints, I had only **2h30** in total to work on a game for this compo.

I really loved the theme, and while I knew I had to keep the scope very small due to very limited time, I thought that it could be funny to interpret the theme as "we are running out of space in the web page to display the game, so you have to play it from the URL bar".

So that's it, **"Outrunning Space!" is a very simple game taking place in the URL bar**, where you have to avoid obstacles in order to outrun a deadly "Space" in the URL.

It was made in Javascript, using the location.replace() method to modify the URL display inside the browser URL bar.

## Extra theme constraints

At first, I thought that the theme could be a cool way to make a "small game", as in "taking as less disk space as possible for the source code". So, there you have it: once minified *(striped comments + regpack'ed)* the **whole code source is only 792 Bytes**, so way below the famous 1KB code limit of the JS1K code compo :).

The source code is **inside the HTML page of the game** (due to its small size, I wrote it directly inside the HTML page, with comments and all).

## Conclusion

**All in all,** I hope you enjoy this game despite its very "simplistic" nature (using a 1x20 display area is though!)

By-the-way, it's a Javascript game, it should work on every browser, except Safari (and maybe others) as it doesn't display the whole URL in the address bar. 

I've only tested it on Firefox, so I hope it will also run well on others browsers (I lacked time to do more thorough testing, sorry!)

meta.link-01-name: See Javascript source code inside the HTML page

You are a cube, when you move the place you were gets occupied, thus making you run out of space. There are other obstacles like things that shoot other things, tripwires, and bombs.

![GIF.gif](///raw/810/9/z/168cc.gif)

This game was build using:
- Photoshop
- Unity
- Paint3D
- Visual Studio Community
- Da Internets

Here are the main rules/objectives for this game:
- fun (kinda achieved)
- puzzle/arcade (yes)
- scalable (yes! levels are very modular)
- playable on mobile (yes, controls are simple enough, the unity physics and collisions are not used so its not a very heavy game)
- must not be based on reaction time/reflexes(yes)




In the end I am not that Happy with the result, couldn't solve some of the bugs, and the looks of the game are ugly as hell. But still this was just the boostraping. From now on I will polish it, and deploy it on mobile :)

# Description
This is a game about managing a colony on a broken starship running out of time and space.
As the game goes on, sections of the ship start to break and need to be rebuilt.
You will start running out of space for the things you need to maintain civilization
You need to construct residences, farms and utility buildings to keep a balanced population while dealing with unexpected events (e.g. mumble rap resurgence)

# Intructions
Move the camera with WASD
Click on buttons to make them do stuff
Make sure you always have population and credits

# Tools
Tools used: Unity, Photoshop, Substance Designer, Blender

**Play this game at your own risk, as I made it in about 12 hours and even I am amazed at its sheer lack of anything resembling quality.**

Wat?

Turns out some things in your world like you a lot and start moving closer when you touch them. But it's also suffocating and feels like you have no space. Wat do?

Install / Play
-------------

Get [ghost player](https://game.builders/). It allows you to play Lua / Love games like this one by just copying a link.

Then open this link in it: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nikki93/wat-do/499c4e2d8d44c7fbe4f744888717763916759fef/main.lua (copy the link to your clipboard, then click the "Clipboard" option in ghost player)

Pics??

![screenshot-3.png](///raw/fa6/b1/z/170d4.png)

![screenshot-1.png](///raw/fa6/b1/z/170d7.png)

Keys?

**left**, **right** -- run

I wasn't expecting to do this game jam, but I wanted to try out some new stuff this time around. Instead of pixel art I used vector shapes this time around. I also made all of the music and sfx too. This was my first time using garage band and I guess making anything close to music to hopefully it sounds alright~

The theme was "running out of space". The interpretation I went for was "space" being stars and such and not a physical/digital "space". So in the case of the game, you're "running out of space" as you fill the sky with constellations.

Everything was created during the jam! I hope you enjoy it!

"Running out of Space" was the theme and I took both the parts of the theme, in my game if the player slows down from his max speed while "running", the screen starts shrinking. BTW Use Horizontal & Vertical axis to run faster (totally an intentional feature)

The Main Boss shoots projectiles which the player has to dodge to avoid losing health, but when dodged it lands and if not "crushed" by the player by going over it, spawns an egg which spawns minions which shoot the player too which shoot their own egg that spawns minions that shoots the player and spawns their own egg shoots the player and spawns their own egg..

![Cover Art.png](///raw/006/b1/z/16d38.png)


The game is a top-down shooter in which you have to eliminate all the enemies to win the game (which you cannot because of a bug in the "Victory Scene"). The game gets pretty challenging in the end where u have to deal with the reduced screen space and dodge projectiles and crush the eggs and aim and shoot the Boss and/or minions

112348.name: The last witch-knight
112348.body:
![pic-1.png](///raw/3d1/z/170f3.png)

![pic-2.png](///raw/3d1/z/170f4.png)

![pic-3.png](///raw/3d1/z/170f6.png)

# Description

Your mission, if you decide to accept it, is to slay *the last witch-knight* (the dude above).

As the fight progresses, the circle of light illuminating the arena will dwindle, leaving you with **less space** to maneuver. (Going out of light means imminent death after a few seconds.)

The game consists of the one *hard* boss fight. That's all.

Oh, and you die in one hit!

# Controls

 * **Arrows** - movement
 * **X** - shoot
 * **Z** - dash
 * F11 - toggle fullscreen

Try to **stay in the circle of light**. You can go outside for a few seconds, but stay for too long and you'll die miserably. (There is a visual indicator, so you'll know how much time you have.)

Dashing not only allows you to move faster, but it also makes you invulnerable, *and* destroys projectiles.

(non-QUERTY keyboards are supported properly - Z and X will be remapped to whatever the two bottom-left keys on your keyboard are)

# Strategy Guide

**(skip to avoid spoilers)**

This game might be a bit too hard. (Like, *Titan Souls*-esque hard.)

While it might be interesting to figure everything out by yourself, it may be too frustrating.

Here are a few tips to make your life easier:

 * Phase 1 - Crystals  
   This shouldn't be hard. Use dash to dodge bullets, and shoot crystals from afar.

 * Phase 2 - Laser  
   Simply wait behind a rock, until the boss comes nearby. Then dash sideways, get behind his back and hit him a few times.

 * Phase 3 - More crystals  
   This one is tricky. Try to destroy one of the two crystals ASAP, preferably before it starts shooting. Then you can hide behind the boss and chill.  
   There is a trick to destroying the second one: Instead of rushing towards it, use boss shield to deflect bullets towards the crystal while sitting in a safe spot.
   
 * Phase 4 - Magic  
   At this point you should know how to dodge.  
   First, you need to kill the two small orbs. Beware: when one is destroyed, the other and the boss itself will start shooting at you.
   After both orbs die, the boss becomes vulnerable, but also aggressive. You'll need to dash a lot.

That's all, good luck!

# Please comment

Your feedback is important!

# Help needed!

Some people in comments have reported a visual game-breaking bug. None of my friends can reproduce, so I'm somewhat stuck for now.

**If the bug happens to you, you can help immensely** by contacting me (on Discord: HolyBlackCat#7530, or some other method of your choice), and running a few tests to collect some data for me. Expect it to take approximately 15 minutes.

## Changelog

2. Fixed respawn point placement
1. Initial upload

Bug reports will be appreciated as well.

112372.name: Merge Machine
112372.body:
A puzzle game where you merge cells to gain money. When you start to run out of space, expand your grid by spending your hard earned cash!

## Connect for Cash

By connecting similar joints they will be merged and you get a bit of cash.

![Connect joints](///raw/91c/2/z/1724d.gif)

## Cause chain reactions

When joints are merged they can impact surrounding the cells.

![Cause a chain reaction](///raw/91c/2/z/17255.gif)

## Expand the grid by spending money

You can expand the grid with the money you've earned. Be careful though, it gets more expensive each time you expand!

![Expand the grid by spending money](///raw/91c/2/z/1725a.gif)

## Joint types increase with grid expansion

As you buy more space, the number of joint types increase. Some require matching four cells.

![Cross combination](///raw/91c/2/z/172bf.gif)

You move around with the mouse, using only your trusty grapple.

**Controls**:  
*Left click*: Attach grapple  
**Right click: Release grapple** (some puzzles will be near impossible without this)  
*Esc*: Quit game  
Sensitivity can be adjusted in the menu. (The sensitivity buttons are accidentally inverted ^^)

![MZzWBxn.png](///raw/b4d/z/16986.png)  

Gameplay / Walkthrough  
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oz6fA3IpSa0

![FkxsdN3.png](///raw/b4d/z/16c49.png)

112383.name: Datacell: a dungeon crawl
112383.body:
This a Rougelike without randomization.
You have no Levels and no Equipment slots, but every one of your 6 Items contributes all its bonuses to you.

Contolls:
- WASD: move your charachter (@) and hit enemies (E)
- Space: pick up loot (~)
- Mouse: organize inventory

Your Hero: ![at.png](///raw/775/1/z/16996.png)


Tips:
- Items with max health heal you.
- Your Inventory has only 6 Slots, so be careful what you thrash when you run out of space. 
![screenshot.PNG](///raw/775/1/z/1698d.png)


Tools:
- Unity
- Jetbrains Rider
- Paint.net

112386.name: Slug Invasion
112386.body:
Very toxic slugs have invaded your island.
They reproduce very rapidely.
Kill as many as you can before you run out of space !

controls : arrows, space to move, click to shoot

For the moment you need to install eclipse to run the game with sounds, I didn't manage to export them in the JAR file.
![game.png](///raw/9f6/b1/z/16a57.png)

112388.name: Takeover
112388.body:
Welcome to the battlefield.  Fight against the other team to see who can Takeover the battlefield.  As time goes by the battlefield shrinks so plan accordingly!

Was designed something similar to Clash Royale but didn't get around to the network code.  So a simple AI was created to play against.

112389.name: Void Runner
112389.body:
Void runner is a game about dodging fast asteroids, and going the farest and the fastest possible.
Controls :
UP, DOWN - move ship.
CTRL - shoot ( 5s cooldown )
SPACE - become invincible ( and half transparent ) for 1s, 2.5s CD
SHIFT - speed up

The fastest you go, the bigger you and the asteroids are.

Starring : an Hiigaran Interceptor !

112390.name: Escape the Big Rip
112390.body:
The Universe will die in a Big Rip. Your only chance is to leave it. So you are running... out of space!

Whole game works with using the spacebar, nothing else.

EDIT: The green orbs around the ship represent your remaining 'space' key presses (they slowly regrow and you can gather powerups containing some).

112391.name: Shrinking Snek
112391.body:
THIS GAME REQUIRES JAVA 8 IT DOES NOT WORK WITH JAVA 9

I ended up having less time than I thought so ended up not having enough time for my original idea. I has about three hours left when i thought "isn't snake technically running out of space?" so here we are.

The playing area shrinks over time starting fast and then slowing down as it expands.If you enter the red area you will get teleported to the other side like normal. there is no penalty to being in the red area. You move with WASD or arrow key and can speed up with shift or slow down with ctrl.

Added a post download link that is a single jar so you don't have to extract a zip. the only change is I added ingame instructions (and the code to extract the native dlls).

112393.name: Space Escape
112393.body:
![Space Escape Screen 0.png](///raw/eb8/f/z/17017.png)

Top-down monochromatic action game where you need to escape avoiding obstacles through 10 stages.

![Space Escape Gif.gif](///raw/eb8/f/z/1701d.gif)

You are a skillful space secret agent caught on a trap in a enemy orbital base. **Run out of space** or die without oxygen!

![Space Escape Screen 1.png](///raw/eb8/f/z/17019.png)

Use enter/space for confirm text and arrows/WASD for movement. Game made with Cocos Creator. Post your high score. Game screen is too small? Remember: Browsers have zoom function.

![Space Escape Screen 2.png](///raw/eb8/f/z/1701b.png)

112394.name: Space Run
112394.body:
![animatedThumbnail.gif](///raw/0b4/z/16ae1.gif)

Remember those stories you heard back in preschool about our Universe rapidly expanding, which would eventually end in the death of everything?

Me neither, but the protagonist surely believes so.

Help him escape this "space".

By... quite literaly running out of it to the vast nothingness.

112395.name: Shrinking Panes
112395.body:
![title.png](///raw/0f4/z/16cd0.png)

This was my first time using Unity for a 3D game, and everything was created by me in 48 hours.  The game is nothing like what I set out to make _at all_, but I'm very happy with the end result.

If you have problems with the web version, please download the standalone version.

There is a **known bug** with the mouse controls when the game regains focus.  The only workaround I know of (right now) is to never resize or exit the game window until you're done.  If anybody knows how to fix this, please let me know...

## Tools
* Unity
* Inkscape
* sfxr
* Musagi

## Base Code
* The dialogue system is based on Brackey's tutorial, which I followed inside the 48 hours.

## Screenshots
![screenshot-1.png](///raw/0f4/z/16ca7.png)

![screenshot-2.png](///raw/0f4/z/16cb1.png)

112397.name: Path of Excess: Hoarder vs Horde
112397.body:
"Why can't I hold on to all these items?" -- The Lament of All Adventurers

Path of Excess is a loot acquiring and inventory management game.  You're responsible for selecting items to equip to your adventurer, while also trying to return to town with as much loot as you can possibly carry.

[LD42-02.jpg](///raw/f6/z/16eda.jpg)

-=-=-=-

INSTRUCTIONS

Click-and-drag items to collect and equip! See in-game tutorial for more information on game mechanics.

-=-=-=-

Made in 48 hours in front of a live Twitch audience.

Author:  
  Martin "quill18" Glaude  
  quill18@quill18.com  
  https://youtube.com/quill18 -- Let's Play Videos  
  https://youtube.com/quill18creates -- Programming Tutorials  
  https://twitch.tv/quill18  

Tools:
 - Unity /w Visual Studio
 - Photoshop
 - Audacity!

112399.name: Climb
112399.body:
Out of all of the two game jams I've ever attended (counting this one), this is the first one I actually managed to finish! My goal before I entered was to make a playable game, and in my opinion it went pretty well :)

Controls: A-D=move SPACE/W=jump R=restart

Tools used: Unity, paper and pencil :)![LD42_Thumbnail.jpg](///raw/692/41/z/16f86.jpg)![LD42_image01.jpg](///raw/692/41/z/16f92.jpg)

112403.name: Claustr - LD42
112403.body:
Claustr is a lil' 3D platformer where the environment is trying to ruin your day!

Thank you for playing!

![ScreenShot01.jpg](///raw/341/a1/z/16d0d.jpg)

![ScreenShot02.jpg](///raw/341/a1/z/16d18.jpg)

![ScreenShot03.jpg](///raw/341/a1/z/16d1c.jpg)

112405.name: Sliders
112405.body:
![Screenshot.png](///raw/f39/e/z/16c6f.png)

![Sliders_GIF.gif](///raw/f39/e/z/16cb6.gif)

Move the spheres to the red tile, but watch out! 
The spheres will destroy the floor and limit the spaces avaliable.


Controls

WASD/Arrow keys - Move the sphere and helper blocks

R - Reset the level

X - Skip Level

Esc - Pause menu

112408.name: Circle Swarm
112408.body:
Circle Swarm is a small game where you *must* protect your core no matter what! There are enemies flying in from all side aimed at your core. Use the paddle with your mouse to move the paddle and deflect the enemies.

Be careful because once your core gets too big you are out of space and will not be able to deflect anything!

112409.name: ASCII CAVE
112409.body:
First Ludum Dare!
I tried to make an ascii art game engine. Source code here https://github.com/devgr/asciicave/tree/master/src/game-logic
It's more interesting as an experiment of animating text, it isn't a whole game yet.

112410.name: LimitedLootHunters
112410.body:
Hello!

This is my first Ludum Dare entry. Since Ifound out about this competition, I always wanted to participate. 

Sadly I couldn't finish adding some music, but I'll try to continue the work on this game. Maybe someday it will have some music.

Anyways here is the idea for this game with this Ludum Dares theme "Running out of space".

You start out with three Players. Your goal: keep them alive as long as possible. You'll get Loot from enemies and also from chests. Some of these are useable some are not. Useable items will vanish after they were used, equip items however will not. 
![How_to.png](///raw/0b3/21/z/16de9.png)

The violet highlighted boxes are where you obtain your loot. If all of these slots are occupied you won't get any new loot. -> Keep them empty!

The other coloured boxes represent the free storage of the group. Each group Member has 2 colored Columns. Equipable Items can be put there, they will be automatically equipped. You can swap these Items around. However say blue dies and had some sword equipped and you try to equip it on green, you won't get the effect on him. Useable items however can still be used.


Controls: Mouse only

Left click: Swap the items in the inventory.
Middle click: Shows information for the item.
Right click: Use the item if it is useable.

112414.name: Precious Things
112414.body:
This is a game where your house is shrinking so you must move your precious things so they don't get crushed. Made in Construct2. 

![screen.png](///raw/531/4/z/16df1.png)

112415.name: Running Out in Space!
112415.body:
**Running Out in Space!** is a platformer game. While progressing through each level, the walls will become closer and closer from each other. Be careful, and use them at your advantage, while always trying not **running out of space!**

**Move** : Q/D
**Jump(double)** :SPACE
**Retry** : R

EDIT : A new version is available with fixes on potential blockers in the flow. The original Compo version is for sure still available to download as well!

![screen1.PNG](///raw/db1/z/16df7.png)![screen3.PNG](///raw/db1/z/16dfa.png)![screen4.PNG](///raw/db1/z/16e01.png)![screen5.PNG](///raw/db1/z/16e05.png)


PS: Finally Done!!! Submission was made 1 minute before end of the countdown, so sorry for the lack of description. I'll pass by as soon as I can to complete everything.

112416.name: BEYOND
112416.body:
**Controls**:  
arrow keys to move  
z to interact/further dialog or attack (in battles)

112421.name: The Ceiling
112421.body:
I made this game in 3 hours because of lack of time, so it's probably the worse game ever created, but basically, you have to jump over lava lakes and don't get smashed by the ceiling.

Source code (for some reason it doesn't appear in the links section): https://github.com/yoannlr/ld42

112422.name: BulletMan
112422.body:
![BulletMan_Banner.png](///raw/915/6/z/16c51.png)

BulletMan is a Top-down shooter Game with a little twist(download and find out yourself).

BulletMan is made with Godot.  
Everything got created in under 48 Hours.  
The Game needs some polishment but i ran out of time.  
I created the last two Levels within the last 2 Hours.  
But i hope you enjoy it anyways!

![1.PNG](///raw/915/6/z/16da4.png)

![2.PNG](///raw/915/6/z/16da6.png)

112425.name: Detox
112425.body:
![moja2.gif](///raw/d5c/1/z/16f0b.gif)

![gameplay.gif](///raw/d5c/1/z/16f52.gif)

### You can press M midgame to turn on the music, I set it as off by default because I imagine it can get old pretty fast

------------------------
## About

At first I was going for a "Keep the bottle from filling up by pushing everything away" game, but I realized it was way more nuanced if the player had to let some things get through and push away others, so the final game doesn't really fit much the jam theme.

I'm still very happy since this is my first game with some online functionality, which took me most Sunday but in my opinion was well worth it.


------------------------

## Made Using:
 - Unity (with [GBCamera](https://roguenoodle.itch.io/gbcamera-for-unity))
 - Photoshop
 - Blender
 - [bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/)
 - [beepbox](www.beepbox.co)

------------------------

# Play it here!

112430.name: Iris
112430.body:
**You're *trapped*!** Dodge bullets and destroy your enemies while the trap grows ever closer — but there is no hope of escape.

Iris is a procedurally-generated, top-down bullet-hell shooter where the place space shrinks (and moves) after every wave. How long can you survive?

### Controls:
**↑↓←→:** Move

**Z:** Fire

**X + Arrow:** Dodge (uses stamina)

### Tips:
- Focus on survival over killing.
- Try sweeping back and forth over the bottom 1/5th of the space — it can help keep you alive longer.
- Remember to dodge!

**Post-jam tweaks:**
- Restored difficulty curve that had been disabled due to a last-minute bug fix
- Increased master volume (was too quiet, *thanks* headphones!)
- Added self-branded splash screen in place of logo
- [Esc] can now close at any time, not just on game over screen

![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 6.22.50 PM.png](///raw/b65/z/16c06.png)

![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 6.22.46 PM.png](///raw/b65/z/16bfb.png)

![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 2.06.49 PM.png](///raw/b65/z/17bfd.png)

![Screen Shot 2018-08-12 at 6.22.33 PM.png](///raw/b65/z/16bf9.png)

112441.name: The Space Bar
112441.body: This was a concept I thought of and only barely made a prototype of. Made in the 48 hours as a time challenge.

112446.name: Slaying Dragons with Infrastructure
112446.body:
Slaying Dragons with infrastructure is a fun, magical game where the player uses a grid of 5x5 tiles to power a rocket and slay a dragon.  A tutorial is present within the game.  Later tonight I will add a lot more to this description.  All I have time to say now is, this was a lot of fun and I'm proud of my creation (except there's no audio).

All the download links are the same link.  The game is untested on Windows, I presume it will work.  To run unzip the .zip file and open the .jar file.  If you get a notification telling you that your computer won't run it because it is by an unknown developer, try right clicking the .jar file and selecting open.  Hope it works!  Have fun!

112451.name: Suffocating Tower
112451.body:
Dungeon... with some space problem.

I had a lot of ideas and mechanics fleshed out but didn't have the time to make more levels. ^^'

112454.name: Failing Island
112454.body: You Take Control of an Island, that constantly sinks. You must manage your buildings and place them strategically so that they will increase your revenue.

112455.name: Crystalmancer
112455.body:
In **Crystalmancer** you are a wizard apprentice who specializes in crystalization spells.
To complete his training, he must delve into a dungeon and clear it from monsters that can only be defeated by magic. A single shot of his trusty Crystal Rod is enough to defeat any monster, but it must be used carefuly as you can get damaged by the crystal debris left behind. Might be a good idea to carry a hammer just in case your path gets blocked by the aftermatch.

**Controls**
* Arrow Keys - Move
* Z- Shoot
* Shift - Change weapon
* R - Restart the level
* Q - Palette Swap

Source coude included on itch.io.

112457.name: Petris
112457.body:
![Petris 1.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/16bd2.png)

![Petris 2.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/16bd4.png)

![Petris 3.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/16bd6.png)

![Petris 4.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/16bd8.png)

![Petris 5.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/16bdc.png)

![Petris 6.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/16bdf.png)

Petris is just like Tetris, only pet-themed! Manoeuvre the pieces (petriminos) to complete rows and earn points. You lose when the stack reaches the top of the screen.


Controls:

Left + Right arrows: move the current petrimino left or right

Up arrow: rotate the current petrimino by 90 degrees clockwise

Down arrow: 'soft drop' - speed up the descent of the current petrimino

Space key: 'hard drop' - drop the current petrimino instantly

G key: toggle the grid overlay on/off

C key: open/close the controls panel

Esc key: open/close the pause menu

112458.name: Getting Some Space
112458.body:
![Cover Image.png](///raw/a6b/81/z/16d8a.png)

Getting Some Space is a short work about feeling reassured by your insignificance. It's also my first LD submission!

For the bulk of the project, I used Unity (though it hardly fits the project), Photoshop and TV Paint.

Please give me all your criticism. Some really horrible, nasty stuff.


CONTROLS:     [SPACE]

112468.name: you have a fish bowl defend it
112468.body:
probably garbo, but it's something i guess??????

at least i managed to publish this time

here's to actually bothering to do all the things

c to shoot arrows to move!

also fenyxofshadows and magicalfeyfenny are the same person im just dont know how to remember passowrds

![Untitled.png](///raw/904/81/z/16c9c.png)
![adfg.png](///raw/904/81/z/16d82.png)

112470.name: That One Improv Game
112470.body:
This is a recreation of one of my favorite improv games, mostly done out of curiosity if it would work in an online game format.

Note: the multiplayer may be wonky, if something unexpected happens (like you get kicked for a room or appear to be in a weird state) just refresh the browser and try again.

I made all my own assets but I'm not really interested in ratings so I opted out, I did this just for fun and curiosity and to exercise my online multiplayer chops.

Bugfixing: Fixed an issue where host could control client's boost. Still an issue where occasionally host takes over client's movement.

Made with Construct 2
Sound fx with sfxr
Music made with Otomota Generative Music Sequencer![screenshot.gif](///raw/c78/z/16b59.gif)

112481.name: HELP: The Illuminati captured my family and are forcing me to make this game
112481.body:
Help the brave, honorable, amazing, cool and handsome Illuminati save the earth from overpopulation! Love the Illuminati, they are just great, what friendly people, save me, they make great coffee, too.

The text is a bit smaller than I had hoped for, please try fullscreen mode if you have problems reading it. Other than that, thanks for playing!

112482.name: RoboCoup
112482.body:
It's the robot revolution and they want to exterminate all the humans on Earth because of surpopulation and legal measures taken against the robots related to it. You are one of these robot agents. Goal of the game: identify all the humans in the building and kill them.

*Note: the game is quite violent but I wanted to experiment, in an artistic way, this dark vision of human progress, and what oppression and division into groups can lead into. And, huh, also surpopulation is not sci-fi, that's a real problem. If not out of space, we'll run out of resources.*

The game is supposed to be played only once. There are many ways to play it, but if you play too fast you will probably lose.

Commands:

 - WASD or arrows to move horizontally, and vertically in the elevator
 - T to talk
 - K to kill
 - SPACE in dialogues and 1-2-3 when there are options.

![screenshot1.png](///raw/c17/8/z/16c5b.png)

![screenshot2.png](///raw/c17/8/z/16c5e.png)

112487.name: Spirits of Semb
112487.body:
Battle through the Dungeons of Semb. Collect spirits and combine them in ever increasing quantities to grow your power. How deep can you go?

Mini-Post Mortem:

Lack of polish. This design might have been doable in a engine and language I was more familiar with, but things turned out a little tight come submission hour.
 * Missing Overworld art.
 * No attack animations.
 * Music missing, but sounds basically filled out.

Rust doesn't help you against unsafe APIs. Specs and ggez lead to lots of runtime errors, if you're not careful. Aaand, when you're coding at the speed of Ludum-Dare, you're not being careful. Oh well.

112490.name: Space Cadet
112490.body:
![scr1.png](///raw/36e/1/z/16c6e.png)

==== SPACE CADET ====

A game by bobismijnnaam for Ludum Dare 42, about a protagonist losing himself in the genre of idle games, spiraling out of control in no time.

![scr4.png](///raw/36e/1/z/16c9a.png)

==== Controls ====

Mouse to look around, wasd to walk around, F to interact. Don't forget the front door!

The game contains sounds but some might be a bit harsh. Don't leave your speakers on 100%!

![scr3.png](///raw/36e/1/z/16c9f.png)

==== Files ====

The zip contains linux, windows, macos, and webgl builds. Pick the one you need! Macosx build is untested.

==== Tools ====

Unity (FPS Character, postprocessing)

Gimp

Bfxr

Audacity

==== About the author ====

bobismijnnaam on ludum dare

http://plusminos.nl

bobrubbens [at] gmail [dot] com

@bobismijnfaam

112495.name: Mike's Pizza Shop
112495.body:
In this game you make pizza.

On the right there are ingredients. 

To mix items, or to put items in pots and bowls, drag them ontop of one another. Note that you can't drag items ontop of the ingredients on the left.

Put tomatoes, pepper and flour into a pot to make tomato sauce which you then cook on the stove on the left. Put flour, water and yeast into a bowl to make dough which you then rise on the left right above the stove. Put the tomato sauce and dough together to make a sauce-only pizza. Then add cheese to make pizza and then put it in the oven. Finally sell the pizza by dragging it into the area on the top of the screen.

The bar on the top of an item says how well cooked it is. The bar on the bottom says how good the item is. The more well cooked items are upon mixing the better the resultant item is. Also, for tomato sauce and dough a green checkmark will indicate that it has all the ingredients. The better the pizza the more money you make.

You may also throw out items in the red zone.

112498.name: Warehouse Rush!
112498.body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iodCrnmCsrM
A game about moving boxes around a warehouse.
Keep your warehouse organized while boxes are being delivered and sent out.
![title.png](///raw/5a5/2/z/16b48.png)

112499.name: Eterneroids
112499.body:
My first Ludum Dare! Really my first completed game altogether. 
Wasn't able to add sound or much polish but it works more or less.
Basically a bullet hell shmup asteroids-like with a minor twist: enemy bullets and wreckage gradually fill up the space! How long can you go?
!![Eterneroids_screenshot1.png](///raw/b67/b1/z/16e3e.png)

112503.name: Everyone Chess
112503.body:
*Chess + Battle Royale (kind of)*

Welcome to **Everyone Chess**, a game of chess for everyone. I don't have many pieces so you'll have to play with just one for now. Also I don't have many chess boards so you'll have to share the same chess board as everyone else. It can get a little cramped, we're kind of *running out of space*, sorry!

## How to play:
- Click a square to move
- Take as many chess pieces as you can
- When you die you respawn so that's fine
- There are AI enemy chess pieces, as well as real humans playing at the same time. And one board for all of you.

How to distinguish AI players for human players? Well... the humans are probably a lot better. You might need to message a friend and get them to play at the same time to actually see that happen though.

**NOTE:** I'm having some issues deploying my server for this, so please stay tuned for that to happen first!

112504.name: Rising Tide
112504.body:
![Screenshot.PNG](///raw/4f5/z/16e50.png)
Take charge of a small Island just as sea levels start to rise in earnest. It is a race against time to complete researching a solution to the rising tides as you build up an industrial base to support your research knowing that each factory you build is only increasing the rate that the seas rise. House your people knowing that the areas that they live will soon be underwater. 

Use WASD to move the camera and find more building sides on the island. Click on areas to build a building, but watch out, the higher up the island you build the higher the land prices will be. Complete 100 units of research to win. 

Game made in 48 hours (Really quite a lot less, I put in almost no time on Saturday) using only Unity and MS Paint. I added sounds that I got from FreeSound.org at the last minute to make the game less silent, but did not make them myself.

I had a lot of fun with this project, my 5th completed Ludum Dare game. Any constructive feedback or questions are appreciated, and I will try and get back to comments as soon as possible.

112508.name: Prototype Shooter
112508.body:
This has been a rough LD for me. Missing the last one, and being able to participate in this one at the last second caused me to not be ready. BUT! I'm here to bring you games not excuses. So presenting... uh... I never named this game. :(

This game is a prototype shooter that I've wanted to make, and this theme seemed to fit it well. You control the player on the left vs enemies who appear on the right. The goal is to shoot and kill all opponents, that get progressively harder as you play. 

Things I wanted to add
Music/Sound effects
Pickups/Powerups
Items that revert the tiles back to moveable.
More enemies
Better AI
Better Artwork

112513.name: Outta Space
112513.body:
Get it?

"Outta" like "out of" space

but also "outer" like "outer space"

Get it now?

Like with a Boston or UK accent where you add/remove extra "r"s.

If you don't have that just imagine saying it with one.

Just trust me.

It works.

Also the game is about running out of space or something.

112515.name: Ice Interstice
112515.body:
![ld_banner.png](///raw/2e2/1/z/16caa.png)
## Description

You are a penguin who fell down into a cave. But you have ice powers to fill the cave floor and help you get back up.
A puzzle game about filling all the tiles you can walk on.

Thanks for playing!![penguinspin.gif](///raw/2e2/1/z/16e8e.gif)


## Controls

- **[Arrow Keys]** to Move!
- **[R]** to Reset Level
- Press against an ice block to use your ice breath. Only one can be on the screen at a time.


## Tools

- Art: **Gimp**
- Library: **HaxeFlixel**
- IDE: **Flash Develop**
- Music/Sound: **OpenMPT**
- Level Editor: **Tiled**

112517.name: Wherehouse
112517.body:
Even warehouses have to deal with limited space...

Memorise the order of the sorting bays, and then lob parcels into their colour-coded areas! But throw with caution; if you fill up the lower levels to quickly, your packages will smash into each other. Some of those are fragile, you know!

Play it in-browser, or download it from itch.io~!

112523.name: Little Rocket
112523.body:
Save the little rocket as the world gets bigger and bigger, asteroids become more deadly, and you get sucked towards deadly black holes! Or challenge your friends to see who can survive the longest. There is also a three player mode, fight for keyboard space as you swerve out of the way of danger!
![Capture.PNG](///raw/977/b1/z/16cad.png)![LittleRocket.PNG](///raw/977/b1/z/16d30.png)![Controls.PNG](///raw/977/b1/z/16cb5.png)

112524.name: An Ode to Space
112524.body:
Collect eggs until you run out of space. Jump carefully.

Every time you press Space, you slowly run out of space. Press Backspace to rewind and gain some space.

Controls:
Move: WD to move
Spacebar: Fly
Backspace: Rewind

<3
Thank you for playing,
@aumniez

112527.name: Cash Grab
112527.body:
Cash Grab is a simple game. All you do is move around collecting gold coins and gold bar, all the while avoiding the moving walls slowing creeping to your impending doom! 

The in-game instructions, all 2 pages of it, will let you know how to play.

Have a nice day!

112528.name: PhoneBreaker
112528.body:
You are a kid who has a curse, every time you touch a phone it has a great GREAT ease to break in your hands​.

Everyone hates you because you broke their phones and  even though it was unintentional they want revenge.

Don't let your phone RUN OUT OF SPACE :).

![Captura2_edited.jpg](///raw/c32/21/z/16ea4.jpg)

112529.name: Shrink Bots
112529.body: The world is constantly shrinking, and you have to throw bombs, launch missiles, shatter glass bottles full of lava, and detonate nukes in order to keep the map from crushing you. Build machines to produce items and gold, and protect them from the border, your bombs, and missiles from enemy bots that parachute down from the sky. Destroy the borders to increase the size of the world, giving you more space to build and move and unlocking new items for purchase in the shop, but leaving more area to destroy for the next advancement of the world size. Try to beat your highscore in easy, medium, and hard modes.![Shrinkbot 8_12_2018 9_00_51 PM.png](///raw/6ac/z/17117.png)![Shrinkbot 8_12_2018 9_13_12 PM.png](///raw/6ac/z/17120.png)

112532.name: Decal Royale
112532.body:
![titleScreen.PNG](///raw/ab7/1/z/1711d.png)

Put stickers on everything and get points! Don't run out of space! 

WASD or Arrow Keys to move.

SPACE to place a sticker. 



Sticker tips:
* Bigger stickers are worth more points. 
* Combine certain stickers to create special combos and multiply your score!
* Stickers are worth fewer points if they go off the edge.

112534.name: The Space Station Is Running Out Of Space By Crashing Onto The Planet Below
112534.body:
The Space Station has had an accident and is running out of space into the planet below!  
Escape before you die a certain death!

![2018-08-13-001545_1523x670_scrot.png](///raw/73f/2/z/16b01.png)
![2018-08-12-233522_990x744_scrot.png](///raw/73f/2/z/16b05.png)

112536.name: Neighbour Nullification
112536.body:
A 2 player PVP game about killing your neighbour by ordering useless junk to his home, until he runs out of space and can't take care of his basic needs anymore. 

Controls: Player 1 WASD + Space for interaction, Player 2 Arrow keys + right ctrl for interaction. To use the facilities in house walk in the range of an object and press the interact button. You can lift up shit, use the toilet, fridge, tap, bed to reset your basic needs. 

Unique Features: Fully destructible environment, Realistic Physics based gameplay, SID inspired music, BEARS, no controllers needed, one keyboard 2 players! ![2.png](///raw/c47/b1/z/16ad2.png)

Mechanics: 

1. Use facilities in your house (or neighbours) to take care of basic needs. If some need is not getting taken care of properly, you die and lose the game. 
2. Order shit to your neighbours house through order shit box, to fill his house with shit. 
3. Throw shit in the mixed waste trash to contribute to global warming. 
3. Don't walk on the road, or bears will attack.

112544.name: Starsailer
112544.body:
## About

Starsailer is a sidescrolling shooter where the screen is slowly enveloped by a black hole, forcing you to maneuver in a smaller area as the game continues. 

Once you collect enough crystals from the current area (obtained by shooting obstacles, like asteroids and other ships), you'll be taken to the next area. Obstacles move faster in every consecutive area.

## Controls
**Arrow Keys**: Move  
**Z**: Shoot  
**Enter/Return**: Start Game

112553.body:
![logod.png](///raw/32e/2/z/16d2a.png)
Fight to keep your gems before the bridge dissolves!  
![attacking.png](///raw/32e/2/z/16d33.png)

Can you beat it?

112558.name: Hoarders
112558.body:
Hoarders is a local multiplayer game, pitting a hoarder against a cleaner. The cleaner must empty the house of trash, while the hoarder and his fellow critters try to fill it up. I wrote it in PICO-8, and it is my first game ever. I thought I had 72 hours, so I didn't really get to polish it, but I am pretty happy with the result.

Cleaner: directional keys, X to clean
Hoarder: S/E/D/F for directions, W to clean (to make a path), Q to create trash

112562.name: Samurai Delve
112562.body:
You are a Samurai. You must (do Samurai things). The theme was supposed to be a bigger element, but I ran out of time! Still: play 4 levels, with two separate bosses. Level up! Use skills! Marvel at the animations.

Arrow keys move. Move into enemies/triggers to trigger them. Click skills to activate. Space waits (but might also accidentally click the quit button if it's highlighted).

Changelog (13.8.2019)
- Fixed some level transitions not working!
- Fixed some buggy skills, and made the Knight's personal skill actually work
- Fixed some balancing issues with certain enemies (still a cakewalk)
- Fixed the ending scene (it was bugged, yo)
- Made the enemy turns snappier (oh my god what a slog)

The itch.io link allows for both play in browser & download to Windows.
![mainmenu.JPG](///raw/a40/a1/z/17060.jpg)


![level1.JPG](///raw/a40/a1/z/176d1.jpg)

112571.name: Too Many Boxes
112571.body:
In Too Many Boxes, you play as a lone warehouse worker who is receiving more boxes than he can handle.  Stack the boxes as quickly as you can before you get overwhelmed!  

You can place boxes carefully:
![TooManyBoxes1.gif](///raw/8f4/8/z/16e0d.gif)

Or throw caution to the wind!
![TooManyBoxes2.gif](///raw/8f4/8/z/16eb3.gif)


Careful not to stack too high or on top of fragile objects!

112574.name: Delivery!
112574.body:
![DeliveryCover.png](///raw/253/9/z/16efb.png)

### Non-stop BLAMazon boxes keep being delivered to your house, and you need a place to keep them. Unfortunately, you still need to eat, sleep, use the bathroom, and wash your clothes, be careful not to block yourself in! 

Balance gathering all the boxes into your house and basic living on a tight schedule! 

Post your best score in the comments!

## How to play:
In the top left of the screen displays the current objective you need to complete.

### Deliveries
When you get deliveries, you must bring all the boxes into your house within the time limit.

### Other Objectives
With other objectives, you have a much tighter schedule, and must navigate to the correct object (food, sleep, toilet, washing machines) and click on them to complete the objective. 
There is also a helpful little marker visible through walls to see where the current objective is located.

## Controls:
WASD - Movement
Mouse - Look
Left click - Interact (open doors, eat food, etc)
Hold Left click - Pick up a box
Right click - Throw the box you are holding

112594.name: Action Replay
112594.body:
![lv9.gif](///raw/cc7/b1/z/181ff.gif)

This game is a set of 2d platforming challenges that quickly increase in difficulty, with a huge twist...

Your efforts will be recorded as replays, but our server space is precious and we have many test subjects. We can only store the best results - inefficient runs will be terminated immediately. Don't let us down!

# Instructions 

As you play, the game is dynamically generating a replay for your inputs. The more complex your inputs are, the more space they will take out, and the quicker you will run out.

Each level has a byte quota that your inputs should fall under to succeed. You will need to collect keys to complete some levels. Note that the byte quota is not optimal on most of the levels - you can easily find solutions that use less space. Use the leaderboards to compare your scores to others.

Each button press AND release costs *2 bytes* (time since last press, buttons pressed/released).
Each missile fire costs *6 bytes* (fire command, position (x,y) as short)

Holding both directions will cause you to slide frictionlessly. This is very useful if you don't want to release a key, which would cost 2 bytes.

# FAQ
## My browser does not seem to support this game?
This game is written in ES6. Most modern browsers should support it, but if you haven't updated you may run into issues.

## Why am I playing as a fox?
The main character is a fox so I can break the cycle of every player sprite being a robot in literally all of my Ludum Dare Entries. This game could have been Low Battery 4.

## Where do the missiles come from?
??????????????

## Level X seems impossible
The limitations of the game mean you need to think about platformers a bit differently. Jumping at the right time during the player's acceleration, for instance, is useful for getting low times on many of the courses.

A few courses are designed with momentum in mind, which can help you save presses and releases. Instead of moving directionally, try holding both directions to slide around. You can tell when you're doing this if you emit sparkles.

Also, try not releasing keys after pressing them. This is useful if you know you aren't going to jump again in the level - simply hold the key all the way to the finish. (you only jump on the initial press)

112606.name: Office Builder
112606.body:
# Office Builder

Welcome to Office Builder! In this game you will take your corporative minions and finish jobs at the given time.

Each employee you hire (by placing a Work Spot) will work without complaints if all needs are met.

Take this in consideration! The employees won't put up with uncormftable conditions! Eventually, they'll get angry and quit!

If you reach the given amount of progress before the time runs out, it's paytime! you will be able to afford more employees and grow in this limited building... Try to handle things as best as possible! Job requirements will grow bigger the more jobs you do!

### Good Luck!

*PS: The author knows that if 1 women can deliver a baby in 9 months, 9 women can't deliver a baby in 1 month... But for the sake of fun, this isn't true for these employees!*

112637.name: WizarDwarf
112637.body:
Push the rocks against the runes to make them explode. Try not to finish burried in that cave !

That game was made for 42th edition of the Ludum Dare. We were two people working on the project, and we used Unity3D (personnal license) to make it. We used Krita for graphics art.

Graphic arts and code were made from scratch, this is not the case for the sounds,  musics and fonts :

Fonts :     PixelSix by Cal Henderson (on dafont.com for scoring and Game Over)
Sounds :     Tamagotchi on GameBoy, Kaptn Blaubar Die Verruckte Schatzsuche on GameBoy Color, Falling Rock by Spookymodem (OpenGameArt.org)
Game Intro :     Green & Gray by Pugly (OpenGameArt.org).

Cause we're not professional in procedurally generated level design, you may be stuck sometimes. So be carefull, anticipate, and click "retry" if you are !!
