112653.name: Space Plots
112653.body:
![SpacePlots_720p.jpg](///raw/14a/5/z/16ecf.jpg)

My take on the LD42 theme (Running Out of Space) is:
- Plots spawn in a tray and move towards the right
- You can drag them into the playing area to place them (Left mouse button) or immediately summon the last one in the tray to your cursor (Right mouse button)
- If they reach the end of the tray without being placed, something bad happens
- The playing area is of limited size, and plots placed down destroy any existing ones in their way
- You score points at some interval for all active plots
- Placed plots age/grow over time, becoming worth more points per scoring interval (this didn't get implemented...)

112659.name: Easter Shabobble
112659.body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rrmn6GcSaos

# :rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit:
## Description and controls
Easter Shabobble is a short little game about collecting easter eggs. Download the desktop version for better graphics and overall better performance.

Use WASD to move, 'e' to pick up items, 'q' to drop items, press 'p' to pause the game or return to the menu, and press the spacebar to jump.

Sometimes you get stuck on moving platforms which can cause a soft lock. I'm too tired to fix it right now.

![giphy-2.gif](///raw/cb5/z/178db.gif)

# :rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit:
## Inspiration and theme
I chose to express the theme "space is running out" by giving the player a shrinking inventory and also limit the amount of times the player can press the spacebar. The Easter theme was an impulsive choice.


# :rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit:
## Challenges and experience
This Ludum Dare went fairly well, especially compared to my struggle during LD41. I lost a solid four hours due to a rather slow process of making a backup of all locally saved files. I also started a bit late due to living in Europe. However, for the first time in a while, I really like my LD submission.


# :rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit:
## Known glitches and bugs
If you have any clue what may cause the bugs with a bounty on them, please leave a comment:
-the player sometimes gets stuck on moving platforms (not fixed yet) (bounty: 5 eggs)
-sounds act weird when game is paused (not fixed yet)
-the 'fastest' option on desktop versions doesn't work and needs to be removed  (bounty: 2 eggs)
-some trampolines don't get you where you need to go when you lose too much speed (not fixed yet)

# :rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit:
## bug fixes and patch note
-Web version was broken so I rebuild and reuploaded it.
-Placed an extra trampoline in level 5 (web version only for now)

# :rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit::rabbit:

112699.name: Der Raum
112699.body:
After a nontrivial amount of home IT support for myself, my son and his friend (both of which are also participating in LD42 and have Compo submissions in!), I'm finally able to get my uploads worked out. Fixed a few bugs along the way, hope no one minds. All substantive work was completed by the deadline, I swear. :)

![DerRaumGamePlayGIF-reduced.gif](///raw/660/b/z/17458.gif)

Der Raum is strongly inspired by an arcade game from my youth, the name of which I'm not going to reveal just yet to see if anyone recognizes it. I spent many, many quarters on the game as a teenager. 

The gist of it is you're trapped in an ever-shrinking room and need to get out... and you will, only to find out you're stuck in another room, over and over again, and it's only getting more and more crowded each time.

I have more enemy types partially complete but not playable in the game. The game should be a progression of enemy types, each with their own behaviors. But, since I don't have them all ready, I've opted to let you play one room over and over again, with sliiightly increasing difficulty every runthrough. It does get quite challenging, and eventually, of course, you WILL fail.

**CONTROLS:**

As follows, but note:

**A DUAL-STICK CONTROLLER IS REQUIRED!** (keep reading)

- **Left stick:** *player movement*
- **Right stick:** *shooting*
- **Start / A:** *start the game from the title screen*
- **M on keyboard:** *toggles audio muting on/off*

** ~~BUG~~ engine/browser issue: If you don't have music right away at the title screen, press M TWICE to toggle the audio off and back on again. Should fix it. I'll fix the code later! Sorry!**

While the arrow keys on the keyboard still work for player movement, this game is controller-based. It's a twin-stick shooter, basically, in my incarnation... although I have limited the firing to eight directions as a hat tip in the general direction of the yet-to-be-revealed arcade original. 

And for those of you that don't have controllers, I am truly sorry. I'm OK with it being a controller-only game. It was developed and tested with a newer bluetooth-capable Xbox One controller, both via BT and via USB cable. I suspect any reasonably-modern dual-joystick controller would work (old PS2/PS3 controllers, 360 controllers, random Logitechs, etc). If any of you try other joysticks with success, I'd love it if you'd let me know. :)

I created some music using Auxy on my iPad this time. I'm not a musician, and I'm not a composer. It's not exactly the music I had in my head when I was making the game, but I figure something is better than nothing. I'm also not all that wild about most of the sound effects in the game... but again, solo compo participant, limited time, and it's still better to have something than nothing. 

I both love and hate that audio can really make or break a game's feel. Hopefully it'll grow on you. I think I'm missing a few sounds here and there, but nothing crazy-important. And again, the M key on the keyboard is there if you hate it all or just wanna quietly play. ;)

I spent a lot more time on art this time, which I'm pretty happy with, though most of it like the majority of the mechanics work, you won't get to see--yet, anyway, I hope.

**TOOLS:**

Game was made with Construct 2:
https://www.scirra.com/construct2

Audio was created using Auxy on iPad, bxfr, and ChipTone.
 
Auxy:
http://auxy.co/

bfxr:
https://www.bfxr.net/

ChipTone:
http://sfbgames.com/chiptone/

Images created in PyxelEdit, with some light MS Paint usage:
https://pyxeledit.com/

Progression tables done via Google Sheets.

Google Home streamed "Code Radio - 24/7 concentration music for programmers" from freeCodeCamp.org via YouTube:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PQ22pgaXog4

WinSCP used to upload HTML5 code and the various game builds to my website:
https://winscp.net/eng/index.php

If you find any breaking bugs or other annoyances, or even \*gasp\* an Easter egg or two (maybe?)... please let me know. I'd also love ANY other feedback you can offer. 

Those that leave a well-intended comment, I'll definitely rate you back! 

And since my son and his friend were here all weekend making their games, why not reward them with a rating? I'm sure they'd appreciate it, and I'd like to think they'd also rate you back. :)

My son's game, TENORMS: 
https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/tenorms

His friend's game, FaceGuy:
https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/faceguy

Thanks for reading this, have a great LD!

-A

112778.name: Body Hiding Simulator 1995
112778.body:
![Dead Bodies 3.gif](///raw/588/b1/z/177e4.gif)

You play as a happy housewife. Not happy because of your house, but happy because you are secretly a murderer behind your husbands back.

![Screenshot 2.png](///raw/588/b1/z/177d6.png)

Your goal is to kill as many people as possible, and hide their bodies around your house. The more people you murder, the less space to hide their floppy corpses. If your husband comes home and finds a dead body, the Jig is up! Enjoy a silly game, with a ridiculous mechanic, but absolutely quality voice acting. Seriously, the budget for this game went 90% towards hiring a professional voice actor.

![Screenshot 1.png](///raw/588/b1/z/177d3.png)

Controls:
- W,A,S,D to Move
- Space to Jump
- left Ctrl to crouch
- Mouse to look around
- E to pickup items and interact with people to let them into your house
- LMB to throw carried items
- Esc to pause

Hints:
- The Husband only recognises the head of a dead body, so make sure that part is hidden
- You can kill someone by throwing anything at them, or stabbing them with a knife
- If someone gets stuck, just push them around a little bit

112980.name: Over-encumbered
112980.body:
You are a sentient backpack, managing inventory for your hapless adventurer owner.

### How to play:
- The bars on the left represent the sum total of health (red), mana (blue), and stamina (green) contained in all the present items
- The hero will automatically consume items as needed
- The hero will pick up new items from chests
- The hero will fight monsters
- 3 mana lets the hero use a spell, which KO's a monster without taking damage
- Lacking a spell, the hero and monster will take turns hitting each other
- Stamina allows the hero to use a stronger melee attack than normal, but a stamina point is lost each time
- If health runs out, it's game over

- Drag mushrooms onto each other to craft potions
- Drag junk outside of the bag to throw it away
- Gold coins add to your final score, but take up space for restorative items
- Items from chests opened while inventory is full will get thrown away (running out of space!)

### See how far you can get!

----------------------------------------------------

113067.name: Blooming Heights
113067.body:
Blooming Heights is a game where you play as gardener on a floating island. A pretty careless gardener at that. The island itself is held toghether by a special crystal plant. However the plant dies one day, and being unprepared, you spend almost all of your money to buy a new sprout. It will take some time to regrow and island itself slowly starts to collapse.

![3.png](///raw/d35/61/z/179ed.png)

Your task is to grow plants and sell them for profit while island around you collapses. Less space means less plants, less plants means less profit. In order to win you need to survive until the crystal plant grows fully. You can't fall off the island and you can't allow your house or crystal plant to collapse. Plants will yeld you shards, which can be used to purchase more seeds, as well as island repair kits (You can use those to bring back 1 tile). Be careful what you plant though. Some plants will affect your islands integrity which determines how often landfalls occur.

![2.png](///raw/d35/61/z/179eb.png)

You will be required to manage space for plants as well as your money, so you can buy island repair kits and repair the damage. If the tile with plant gets removed, the plant is also gone. However tiles will only collapse if they are on the border of the island (Red grass colour). You can protect your house and plants by building around them. You lose if landfall occurs while either your house or your crystal plant is on the border or your character is standing on a tile that is about collapse. I recommend playing on easy difficulity first so you can get familliar with the plants and then move to normal or maybe even hard.

![1.png](///raw/d35/61/z/179e2.png)

113130.name: Prime Planets
113130.body:
PRIME PLANETS is a maths/number puzzle game you play against the computer. *Try not to run out of space!*

![MAINsshot3.png](///raw/82a/2/z/1804c.png)

How to play (sorry, no time to add in-game instructions)
===========
There are 15 rounds. In each round, the player has a turn, then the PC.
Each time, 3 random numbers are chosen.
Your aim is to use these 3 numbers, together with the 4 mathematical operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide) to claim an unoccupied tile on the board. You **must** use all 3 numbers. 
*Click* on the numbers, and the operators, to cycle through them, before hitting 'Submit'.

Hitting 'ESC' will quit the game.

Scoring
=======
You score the number on the tile you claim. So, aim high (the CPU will!).
PRIME numbers are occupied by planets - these all score **50 points**.
The winner has the most points after 15 rounds.

Extra tip: BIDMAS
=================
You may remember from your maths class that operations follow BIDMAS rules, ie division and multiplication are performed *before* addition and subtraction (regardless of order). Brackets take overall priority, and you can use the brackets button if you wish. The CPU currently doesn't attempt to use brackets for it's answers.

Note
====
THANK YOU for playing!  I really enjoyed making this one, and will do a blog/post-mortem asap. The CPU AI was a right pain to code, the rest was fairly straightforward. I usually enter the Compo, but circumstances meant I coded on Sunday/Monday, so entered into the Jam. It did make it a bit easier getting sfx and graphics.

Disclaimer: yes, I'm a maths + computing teacher! :smile:

113134.name: Keeper of Balance
113134.body:
![title.png](///content/1db/4/z/179ca.png)
![Gameplay2-red.gif](///content/1db/4/z/17ae4.gif)

Play at Itch.io: https://cosmicadventuresquad.itch.io/keeper-of-balance

#### ⚖️🌎✨ Summary

You are the keeper of balance. The planet is running out of space due to over population! Balance must be maintained. Defeat the 3 heroes holding the 3 eternity emeralds to unlock the power to “keep the balance”. 

* The game ends when you die, the population reaches zero, or the planet is overpopulated
* Destroy cities to reduce the population growth
* Defeat the heroes and take their eternity emeralds to gain new abilities
* Using the ultimate power heals you to full health and respawns the heroes
* See how long can you keep the balance!

#### :video_game: Controls

Keyboard and Mouse:
- WASD - movement
- 1 - Yellow Gem Power (Slow Time)
- 2 - Blue Gem Power (Dash Attack)
- 3 - Red Gem Power (Projectile Spread)
- Space - Ultimate power

#### :bulb: Credits

- Vu Ha - Code :computer:
- Rose Peng - Art :paintbrush:
- Johan Soriao - Music :musical_keyboard:

113136.name: Claustrophobia
113136.body:
Claustrophobia is a 2D shooter where the walls are closing in on you. To stay alive you must shoot the enemies that are coming towards you. Every time you kill an enemy the walls move back a bit. Kill 25 enemies and the walls will reset and all currently spawned enemies will despawn. As the game goes on the enemies will move and spawn faster and the walls will move faster. Try to stay alive as long as you can!

Controls:
- To move left and right use the arrow keys
- To shoot press z

To run the game click the link, then download and run the .jar file.

This game was made from scratch in Java using Libgdx

113145.name: Bunker Down
113145.body:
![banner.png](///raw/7f9/b1/z/17fde.png)

Through the window of your bunker you stare into the wasteland beyond yearning for the day you might return. Someone appears, looking into their eyes you see desperation, tiredness and despair. Will you let them join you inside or will you leave them outside to die.

In Bunker Down you need to speak to people on the outside of you bunker and decide if you will let the join you in safety. You only have a limited amount of space so you can't save everyone.

![screen1.png](///raw/7f9/b1/z/17fcc.png)

113159.name: nokill
113159.body:
![2.gif](///raw/817/z/1742d.gif)

No-Kill
Ludum Dare 42 - Running out of Space
You work at a No-Kill dog shelter and must keep your dogs happy so that families will adopt them. New dogs are constantly arriving, so make sure you don't run out of space! Refill your food supply at buckets located around the facility.

We made this game to celebrate our beloved pets, and to encourage everyone to enrich their lives by rescuing a loving animal from a local shelter. You can make a huge impact simply by finding your new furry best friend!

Controls:
 Movement
  WASD
  IJKL
  ←↑↓→
 Action
  Space
  Shift
  Enter
 Quit
  Esc

Windows Users: You may get a warning about the .exe, you can hit More Info and Run Anyway to play.

Team: Caleb, Chris, Danny, Devin, Erin

![1.gif](///raw/817/z/1742c.gif)

113160.name: Space is Limited.
113160.body:
![56385485fc33253c177e860ef4e73ddc.png](///raw/8ef/11/z/18152.png)

# Gameplay

Space is Limited is a isometric game where the floor falls from beneath you.

You can collect tiles and place them down to give yourself platforms to jump on but be careful to not stand still!

Try to get as high a score as you can!


# Controls

**W=** Move away from the camera

**S=** Move towards the camera

**A=** Move left

**D=** Move right

**Space=** Jump

**Left mouse button=** Place tile


# Notes

I made this game pretty last minute because I did not realize LD started already so it might seem kind of 
unpolished but I think it turned out great and I love it.
This is also the reason there is no audio in the game.

This was my first Ludum Dare and I hope I did okay!

# Download

113174.body:
A hidden object game where you have to find some ingredients for a potion. A werewolf is also there.
Most assets were made by me during the jam period, but due to the many creative commons photograph for the hidden object part, I opted out of judging on graphics.

113197.name: Save the World?
113197.body:
In 2042, mankind reached its maximum. No more water, food, resources..
Scientists have developed device "HEPPYREPRESSOR5000" for resolving the situation. 
You are the operator of this device!

113205.name: Iceberg Fall
113205.body:

Stay on the iceberg for as long as you can.  Be careful the iceberg breaks up and someone is throwing snowballs at you.

wasd for movement and spacebar to jump.

Enter key for quick restart

Tools I used are Unity, Blender, Visual Studio, Inkscape, Rytmik Ultimate

113213.name: Snek
113213.body:
### Overview

A technical challenge to make a clone of a game about a danger noodle with an insatiable hunger.

1. The protagonist of our game is running out of space in it's crazed quest to eat more blocks.
2. Lines of code capped at 100, columns capped at 132, and the code should still be (kinda) readable. So I'll be running out of space at each step.

### Controls
`left` turn anticlockwise

`right` turn clockwise

### Rules
`green` bigger

`red` dead

### Source
:snake: Full source available via view source in browser or link below.

113218.name: Dog Science
113218.body:
![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 1.51.23 AM.png](///raw/14a/b1/z/174b2.png)

You're a dog who's gone off to college to become a Dog Scientist. In order to get your PhD, you'll need to cram your brain full of mathscience, however, don't forget how to live!

Use A and S to move blocks left and right, D to move blocks down, and W to rotate blocks.

This game is like tetris, but don't clear too many rows or overfill your columns.

Best played on the latest version of Chrome.

113243.name: Spaceness
113243.body:
Earth’s atmosphere is increasingly saturated by space junk, so now it is very difficult to launch satellites successfully. Help SpoceX guiding their new rocket into outer space.

A little 2.5D runner against space rubbish.

113249.body:
Space Shooter in Space but with less and less Space.


![oIbduOv.jpg](///raw/621/z/174fe.jpg)


Hi,

we are a german team of 5 members. We made a Space Shooter.  
Try to get the highest score before you run out of space.

Have fun!

## Controls

- Aim with Mouse
- Shoot with Space or Left-Click

​In this game you are a rocketship, which is located somewhere in space, and has to find its way back to Earth. Meanwhile you also have to avoid the obscales such as other planets, satellites and asteriods.

113270.name: Space Ninja
113270.body:
Swing through gravitational pulls of stars and planets in this tricky action game!

## Story
You belong to the Space Ninja - a race of intergalactic warriors renowned across the universe for
their incredible power – However, despite their peerless might, their innate susceptibility to
sunlight has held them back for millennia.

As the sun continues to grow, most of space has become far too deadly for you to stay, so you
board your spaceship, the Shuriken, and begin a journey to find a new home.

You are, but a ninja breaking through gravitational pulls, and running out of space.


## Controls
| Key             | Function            |
|-----------------|---------------------|
| WASD/Arrow Keys | Engage Rocket Boost |


## Screenshots
|Title Screen|Boosting through solar system|Rest-stop to the new home|

## Credits

Made using the [LÖVE Framework](https://love2d.org/).

113273.name: Escape
113273.body: My First Ludum Dare Entry!!! First I decided to make a large game but after 2 days of work my Unity crashed deleting everything. So with 12 hours left I made this. I am still a child and a young programmer so please post some comments so I can improve. Thanks!!!

113287.name: ROBO Brick Factory
113287.body:
A fully automated nuclear powered brick factory AI has gone bananas.

You, the last remaining laser-equipped maintenance robot, are destined to finally freeze the means of production and go explore the beautiful surface land to the full extent of your battery life.
One day you will find these tiny cogs inside your chest, totally absent in the manual, that make you shudder with each tick and tock, bringing desires so invideogamey

But first, you need to climb out of the hole. Right above your head is the light.

**Controls:**

**WASD**

**Space - jump**

**Shift - run**

**LMB - laser**

**RMB - build**

**E - grappling hook / interact**

113303.body:
For LD42 I've made small game about all difficulties windows user encounters. Annoing messages, crappy design and Worst of all: Running out of Disk space. You can say: "Dude I've seen dozens games like this", NO you haven't, only in this game you can kill yourself becouse your hamster died. Also I've added references to other LD games and if you've send me title of your game, you should see it. Have fun and try to NOT RAN OUT OF SPACE!  

Also I'll add LD winners into game and upload new version with them!

113305.name: Colony Builder
113305.body:
## Gameplay
Colony Builder is a strategy game where your objective is to colonise a planet. Your resources: metal, food, water and oxygen must not fall below zero or you lose. Build units on tiles to generate resources, each unit has its own unique resource upkeep cost. Get 100% development to gain more map space. As the game progresses corruption will spawn and start to take over the map.

## Controls
### Menu:
* Up and Down arrows - To change selected option
* Enter - To select the option

### Game:
* To place a unit on a tile click to select the tile and then click a unit
* To claim more area click the plus on the rectangle when it appears

## Screenshots:
![title-screen.png](///raw/a0d/z/175c1.png)

**A brand new kind of malware is born.**

Almost every single asset was recreated from scratch except:

- Wallpapers

113331.name: Reaper Boy LD42
113331.body:
Pixel Vision 8: ReaperBoy LD 40 Edition
Navigate the underworld collecting stars in a fast-paced race to escape. Use gravity to help you defeat your foes but be careful. Fall too fast and it could prove fatal. As you collect stars, you can use their power to stay alive but the longer you spend in the underworld, the less power you will have. When you run out of energy and die, it’s game over!

ReaperBoy is a classic platformer build for the Pixel Vision 8 Fantasy Console in 72 hours during Ludum Dare 40. The Game Creator is a full development environment for authoring 8-bit games and is built on top of the open source Pixel Vision SDK framework. It contains project management, asset creation, and coding/debugging tools. This all in one solution enables complete end to end development allowing anyone to create desktop games, share them and even build custom tools.

Please note, the HTML5 version is there for people that don’t want to run the game locally on their computer. There are some known issues with sound and performance depending on the browser. For the full experience, please download one of the desktop builds.
Created by @jessefreeman, art by @castpixel and built with @pixelvision8​

113344.name: Flesh Packer
113344.body:
![ss.png](///raw/e04/1/z/17605.png)

**Warning: NSFW Entry**

A point and click puzzle game.

We hope to have a post jam entry with more content!

Music: Monkeys Spinning Monkeys (Incompetech)

113354.name: Please Don't Step on My Hat
113354.body:
![please-dont-step-on-my-hat.png](///raw/3e9/b1/z/17619.png)

Move your hat around with the arrow keys to keep it safe.

A small game to prove to myself that I can, realistically, build games based on Libretro (https://www.libretro.com/) over a weekend.  Web (WASM/Emscripten) and Game Shell (ARM) binaries have been built and tested.  I'll share the Game Shell binary once I've had a chance to write installation instructions.

This game was originally intended for submission to the compo, but was not completed to a playable format in time.

113369.name: Achtung die Schlange
113369.body:
"Battle it out with ever growing biogenetically engineered snakes."

Basicly we made a "Snakes"-like that can also be played against a friend locally or on your own. There are elements like doors/ice/turbo/mud on the map that you can use to your advantage. When you survive long enough that level will become smaller and smaller untill you run out of space.

Controls
Player 1: < >
Player 2: A D

113377.name: Event Horizon
113377.body:
![AcceptableBowedHen-size_restricted.gif](///raw/d50/81/z/176a3.gif)

You are a black hole and must decide how to deal with running out of space to consume as your mass increases.

A small sub-1 minute game. I familiarized myself with aspects of Unity that I hadn't done before, so I'm happy. I think the gravity effect on the black hole works pretty well, and I wrote a simple and functional dialogue system.


### Attributions

**Rumble SFX:**  [SoundEffectsFactory](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYIxR_86Ck0sCL26eVuumvQ) 

**Black Hole GFX:** [Sirhaian'Arts](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUqIetx0scoe79qZTovn9BA)

**Font:** [Trench](https://www.1001fonts.com/trench-font.html)

113389.name: You Shoot Walls
113389.body:
You shoot walls. 
I don't mean you shoot *at walls*, or *near walls*... you **shoot walls**.

![0.png](///raw/58b/6/z/1768f.png)

113397.name: Run into the Space
113397.body:
Lessons i learned this Gamejam:
- dont participate in a Party on friday 
- dont sleep all Saturday 
- dont split your team because of hangover 

But this is what i managed to build in the remaining time. 

You are running into the endlessness of space but the black materia will kill you when you have to much. So avoid them, but the happy light brings points. ![space.PNG](///raw/030/9/z/1769e.png)

113400.name: ExplodyOS
113400.body:
![ExplodyOS_Screenshot1.png](///raw/d85/z/1767c.png)
The story behind ExplodeyOS is that your computer has caught a virus, which is taking up storage on your computer. Your only means of getting rid of this virus is to use 3 anti-malware floppy disks, each with their own minigames. Lose a minigame, the virus takes up space on your computer. Win a minigame, space on your computer will be recovered. If you lose enough games, your computer will no longer have any storage space and it will cease to function and you'll be required to reset it!

There is a whole bunch of features that we would have liked to be implemented into this game, but we simply didn't have enough time. We will definitely go back and polish this baby up and maybe even add more minigames so stay tuned!

Programming done by: [Ltven0mI](https://twitter.com/Ltven0mI)
Art done by: [numilumi](https://twitter.com/numilumi)

113408.name: Guardian Of The Tengri Mountain
113408.body:
This is a game of point and click. Remove diamonds (before they fill the screen) and avoid death due to hunger. There is no music.![sc1.PNG](///raw/be6/41/z/17724.png)

Game instructions:

- Your character can move anywhere it likes to move except to the places where black diamonds occupy.
- Each movement costs you mana. And each removal of diamonds costs you mana. 
- You can't remove diamonds if you are far away (diamond removal is allowed only around their immediate vicinity).
- If you choose pass, it increases your mana by 1 and reduces your food by 1. So be careful.

BUGGGG:
- After a few passes, some diamonds cannot be removed and it is very annoying (I know!!!).

113414.name: Kiki's Clocktower Run
113414.body:
📻 🥨 🎃 Kiki's Delivery Service inspired game
 
This is a WIP. It was made at CampJS in Koonjewarre & still needs work. I made allthe pixel art in AseSprite.

 ![Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 12.14.41 pm.png](///raw/50b/b1/z/176d0.png)


How to Play

- arrow keys - collect the items from the geese
- deposit items at the clock tower


Tools used:

- ⚙️ Phaser CE (game engine)
 - 🎨 AseSprite (to make the pixel art)

113427.name: Immortals (and Mr Pickles)
113427.body: A short, barely interactive story 'game' made by the beach, using Twine

113434.name: Space Escape
113434.body:
Run for as long as you can across the buildings of a colonised moon. Space is to jump.
But there is a catch: you have a limited number of space presses! Collect more space presses, or run out and fall to your demise!

This is an infinite runner type game; however, there is technically a way to win! See if you can find it.

113439.name: Class 3 Civilisation
113439.body:
Humanity has finally advanced beyond the confinements of Earth in a new era of expansion. Create the best network of systems before you run out of systems to claim! This is a test of how well you can solve a complex problem to find the simplest solution.
You first start with the primary solar system and hover your mouse over another system that is nearby to add it to your collection. To win simply connect every single star system keeping in mind that it is best for the network to be as short as possible.

113440.name: Fluffy Tile World
113440.body:
![tiles.png](///raw/e1b/b1/z/17728.png)

Fluffy Tile World is a simple tile puzzle game. You have to step on each tile and make it to the end tile, but you can only step on each tile once! Wow. There are also fluffy sheeps :sheep: you can talk to.

I used a pretty liberal amount of base code and snippets from other projects, but all the level design and art was done during the jam.

113449.name: Triage
113449.body:
![5.png](///raw/186/1/z/17740.png)
You play a triage doctor serving innocents in a war torn country.

Save who you can, and try to forget those you can't.


Software used:
- [LÖVE](https://love2d.org/)
- [Paint.net](https://www.getpaint.net/)

- Andrew Wilson (@chao) - Coding, Art

- Ango Zhu (@infraxion) - Music, Sound
- Steven Hart (@neverlucky) - Art

113452.name: UNTIL I RUN OUT OF SPACE

113461.name: No Vacancy
113461.body:
![LD42Logo2.png](///raw/732/c/z/1779c.png)

**Heaven is running out of space!**

You play as God and your Job is to corrupt every good human left on Earth to keep them from accessing Heaven.

Good humans are wearing blue shirts (Bad ones are dressed in red, don’t mind them).

When you click on a human you can see its weakness, lifespan (represented by the green bar)  and their Good/Bad balance (represented by the blue/red bar).
Your goal is to change humans into sinners by clicking on the sin corresponding to their weakness.

(Write « thanos » on your keyboard for special effect)

 

-----------------------------------

 

**No Vacancy is my 3rd Game in Ludum Dare and my first game alone during a Game Jam!**

The game is a little bit buggy sometimes but I really like the final result.

**Any feedback is appreciated!**

![Screenshots2-3_small.png](///raw/732/c/z/17795.png)
![Screenshots4_small.png](///raw/732/c/z/17797.png)

**Software used**:
- **Engine**: Unity
- **Programming**: Visual Studio
- **Graphics**: Adobe Photoshop CC
- **Music/Sounds**: Ableton Live 10

113465.name: Space-Stricken Love
113465.body: Use the Arrow Keys to move and the Spacebar to jump.

113472.name: little circles and pretty sounds
113472.body:
little circles and pretty sounds is a game about clicking little circles and listening to pretty sounds

it was made by steven zavala with sounds by kevin g. (xypher orion) and the internet

it was a personal challenge to see if i could make something that would surprise me without having any random elements

113493.name: Granny Fran's Feline Frenzy
113493.body:
Granny Fran loves cats soooo much, but she's running out of space for all of the strays she taking in! Find them new owners, clean up "messes," and keep the peace, or else The Man will haul her in!

Art and sound by Liam and Zionna. Code by Ted. Special guest appearance by Heathir. This has been a family production!

![catlady_heart.jpg](///raw/156/z/1779d.jpg)

![catlady_newspaper.jpg](///raw/156/z/17be4.jpg)

113500.name: Headspace
113500.body:
![headspace-cover.png](///raw/dfc/81/z/17908.png)

Just a little tri, tryin' to get by. But stress is hard. Take a deep breath and find a little headspace.

A personal challenge to get something to a respectable state and submitted over the latter half of the jam and improve on my C# skills. Built completely solo, with a little help from SoundBible.com and Game-Icons.net

113512.name: Space Cavern
113512.body: Space Cavern. Drive your ship through a series of narrowing caverns. Using keyboard up and down keys

113534.name: Backpack Fight
113534.body:
Sorry,for some reason,I have No time to finish my game.It should have been more more polished and balanced.
This is a turn based RPG game, with all RPG elements in a single backpack stash.![Snipaste_2018-08-13_22-21-30 - 副本.png](///raw/c7b/b1/z/177fb.png)

113535.name: Start.exe
113535.body:
![Cover.png](///raw/1fe/1/z/1783d.png)

===================================

Start.exe is the brand new game sweeping the market that a must have for every PC gamer! Amazing graphics, mind-blowing sound and hyper-intense gameplay awaits you!

Players are recommended to turn off their anti-virus for the optimal next-gen experience!

===================================

**HOW TO PLAY:**

1. Click on a storage device to open it up
2. Click on a file on the desktop to send it to an open storage device
3. Click on a file in a storage device to send it back to the desktop
4. Try and save all your files before time runs out! 

**Note:** This game is mobile friendly!

===================================

Credits:

== Justin Oon ==

Designer, Programmer


== Darshan Li Nair ==

Designer, Artist


== Aidan Wong ==

Programmer


Song used:
"Windows Error Remix" composed by Fabio Mariano

===================================

113544.name: Gardenflow
113544.body:
Mechanics:
* 2 players only,
* you can move your character once in 2 seconds,
* you need to destroy your opponent,
* you cannot attack him yourself, the only way to destroy him is to get rid of his food,
* when you eat the right food, you increase your health, otherwise your health reduces slowly,
* when you eat the wrong food, you decrease your health, but you can siege your opponent this way,
* all the plants grow gradually,
* you can get rid of weeds to make grow your plants better,
* don't allow weeds to cover the whole map!

Team:
* Grigory Kosheev
* Alina Pugacheva
* Viktor Semyanov
* Dina Semyanova
* Eliah Lakhin

Tools Used:
* vue.js
* vuex
* node.js

![XCr_U-wZVSQ.jpg](///raw/78b/b1/z/17a28.jpg)

113554.name: After Halt Mini
113554.body:
After Halt Mini is a smaller version of a bigger project that I'm trying to develop. This is a preview of how the gameplay would look like. 
![33.jpg](///raw/09b/b1/z/17930.jpg)

113558.name: Sumo Fury 2.0
113558.body:
Year 2034. In a distopic future in wich humanity is running out of natural resources, the greatest nations fight using their most destructive weapons: The Sumo Furys.

In this multiplayer game you must try to survive, pushing your rival out of the bounds while the limits themselves are approaching, making yourself run out of space.

Programmers: Samuel Díaz Reyes – Eric Batista Rodriguez –

Designer : Vicente Tortosa Mederos

Musician : Antonio Blas Garcia Socorro ![rPvbkg.jpg](///raw/59b/b1/z/1783e.jpg)

113571.name: ANTI-VIRUS AT WORK
113571.body: your an anti virus you have been call to work as virus has infected the harddrive and occupying space so you need to kill them (btw the game is not fully done so there is only tutorial level so ya.....hope u enjoy it)

113578.name: Windoge 96
113578.body:
English below!

¡El nuevo sistema operativo Windoge 96 ha salido a la venta!

Sentirás desde el primer momento que estás en el sistema operativo más seguro del mundo. Además, entre sus grandes características se encuentran su estilo alejado de los noventa y, por primera vez en la historia (y como nos queremos subir al tren de las modas), ¡Battle Royale!

En este divertido e irónico simulador de instalación de un sistema operativo tendrás que luchar contra un troyano que te intentará saturarte la CPU del ordenador intentando llenarla hasta que éste no aguante más. El simulador consta de varios minijuegos en los que tendrás que ser más rapido que el malvado troyano y estar atento con todos tus sentidos. Un juego sencillo, irónico y divertido para todas las edades, en el que aprenderás los peligros de Internet.

Equipo:

Arian Rosales / @ArianRosales - Programación y diseño

Eros Mesa - Programación

Christian González - Arte

Jonatan Galindo - Música y SFX

Minijuego 1: Cierra las ventanas tan rápido como puedas haciendo click en el símbolo "X".

Minijuego 2: Mueve las carpetas a la papelera arrastrandolas con el ratón.

Para salir del juego selecciona "No" en la pantalla de instalación.

<-------->

The new OS Windoge 96 is now online!

You will feel from the very begin that you are on the safest OS in the world. It's main characteristics are super new and modern style, very far from 90's and for the very first time in an OS, Battler Royales mode!

On this funny and ironic OS simulator, you will have to fight a troyan who will try to push your CPU to the limit. This game consists in minigames where you will need to be faster than the troyan. Simple, ironic and fun for every age.

Team:

Arian Rosales / @ArianRosales - Programming and design

Eros Mesa - Programming​

Christian González - Art

Jonatan Galindo - Music y SFX


Minigame 1: Close the windows as fast as you can by clicking on the "X" symbol.

Minigame 2: Move the folder into the bin by draggin them with the mouse.

To exit game select "No" on the installation screen.

![Captura2.jpg](///raw/a44/z/1796f.jpg)


![Captura5.jpg](///raw/a44/z/17975.jpg)


![Captura4.jpg](///raw/a44/z/17976.jpg)

113591.name: Salvation*
113591.body:
# Game made for Ludum Dare 42 - theme: Running out of Space

You found yourself in what seems to be... hell. In the distance, a cone of light, maybe your salvation?

**How to play**: simply use WASD keys or arrow keys on your keyboard to walk, and move your mouse to look around.

You can find the executables at the game's [GameJolt page](https://gamejolt.com/games/salvation/361038).

113596.name: Dredged
113596.body:
![logo.png](///raw/2cb/6/z/178e8.png)

*An interrogation from someone you don’t know, a cosmic entity, a missing brother and no memory of it all. Rearrange, remove and replace your memories to piece together what you did.*

Drag your cursor to relocate and refocus your memories. Try to keep the good ones close to you, and push the bad ones out. 

Don’t let them clutter up your conscience, or we’ll have to start over.

113605.name: Park & Match
113605.body:
It's time to run out of time and get to parking! The objective is to park cars and wait for them to turn fully yellow before you can ride them out of the parking lot. Parking same color cars near each other makes them turn quicker. After a parking space is used to turn a car yellow, it changes to only allow that color to park in the space. Don't let the queue outside get too long or let the timer run out before driving a yellow car out!

CONTROLS:
- WASD
- Click car to assume control.

This was all produced by me on the weekend except I used an old song of mine and some free font and SFX

![shot1.png](///raw/dca/a1/z/179c7.png)![Shot2.png](///raw/dca/a1/z/179c8.png)

113619.name: Profit Margins
113619.body:
If I'm being honest, I'm not incredibly proud of this game. I wish I had more time to it, but I ended up scrapping my first idea after 24 hours, and that really set me back. In the end it's not terrible, but it's not what I wanted it to be. However, I'm still submitting it because I don't like the idea of putting in ~40 hours of work into something and not ending up submitting it.

---------------------------

You have just been hired to manage a paper sales company, but unfortunately it's losing money. Fast. Even though every two months you'll have one less job to fill (made worse by the fact that you didn't have much space as it was), your boss still expects you to make more money than you spend.

"The MOMENT you start to slip under, you'll be asked to leave the company. I expect great things from you."

Yikes.

You get $1000 to start off, but you're on your own from there. If you want to hire someone, you set the amount you're willing to pay and you get three options based on that amount. More money = more skill.

Work Ethic = How much they work
Productivity = How much they get done when they work
Charisma = How well other employees work with them

Careful though, employees' happiness and energy starts going down as soon as you hire them. If they start to do too poorly, it might be best that you find someone else to take their place.

---------------

Screenshots:

![Screenshot 1.png](///raw/3f9/z/179f9.png)

![Screenshot 3.png](///raw/3f9/z/179fb.png)

![Screenshot 2.png](///raw/3f9/z/179fa.png)

--------------

[F11] to fullscreen

Mouse for everything else

113632.name: Baggage Claim
113632.body:
## Clear out the baggage from the carousel before you run out of space!

You have _5 seconds_ from when a bag arrives to move it onto the carousels. If the bag is still left at the spawn point in the center after 5 seconds, the game is over.

Click on the highlighted shapes to move the bag. The spaces on the first carousel can hold anything, but the second and third need to match the shape. 

Score points by unloading the bags to the waiting passengers at the bottom of the screen.

![2018-08-13 11.17.40.gif](///raw/0a5/2/z/17952.gif)

I'm happy with this initial prototype of the mechanics, but I think the timing and speed needs some good balancing, would be very interested to hear in the comments what kind of scores you can achieve.

Credits:
* [Unity](https://unity3d.com/) for game development
* [bfxr](https://www.bfxr.net/) for soundclips
* [Zapsplat](https://www.zapsplat.com/sound-effect-category/airports/) for airport sounds
* PublicDomainVectors for [Luggage](https://publicdomainvectors.org/en/free-clipart/Vector-drawing-of-set-of-colorful-shapes/16861.html
) and [Shapes](https://publicdomainvectors.org/en/free-clipart/Baggage-vector-graphics/69614.html)

113634.name: Entera: The Decay
113634.body:
The remaining Undead are now at Kevin Basin, seeking refuge from the purge of the light... these cursed lands are all that is left from the Dark Lord domain...

Try your best to ensure your people's survival!

This game was made for Ludum Dare 48! (:

113639.name: Void Incoming
113639.body:
![vis2.png](///raw/3eb/b1/z/17a7e.png)
This is not only my first Ludum Dare game, It's my first time sharing my creations with the public! But before i describe the game, i just want to clear something up.
 My account was created after the jam started. I actually had an account ready 2 weeks in advance, but i didnt like the username. I couldn't change it, so instead i decided to just make a new account. Anyways, onto the game!
 In this game, you must use the arrow keys to navigate to the portal at the end of the level, while the void is constantly closing in on you! The game includes a total of 20 levels. 5 tutorial levels, 14 main levels, and an end boss. Throughout the levels, you must pick up items to open doors and grow back parts of the level that you lost to the void, and avoid cannons! The player's design is Scott Cawthon Inspired. I made this with one of my close friends, William. We made everything in the game from scratch. I did the programming, he did most of the sound effects, and we worked together on level design and pixel art. Overall, We're really happy with how the game came out, and we can't wait to hear your feedback! Enjoy!

113692.name: Stacy The Muscle
113692.body: "Stacy The Muscle" is a mini slasher-platformer in which you play as the manliest and most savage barbarian called Stacy. The main goal of the game is to climb on top of the endless tower. All that you have is your faithful sword, beautiful body and tons of enemies. So fill the tower up with cute monster bodies and climb on a mountain of their corpses as high as you can! But be careful, Stacy has an invincible muscular body but still can't breath under the water.![Снимок.PNG](///raw/415/91/z/17acd.png)

113703.body:

Units will attack enemy units.
Spells will target cards on the board.
Buildings will produce cards for you.

Made solo for the Jam competition.

113707.body:
A short 1st Shooter game where the number of platforms becomes fewer and you need to dodge bullets and shoot the enemies.

Controls:
WASD for movement. Scroll Wheel to change weapons. Fall off the platform to die. ALT+F4 to close if you didn't know.

113718.name: Graveyard manager
113718.body:
This is a clicker-symulator of graveyard administrator. You should somehow to deal with the enourmous flow of dead bodies and find the balance, because area of your cemetery is limited. You can control the speed of dying with investing in killer's organisation and also can expand the area of your cemetery with the money you earn buring bodies. Game has also a moral dillemma - you are technically allowed to bury bodies in the occupied graves due your unability to expand your area, but you will cause creation of zombie, which will reduce your reputation.

Your goal is to be helpful member of society and manage the cemetery as long as possible. Because someone have to. Watch your reputation!

113722.name: Don't Miss!
113722.body:
Don't Miss! is a top down shooting game where you control a spaceship and you need to survive waves of enemies, the twist is that when you shoot a bullet if you miss and hit a wall it will create another block nearby, so the more you miss the smaller your play area becomes.

![Honeycam 2018-08-13 22-21-37.gif](///raw/000/2/z/18248.gif)

I made everything myself from art to the pewpew sounds as well, it was fun making them. Also it's my first time making a game in Unity so there are probably several issues, sorry :P

Instructions:
You can control the ship with WASD and target with mouse, shoot with Left mouse button.

Hope you have fun.

You can find me on twitter https://www.twitter.com/DJ_Link

113723.name: space sucks
113723.body:
Suck away the world until there's nothing left, then shoot it out at your friends and enemies (assuming they're different). It's endless fun, until the fun ends...  

[download here](https://drkr.itch.io/space-sucks-ld42)

Right Mouse- - sucks tiles to gain meter (also leaves void in the ground)

113727.name: Crumbling Glaciers
113727.body: The glaciers are crumbling and you need to survive! Play either as the diabolical Pingu or dynamic Walrus, and make sure you don't fall into the water before your opponent does. Watch out for strong gusts of wind as well!!! (Two Xbox controllers required to play)![title 2.jpg](///raw/b61/61/z/17a01.jpg)

113728.name: Balls N Basket
113728.body: Catch the balls with the basket. It keeps getting smaller, though.

113747.name: Dance for your Light
113747.body:
[Play here!](https://dance-for-your-light.herokuapp.com/)

Dance for your Light is a **HTML5** game that you can play on your phone or desktop. You must dance to keep the light protecting you from the darkness, choreographing moves to dance dance dance! Only then can you shine bright and keep the darkness at bay.

At the time of submission there are 4 dance you can discover, each with their own animation. My ** favorite dance is the shake**, since this most accurately represents my own dancing style. See if you can find it!

![dance-for-your-life-luczynski.PNG](///raw/05c/b1/z/17ad9.png)

I created the art and code for this game myself using the following tools and frameworks:
 
* iPad and Procreate for drawing :pencil2: 
* Atom as a text editor :musical_keyboard: 
* Vue.js as a framework :v: 
* Sweet, sweet Canvas API :older_woman: 
* Heroku to host <3 :heart: 

I spent about 22 hours working on this, and focused on building a solid foundation of code to deliver a smooth game. That said, I would love to work more on this in the future, and focus more on the graphics.

113756.name: MoonSpell
113756.body:
Avoid the darkness and save all animals as fast as you can!
![banner.png](///raw/8f9/1/z/17acc.png)

Moonspell is a casual game focused on dexterity and priority skills. You must collect the necessary quantity of animals on each level to clear it. As you going saving the animals, the darkness keeps raising its power. How long can you survive and save the animals?

![2.gif](///raw/8f9/1/z/17aef.gif)

Team:
Design & Story - Flavio Augusto Viana Pereira

Music - Victor Jefferson Lima Vieira

Code & Art - Welliton de Almeida Souza

113765.name: Blast Off!
113765.body:
Your home world is under attack. Strange creatures have captured almost all the planet. Fight back the invasion long enough until you have finished building the rocket. Make good use of the remaining space to survive and escape!

![2018-08-13 (1).png](///raw/24f/1/z/1804e.png)

# How to Play
* Build factories
* Build turret bases
* Stack towers
* Build, fuel & load rocket
* ???
* Profit

![2018-08-13 (7).png](///raw/24f/1/z/18096.png)

(Mac version will be provided after jam)

113773.name: Clutteralism
113773.body:
**LOCAL TWO PLAYER VERSUS ONLY**

Send tons of stuff to your friend and bury them under clutter.

https://youtu.be/G_fffmH78mo
https://youtu.be/-BdeygjSHWo

**Credits**

113782.name: Trash Smash 2072
113782.body:
**Trash Smash 2072** is a **1vs1** total trash mayhem. In a year 2072 space was overwhelmed with garbage, so the **Fart Monkey Association** decided to create **Trash Games** (*Olympic Games of Space*). To clean out garbage in space Trash Smash was born to bring together galaxys best fighters. Bring your friend and get ready to be **traaaaaashed** with **flamings socks** and **underwear** covered in **green goo**...


## How to play?

First and most important, find someone to play this game with. This could be your grandpa, friend or anyone who can push some buttons. **Loads of fun guaranteed!**

![you got traaashed!.png](///raw/827/6/z/17bd5.png)

#### Controls

- **Player 1** WASD + F or Ctrl key
- **Player 2** Arrows + M or Numpad Enter (*works on some keyboards only*)
- Use **SPACEBAR** to start new round!
#### And don´t forget to have fun!

#### Our creative team
- **Aimar Soots**              Game Design/Animations/Manager
- **Kersti Mölder**            Cute kittens/Art
- **Giancarlo Robles Pacheco** Characters/Art
- **Vootele Parts**	       Sound/Music	
- **Marko Korbun**	       Head Programmer/Game Design/UI
- **Rain Vagel**	       Programming/UI

#### Screenshots below!

![bring it on.png](///raw/827/6/z/17bd3.png)
![you got traaashed!.png](///raw/827/6/z/17bd5.png)

113790.name: Descension
113790.body:
### It is your time to leave the elevator, but there's not space

![Screenshot.png](///raw/8f0/2/z/18140.png)


# Descension

Descension is a short puzzle game about leaving the elevator by pushing people and other mechanics. Will you be able to complete it?



## Controls

         <↑>                Keyboard Arrows to Move


      <←><↓><→>             When you are next to the exit press <↑>



Game Made in 72 for #LudumDare42 by:


@CHUMASQUITO : https://twitter.com/chumasquito

@_jowent : https://twitter.com/_jowent


### Hope you like it!


![png.png](///raw/8f0/2/z/17ba8.png)

113797.name: Nightmare Trip
113797.body:
Download: https://gamejolt.com/games/nightmaretrip/361099

Fight and survive throught endless spawning nightmares. But be aware that your space reduces every 5 seconds, therefore you have to kill your nightmares to remain your space.

Controls:
tap leftmousebutton to shoot

awsd/arrow keys to move

mouse to aim

ESC to exit game

Also please download the fonts included in the .zip

113805.name: Empillets
113805.body:
[screenshot2.png](///raw/347/3/z/17b38.png)

​Game made in only 5 hours.

The objective of the game is to stack up a high amount of cardboard boxes trying to reach out the goal of 25 points. If you stack up boxes over other boxes, you'll double your points! Try to not run out of space :p
CONTROLS:

![screenshot1.png](///raw/347/3/z/17b3c.png)

WASD: move
Click: grab box
Click again: throw box
Shift: run!
Space: jump

113806.name: SpellBounce
113806.body:
A wizard dueling game with too many projectiles.

WARNING: Requires 2 players and a controller. Sorry!

*How can you bounce spells  
into your opponent's face  
when running out of*

Credits:

Robert "projab" Raulus  
Kalle-Eemeli "Magnega" Paananen  
Ruska "Myrrysmiesi" Sarapisto

![screenshot.png](///raw/1f0/e/z/17cd4.png)

113814.name: Espace
113814.body:
The universe is being consumed by a massive black hole, but there is a portal nearby. Scientists don't know anything about it, but it's the only option to survive this collapse.

CONTROLS:
- W/S or arrow keys: Move
- Left click: press button
- Mouse wheel: interact with difficulty button
- Esc: skip intro/outro, return to main menu!
[Screenshot](///raw/736/71/z/182b6.png)

113828.name: Endless cleaner
113828.body:
Tons of garbage come from pipes mounted to wall and fill the room. 

You are armed with Garbage Disposal Device (GDD). 

How long can you hold out until you drown in this trash?? 

![tutorial.jpg](///raw/d0b/81/z/17c73.jpg)

Energy is consumed while the GDD working. Energy may be restored by collecting batteries. Energy also restores by itself, but its restoring rate is very slow.

The GDD heats while using. If it's get overheated wait until it cooled down.

The GDD can be also upgraded. To do so find the chip in the trash heap.

### Controls
WASD - Movement

Left mouse button - turn on the GDD

Space - Jump

113829.name: The skeletons took my boat
113829.body:
![Skeletons-cover.png](///raw/7d2/3/z/17c58.png)

![Skeleton-screen1.png](///raw/7d2/3/z/17b8c.png)
Hunt skeletons in search for your boat and the oars so you can leave the island!

![Skeleton-screen2.png](///raw/7d2/3/z/17c0b.png)
Watch out for the poisonous gas the evil skeletons and bats are leaving behind!







### Enjoy random generated islands. Yes you will get a new one every time you play!


## Instructions


* WASD to move around
* Mouse-wheel or 1-3 to change weapon
* Aim with the mouse.
* Space or mouse button to shoot.
* Survive long enough to find the boat, the oars and escape :)
* Make sure that the poisonous gas doesn't cover the whole island. You wouldn't like to **run out of space** would you? ;)

You can stay in the poisonous gas but you will get hurt. If you reach "99" you will loose a heart from your health.
The pickups will refill your ammo and also your health and hurt bar.


Windows: http://cloud.rhapsody.st/ld42/The_Skeletons_Took_My_Boat-Windows.zip

Mac: http://cloud.rhapsody.st/ld42/The_Skeletons_Took_My_Boat-Mac.zip



## Techincal details


We left the comfort zone and used Unity this time instead of the usual Java and LibGDX. Both good and bad experiences... :)


### What was fun:

Learning Unity..     And that crazy idea late Saturday afternoon: - Lets design an island..  - No don't bother paint it..  we will create random islands with code!

### What was less fun:

The 19 crashes and four restarts of Unity..

The theme...  Tricky but we managed to do something touching the theme at least

113831.name: I Dreamt I Was Love
113831.body:
![screenshot001.png](///raw/5a3/z/17bd8.png)

"As the tiny point of a pencil can draw innumerable pictures, so does the dimensionless point of awareness draw the contents of the vast universe. Find that point and be free."
-Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj

113838.name: Spaceship Slam
113838.body:
![SS01.png](///raw/65d/z/17bae.png)
![SS04.png](///raw/65d/z/17bb1.png)

# Description

You spent your life savings on a ship and a vacation to the best stargazing spot in the galaxy.

You arrive, only to find that it's completely running out of space!
Maybe if you ask nicely, some of the other ships will move.

This is our entry for Ludum Dare Game Jam #42

# Controls

## Keyboard
- Left click to launch your ship
- Escape/P to pause

## Xbox Controller
- Left stick to launch your ship
- Start to pause

113842.name: Battle Blocks
113842.body:
This is a fun little strategy game that might also be diffucult to beat. Your goal is to beat the enemy monsters while defending your own units and headquarters all while the enviroment around you is slowly shrinking. The game might be short if you know what you're doing ;)

![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/8e6/1/z/17d93.png)
![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/8e6/1/z/17da4.png)
![Screenshot_3.png](///raw/8e6/1/z/17dad.png)

113846.name: Zachary's Memory
113846.body:
Zachary is arrived at the end of his life and he remembers.
His memories  mix. You are the memory's archiver, and you have to sort them.
You have to type on your keyboard to create a label and sort a memory. Some of them are linked and need to have the same label, but be carefull, by mixing two memories which are not linked, you will lost the last memories and those to come which are linked with it.![ZachScreen.png](///raw/c2b/2/z/17b9d.png)

113852.name: Bot Saves Dream
113852.body:
Platforms: Windows and Linux

Story:
In the Future, where people can't find games on Dream the digital distribution store created by Gabe Renewal, one AI Bot stands to curate for the players and keep his world alive before people go shop somewhere else. Bot saves dream! 

Gameplay: 
This game is a platform/puzzler. 



Most of the art was created by Title Pending
The dialog system has been developed by Jeremi360 
And most of the coding came from Plopsis

However, what was great about this team this jam is we helped each other get to the end.

https://itch.io/jam/kenney-jam-2018

And  his free assets and licences here:

113860.name: Pursuit of Freedom
113860.body:
When the free nation of Space is gripped by the cruel hands of autocracy, only one option remains for the freedom-loving citizen: leave. You will have to maneuver, negotiate, and duel your way through the most secure border in the world, all in the name of freedom.

Features cutting-edge flight simulation technology:

![flight.png](///raw/b8c/5/z/17f75.png)

Not to mention fast-paced dueling action:

![duel.png](///raw/b8c/5/z/17f7c.png)

All set to a masterfully-crafted two-minute soundtrack.

113865.name: Moon Marbles
113865.body:
Genre: Action/Arcade

Players: 1 - however many you can fit around your keyboard

A massively-local-multiplayer space marble sumo game. Press Escape to quit, or any other key to join the game. Hold your key to charge up and release to jump. Be the last marble standing. Or rolling, or whatever.

(The game should support most/all keyboard keys. If you decide to do something foolish like playing as Alt and F4, that's not my problem.)

113882.name: Dice Blackout
113882.body:
About a month ago, Embarcadero released a Community edition of the RAD environment for Delphi and C++.
Because I've been familiar with Delphi since the second half of the 90's (from version 3.0), I've decided to try my hand at making a Ludum game in Delphi 10.2 and (for the very first time) using FireMonkey framework.
Because the theme 'running out of space' made me think about shrinking game board, in the past 2 days the logical - random puzzle game 'Dice Blackout' was created.

All of the game's assets are compiled in the .exe file (unfortunately, it's Windows 7 or newer only). The file is relatively large (about 13 MB), but that's due to the FireMonkey framework. If I didn't use it, filesize would be much smaller, but most of the graphical problems would have to be solved using many roundabout ways - in much longer time.

It's my third game written in Pascal and finished in time for Ludum Dare. The first (2014) was 'Musing About' - a simulation about being a painter in XIX century, created in FreePascal (in Lazarus). In 2015, using the same tools, I've created DEmonsterization (a puzzle game about escaping a dungeon while simultaneously trying to become human again)

# How to play:

Every level consists of 10 dice scattered on an orange board.
Your task is to click on a sequence of 3 consecutive numbers in ascending or descending order, for example: 4, 3, 2 or 2, 3, 4. You can't start with the middle number (for example: 3, 4, 2).
You'll have to hurry, as the board gets more concealed as times passes, and dice disappear.
Clicking in a die that doesn't fit into the already started sequence (as in 3, 4 and clicking 1) will make the black board cover blink red and the die will remain active and not become a part of the sequence.
Die that is a part of a sequence turns inactive and won't react to clicking again.

There can be more than 2 possible sequences among the 10 dice on the board. The higher numbers are in the sequence you choose, the more points. Choosing the highest one also gets bonus points!

If on a level you didn't manage to find a sequence of 3 numbers in time the game is not over - you'll just get fewer points.

The game consists of 5 levels, all keeping score - try to get 100% of points available! 

![screen04.png](///raw/05d/c/z/17cc3.png)

![screen05.png](///raw/05d/c/z/17cc4.png)

113884.name: Plant Tight
113884.body:
Hello there! This is my first game in Unity, done in 18-20 hours! I'm proud of this little piece of junk.
Game is unfinished but if I spent some time on it and it's quite playable, so why not upload it here
No audio in this version, maybe tommorow I will upload v0.2 version!

So, if we're talking about gameplay:

-> Your boss is planting plants really quickly and you have to pick it up

-> when plant is just about to be picked, the field under it changes color to near-green

-> if you could not make it - field will be corrupted and nothing more won't grow there

-> when there isn't any empty field, you lose

example: 8x8 map, 40 corrupted fields and 24 plants growing but 25 couldn't be planted - game over


For every picked plant you collect 10points, just collect as much as you can
![plant2.PNG](///raw/8e9/3/z/17c5d.png)

113894.name: Ruthless
113894.body:
Goal of the game is become the best. Stay on the top of the leader board. You can achieve this by performing actions and then buying items from the shop to increase your influence and guard.

We developed this game in the hope to make it somewhat pvp and/or with player interaction. But we ran out of space time. So the only way you know there are more players in this game is by looking at the leader board. We still think what we've developed this weekend is a pretty solid foundation for a good game. We'll definitely consider continuing developing if the responses are somewhat decent. We still have plenty of idea's that we could add to this game.

##### Leader Board

113895.name: Hardburn
113895.body:
Save all the survivors before the raging fire engulfs you.​
Douse the flames with your mighty water gun.

113901.name: Space Escape
113901.body: Here is my submission for this jam. I tried to use particles to make it look fancy.![SADADSDSA.png](///raw/665/3/z/17cc8.png)

113938.name: T3DRIS
113938.body:
It's basically 3D Tetris. In Tetris you run out of space if you don't carefully consider your block placement, it's the same in 3D Tetris, but with another dimension. 

Made with my own OpenGL engine, which doesn't have sound support yet so there is no sound. The game has a steep learning curve, but once you have climbed that curve you will be rewared by pure happiness and a high score.

![cover.png](///raw/40d/b1/z/17ece.png)

*Controls:*

**WASD** : Move the block

**Q** : Rotate block around the Z-axis

**E** : Rotate block around the Y-axis

**P** : Pause the game!

113951.name: Healing Overflow
113951.body:
ou are a healer in an MMORPG, and of course the only healer in your noob filled party. Try to keep everyone alive, else you might get banned for not doing your job.

Be careful, because if you overheal someone too much they will duplicate, and eventually fill your screen.

Also try not to heal your enemies.

114003.name: Dig
114003.body:
*Game made by Simon Chanson ( game-design and coding ) and Léo Marius ( graphics ).*

**Synopsis** : The new mayor tell the town cemetery is to old and the municipality is losing money with it.
You are playing a cemetery employee who have to clear off old unpaid tomb for the municipality be able to bury new "paying" corps.
No reason dead cannot be profitable for someone !

**How to play** : Move with the arrows, dig tombs with space, move the bodies to the common pit, and start again ! Keep the rhythm or you will be fired.

**Installation** : Unzip all the files in a folder, for windows run **Dig_LD42_win.exe**, on Linux **Dig_LD42_linux.x86_64** or on mac **Dig_LD42_osx.zip**

114005.name: Chrono Caverns
114005.body:
​As a famous explorer in search of treasure, you one day come across a mysterious labyrinthine ​cavern. Surrounded by puzzles and traps, you explore deeper and deeper in search of a mysterious lost treasure. But something is not quite right about this cavern, time seems to flow both forward and backward under your control when you come into possession of the pendant.

## Gameplay

​Chrono Caverns is a puzzle game where you explore unexplored caverns, tile by tile. When you leave a tile, it turns into a pool of lava preventing you from retracing your steps. Once you discover the pendant you gain the ability to control the flow of time and undo your previous movements. Touching every floor tile will unveil a stairway to the next floor, bringing you one step closer to the mysterious treasure.

## Controls

Move: Arrow keys

Undo: Z

Return to main menu: Escape

Fullscreen: F

## Download Instructions

There are Windows and Mac builds available at the Itch.io links below. Just visit the page and choose the download for your platform of choice.

![Screenshot2.png](///raw/785/z/17f68.png)

![Screenshot3.png](///raw/785/z/17f6a.png)

114010.name: Mole Invaders
114010.body:
Mole Invaders

This is a game made for the Island Jam IV

Get a friend to play in this territory control game!

As one of the moles you have to drill through the ground, claiming it as your own.
Get the super drill power up to gain the ability to invade your enemy's territory!
The mole that conquered more ground when the time is over wins.
Be warned, it's easy to get trapped if you don't plan your moves in advance!

-------------{ CONTROLS }------------

Player 1 : [ w, a, s, d ]

player 2 : Arrow keys

--------------{ CREDITS }---------------

Art : Eduardo Martínez

Sound :  Ancor Amador

Code : Giovanni Bodega , Ismael Bolaños

114026.body:

114028.body:

The Apocalypsis is happening. You must save as many parishioners as you can. Build banks so they can sit and pray, and buy relics so their prayers are effectively carried to God. You can help them pray by clicking on them parishioners.

As time goes by, relics will become evil, thus reducing the space you have and not affecting your parishioners prayers.

Thanks to **Avalanch - Torquemada** for the starting notes of the theme.


**NOTE**: To be honest I didn't spend much in the game, and that's why I ended up participating in the Jam, and maybe a few more tweaks would be needed for the game to run fine, but here it is.

114030.name: Ship It!
114030.body:
You work for a shipping company and are tasked with loading boxes onto a truck. Corporate wants to cut down on waste, so if you waste any space on your truck, then the next one they send you will be that much smaller. See how many trucks you can fill! Be careful though, if the conveyor belt gets backed up to the yellow, you lose!

Click on a box to select it, and then click again to place it on the truck. Press [tab] to rotate the selected box. You can also press the number on the box to select it. The box farthest along is always box #1.

Once you think you can't fit any more on your truck (or you are running out of room on your conveyor belt), press [space] to Ship It! and get a new truck to fill.

## It's easy to start
![ShipIt.png](///raw/b6d/b1/z/17f89.png)
## Your truck will shrink as you have to send it partially filled
![ShipItInGame.png](///raw/b6d/b1/z/17f2a.png)
## Don't let those boxes get backed up!
![ShipItGameOver.png](///raw/b6d/b1/z/17f2b.png)

This game was made by a group, but we have one account.

The party's over. It was great - games, beer, food... SO MUCH food.

TOO MUCH food.

And now most everyone's gone and left you to deal with the damn leftovers! It's up to you to figure out who to send home with what so you don't end up with more food than you could fit in an industrial grade fridge.

An inventory-management puzzle game.

114075.name: Landfill
114075.body:
![screen2.PNG](///raw/dd9/z/18136.png)

Hi and thanks for playing our game! 

Unfortunately, I admit that we did not have a clear idea on what kind of game to make for this specific theme. Therefore, the development process saw a few setbacks where the mechanics of the game were changed several times, and as a result of this, I was not able to implement  a level system nor was I able to completely implement the sounds.

--Game--

The objective of the game is to score as many points as possible while avoiding that the garbage exceeds the specified limit. 

To get rid of the garbage simply click with the mouse cursor on the object you wish to get rid of, and it will be automatically moved to its corresponding bin. 

Each bin can only contain up to 10 pieces of garbage, after that, the bin will need to be emptied to be used again. 

To empty the bin is to click on it, but be aware: It till take 5 seconds for the bin to be usable again. 

Every once in a while, a special power up will appear on the screen that if used it will allow to get rid of some of the garbage, so keep your eyes peeled!

--Credits--

Game Design: Lagoe, Varcx

Programming: Lagoe

Graphics: Varcx

114141.name: Metro 2048 Exodus
114141.body:
![e41a55f2-db0a-4059-bcf8-900c959e1b0a.jfif](///raw/570/1/z/18273.jpg)
![d4340716-834b-4c14-b3b8-630bc364d969.jfif](///raw/570/1/z/18333.jpg)

You’re the pusher. Your job is to push people into underground carriage.
You must push people, tell them to move to the windows and send train away. Your working shift is 3 trains. If you sendet all train fast enough and pushed enough people with enough respect you did good otherwise you did bad).

Controls:
A - walk to the left  

D - walk to the right  

Space - push people in doors. Faster you press - harder your push, but be careful - if you respect meter is in red - you're not respectful enough and you would do bad. There is limited space in doors, you would see red message if doors is full and doors would be dark of people.  

E - whistle for people to move from doors to windows (after that you can push more people)  

Enter - Send train away. You have 30 seconds to push as many people as you can and send the train. If you don’t do it, then time would be subtracted from time of next train. And you would do bad.  

Enjoy!)

Drive along an everlasting, continuously spawning road as you weave between obstacles and outrun the police.

114246.name: Spaceless Space

Running out of space... In space? Spaceless space.

114254.name: No Man's Space
114254.body:
BACKGROUND

In a not so distant future life on our galaxy has become more and more scarce. 
To the point were months can happen until two humans contact with each other.

Communication has become so extrange and uncommon that the languages that we all 
know and employ have become memories from a brighter past. In this new reality the
distinction between humans and machines is so vague that it is no longer possible to 
tell which one are you talking to.

This game pictures the everyday life of an anonymous inhabitant of this universe in his 
fight to keep his ship running through space a little longer.

OBJECTIVES

Life in this solitary space consists in managing your resources correctly. Inhabited planets 
where refueling your beaten up ship are hard to find and fuel is a limited resource that is 
requiered for everything around the spaceship.

But not only the outside universe limits your range of action. Your trusty ship, that has been
with you through the years has very limited instruction memory. Which runs out of space when 
executing the smallest of codes.

With these factors in mind the pilot has to manage to protect his ship from the debris floating 
around space and find new planets to continue his journey.

MECHANICS

The pilot's task is to give the right orders to keep the ship and himself safe. 
As good old machine, the ship, requires its orders using a programming language, that prevents 
any possible ambiguity. This language consists of the following rules, that can always be consulted 
by pressing <TAB>:

* shield(s): Activates a shield that protects the ship from impact during s seconds.

* power(m): Turns on motor m (from 0, 1 or 2) Speeds up the ship but increases fuel use.

* goto(x,y): Head the ship to (x,y) coordinates. Locations can be consulted in the minimap.

* fire(): Fire a laser beam that clears the ship sorroundings from asteroids.

* refuel(): While on a planet, it allows refilling the fuel tanks of the ship.

To enter these commands the ship provides the user with a console terminal where they can be written.

Every time a program has to be executed, by pressing <ESC> key the code is first compiled 
and executed if everything is correct. But do not worry, because it provides a useful set 
of error messages than can guide you through the most difficult syntax errors and misspellings.

Not everything can be coding orders and the ship provides you with two additional source of 
information:

* A minimap: Depicting the closest planets to the ship at any given moment

* A status monitor: Showing the state of the individual parts of the ship along with the motors,
shield and fuel. 

Wish you luck in your journey and hope you always find a planet before running out of fuel.

![Screenshot_0.PNG](///raw/7f8/c/z/1815c.png)

114262.name: Space Holiday
114262.body: Help an ALIEN fill their LUGGAGE to go on HOLIDAY!

114268.name: Stor:Age
114268.body: You need to free up some space on your phone by deleting photos. Of course, going through your photos brings up some old memories. Then you get a fateful text message.

114304.name: Moving In
114304.body: You moved into your new apartment. Your friends send you house warming gifts to fill your apartment with. Find a place for as much as you can in your new place.

114324.name: Blowup
114324.body:
This was intended for the compo, but since I forgot it started/ended 3 hours early, I'll submit it to the jam.

It's basically a breakout style game with a little twist for the theme. Each time you hit a brick, more bricks will spawn depending on what brick you hit. TO get rid of some bricks, try hitting the bombs that spawns quite frequently

114353.name: Shrink
114353.body:
First Ludum Dare for me, I am happy to have at least a playable game.

Shrink; don't let outer barriers to shrink you Square. You can only destroy outer barriers when they touch square.

I would appreciate all kinds of feedback.

Thanks!!

114424.name: Sim Tabloid
114424.body: Manage a small newspaper. Publish content that people like to grow your subscriber base and build your business.
